language1_text: And their eyes were opened; and Jesus straitly charged them, saying, See that no man know it.
language2_text: Makarahan am to sira na makacita. Maniring rana si Yeso jira am, "Ji nyo meycicicyan o vazay eya do tao an."

language1_text: But they, when they were departed, spread abroad his fame in all that country.
language2_text: Am kapakowbot da no rarwa ori am ipeylimwang da rana o mina vazay na ni Yeso jira do ili do dang.

language1_text: As they went out, behold, they brought to him a dumb man possessed with a devil.
language2_text: Mangay rana sira o nimavota a tao ori am yai no tao do tangain ni Yeso o kovotan no kalamsoyan ni Satan a tao a ji makabnebnek.

language1_text: And when the devil was cast out, the dumb spake: and the multitudes marvelled, saying, It was never so seen in Israel.
language2_text: Vozwawen ni Yeso o kalamsoyan ni Satan do kataotao na am to rana makabnebnek o tao ang. Ori o nisavasavakan da nya no aro a tao. Maniring sira am, "Abo pa o akman so sya vazay a nimacita namen do Isedi!"

language1_text: But the Pharisees said, He casteth out devils through the prince of the devils.
language2_text: Am maniring sira o tao a macyagom do Vadisay am, "Oyowyat na ori a yamamozwaw an? No na nitoro jya ni Satan."

language1_text: And Jesus went about all the cities and villages, teaching in their synagogues, and preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing every sickness and every disease among the people.
language2_text: Nilivolivon ni Yeso o peyneynozyan do peycyeylilyan na a kapangnanao na a meylimwang no Mapasaray a Ciriciring do katalamozong na rana nyaten ni Ama ta do to, a keywakwak na do meykeyngeyngen a tao.

language1_text: But when he saw the multitudes, he was moved with compassion on them, because they fainted, and were scattered abroad, as sheep having no shepherd.
language2_text: Macita ni Yeso o aro a tao am ikarilaw na sira. Ta akmey minaminasbang sira abo so marilaw nira. Akman so kagling a abo so omonong jira a tao.

language1_text: Then saith he unto his disciples, The harvest truly is plenteous, but the labourers are few;
language2_text: Am maniring do macinanao jya am, "Aro tao a makza no Mapasaray a Ciriciring. Akman so nihakawan a mazako rana. Aro o langin am apeleh o tao a manlangi.

language1_text: Pray ye therefore the Lord of the harvest, that he will send forth labourers into his harvest.
language2_text: Am ori o ipeynozi nyo ji Ama ta do to a kapanovoy na so tao a meylimwang no ciriciring na."

language1_text: And when he had called unto him his twelve disciples, he gave them power against unclean spirits, to cast them out, and to heal all manner of sickness and all manner of disease.
language2_text: Lovoten na ni Yeso o rarwa so ikakarwan (12) a macinanao jya a kapanta na nira so oyowyat da ipamozwaw da so kalamsoyan ni Satan a kapangiwakwak da so meykeyngeyngen a tao.

language1_text: Now the names of the twelve apostles are these; The first, Simon, who is called Peter, and Andrew his brother; James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother;
language2_text: O ngarangaran da no macinanao jya am yadomket do jya. Ney manma na am si Simong, kasaing no ngaran na am si Pite, a kani wari na a meyngaran si Antele a kano anak ni Sipitay a meyngaran si Yake a kani wari na a meyngaran si Yowani,

language1_text: Philip, and Bartholomew; Thomas, and Matthew the publican; James the son of Alphæ us, and Lebbæ us, whose surname was Thaddæ us;
language2_text: a kani Veydipo a kani Patolomaw a kani Tomase kano mapeyvazay so deyking a tao a meyngaran si Matay a kani Yake a anak ni Alevey a kani Tatay,

language1_text: Simon the Canaanite, and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed him.
language2_text: a kani Simong a macikagom do macioya do Loma a tao a kano nimanazang ni Yeso a tao do Isecyadi a meyngaran si Yota.

language1_text: These twelve Jesus sent forth, and commanded them, saying, Go not into the way of the Gentiles, and into any city of the Samaritans enter ye not:
language2_text: Tovoin na ni Yeso o rarwa so ikakarwan am maniring jira am, "Ji kamo angay do ili da no beken a tao do Yotay. Ji kamo angay do ili da no Samadiya.

language1_text: but go rather to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.
language2_text: Mangay kamo do Isedi a tao, ta yakmey mavozaw sira kagling.

language1_text: And as ye go, preach, saying, The kingdom of heaven is at hand.
language2_text: Ipeylimwang nyo do angayan nyo o kakeykai na rana makaranes no katalamozong na ninyo ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: Heal the sick, cleanse the lepers, raise the dead, cast out devils: freely ye have received, freely give.
language2_text: Iwakwakan nyo sira o meykeyngeyngen a tao. Avyain nyo sira o nimawakwak a tao, kapya da no omlabyab so kolit a tao a kapamozwaw nyo so kalamsoyan ni Satan a komovot do tao. Yabo o ngina na no oyowyat ni Ama ta do to a nitoro na jinyo. So icyakman nyo sang a ji macyami do sidongen nyo a tao.

language1_text: Provide neither gold, nor silver, nor brass in your purses,
language2_text: Ji kamo mapalolo so ovay a kano gizit a kano nizpi.

language1_text: nor scrip for your journey, neither two coats, neither shoes, nor yet staves: for the workman is worthy of his meat.
language2_text: No mangilili kamo am taosya o kapalolo nyo so adwa ka patapilen nyo a ayob nyo. Taosya o kapeytokap nyo a kano sisikod nyo. Ta o peyvazain a tao am pakanen sira an.

language1_text: And into whatsoever city or town ye shall enter, enquire who in it is worthy; and there abide till ye go thence.
language2_text: No mangay kamo do teyhesa ka ili am amyamizngen nyo o tao a masaray a tomaotao jinyo. Ta ori o isanan nyo so vahay mangay do ikaro nyo na do dang.

language1_text: And when ye come into an house, salute it.
language2_text: No somdep kamo do asa ka vahay am ipanci nyo jira o 'Kokay kamo.'

language1_text: And if the house be worthy, let your peace come upon it: but if it be not worthy, let your peace return to you.
language2_text: No isaray da inyo no asa ka vahay am ipeynozi nyo sira a kangay na jira no aryarilaw na ni Ama ta do to. No ji da raralayan inyo am cyaha, ta ji na sira arilawan ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: And whosoever shall not receive you, nor hear your words, when ye depart out of that house or city, shake off the dust of your feet.
language2_text: O ji naotao jinyo a kano ji ngamizing so ciring nyo a kavahay na kano keyliyli na am to nyo na ngaroi sira a katoktok nyo so tana do ai nyo.

language1_text: Verily I say unto you, It shall be more tolerable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrha in the day of judgment, than for that city.
language2_text: To ko na macitangayan jinyo am no marateng rana o araraw no kapeykapyapinpin na so tao ni Ama ta do to am makdekdeng pa o oyaoyyan na do ji naotao jinyo a kano nipasingsingkad na do tao do Sotoma kano Hamola no kakwa pa.

language1_text: Behold, I send you forth as sheep in the midst of wolves: be ye therefore wise as serpents, and harmless as doves.
language2_text: "Amizngen nyo an, ta akma kamoy kagling a ko tovoin do kokoman so tao. Am ori o ipeytataziman nyo a makapiya so nakenakem jira.

language1_text: But beware of men: for they will deliver you up to the councils, and they will scourge you in their synagogues;
language2_text: Azimanen nyo o amrakep jinyo a kano mangay ninyo do pacicicyan a kabakbak da jinyo do peyneynozyan,

language1_text: and ye shall be brought before governors and kings for my sake, for a testimony against them and the Gentiles.
language2_text: mangay o kangay da ninyo do tangain da no panirsirngen a kado meymatmatngeh no teyhesa ka mahataw a pacicin. So ikanoyong nyo a meylimwang no Mapasaray a Ciriciring ko jira a kado beken a tao do Yotay.

language1_text: But when they deliver you up, take no thought how or what ye shall speak: for it shall be given you in that same hour what ye shall speak.
language2_text: No pacicin da inyo am ji nyo anyaheyan o kaji nyo makatenngan do itovis nyo jira a ciring. Ta ipeypalanginan na inyo ni Ama ta do to a mapasapa jira.

language1_text: For it is not ye that speak, but the Spirit of your Father which speaketh in you.
language2_text: Ta o ciring nyo am beken a monganay jinyo, ta itoro na no Seyzi ni Ama ta do to o ciring na jinyo.

language1_text: And the brother shall deliver up the brother to death, and the father the child: and the children shall rise up against their parents, and cause them to be put to death.
language2_text: No si marateng o araraw no nang am ipanazang da no tao o meysominogat a kakteh da a wakwaken no tao. So icyakman na sang no ama da do ananak da. O ananak da am ioya da sira o inyapwan da a manci no kawakwak da sira no tao.

language1_text: And ye shall be hated of all men for my name's sake: but he that endureth to the end shall be saved.
language2_text: Pacioyyan da inyo a yaomraralay nyaken. Am o jyamama no makakaday a alalaw a tao am mahap da o to meyyonong a ikavyay no pahad da.

language1_text: But when they persecute you in this city, flee ye into another: for verily I say unto you, Ye shall not have gone over the cities of Israel, till the Son of man be come.
language2_text: No peyrarehten da inyo do asa ka ili am to kamo na nayo a mangay do asa ka ili. To ko na macitangayan jinyo am ji nyo pa nilivon o ili do Isedi a peylimwangan no ciriciring ko am meyhekas ko rana a Nipamnekan na ni Ama ta do to a tao.

language1_text: The disciple is not above his master, nor the servant above his lord.
language2_text: "O macyamizing rana am jyakarakarang a kano mangnanao. O peylamsoin da am ji da meyhavasi o mapeylamsoy sira.

language1_text: It is enough for the disciple that he be as his master, and the servant as his lord. If they have called the master of the house Beelzebub, how much more shall they call them of his household?
language2_text: O macinanao a tao am amyan so kasaraw a ipacingay da do amnanao sira. Akman sang o peylamsoin da tao, ta amyan so kasaraw a ipacikto da do mapeylamsoy sira tao. No ngaranan da o makayokod no asa ka vahay so marahet a ngaran a Peysepo am jyabo kaji da to macizagoman no macivahay jya tao a.

language1_text: Fear them not therefore: for there is nothing covered, that shall not be revealed; and hid, that shall not be known.
language2_text: "Am ori o ji nyo anyahei no tao an, ta mamimin o matayo a vazay a mababa. So icyakman na sang no ji meycicicyan a vazay a meytotwaw.

language1_text: What I tell you in darkness, that speak ye in light: and what ye hear in the ear, that preach ye upon the housetops.
language2_text: O ko ipanci jinyo a ji da mamizing no karwan no tao am ipeylimwang nyo do aro a tao.

language1_text: And fear not them which kill the body, but are not able to kill the soul: but rather fear him which is able to destroy both soul and body in hell.
language2_text: O makawakwak so kataotao a ji makawakwak so pahad am ji nyo anyaheyan. Si Ama ta do to o ikanyahey nyo. Ta iya o makawakwak so kataotao a kano pahad a alyowen do kararatan.

language1_text: Are not two sparrows sold for a farthing? and one of them shall not fall on the ground without your Father.
language2_text: Kakwakwan da no likta meyyasasalap ori a na manakem ni Ama ta do to am imanngo kamo.

language1_text: But the very hairs of your head are all numbered.
language2_text: Kakwakwan no avok nyo a na katenngan so vilang.

language1_text: Fear ye not therefore, ye are of more value than many sparrows.
language2_text: Am ori o ji nyo anyaheyan. Ta yarakorako o nakenakem na jinyo ni Ama ta do to a kano meyyasasalap.

language1_text: Whosoever therefore shall confess me before men, him will I confess also before my Father which is in heaven.
language2_text: "Ko pa ciring jinyo am omanoyong jyaken do tangain no tao am anoyngan ko ori do tangain ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: But whosoever shall deny me before men, him will I also deny before my Father which is in heaven.
language2_text: Omalalas jyaken do tangain no tao am alalasan ko ori do tangain ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: Think not that I am come to send peace on earth: I came not to send peace, but a sword.
language2_text: "Nyo ipanci yaken a yameygegcin no ikapya nyo so nakem do icyatatao nyo an? Beken a ori o ko nyai. Ta ko nyai do karawan o ikasyasyay nyo.

language1_text: For I am come to set a man at variance against his father, and the daughter against her mother, and the daughter in law against her mother in law.
language2_text: Ta papwen sicyakwaya o ikasyasyay da no lalima do vahay da. O tatlo am ji sira macipaswasovoy do rarwa jira.

language1_text: And a man's foes shall be they of his own household.
language2_text: O ney makdeng na kavosoyan no tao am monganay jira asa ka vahay.

language1_text: He that loveth father or mother more than me is not worthy of me: and he that loveth son or daughter more than me is not worthy of me.
language2_text: O mapahamahama pa so inyapwan na ka nyaken am ji ko na abneka o akman sang a tao a macilolo jyaken. O mapahamahama pa so ananak na ka nyaken am ji ko na abneka o akman sang a macilolo jyaken.

language1_text: And he that taketh not his cross, and followeth after me, is not worthy of me.
language2_text: O ji nabway no jyojika na a macihza jyaken am ji ko na abneka ori a macilolo jyaken.

language1_text: He that findeth his life shall lose it: and he that loseth his life for my sake shall find it.
language2_text: Ta o tao a makza no kasaray na do karawan am beken a ikapya na ori. Am o to ngawaw pa no kataotao na a mahap so vazay ko am mahap na o to meyyonong a ikavyay no pahad na.

language1_text: He that receiveth you receiveth me, and he that receiveth me receiveth him that sent me.
language2_text: "O tomaotao jinyo am yaken o taotawwen da. O tomaotao jyaken am akma dey to naotawwa o yanitomovoy jyaken.

language1_text: He that receiveth a prophet in the name of a prophet shall receive a prophet's reward; and he that receiveth a righteous man in the name of a righteous man shall receive a righteous man's reward.
language2_text: O tomaotao so lamlamsoy ni Ama ta do to am pazanoden na sira do yazaw na so lamlamsoy na. O tomaotao so ji meylimoteng so onowned a tao am pazanoden na sira ni Ama ta do to do yazaw na so ji meylimoteng so onowned a tao.

language1_text: And whosoever shall give to drink unto one of these little ones a cup of cold water only in the name of a disciple, verily I say unto you, he shall in no wise lose his reward.
language2_text: To ko na macitangayan jinyo am o maglaw no pakananaken da a omraralay nyaken a tao am jyabo kaji na makahapan so nakem na sya ni Ama ta do to a."

language1_text: And it came to pass, when Jesus had made an end of commanding his twelve disciples, he departed thence to teach and to preach in their cities.
language2_text: Teyka na o ciring na ni Yeso a inanao na so rarwa so ikakarwan a macinanao jya am karwan na dang a kangay na do macisngen a ili a mangnanao no Mapasaray a Ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: Now when John had heard in the prison the works of Christ, he sent two of his disciples,
language2_text: O nimanaktak a meyngaran si Yowani am amyan do pamemtengan. Mamizing na o vazay ni Kizisto am ori o nipanovoy na so macinanao jya mangay a macisirsiring ji Yeso. Maniring sira jya am,

language1_text: and said unto him, Art thou he that should come, or do we look for another?
language2_text: "Manngwa, imo o nipanci ni Yowani a mai? No namen pa nanalahen."

language1_text: Jesus answered and said unto them, Go and shew John again those things which ye do hear and see:
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso do nitovoy ni Yowani am, "Angay kamo pancyan ji Yowani o nyo nimacita kano nyo nimamizing,

language1_text: the blind receive their sight, and the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, and the deaf hear, the dead are raised up, and the poor have the gospel preached to them.
language2_text: do yada kapakacita rana no nimavota tao. Da kapakalam rana no nimakasapa a tao. Yada kapya rana no niomlabyab so kolit a tao. Da kapakamizing rana no nimateleh a tao. Da kavyay rana no nimawakwak a tao. Da kapakamizing rana so Mapasaray a Ciriciring no ipangoyongoyod da a tao.

language1_text: And blessed is he, whosoever shall not be offended in me.
language2_text: Omanoyong jyaken a ji meykarwa so nakem am tey yapya ori."

language1_text: And as they departed, Jesus began to say unto the multitudes concerning John, What went ye out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken with the wind?
language2_text: Mangay rana sira o nitovoy ni Yowani am ipanci na ni Yeso o vazay na ni Yowani do aro a tao. Maniring jira am, "No kangay nyo no kakwa a komala si Yowani do kabwan no nihakawan no tao am sino dang mangay nyo amizngen. Manngwa, nyo ipanci si Yowani a todapliplin so onowned?

language1_text: But what went ye out for to see? A man clothed in soft raiment? behold, they that wear soft clothing are in kings' houses.
language2_text: Manngwa, nyo mangay citahen o meyyayob so apiya ayob a tao? Ta o meyyayob rana so apipya ayob am amyan sira do vahay no panirsirngen.

language1_text: But what went ye out for to see? A prophet? yea, I say unto you, and more than a prophet.
language2_text: Ikongo nyo yangay do dang. Manngwa nyo mangay citahen o panoyonoywan na so ciring ni Ama ta do to? Ko pa ciring jinyo am manoyong ori. Am naknakmen nyo, ta yamahamahama ori a kano panoyonoywan na so ciring ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: For this is he, of whom it is written, Behold, I send my messenger before thy face, Which shall prepare thy way before thee.
language2_text: Iya rana am yamyan so yamonganay jya a yadomket do Seysyo. O ciring do dang am, 'Cita pala o yako tovoin a omwadwad do rarahan mo.'

language1_text: Verily I say unto you, Among them that are born of women there hath not risen a greater than John the Baptist: notwithstanding he that is least in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he.
language2_text: O ko ipanci jinyo am yabo o tao no kakwa a makahap si Yowani. Am yawara sicyakwaya am yarana maizaizay o ney maveveh na tao do italamozong na ni Ama ta do to a kani Yowani an.

language1_text: And from the days of John the Baptist until now the kingdom of heaven suffereth violence, and the violent take it by force.
language2_text: Niminda no kapangnanao ni Yowani a na kato ngayyan nya sicyaikwaya o da kapeyyoyoba a macikaop do italamozong na ni Ama ta do to no tao, do na katey arako no oyowyat na.

language1_text: For all the prophets and the law prophesied until John.
language2_text: O nivatvatkan da no panoyonoywan na so ciring ni Ama ta do to a kani Moyse am nimamimin sira makalavat so italamozong na ni Ama ta do to. Am si Yowani o niseykedan na rana.

language1_text: And if ye will receive it, this is Elias, which was for to come.
language2_text: No si anoyngan nyo o ciring da a nimalavat da am manoyong o kakma ney Idiya ni Yowani a mai.

language1_text: He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.
language2_text: Amizngen nyo an, peyyanen nyo do onowned nyo ori an."

language1_text: But whereunto shall I liken this generation? It is like unto children sitting in the markets, and calling unto their fellows,
language2_text: Maniring pa jira si Yeso am, "Ikongo o pehngehngayan ko so tao sicyakwaya. Sira ori am akmey kanakan a meyyalalam do rarahan a manci no,

language1_text: and saying, We have piped unto you, and ye have not danced; we have mourned unto you, and ye have not lamented.
language2_text: 'Ipeyyanwanood namen inyo am kanyo ji maganam. Namen amlavi am kanyo ji lavi.'

language1_text: For John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say, He hath a devil.
language2_text: Mai si Yowani am jyangan no tomakatakaw do kanakenakem na si Ama ta do to a kano ji nimyop so saki. So nipancyan da nya zomyak.

language1_text: The Son of man came eating and drinking, and they say, Behold a man gluttonous, and a winebibber, a friend of publicans and sinners. But wisdom is justified of her children.
language2_text: Yaken rana a Nipamnekan na ni Ama ta do to a tao am ko koman a ko keyyop. Am no kamo maniring am, 'Yamatetehnan a yameyyeyyopen a yamacizavoz do mapeyvazay so deyking a tao a kano meyraraten a tao.' Am o teneteneng na ni Ama ta do to am manoyong a meytotwaw do makza nya tao."

language1_text: Then began he to upbraid the cities wherein most of his mighty works were done, because they repented not:
language2_text: No kanang am nioya na o tao do peycyeylilyan na a nimakacita sya a mapeyvazay so mapeyzokab a vazay. Ta ji da ngaroi o peyraratenan da.

language1_text: Woe unto thee, Chorazin! woe unto thee, Bethsaida! for if the mighty works, which were done in you, had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.
language2_text: Maniring am, "Inyo rana tao do Kelasin a kado Peysayta am to kanyo makasi an. Ta o mina vazay ko jinyo do dang am no nimyan pa ori do Tayar a kado Siton am jyabo kaji da nimamlisan so nakenakem a komaro do peyraratenan da.

language1_text: But I say unto you, It shall be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon at the day of judgment, than for you.
language2_text: Am yakanyo ji mamlis. To ko na macitangayan jinyo am no marateng o araraw na no peykapyapinpinan na ni Ama ta do to so tao am makdekdeng pa o oyaoyyan na ninyo a kano nipasingsingkad na so tao do Tayar a kado Siton no kakwa pa.

language1_text: And thou, Capernaum, which art exalted unto heaven, shalt be brought down to hell: for if the mighty works, which have been done in thee, had been done in Sodom, it would have remained until this day.
language2_text: Inyo rana tao do Cyapaynong am manngwa, nyo ipanci o kapakaranes nyo do teyngato? Jyabo kaji nyo akasan do kararatan a, do kanimakacita nyo so mapeyzokab a vazay ko a. Am no nipeyvazay ko do Sotoma am yabo kanimbalinas ko sira.

language1_text: But I say unto you, That it shall be more tolerable for the land of Sodom in the day of judgment, than for thee.
language2_text: Am ko pa ciring jinyo am no marateng o araraw na no peyoyaoyyan na ni Ama ta do to am makdekdeng pa o oyaoyyan na ninyo a kano nipasingsingkad na so tao do Sotoma no kakwa pa."

language1_text: At that time Jesus answered and said, I thank thee, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because thou hast hid these things from the wise and prudent, and hast revealed them unto babes.
language2_text: No kanang am maniring si Yeso am, "Mo Ama a Panirsirngen do teyngato a kano karawan, ko isaray jimo, ta mo nibengbeng do mapakateneteneng a tao o aro a vazay, a mo kapatwaw sya do yamapehbo so nakem da a tao,

language1_text: Even so, Father: for so it seemed good in thy sight.
language2_text: mo Ama do to. Ta o akman rana sang am monganay do nakenakem mo."

language1_text: All things are delivered unto me of my Father: and no man knoweth the Son, but the Father; neither knoweth any man the Father, save the Son, and he to whomsoever the Son will reveal him.
language2_text: Maniring pa si Yeso jira am, "Yamamimin o meycyamadadayan a na nitoro jyaken ni Ama. So na ikabo no tao a makateneng jyaken. Ta si Ama o yamakateneng jyaken a Anak na. Yabwata o tao a makateneng ji Ama. Ta yaken a kano nipamnekan ko o makateneng jya. So ikabo no matarek a tao a makateneng jya.

language1_text: Come unto me, all ye that labour and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.
language2_text: "Sijya kamo a yamazikna kano yaro so alalaw a tao. Ta ihepawan ko inyo.

language1_text: Take my yoke upon you, and learn of me; for I am meek and lowly in heart: and ye shall find rest unto your souls.
language2_text: Ahapen nyo o vazay ko. Inarahen nyo yaken. Ta o nakenakem ko am mapanadnad so nakem a ji makazyazyak. No si akman kamo sang am manoyong kamo a keyhepawan so kataotao.

language1_text: For my yoke is easy, and my burden is light.
language2_text: O ko inanao jinyo am jyasalit a pangozayan nyo. O ko pahanhanan jinyo a vazay am jyasalit."

language1_text: At that time Jesus went on the sabbath day through the corn; and his disciples were an hungred, and began to pluck the ears of corn, and to eat.
language2_text: Ipisa do ipeywalam no tao am mangonong si Yeso a kano macinanao jya do nihakawan a mogi. Makcin sira o macinanao jya am to sira mangoztod so aknatahen da.

language1_text: But when the Pharisees saw it, they said unto him, Behold, thy disciples do that which is not lawful to do upon the sabbath day.
language2_text: Macita da no tatasa ka tao a macyagom do Vadisay am maniring sira ji Yeso am, "Cita pala sira o yamacinanao jimo a yaji mangozay do iwawalam ta, a yato meyvazay do ipeywalam no tao."

language1_text: But he said unto them, Have ye not read what David did, when he was an hungred, and they that were with him;
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso jira am, "Manngwa, ji nyo pa nivilangan o vazay da da Tawey a kano kararay na tao no kakcin da?

language1_text: how he entered into the house of God, and did eat the shewbread, which was not lawful for him to eat, neither for them which were with him, but only for the priests?
language2_text: Ta nisomdep si Tawey do raralayan da ni Ama ta do to a kapangap na so nipatanang da ji Ama ta do to a myanpaw a kanen a katoro na pa nya do kararay na. So nyakanan da sya. Ta o myanpaw rana ori am ji da mya kanen no tao. O mapatanatanang so nakem da si Ama ta do to o apya koman sya. Am beken a raraten da o mina kakan da sya.

language1_text: Or have ye not read in the law, how that on the sabbath days the priests in the temple profane the sabbath, and are blameless?
language2_text: Manngwa, nyo pa jya nivilangan o yadomket a ciring do iwawalam ni Moyse, do kapangday da do ipeyweywalam no tao o kaji da mangozayan do araraw no ipeyweywalam no tao no mapatanatanang so nakem do rako a panaralayan? Am beken a raraten da ori.

language1_text: But I say unto you, That in this place is one greater than the temple.
language2_text: To ko na macitangayan jinyo am yamyan jya so yamakdekdeng pa kano rako a panaralayan.

language1_text: But if ye had known what this meaneth, I will have mercy, and not sacrifice, ye would not have condemned the guiltless.
language2_text: Ta o ciring do Seysyo am, 'O ko kakzeben am apiya so nakenakem do icyatatao. Ko jyakzan o yapatanangen a makakaday.' No si manoyong kamo a makateneng do peypeypangayan no ciring eya am jyabo nyo kato mancyan no yapya so nakenakem a tao a meyraraten a.

language1_text: For the Son of man is Lord even of the sabbath day.
language2_text: Ta o Nipamnekan na ni Ama ta do to a tao o yameymatmatngeh no araraw no ipeyweywalam no tao."

language1_text: And when he was departed thence, he went into their synagogue:
language2_text: Makarahan am karwan na rana do dang ni Yeso a kangay na do peyneynozyan da no tao do Yotay.

language1_text: and, behold, there was a man which had his hand withered. And they asked him, saying, Is it lawful to heal on the sabbath days? that they might accuse him.
language2_text: Amyan do dang so asa ka tao a meykazakazain so lima. Ikongo do naknakmen da no tatasa ka tao o kapeykala da so karatan ni Yeso. Maniring sira ji Yeso am, "Manngwa, iwawalam ta o kapangiwakwak so tao do ipeyweywalam no tao an?"

language1_text: And he said unto them, What man shall there be among you, that shall have one sheep, and if it fall into a pit on the sabbath day, will he not lay hold on it, and lift it out?
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso jira am, "No si myan jinyo so mangonong so kagling a kakas na no kagling do gazawagaw do ipeywalam no tao am manngwa, ahapen nyo ori an?

language1_text: How much then is a man better than a sheep? Wherefore it is lawful to do well on the sabbath days.
language2_text: Manngwa, makdekdeng pa o kagling a kano inawan no tao? Am ori o ikapya no mangiwakwak do ipeywalam no tao."

language1_text: Then saith he to the man, Stretch forth thine hand. And he stretched it forth; and it was restored whole, like as the other.
language2_text: Maniring rana si Yeso do meykazakazain so lima tao am, "Zanet pala o lima mo." Zaneten na am todapya rana, kapeyyangay na rana no lima na.

language1_text: Then the Pharisees went out, and held a council against him, how they might destroy him.
language2_text: Makowbot sira o tao a macyagom do Vadisay do peyneynozyan am ipeysirsiring da o kacivet da ji Yeso.

language1_text: But when Jesus knew it, he withdrew himself from thence: and great multitudes followed him, and he healed them all;
language2_text: Mamizing ni Yeso o kapacioya da jya am karwan na do dang. Am aro sira o tao a macihza jya. Ori o niwakwakan na do meykeyngeyngen a tao.

language1_text: and charged them that they should not make him known:
language2_text: Meyratateng am ipanci na jira o kaji da meylimwangan no mina vazay na jira.

language1_text: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Esaias the prophet, saying,
language2_text: So ikanoyong na mangononong no mina ciring no panoyonoywan na so ciring ni Ama ta do to a meyngaran si Isayya. Ta maniring am,

language1_text: Behold my servant, whom I have chosen; My beloved, in whom my soul is well pleased: I will put my spirit upon him, And he shall shew judgment to the Gentiles.
language2_text: "Cita kamo, ta iya rana am ko nipamnekan a lamlamsoy ko. So ko kaglawan nya. Ko sarayan nya. Itoro ko jya o Seyzi ko. Ipeylimwang na do tao o kapatazadang ko sira do teyngato.

language1_text: He shall not strive, nor cry; Neither shall any man hear his voice in the streets.
language2_text: Iya rana am ji meyzezyak a gomalagal. Ji lololos do rarahan.

language1_text: A bruised reed shall he not break, And smoking flax shall he not quench, Till he send forth judgment unto victory.
language2_text: Ikarilaw na sira o ji rana teneng a tomala sya a tey arako so alalaw a tao. So icyakman na sang a somidong so ji rana teneng a meyvevyay a tao. Ji na lilis o nakem na mapeyvazay so manoyong a vazay, mangay do ipangononong no ahahapan na sya.

language1_text: And in his name shall the Gentiles trust.
language2_text: Mamimin o tao do karawan a manapet jya so pahad."

language1_text: Then was brought unto him one possessed with a devil, blind, and dumb: and he healed him, insomuch that the blind and dumb both spake and saw.
language2_text: No kanang am amyan so tao a mangay nya ji Yeso so kovotan no kalamsoyan ni Satan a ji makabnebnek a mavota tao. Makarahan am iwakwakan na kapakabnebnek na rana kapakacita na rana.

language1_text: And all the people were amazed, and said, Is not this the son of David?
language2_text: Nisavasavak da no aro a tao. Maniring sira am, "Ala iya ya o sivovoong ni Tawey."

language1_text: But when the Pharisees heard it, they said, This fellow doth not cast out devils, but by Beelzebub the prince of the devils.
language2_text: Mamizing da no tao a macyagom do Vadisay am maniring sira am, "O na ipakavozwaw so kalamsoyan ni Satan am na oyatan ni Satan a meyngaran so Peysepo."

language1_text: And Jesus knew their thoughts, and said unto them, Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation; and every city or house divided against itself shall not stand:
language2_text: Katenngan na ni Yeso o keyleylamdam da sya. Maniring jira am, "Abwata asa ka mahataw a macizakazakat. So icyakman na sang no asa ka vahay a ji macizakazakat.

language1_text: and if Satan cast out Satan, he is divided against himself; how shall then his kingdom stand?
language2_text: No si meyyarap sira Satan a kano kalamsoyan na am ji da rana pakongo o kabedbed da. So to da ranavwaki.

language1_text: And if I by Beelzebub cast out devils, by whom do your children cast them out? therefore they shall be your judges.
language2_text: Nyo panci yaken a na oyatan ni Peysepo. Ikongo o nyo ji mancii no kararay nyo a nipantan na ni Peysepo so oyowyat na.

language1_text: But if I cast out devils by the Spirit of God, then the kingdom of God is come unto you.
language2_text: No si manoyong ko a mamozwaw no oyowyat ni Ama ta do to am yamanoyong rana si Ama ta do to a tomalamozong no omanoyong jya tao sicyaikwaya.

language1_text: Or else how can one enter into a strong man's house, and spoil his goods, except he first bind the strong man? and then he will spoil his house.
language2_text: "Abo tao a tondep do yanan no makapya meykalokal a tao a mangay tomakaw so apzapzatan na. No si myan saon so makavaod so meykalokal a tao am ori o ipakatakaw na so apzapzatan na am."

language1_text: He that is not with me is against me; and he that gathereth not with me scattereth abroad.
language2_text: Nipanci na pa ni Yeso am, "O ji nganod jyaken am mapasobna jyaken. O ji nidong jyaken am zazatan na o vazay ko.

language1_text: Wherefore I say unto you, All manner of sin and blasphemy shall be forgiven unto men: but the blasphemy against the Holy Ghost shall not be forgiven unto men.
language2_text: Am ori o ko pancyan nya jinyo an. O raraten no tao a kano kakolala da si Ama ta do to am mavonas ori. Am omraherahet so Seyzi na ni Ama ta do to a tao am jyavonas o akman sang a raraten na.

language1_text: And whosoever speaketh a word against the Son of man, it shall be forgiven him: but whosoever speaketh against the Holy Ghost, it shall not be forgiven him, neither in this world, neither in the world to come.
language2_text: O komolala jyaken a Nipamnekan na ni Ama ta do to a tao am mavonas o akman sang a raraten. Am omraherahet so Seyzi na ni Ama ta do to a tao am to rana meyyonong a jyavonas o akman sang a raraten.

language1_text: Either make the tree good, and his fruit good; or else make the tree corrupt, and his fruit corrupt: for the tree is known by his fruit.
language2_text: "O kakanen so asi a kayo am kanen o asi na. O ji ngangana so asi a kayo am ji nganna o asi na. So to na macilociloloi do kakayokayo na no asi na.

language1_text: O generation of vipers, how can ye, being evil, speak good things? for out of the abundance of the heart the mouth speaketh.
language2_text: Inyo rana macitapas do tokza so onowned a tao am abo o apya ciring a powboten nyo.

language1_text: A good man out of the good treasure of the heart bringeth forth good things: and an evil man out of the evil treasure bringeth forth evil things.
language2_text: O apya so nakenakem a tao am apya o icicirawat na. O marahet so nakenakem a tao am marahet o icicirawat na. Ta to macilocilolo do kapyan no onowned nyo a karahet no onowned nyo o powboten nyo a ciring.

language1_text: But I say unto you, That every idle word that men shall speak, they shall give account thereof in the day of judgment.
language2_text: To ko na macitangayan jinyo am no marateng o araraw no peykapyapinpinan na ni Ama ta do to so tao am abo rana o taywen da ciring da.

language1_text: For by thy words thou shalt be justified, and by thy words thou shalt be condemned.
language2_text: Ta to na palololwa ni Ama ta do to do mina ciring nyo o keyyan no raraten nyo a kabo no raraten nyo."

language1_text: Then certain of the scribes and of the Pharisees answered, saying, Master, we would see a sign from thee.
language2_text: No kanang am amyan so mangnanao no iwawalam ni Ama ta do to a kano tao a macyagom do Vadisay a manci nya ji Yeso. Maniring sira am, "Mo Mangnanao, namen kakzeben o kapakacita namen jimo a meyvazay so mapeyzokab a vazay."

language1_text: But he answered and said unto them, An evil and adulterous generation seeketh after a sign; and there shall no sign be given to it, but the sign of the prophet Jonas:
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso jira am, "Yatey makdeng o raraten no tao sicyakwaya. Ikongo o da kakzeban so da kapakacita so oyowyat na ni Ama ta do to. Am o akman so mina vazay na ni Ama ta do to do panoyonoywan na so ciring na a meyngaran si Yena o macita nyo. So ikabo no maharahara pa kano nang a macita nyo.

language1_text: for as Jonas was three days and three nights in the whale's belly; so shall the Son of man be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth.
language2_text: Mina katlo araw a kano katlo ahep si Yena nimyan do velek no rako a among. Akman ko sang a Nipamnekan na ni Ama ta do to a tao a amyan do oned no tana so makatlo araw a kano katlo ahep.

language1_text: The men of Nineveh shall rise in judgment with this generation, and shall condemn it: because they repented at the preaching of Jonas; and, behold, a greater than Jonas is here.
language2_text: No marateng o araraw no ipacici na a mapeykapyapinpin so tao ni Ama ta do to am meytatanek sira o tao do Niniwey a omraherahet jinyo a tao sicyakwaya. Ta mamizing da o ciring ni Yena am mamlis rana sira. To ko na macitangayan jinyo am amyan jya so rakorako pa so vazay a kani Yena. Am yanyo ji ngapa o nanao na jinyo.

language1_text: The queen of the south shall rise up in the judgment with this generation, and shall condemn it: for she came from the uttermost parts of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and, behold, a greater than Solomon is here.
language2_text: No marateng o araraw no ipacici na a mapeykapyapinpin so tao ni Ama ta do to am meytatanek o panirsirngen a mavakes a meyvahay do Siba no kakwa pa a omraherahet jinyo a tao sicyaikwaya. Ta iya rana am nimapo do marai a ili da a mangay a omamizing so ciring ni Solomen. To ko na macitangayan jinyo am yamyan jya so yarakorako pa so vazay a kani Solomen am yanyo ji ngamiznga.

language1_text: When the unclean spirit is gone out of a man, he walketh through dry places, seeking rest, and findeth none.
language2_text: "Mavozwaw o kalamsoyan ni Satan do nikovotan na tao am omlivolivon a meykala so peywalaman na. Am ji makakala.

language1_text: Then he saith, I will return into my house from whence I came out; and when he is come, he findeth it empty, swept, and garnished.
language2_text: Maniring am, 'Yapyapya rana o kapeysinaoli ko pa mangay komovot do nikovotan ko a tao.' Meysinaoli rana am macita na o tao ang a makownong rana jya, ta abo nimacipalit a nikomovot jya.

language1_text: Then goeth he, and taketh with himself seven other spirits more wicked than himself, and they enter in and dwell there: and the last state of that man is worse than the first. Even so shall it be also unto this wicked generation.
language2_text: So nyangay na manara so papito a masozisozi pa ka nya a kalamsoyan ni Satan a mangay komovot jya. Manngo o tao ori a. Jyabo kaji na raherahetan pa sicyaikwaya kano kakwa no nakenakem na. To ko macitangayan jinyo am o raraten da rana no tao sicyaikwaya am maraherahet pa kano kakwa."

language1_text: While he yet talked to the people, behold, his mother and his brethren stood without, desiring to speak with him.
language2_text: Mangononong pa si Yeso do aro a tao am mai si ina na kada wari na mahakay a komakzeb so kapacisirsiring da jya.

language1_text: Then one said unto him, Behold, thy mother and thy brethren stand without, desiring to speak with thee.
language2_text: Maniring o tao ji Yeso am, "Ana, yamyan so da ipanci ni ina mo a kada wari mo do pantaw."

language1_text: But he answered and said unto him that told him, Who is my mother? and who are my brethren?
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso am, "Sino ina ko a kano kakakteh ko."

language1_text: And he stretched forth his hand toward his disciples, and said, Behold my mother and my brethren!
language2_text: Makarahan am maniring rana do macinanao am, "Cita kamo, ta sira rana ito am ina ko a kada kakakteh ko.

language1_text: For whosoever shall do the will of my Father which is in heaven, the same is my brother, and sister, and mother.
language2_text: Ta o mahap so vazay ni Ama do to a tao am ori o abneken ko a kakakteh ko a kano ina ko."

language1_text: The same day went Jesus out of the house, and sat by the sea side.
language2_text: Araw no nang am karwan na ni Yeso o vahay ori a kangay na do pamsan na no rako a meybebneng a ranom a omlisna do dang a mangnanao.

language1_text: And great multitudes were gathered together unto him, so that he went into a ship, and sat; and the whole multitude stood on the shore.
language2_text: Aro tao a meylovolovot do tangain na. Am ori o nizagpit na do vazangay a omlisna. O aro a tao am meytatanek sira do pamsan na.

language1_text: And he spake many things unto them in parables, saying, Behold, a sower went forth to sow;
language2_text: Makarahan am mangononong so pehngehngayan na so aro a ciring na. Maniring am, "Amyan so asa ka tao a mangay a manokos.

language1_text: and when he sowed, some seeds fell by the way side, and the fowls came and devoured them up:
language2_text: Manokos ori am amyan so zomsi do rarahan. Am mangay da toktokan no meyyasasalap.

language1_text: some fell upon stony places, where they had not much earth: and forthwith they sprung up, because they had no deepness of earth:
language2_text: Karwan na am zomsi do kavatovatwan. Am amlida, ta amyan so aliket a tana.

language1_text: and when the sun was up, they were scorched; and because they had no root, they withered away.
language2_text: No amdada o araw am mapseng, do kaji na makayamotan, ta alikey o tana.

language1_text: And some fell among thorns; and the thorns sprung up, and choked them:
language2_text: O zomsi do katamtamkan na am tana amlida am ji malasi. Ta kaongongan no aro a tamek.

language1_text: but other fell into good ground, and brought forth fruit, some an hundredfold, some sixtyfold, some thirtyfold.
language2_text: O zomsi do apya so tanatana am apiya o kalidalida na a kapakapya na rana malasi. So iyan no makapoo (100) a kano sikanem a ngarnan (60) a kano sikatlo a ngarnan (30) so kasahasahang."

language1_text: Who hath ears to hear, let him hear.
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso am, "Amizngen nyo an, peyyanen nyo do onowned nyo ori an."

language1_text: And the disciples came, and said unto him, Why speakest thou unto them in parables?
language2_text: Mai sira o macinanao ji Yeso am maniring sira jya am, "No mo nanawen sira o tao am ikongo o mo pehngehngayan so ciring mo."

language1_text: He answered and said unto them, Because it is given unto you to know the mysteries of the kingdom of heaven, but to them it is not given.
language2_text: Tovisan ni Yeso am, "O ji na nipatwaw pa a peypeypangayan na do talamozongan na ninyo ni Ama ta do to o nipanci ko jinyo. Am o karwan no tao am da pa jyatenngi ori.

language1_text: For whosoever hath, to him shall be given, and he shall have more abundance: but whosoever hath not, from him shall be taken away even that he hath.
language2_text: Ta o tao a omamizing so ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to am arwaro pa o makarapa jira ciring. So icyakma ney kanen a to meypanpani. Am o ji ngamizing so ciriciring ni Ama ta do to am tana amyan so alikey a katenngan da am to meykabobo pa jira ori.

language1_text: Therefore speak I to them in parables: because they seeing see not; and hearing they hear not, neither do they understand.
language2_text: Ori o ko pehngehngayan so ciring ko a yamnanao sira. Ta tana da citahen am akma dey jyacita. Tana da amizngen am akma dey jyamizing. Da jyatenngi.

language1_text: And in them is fulfilled the prophecy of Esaias, which saith, By hearing ye shall hear, and shall not understand; And seeing ye shall see, and shall not perceive:
language2_text: Am ori o na todey mangononong do mina ciring no panoyonoywan na so ciring ni Ama ta do to a meyngaran so Isayya. Ta maniring am, 'Manoyong o kamizing nyo sya am ji nyo a tenngi. Macita nyo am ji nyo a pengkad.

language1_text: For this people's heart is waxed gross, And their ears are dull of hearing, And their eyes they have closed; Lest at any time they should see with their eyes, And hear with their ears, And should understand with their heart, And should be converted, and I should heal them.
language2_text: Ta tey masalit o onowned da no tao eya. O cicilwan da am yakacilcilan. O mata da am yameyreket. Ta no sira macipayok so onowned am makacita o mata da. Makamizing o cicilwan da. Makazazap da no onowned a kapeysinaoli da rana jyaken. Ta ori o ipatazadang ko sira do teyngato.'

language1_text: But blessed are your eyes, for they see: and your ears, for they hear.
language2_text: "Am inyo am kamo tey yapya. Ta yamakacita o mata nyo. Yamakamizing o cicilwan nyo.

language1_text: For verily I say unto you, That many prophets and righteous men have desired to see those things which ye see, and have not seen them; and to hear those things which ye hear, and have not heard them.
language2_text: To ko na macitangayan jinyo am aro o panoyonoywan na so ciring ni Ama ta do to a kano omraralay ni Ama ta do to no kakwa a makza no kapakacita da so nyo macita kano kapakamizing da so nyo mamizing. Am da jya nimacita. Da jya nimamizing.

language1_text: Hear ye therefore the parable of the sower.
language2_text: "Amizngen nyo o peypeypangayan no manokos ang.

language1_text: When any one heareth the word of the kingdom, and understandeth it not, then cometh the wicked one, and catcheth away that which was sown in his heart. This is he which received seed by the way side.
language2_text: O tao a makamizing so nanao a omagaz do italamozong na ni Ama ta do to a kaji makatenngan jya am akman so nizomsi do rarahan ang. No mai si Satan am pehsen na jya o ciring na ni Ama ta do to amyan do onowned na.

language1_text: But he that received the seed into stony places, the same is he that heareth the word, and anon with joy receiveth it;
language2_text: O nizomsi do kavatovatwan am katonodan no masaray a omamizing so ciring na ni Ama ta do to a tao.

language1_text: yet hath he not root in himself, but dureth for a while: for when tribulation or persecution ariseth because of the word, by and by he is offended.
language2_text: Am ikongo do ji makayamot do onowned na, am no masazi na o alalaw na kano peyrarehtan da sya do kahap na so nanao ni Ama ta do to am makeykai a mablis o onowned na.

language1_text: He also that received seed among the thorns is he that heareth the word; and the care of this world, and the deceitfulness of riches, choke the word, and he becometh unfruitful.
language2_text: O nizomsi do katamtamkan am katonodan no tao a omamizing so nanao ni Ama ta do to. Am masanga no vazay na do karawan a kalita jya no peymeymasaodan na. Am ori o ikabengbeng no ciring na ni Ama ta do to do onowned na.

language1_text: But he that received seed into the good ground is he that heareth the word, and understandeth it; which also beareth fruit, and bringeth forth, some an hundredfold, some sixty, some thirty.
language2_text: O nizomsi do apya so tanatana am katonodan no tao a omamizing so ciring na ni Ama ta do to a makateneng rana jya a pangozayan a peyvazain. So icyakma ney malasi so makapoo (100) a kano sikanem a ngarnan (60) a kano sikatlo a ngarnan (30) so kasahasahang."

language1_text: Another parable put he forth unto them, saying, The kingdom of heaven is likened unto a man which sowed good seed in his field:
language2_text: Mangononong pa si Yeso so asa ka pehngehngayan na so ciring na. Maniring am, "O italamozong na ni Ama ta do to am akman so tao a mangay a meymowa do nihakawan da.

language1_text: but while men slept, his enemy came and sowed tares among the wheat, and went his way.
language2_text: Mitkeh o tao ori am mangay o kavosoyan na a mangay a meymowa so tamek a kangay na rana a moli.

language1_text: But when the blade was sprung up, and brought forth fruit, then appeared the tares also.
language2_text: Amlida o mogi am amrawa rana. Amlida o tamek am to rana singkaji a malas a amrawa.

language1_text: So the servants of the householder came and said unto him, Sir, didst not thou sow good seed in thy field? from whence then hath it tares?
language2_text: Mai sira o lamlamsoy no mapeynihakawan sya am maniring sira am, 'Mo maran, mina kapeymowa mo so apipiya mogi asyo am. Am asyo o tamek ang!'

language1_text: He said unto them, An enemy hath done this. The servants said unto him, Wilt thou then that we go and gather them up?
language2_text: Maniring o mapeynihakawan sya am, 'Ori am na mina vazay no kavosoyan ko.' Maniring o lamlamsoy na jya am, 'Manngwa, to namen rana botbota o tamek ori an?'

language1_text: But he said, Nay; lest while ye gather up the tares, ye root up also the wheat with them.
language2_text: Maniring jira o mapeynihakawan sya am, 'Taosya, ta to nyo pazaksa o mogi a botboten.

language1_text: Let both grow together until the harvest: and in the time of harvest I will say to the reapers, Gather ye together first the tares, and bind them in bundles to burn them: but gather the wheat into my barn.
language2_text: To nyo macipanadngi a mamno. Cyaha, ta no langin ko na am ipanci ko do lamlamsoy ko o kapanma da so tamek a botboten a kapeykabedbed da sya asleben. O mogi am ahapen da a mangay a sokzen do panonokzan ko.'"

language1_text: Another parable put he forth unto them, saying, The kingdom of heaven is like to a grain of mustard seed, which a man took, and sowed in his field:
language2_text: Ipanci na pa jira ni Yeso o asa ka pehngehngayan na so ciring na. Maniring am, "O ipeyparo da no tao a macikaop do italamozong ni Ama ta do to am akman so asa ka vettow no nappa a tokosen no tao do peymowamowan na.

language1_text: which indeed is the least of all seeds: but when it is grown, it is the greatest among herbs, and becometh a tree, so that the birds of the air come and lodge in the branches thereof.
language2_text: O vettow rana am ney likey ori. Am no amlida ori am abo makataha sya so karakorako. So icyakma ney kayo a panagzan da no meyyasasalap."

language1_text: Another parable spake he unto them; The kingdom of heaven is like unto leaven, which a woman took, and hid in three measures of meal, till the whole was leavened.
language2_text: Ipanci na pa ni Yeso o asa ka pehngehngayan na so ciring na. Maniring am, "O ipeyparo da no tao a macikaop do italamozong na ni Ama ta do to am akman rana so kosozi no odong a ahapen no mavakes a pazavozen do odong a ipeymway na sya."

language1_text: All these things spake Jesus unto the multitude in parables; and without a parable spake he not unto them:
language2_text: Mangononong si Yeso so pehngehngayan na so ciring na do aro a vazay na. No abo pehngehngayan na so ciring na am abo inanao na sira so aro a tao.

language1_text: That it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet, saying, I will open my mouth in parables; I will utter things which have been kept secret from the foundation of the world.
language2_text: O ikakman na sang am todey mangononong o mina ciring no panoyonoywan na so ciring ni Ama ta do to. Ta maniring am, "Mangamaog ko so pehngehngayan ko so ciring ko a pancyan ko no ji pa nipatwaw a vazay ko, nimakalapo no kapangamaog ko so karawan."

language1_text: Then Jesus sent the multitude away, and went into the house: and his disciples came unto him, saying, Declare unto us the parable of the tares of the field.
language2_text: Karwan ni Yeso o aro a tao am somdep do vahay. Maniring sira o macinanao jya am, "Pancyan pala jyamen o peypeypangayan no mo pehngehngayan so ciring mo a omagaz do tamek do nihakawan."

language1_text: He answered and said unto them, He that soweth the good seed is the Son of man;
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso am, "O manokos a tao ori am yaken a Nipamnekan na ni Ama ta do to a tao.

language1_text: the field is the world; the good seed are the children of the kingdom; but the tares are the children of the wicked one;
language2_text: O nihakawan ori am karawan. O nitokos ori am monganay do italamozong ni Ama ta do to a tao. O tamek am aro a tao a italamozong ni Satan.

language1_text: the enemy that sowed them is the devil; the harvest is the end of the world; and the reapers are the angels.
language2_text: O mapasakoy so tamek a kavosoyan ori am si Satan. O peypeypangayan no mangay mangap rana sya ori am kavosan no karawan. O mangap sya a tao ori am tinsi.

language1_text: As therefore the tares are gathered and burned in the fire; so shall it be in the end of this world.
language2_text: No komavos o karawan am o meyraraten a tao am akman sira so tamek ang a botboten a pasleben do lila no apoy.

language1_text: The Son of man shall send forth his angels, and they shall gather out of his kingdom all things that offend, and them which do iniquity;
language2_text: Yaken rana a Nipamnekan na ni Ama ta do to a tao am manovoy ko so tinsi a mangay omrakep so tomirara so tao a meyraraten a kano marahet so ahahapan sya,

language1_text: and shall cast them into a furnace of fire: there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth.
language2_text: a kapasleb ko sira do apoy a kapeylavilavi da a mapeygazicigit so ngepen da a maneneseh.

language1_text: Then shall the righteous shine forth as the sun in the kingdom of their Father. Who hath ears to hear, let him hear.
language2_text: No si marateng rana ori am o ji meylimoteng so nakem do italamozong ni Ama ta do to am akman sira so araw a maniray. So amizngan nyo sya an, peyyanen nyo do onowned nyo ori an.

language1_text: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto treasure hid in a field; the which when a man hath found, he hideth, and for joy thereof goeth and selleth all that he hath, and buyeth that field.
language2_text: "O italamozong na ni Ama ta do to am akman so ovay a nibobo do tana. Makala no asa ka tao am bonbonan na kasaray na mamalit no kangangay na isazang na do nihakawan ang.

language1_text: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto a merchant man, seeking goodly pearls:
language2_text: "O italamozong na ni Ama ta do to am akman so tao a meykala so mazaponay a sazangan na.

language1_text: who, when he had found one pearl of great price, went and sold all that he had, and bought it.
language2_text: No makakala so mazaponay am ipamalit na o kangangay na so nizpi a mangay na isazang do mazaponay ang.

language1_text: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto a net, that was cast into the sea, and gathered of every kind:
language2_text: "O italamozong na ni Ama ta do to am akman so tawaz a pazaten do awa a ipanawaz so makakaday a among.

language1_text: which, when it was full, they drew to shore, and sat down, and gathered the good into vessels, but cast the bad away.
language2_text: No aro rana o among am ngingiten da rana no mangahahap a tao a kapeykapyapinpin da sya do pamsan na. O pipya among am pangain da do aomas a kawalit da no ji ngangana a among.

language1_text: So shall it be at the end of the world: the angels shall come forth, and sever the wicked from among the just,
language2_text: Akman sang no komavos o karawan. Ta mai o aro a tinsi a mapapinpin so ji meyraraten a tao a kapapinpin da so meyraraten a tao,

language1_text: and shall cast them into the furnace of fire: there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth.
language2_text: a kawalit da no meyraraten a tao do apoy a kapeylavilavi da do dang a meygazicigit so ngepen a maneneseh."

language1_text: Jesus saith unto them, Have ye understood all these things? They say unto him, Yea, Lord.
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso jira am, "Nyo mamimin o ciring eya yakatenngan?" Maniring sira am, "Namen todamimin a yakatenngan."

language1_text: Then said he unto them, Therefore every scribe which is instructed unto the kingdom of heaven is like unto a man that is an householder, which bringeth forth out of his treasure things new and old.
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso am, "O mangnanao no iwawalam ni Ama ta do to a tao a kapacikaop na rana do italamozong ni Ama ta do to am akman so katenngan a tao a aro so peymeymasaodan. Ta beken a o adan a nanao o katenngan na a ipangnanao, ta katenngan na o vayo a nanao ni Ama ta do to a patwawen."

language1_text: And it came to pass, that when Jesus had finished these parables, he departed thence.
language2_text: Teyka na ni Yeso o aro a pehngehngayan na so ciring na a ipanci am karwan na do dang,

language1_text: And when he was come into his own country, he taught them in their synagogue, insomuch that they were astonished, and said, Whence hath this man this wisdom, and these mighty works?
language2_text: a kangay na rana do ili da. So nipangnanao na do peyneynozyan no tao. Abo ji meyzokab no ciring na a makamizing sya tao. Maniring sira am, "Do wanjin na niyapwan no teneng na ya. Yamyan pa so yamapeyzokab a vazay a na mina vazay.

language1_text: Is not this the carpenter's son? is not his mother called Mary? and his brethren, James, and Joses, and Simon, and Judas?
language2_text: Beken a anak na ori no meykeykawaz asyo? Beken a ina na si Madiya asyo? Beken a wari na si Yake a kani Yoseyvo a kani Simong a kani Yota asyo?

language1_text: And his sisters, are they not all with us? Whence then hath this man all these things?
language2_text: Da kapacikeylyan jyaten da wari na mavakes asyo. Am do wanjin na kapwan no oyowyat na kano teneteneng na."

language1_text: And they were offended in him. But Jesus said unto them, A prophet is not without honour, save in his own country, and in his own house.
language2_text: Makarahan am ikaoya da rana si Yeso. Maniring si Yeso jira am, "O panoyonoywan na so ciring ni Ama ta do to am ikanig da sira no tao do peycyeylilyan na. Am kolalahen da sira no macikeylyan jya kano pacivahayan da tao."

language1_text: And he did not many mighty works there because of their unbelief.
language2_text: Ikongo do ji da nganoyngi si Yeso, am ori o ji na nimeyvazai so aro a mapeyzokab a vazay do dang.

language1_text: At that time Herod the tetrarch heard of the fame of Jesus,
language2_text: No kanang am o panirsirngen no Cyadidi a meyngaran so Helote am mamizing na o vazay ni Yeso.

language1_text: and said unto his servants, This is John the Baptist; he is risen from the dead; and therefore mighty works do shew forth themselves in him.
language2_text: Maniring do lamlamsoy na am, "Ala nimanaktak a si Yowani o tao ori a yanimirwa a mavyay. Am ori o na ikatey mowyat a yamapeyvazay so yamapeyzokab a vazay."

language1_text: For Herod had laid hold on John, and bound him, and put him in prison for Herodias' sake, his brother Philip's wife. For John said unto him, It is not lawful for thee to have her.
language2_text: O cinawakwak na ni Yowani am o panirsirngen a meyngaran so Helote am to ney mehsa o mavakes no kakteh na a meyngaran so Veydipo. O ngaran no mavakes am si Helotiya. Masangib si Yowani a mazyak nya, do kato ney nakawan so kataned na do vahay no kakteh na. Am ori o nipanovoy na ni Helote so tao no kanang a omrakep si Yowani a kangay da nya do pamemtengan. O cinawakwak na ni Yowani am o panirsirngen a meyngaran so Helote am to ney mehsa o mavakes no kakteh na a meyngaran so Veydipo. O ngaran no mavakes am si Helotiya. Masangib si Yowani a mazyak nya, do kato ney nakawan so kataned na do vahay no kakteh na. Am ori o nipanovoy na ni Helote so tao no kanang a omrakep si Yowani a kangay da nya do pamemtengan.

language1_text: And when he would have put him to death, he feared the multitude, because they counted him as a prophet.
language2_text: Ori o naknakman na sya ni Helote si Yowani a wakwaken. Am ikanyahey na o aro a tao. Ta ipanci da si Yowani a panoyonoywan na so ciring ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: But when Herod's birthday was kept, the daughter of Herodias danced before them, and pleased Herod.
language2_text: Araraw no cinatazak na tao ni Helote am maganam o anak na mavakes ni Helotiya do tangain no nipanoyon na tao. Ikakza ni Helote o ganam na.

language1_text: Whereupon he promised with an oath to give her whatsoever she would ask.
language2_text: Maniring rana si Helote do maganam a mavakes am, "No amyan so amin mo jyaken am cyaha, ta itoro ko jimo."

language1_text: And she, being before instructed of her mother, said, Give me here John Baptist's head in a charger.
language2_text: Ikongo do nyahes na no ina na o anak na, am ori o nipancyan na no, "Oo no nimanaktak a si Yowani a pangain do kakanan a itoro mo jyaken."

language1_text: And the king was sorry: nevertheless for the oath's sake, and them which sat with him at meat, he commanded it to be given her.
language2_text: Makarahan am ji rana teneng a manakenakem o panirsirngen ang, do kanimapanmanma na so ciring na do tangain no nipanoyon na a tao. Am ori o to na rana myapyai so amin na jya itoro jya.

language1_text: And he sent, and beheaded John in the prison.
language2_text: Makarahan am mapahanhan rana so tao a mangay do pamemtengan a motow do oo na ni Yowani,

language1_text: And his head was brought in a charger, and given to the damsel: and she brought it to her mother.
language2_text: kapangay na rana sya do kakanan a itoro do anak ni Helotiya. Ahapen no mavakes ori am itoro na ji ina na.

language1_text: And his disciples came, and took up the body, and buried it, and went and told Jesus.
language2_text: O macinanao ji Yowani am mangay da pingsanan o kataotao ni Yowani, kangay da rana mapakakasa sya. Meyratateng am mangay rana sira a manci nya ji Yeso.

language1_text: When Jesus heard of it, he departed thence by ship into a desert place apart: and when the people had heard thereof, they followed him on foot out of the cities.
language2_text: Mamizing na ni Yeso o kanimawakwak na ni Yowani am omavang do vazangay a kano macinanao jya a komaro do dang a kaveyvow na mangay do kabwan no tao. Katenngan da no aro a tao am omalam sira a apo do peycyeylilyan na a omonot jya.

language1_text: And Jesus went forth, and saw a great multitude, and was moved with compassion toward them, and he healed their sick.
language2_text: Makaranes si Yeso do pamsan na am macita na o aro a tao. So nikarilawan na nira. Am ori o niwakwakan na do ingingnen da no meyngen a tao.

language1_text: And when it was evening, his disciples came to him, saying, This is a desert place, and the time is now past; send the multitude away, that they may go into the villages, and buy themselves victuals.
language2_text: Maseyrem rana am mai sira o macinanao ji Yeso. Maniring sira am, "Yatey mahep rana. Yabo pa do jya o tao a yameyvahay. So to ta na novoi sira kangay da manazang so kanen da do ili."

language1_text: But Jesus said unto them, They need not depart; give ye them to eat.
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso am, "Cyaha, ji nyo novoya sira. Pantan kamo sira so kanen da."

language1_text: And they say unto him, We have here but five loaves, and two fishes.
language2_text: Maniring sira o macinanao jya am, "Yalima ka myanpaw a kano yadwa ka among o yamyan jyamen do jya."

language1_text: He said, Bring them hither to me.
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso am, "Inney kamo."

language1_text: And he commanded the multitude to sit down on the grass, and took the five loaves, and the two fishes, and looking up to heaven, he blessed, and brake, and gave the loaves to his disciples, and the disciples to the multitude.
language2_text: Makarahan am ipanci na sira o tao a amlisna do katamtamkan a kahap na so alima ka myanpaw a kano adwa ka among a katangara na so hanit a somaray nya ji Ama ta do to a kakcikcil na so myanpaw a itoro do macinanao jya a kavonong da rana sya do aro a tao.

language1_text: And they did all eat, and were filled: and they took up of the fragments that remained twelve baskets full.
language2_text: So ikamimin da rana nikoman a mabsoy. Peysinsinmowen da rana o atda da am nipno da o adwa so ikarwa ka yala.

language1_text: And they that had eaten were about five thousand men, beside women and children.
language2_text: O vilang no tao a nikoman am kakaliman a ranaw (5000) sira. Am ji pa nipavilang sira o mavakes a kano kanakan.

language1_text: And straightway Jesus constrained his disciples to get into a ship, and to go before him unto the other side, while he sent the multitudes away.
language2_text: Komavos ori am ipanci na rana ni Yeso o macinanao jya somakay do vazangay a mangay do katovangan na no rako a meybebneng a ranom.

language1_text: And when he had sent the multitudes away, he went up into a mountain apart to pray: and when the evening was come, he was there alone.
language2_text: Teyka na taitaiden o aro a tao am maveyvow a mangay do tokon a meynozi. Mahep rana am amyan pa do dang.

language1_text: But the ship was now in the midst of the sea, tossed with waves: for the wind was contrary.
language2_text: Am marai rana o vazangay do pamsan na. Ikongo do sangozen da, am ori o ikaligaligan no vazangay do kasangoz da sya.

language1_text: And in the fourth watch of the night Jesus went unto them, walking on the sea.
language2_text: Toda jyadagdag rana am amyan si Yeso do rako a meybebneng a ranom a mangonong a meypangay do macinanao jya.

language1_text: And when the disciples saw him walking on the sea, they were troubled, saying, It is a spirit; and they cried out for fear.
language2_text: Macita da no macinanao jya a omalam do ranom am ikanyahey da. Maniring sira am, "Anito!" kwan da a manyahey a amlololos.

language1_text: But straightway Jesus spake unto them, saying, Be of good cheer; it is I; be not afraid.
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso jira am, "Ji kamo anyahey, ta yaken."

language1_text: And Peter answered him and said, Lord, if it be thou, bid me come unto thee on the water.
language2_text: Maniring si Pite am, "Mo Panirsirngen, no si Yeso ka am pancyan yaken a kalam ko do ranom a mangay jimo."

language1_text: And he said, Come. And when Peter was come down out of the ship, he walked on the water, to go to Jesus.
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso am, "Sijya." Makarahan am gomcin si Pite do vazangay a kalam na do ranom a meypangay ji Yeso.

language1_text: But when he saw the wind boisterous, he was afraid; and beginning to sink, he cried, saying, Lord, save me.
language2_text: Am macita na o omaopaong am to rana nyahey. Toda jingned am amlololos a manci ni Yeso do kahap na sya.

language1_text: And immediately Jesus stretched forth his hand, and caught him, and said unto him, O thou of little faith, wherefore didst thou doubt?
language2_text: Makarahan am jya nimeyyahahay si Yeso a mangay komatkat sya. Maniring am, "Yatey likey pa o onowned mo, ta mo ji meyhanhan nyaken. Ikongo o mo peykarwan so onowned mo a yaji meyhanhan nyaken."

language1_text: And when they were come into the ship, the wind ceased.
language2_text: Zomagpit rana sira do vazangay am irekhang na rana o pagpag.

language1_text: Then they that were in the ship came and worshipped him, saying, Of a truth thou art the Son of God.
language2_text: O macikavang ji Yeso a macinanao jya am iraralay da rana si Yeso. Maniring sira am, "Namen anoyngan imo a Anak ni Ama ta do to."

language1_text: And when they were gone over, they came into the land of Gennesaret.
language2_text: Makaranes sira do katovangan no rako a meybebneng a ranom am mangid sira do Kenisale.

language1_text: And when the men of that place had knowledge of him, they sent out into all that country round about, and brought unto him all that were diseased;
language2_text: Masingkad da si Yeso no aro a tao do dang am manovoy sira so tao a mangay a mapeykatokatoyo so meykeyngeyngen a tao do manwanongnong a ili a kangay da nira do tangain ni Yeso.

language1_text: and besought him that they might only touch the hem of his garment: and as many as touched were made perfectly whole.
language2_text: Ta no si ori pa o ipakapinan da do ayob ni Yeso. Ta o minan do ayob ni Yeso a tao am todapya rana sira.

language1_text: Then came to Jesus scribes and Pharisees, which were of Jerusalem, saying,
language2_text: Amyan so tao a macyagom do Vadisay a kano mangnanao no iwawalam ni Ama ta do to a nimapo do Yelosaleng a mangay ji Yeso. Maniring sira jya am,

language1_text: Why do thy disciples transgress the tradition of the elders? for they wash not their hands when they eat bread.
language2_text: "Ikongo da ji ngapi so iwawalam no ineynapo ta no macinanao jimo, do da kaji mavanawan no omanam sira a koman."

language1_text: But he answered and said unto them, Why do ye also transgress the commandment of God by your tradition?
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso am, "Ikongo nyo apyapyan pa so Ciriciring ni Ama ta do to a yataosyahen a yanyo kahap so iwawalam no ineynapo nyo.

language1_text: For God commanded, saying, Honour thy father and mother: and, He that curseth father or mother, let him die the death.
language2_text: No maniring si Ama ta do to am, 'Ikaglaw nyo a ikanig o inyapwan nyo.' Maniring pa am, 'O omavay so inyapwan na am to rana wakwaka.'

language1_text: But ye say, Whosoever shall say to his father or his mother, It is a gift, by whatsoever thou mightest be profited by me;
language2_text: Am nyo kajya pasovoyan a amya so tao a jyaglaw no inyapwan na. O ciring nyo am, 'No myan so tao a tomoro nya do Tao do to so ipakan na so inyapwan na am apyapya o kaji na rana pakanan so inyapwan na.'

language1_text: and honour not his father or his mother, he shall be free. Thus have ye made the commandment of God of none effect by your tradition.
language2_text: Nyo tongbowa no iwawalam nyo o Ciriciring ni Ama ta do to, do yanyo kapyapya pa so iwawalam no ineynapo nyo.

language1_text: Ye hypocrites, well did Esaias prophesy of you, saying,
language2_text: Inyo rana yatanwasiwasi am yamanoyong o ciring no panoyonoywan na so ciring ni Ama ta do to a meyngaran so Isayya a pakacirngen na jinyo. Ta maniring am,

language1_text: This people draweth nigh unto me with their mouth, and honoureth me with their lips; But their heart is far from me.
language2_text: 'O aro a tao am da admadmain yaken no ciring da. Am onowned da am yameyparai jyaken.

language1_text: But in vain they do worship me, Teaching for doctrines the commandments of men.
language2_text: Da ipanci o ciring no tao a ciring ko. So yana ikabo no peypeypangayan no da kararalay nyaken.'"

language1_text: And he called the multitude, and said unto them, Hear, and understand:
language2_text: Lovoten na ni Yeso o aro a tao do tangain na am maniring jira am, "Amizngen nyo a kapakateneng nyo jya.

language1_text: not that which goeth into the mouth defileth a man; but that which cometh out of the mouth, this defileth a man.
language2_text: O apo do ngoso no tao a mangay do velek am ji mapeyraraten so tao, ta o makowbot do ngoso a apo do onowned am ori o mapeyraraten so tao."

language1_text: Then came his disciples, and said unto him, Knowest thou that the Pharisees were offended, after they heard this saying?
language2_text: Makarahan am maniring sira o macinanao ji Yeso am, "Da mamizing no tao a macyagom do Vadisay o ciring mo am sira ji makamyamya. Manngwa, mo katenngan an?"

language1_text: But he answered and said, Every plant, which my heavenly Father hath not planted, shall be rooted up.
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso am, "O ji na nipamowa ni Ama ta do to a mowamowa am miminen ori a botboten.

language1_text: Let them alone: they be blind leaders of the blind. And if the blind lead the blind, both shall fall into the ditch.
language2_text: Ji nyo ngazidan sira, ta sira rana am kapalangayan da o mavota tao a mangonong no tao. No mangalay so mavota o mavota tao am mangay o kangay da matazangeb no rarwa ang."

language1_text: Then answered Peter and said unto him, Declare unto us this parable.
language2_text: Maniring si Pite am, "Ipanci mo pa jyamen o peypeypangayan no mo pehngehngain a ciring mo ang."

language1_text: And Jesus said, Are ye also yet without understanding?
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso am, "Kamo pa meyyangay a kano karwan no tao a yaji makateneng jya sicyaikwaya?

language1_text: Do not ye yet understand, that whatsoever entereth in at the mouth goeth into the belly, and is cast out into the draught?
language2_text: Manngwa, nyo jyatenngi o isovo a kanen am mangay do velek a kapeywadwad rana nya?

language1_text: But those things which proceed out of the mouth come forth from the heart; and they defile the man.
language2_text: Am o makowbot do ngoso am apo do onowned. Ori o mapeyraraten so tao.

language1_text: For out of the heart proceed evil thoughts, murders, adulteries, fornications, thefts, false witness, blasphemies:
language2_text: O mapo do onowned am amyan dang so makakaday a nakenakem no tao a ipeyraraten a mangap so tao, mangzakza, manakaw, mangalalas, manamwad.

language1_text: these are the things which defile a man: but to eat with unwashen hands defileth not a man.
language2_text: O yamakakaday ori am manoyong ori a mapeyraraten so tao. Am o ji mavanaw a koman am ji mapeyraraten so tao o akman sang."

language1_text: Then Jesus went thence, and departed into the coasts of Tyre and Sidon.
language2_text: Karwan na do dang ni Yeso am mangay do meyngaran so Tayar a kano Siton a ili.

language1_text: And, behold, a woman of Canaan came out of the same coasts, and cried unto him, saying, Have mercy on me, O Lord, thou Son of David; my daughter is grievously vexed with a devil.
language2_text: Amyan dang so asa ka mavakes a tao do Cyanan a mangay ji Yeso. Maniring a amlololos am, "Mo Panirsirngen a sivovoong ni Tawey, ikarilaw mo pa yaken, ta na kovotan no kalamsoyan ni Satan o anak ko a mavakes. So na ikatey makasi."

language1_text: But he answered her not a word. And his disciples came and besought him, saying, Send her away; for she crieth after us.
language2_text: Abo o asa ka ciring a nitovis na jya ni Yeso. Mai sira o macinanao jya am mapasyasi sira ji Yeso. Maniring sira am, "Tovoy rana o mavakes ang, ta yamanilo a yaomonot jyaten."

language1_text: But he answered and said, I am not sent but unto the lost sheep of the house of Israel.
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso do mavakes am, "O na pahanhanan jyaken ni Ama ta do to am ko sidongen o Isedi a tao a yakmey nimavozaw a kagling na."

language1_text: Then came she and worshipped him, saying, Lord, help me.
language2_text: Mamizing na o ciring ni Yeso am meylilitod do tangain na. Maniring am, "Mo Panirsirngen, sidongen mo pa yaken."

language1_text: But he answered and said, It is not meet to take the children's bread, and to cast it to dogs.
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso am, "No ahapen o kanen no anak a itoro do ino am malas o akman sang."

language1_text: And she said, Truth, Lord: yet the dogs eat of the crumbs which fall from their masters' table.
language2_text: Maniring o mavakes am, "Yamanoyong ori mo Panirsirngen. Am o meycyakakas do nyakanan da no mapavahay sya am kanen no ino."

language1_text: Then Jesus answered and said unto her, O woman, great is thy faith: be it unto thee even as thou wilt. And her daughter was made whole from that very hour.
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso am, "Mo kavakes, yatey arako o nakenakem mo si Ama ta do to. So to na rana mangononongi no mo kakdain ang." So nikapya na rana no anak na no kapanci na nya ni Yeso.

language1_text: And Jesus departed from thence, and came nigh unto the sea of Galilee; and went up into a mountain, and sat down there.
language2_text: Karwan na do dang ni Yeso am mangay do pamsan no rako a meybebneng a ranom a meyngaran so Cyadidi. So nyangay na do tokon a kahezsad na do dang.

language1_text: And great multitudes came unto him, having with them those that were lame, blind, dumb, maimed, and many others, and cast them down at Jesus' feet; and he healed them:
language2_text: Aro tao a komala pa sya. Sira rana am nipalolo da o mapilay a kano mavota kano nimakasapa kano ji makabnebnek a kano makasazi so meycyamadadayan a ingingnen a yangay do tangain na ni Yeso. So niteyteyhesan na sira niwakwakan ni Yeso.

language1_text: insomuch that the multitude wondered, when they saw the dumb to speak, the maimed to be whole, the lame to walk, and the blind to see: and they glorified the God of Israel.
language2_text: Macita da no aro a tao o ji makabnebnek a kano nimakasapa kano mapilay a kano mavota a to rana apya am isavasavak da. So nyazwazwayan da rana so Tao do to da no Isedi a tao.

language1_text: Then Jesus called his disciples unto him, and said, I have compassion on the multitude, because they continue with me now three days, and have nothing to eat: and I will not send them away fasting, lest they faint in the way.
language2_text: Rarahen na ni Yeso sira o macinanao jya. Maniring jira am, "Ko ikabo sira no nakem o aro a tao, do da kapakatlo araw rana do jya. So nikabo rana no kanen da sicyaikwaya. Am ko ji mamyapyan sira meykakcin a omrateng do vahay da, do ko kahawa nira kalingongawan do rarahan a makcin."

language1_text: And his disciples say unto him, Whence should we have so much bread in the wilderness, as to fill so great a multitude?
language2_text: Maniring sira o macinanao jya am, "Do wanjin o angayan namen a pangapan so kanen a ibsoy ta so aro a tao, do yabo panazangan do jya."

language1_text: And Jesus saith unto them, How many loaves have ye? And they said, Seven, and a few little fishes.
language2_text: Maniring jira si Yeso am, "Yapira o myanpaw a yamyan jinyo." Maniring sira am, "Yapito a ka myanpaw a kano yapeleh a lilikta among."

language1_text: And he commanded the multitude to sit down on the ground.
language2_text: Makarahan am ipanci na rana ni Yeso o aro a tao a amlisna,

language1_text: And he took the seven loaves and the fishes, and gave thanks, and brake them, and gave to his disciples, and the disciples to the multitude.
language2_text: kahap na rana so apito a ka myanpaw a kano among a isaray ji Ama ta do to a kakcikcil na rana sya patodahen do macinanao jya a kavonong da rana sya do aro a tao.

language1_text: And they did all eat, and were filled: and they took up of the broken meat that was left seven baskets full.
language2_text: Nimamimin sira nikoman a kabobsoy da rana. Peykakasahen da no macinanao jya o atda da am nipno da o apito a ka yala.

language1_text: And they that did eat were four thousand men, beside women and children.
language2_text: O nikoman a tao am kakapatan na ranaw (4000) sira. Am ji da nipavilang sira o mavakes a kano kanakan.

language1_text: And he sent away the multitude, and took ship, and came into the coasts of Magdala.
language2_text: Makarahan am tovoin na rana sira o aro a tao a mangay rana, a kazagpit na rana do vazangay a meypangay do Macyatan a ili.

language1_text: The Pharisees also with the Sadducees came, and tempting desired him that he would shew them a sign from heaven.
language2_text: Amyan so tao a macyagom do Vadisay a kano macyagom do Satokay a mangay ji Yeso a omnakenakem so keyleylamdam da sya. Am ori o kakzeban da sya a mapacita no mapeyzokab a vazay na a yongkad na apo ji Ama ta do to.

language1_text: He answered and said unto them, When it is evening, ye say, It will be fair weather: for the sky is red.
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso am, "Makoyab pa am ipanci nyo na o kapya no kakawan simaraw, do kakma ney vangkoro no asked no awa.

language1_text: And in the morning, It will be foul weather to day: for the sky is red and lowring. O ye hypocrites, ye can discern the face of the sky; but can ye not discern the signs of the times?
language2_text: Apnezak pa am ipanci nyo na o kacimoy na kasazowsaw na sicyaraw, do kakedep na. Kamo mateneng a yamanita so palanginan am nyo jyazab o tovil na no vazay na ni Ama ta do to sicyaikwaya.

language1_text: A wicked and adulterous generation seeketh after a sign; and there shall no sign be given unto it, but the sign of the prophet Jonas. And he left them, and departed.
language2_text: Yateywara o raraten no tao sicyaikwaya, do da kapasagpyan so aktokto da. Nyo kakzeben o kapakacita nyo so oyowyat na ni Ama ta do to. Am o akman so mina vazay ni Ama ta do to do meyngaran so Yena o macita nyo. So ikabo na rana no maharahara pa kano nang a macita nyo." Teyka na o ciring na ni Yeso am karwan na rana sira.

language1_text: And when his disciples were come to the other side, they had forgotten to take bread.
language2_text: Makaranes sira do katovangan no rako a meybebneng a ranom am nikahamangan da o kapalolo da so myanpaw no macinanao ji Yeso.

language1_text: Then Jesus said unto them, Take heed and beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and of the Sadducees.
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso jira am, "Azimanen nyo o akmey kosozi no odong a yamyan do tao a macyagom do Vadisay a kano macyagom do Satokay."

language1_text: And they reasoned among themselves, saying, It is because we have taken no bread.
