language1_text: And there went out unto him all the land of Judæ a, and they of Jerusalem, and were all baptized of him in the river of Jordan, confessing their sins.
language2_text: Aro tao a nimapo do peycyeylilyan na do Yotay a kado Yelosaleng a mangay do tangain na ni Yowani. Sira rana am ipanci da o raraten da. Am ori o nitaktakan na jira ni Yowani do ayo a meyngaran so Yotan.

language1_text: And John was clothed with camel's hair, and with a girdle of a skin about his loins; and he did eat locusts and wild honey;
language2_text: Meyyayob si Yowani so niparing da a bobow no baka a kapeyyabtek na so kolit no baka a kakan na so zozon a kano maganinem a amyan do vahay no tapipi.

language1_text: and preached, saying, There cometh one mightier than I after me, the latchet of whose shoes I am not worthy to stoop down and unloose.
language2_text: Maniring am, "O manownowjyan pa ka nyaken am mowyowyat pa ka nyaken. Si meylologod ko a omovay so bedbed no tokap na am abo pacicingayan ko jya.

language1_text: I indeed have baptized you with water: but he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost.
language2_text: Ranom o ko itaktak jinyo. Am iya rana am taktakan na inyo no Seyzi."

language1_text: And it came to pass in those days, that Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee, and was baptized of John in Jordan.
language2_text: Makarahan am mai si Yeso a apo do Nasale a ili a macinapnap do Cyadidi kataktak na ji Yeso ni Yowani do ayo a meyngaran so Yotan.

language1_text: And straightway coming up out of the water, he saw the heavens opened, and the Spirit like a dove descending upon him:
language2_text: Meypapowpow si Yeso a apo do ranom am macita na o hanit a kacyangan. Makarahan am mangay maneyked jya o akmey hato rana Seyzi.

language1_text: and there came a voice from heaven, saying, Thou art my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.
language2_text: Makarahan am maciralay o ciring na ni Ama ta do to apo do teyngato. Maniring am, "Imo rana am Anak ko imo a ko tey kaglaw. So sarayan ko nimo."

language1_text: And immediately the Spirit driveth him into the wilderness.
language2_text: So ji na nimeyyahahai ni Yeso a nitovoy no Seyzi do kabwan no nihakawan no tao.

language1_text: And he was there in the wilderness forty days, tempted of Satan; and was with the wild beasts; and the angels ministered unto him.
language2_text: So niyan na dang so kasikapat (40) so araraw a littan ni Satan. So nipacizavoz na do omalalam do dang. Am keyyan no aro a tinsi a somidong sya.

language1_text: Now after that John was put in prison, Jesus came into Galilee, preaching the gospel of the kingdom of God,
language2_text: Aneban da si Yowani am mangay si Yeso do Cyadidi a meylimwang no Mapasaray a Ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: and saying, The time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God is at hand: repent ye, and believe the gospel.
language2_text: Maniring am, "Yarana makeykai o yana katalamozong ninyo ni Ama ta do to. Am ori o karwan nyo na do peyraratenan nyo a omanoyong do Mapasaray a Ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to."

language1_text: Now as he walked by the sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and Andrew his brother casting a net into the sea: for they were fishers.
language2_text: Mangonong si Yeso do pasalan no rako a meybebneng a ranom a ngaranan da Cyadidi am macita na o rarwa ka tao a mangahangahahap a meyngaran so Simong a kano kakteh na meyngaran so Antele a amzoyo no tawaz da.

language1_text: And Jesus said unto them, Come ye after me, and I will make you to become fishers of men.
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso jira am, "Macilolo kamo jyaken, ta nanawen ko inyo. So icyakma nyoy mangahahap a mapanop so tao."

language1_text: And straightway they forsook their nets, and followed him.
language2_text: Mamizing da am to da rana ngaroi o tawaz da macilolo ji Yeso.

language1_text: And when he had gone a little farther thence, he saw James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, who also were in the ship mending their nets.
language2_text: Alikey pa o nyalaman na am macita na ni Yeso o anak na ni Sipitay a meyngaran so Yake a kano kakteh na si Yowani a rarwa a tomonod so nyayoma da tawaz do tatala da.

language1_text: And straightway he called them: and they left their father Zebedee in the ship with the hired servants, and went after him.
language2_text: Macita na sira ni Yeso am tawagan na sira. Makarahan am to da ngaroi o ama da kano lamlamsoy da do tatala da kapacilolo da ji Yeso.

language1_text: And they went into Capernaum; and straightway on the sabbath day he entered into the synagogue, and taught.
language2_text: Makaranes sira do ili do Cyapaynong am amyan si Yeso do peyneynozyan a mangnanao so tao do ipeywalam no tao.

language1_text: And they were astonished at his doctrine: for he taught them as one that had authority, and not as the scribes.
language2_text: Isavasavak da no makamizing so ciring na ni Yeso o ipangnanao na. Ta tey rako oyowyat na no ipangnanao na, do kapacitarek no ipangnanao na kano aro a mangnanao no iwawalam ni Ama ta do to a tao.

language1_text: And there was in their synagogue a man with an unclean spirit; and he cried out,
language2_text: No kanang am amyan so kovotan no kalamsoyan ni Satan a tao a mai do peyneynozyan.

language1_text: saying, Let us alone; what have we to do with thee, thou Jesus of Nazareth? art thou come to destroy us? I know thee who thou art, the Holy One of God.
language2_text: Maniring a amlololos am, "Imo a Yeso a tao do Nasale am ikongo mo kakzeben jyamen. Mo yamen balinasen? Ko imo katenngan. Imo am na nitovoy imo no Tao do to a tey yapya so nakenakem a tao."

language1_text: And Jesus rebuked him, saying, Hold thy peace, and come out of him.
language2_text: Am ori o nioyyan na nya ni Yeso. Maniring am, "Ji ka meyzezyak. Pakowbot rana do kataotao na."

language1_text: And when the unclean spirit had torn him, and cried with a loud voice, he came out of him.
language2_text: Makarahan am mina to na pazikzika o tao ang no komovot jya a kalololos na kapakowbot na rana do tao ang.

language1_text: And they were all amazed, insomuch that they questioned among themselves, saying, What thing is this? what new doctrine is this? for with authority commandeth he even the unclean spirits, and they do obey him.
language2_text: Isavasavak da no aro a tao. Am ori o nipeysingsingkad da manci no, "Asyo o akman sya vazay. Abo pa o akman sya nimamizing ta a nanao. Asyo oyowyat na ori yato makavozwaw so kalamsoyan ni Satan ang. Na to ngamiznga pa no kalamsoyan ni Satan o ciring na ang."

language1_text: And immediately his fame spread abroad throughout all the region round about Galilee.
language2_text: Ori o nipeyrengarengayan da rana do ngaran ni Yeso do Cyadidi.

language1_text: And forthwith, when they were come out of the synagogue, they entered into the house of Simon and Andrew, with James and John.
language2_text: Karwan na o peyneynozyan ni Yeso am mangay do vahay da Simong a kani Antele. Macita ni Yake a kani Yowani am macihza sira mangay.

language1_text: But Simon's wife's mother lay sick of a fever, and anon they tell him of her.
language2_text: Ikongo do paingwaten na o icyarwa na mavakes ni Simong, am ori o to na ngirai. Makaranes si Yeso am ipanci da ji Yeso o ingingnen no mavakes ang.

language1_text: And he came and took her by the hand, and lifted her up; and immediately the fever left her, and she ministered unto them.
language2_text: Ori o nyangay na tomita sya ni Yeso. Makarahan am pinanan na o lima na keyvangon na sya. Am ji na rana nipaingwat. Am ori o nipeyvangon na rana tomaotao sira.

language1_text: And at even, when the sun did set, they brought unto him all that were diseased, and them that were possessed with devils.
language2_text: Somipsip rana o araw do makoyab am yai da no aro a tao o meykeyngeyngen a tao a kano kovotan no kalamsoyan ni Satan a tao do tangain ni Yeso.

language1_text: And all the city was gathered together at the door.
language2_text: So nikalovot no tao do ili a nimai. Ori o nipanicit da no aro a tao do pangengneban.

language1_text: And he healed many that were sick of divers diseases, and cast out many devils; and suffered not the devils to speak, because they knew him.
language2_text: Makarahan am iwakwakan na rana sira o meykeyngeyngen a tao ni Yeso a kapya da rana. O komovot do tao a kalamsoyan ni Satan am nivozwaw na sira ni Yeso. Ji na mya sira o kalamsoyan ni Satan a meyzezyak, ta katenngan da o yapwan no oyowyat ni Yeso.

language1_text: And in the morning, rising up a great while before day, he went out, and departed into a solitary place, and there prayed.
language2_text: Ji pazngang do ikadwa na araw am mayokay si Yeso a kangay na do kabwan no tao a meynozi.

language1_text: And Simon and they that were with him followed after him.
language2_text: O meyngaran so Simong a kano kararay na am kalahen da si Yeso.

language1_text: And when they had found him, they said unto him, All men seek for thee.
language2_text: Makala da am maniring sira am, "Abo yaji ngala jimo."

language1_text: And he said unto them, Let us go into the next towns, that I may preach there also: for therefore came I forth.
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso am, "Mangay tamo do teyhesa ka ili, ta ipeylimwang ko do dang o Mapasaray a Ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to, ta ori o ko nyai do karawan."

language1_text: And he preached in their synagogues throughout all Galilee, and cast out devils.
language2_text: Makarahan am nikakaday ni Yeso o peyneynozyan do Cyadidi a peylimwangan no ciring na ni Ama ta do to a kavozwaw na so komovot do tao a kalamsoyan ni Satan.

language1_text: And there came a leper to him, beseeching him, and kneeling down to him, and saying unto him, If thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.
language2_text: Amyan so asa ka tao a omlabyab so kataotao a mangay do tangain ni Yeso a meylilitod a mapasyasi jya. Maniring am, "No si apyahen mo am jyabo kaji na apyan no kataotao ko a."

language1_text: And Jesus, moved with compassion, put forth his hand, and touched him, and saith unto him, I will; be thou clean.
language2_text: Ikarilaw na ni Yeso. Am ori o niparapongan na so lima na jya. Maniring am, "Ko apyahen. So na rana ikapya no kataotao mo."

language1_text: And as soon as he had spoken, immediately the leprosy departed from him, and he was cleansed.
language2_text: Ji nimeyyahahay o kataotao na mapya.

language1_text: And he straitly charged him, and forthwith sent him away;
language2_text: So nitovoyan na rana sya ni Yeso. O nipakoyokoy na pa jya am,

language1_text: and saith unto him, See thou say nothing to any man: but go thy way, shew thyself to the priest, and offer for thy cleansing those things which Moses commanded, for a testimony unto them.
language2_text: "Ji mo meylimwangan do tao an. Angay rana pacittan do mapatanatanang so nakem ta si Ama ta do to a kavalivaliw na so kataotao mo a kapangozay mo na do iwawalam ni Moyse a mapatanang so nakem mo si Ama ta do to. So anoyngan da jimo no tao a nimapya rana so kataotao."

language1_text: But he went out, and began to publish it much, and to blaze abroad the matter, insomuch that Jesus could no more openly enter into the city, but was without in desert places: and they came to him from every quarter.
language2_text: Am makowbot o tao ori am to na rana meylimwangan do aro a tao. Am ori o ji na rana nimangai do ili ni Yeso. So niseysan na do siri no ili da. Ta jyates sira o aro a tao do peycyeylilyan na mangay komala sya.

language1_text: And again he entered into Capernaum after some days; and it was noised that he was in the house.
language2_text: Makanateng do araraw am meysinaoli si Yeso a mangay do Cyapaynong. Katenngan da no aro a tao o keyyan na do asa ka vahay am,

language1_text: And straightway many were gathered together, insomuch that there was no room to receive them, no, not so much as about the door: and he preached the word unto them.
language2_text: meysilisilin sira o aro a tao a mangay ji Yeso. So nikabo rana no yanan da do vahay ang. Akman sang do ngoso no vahay. Ta manicit o tao. Mangononong si Yeso do aro a tao am,

language1_text: And they come unto him, bringing one sick of the palsy, which was borne of four.
language2_text: amyan so papat a ka tao a mangai so asa ka tao a ji makapeyvangon.

language1_text: And when they could not come nigh unto him for the press, they uncovered the roof where he was: and when they had broken it up, they let down the bed wherein the sick of the palsy lay.
language2_text: Ikongo do tey yaro o tao, am ori o ji da makaslislini a mangay nya do tangain ni Yeso, kato da rana ngalatan do atep no ji makapeyvangon a tao a kakabkab da so atep no vahay a katonton da so tao a mangay pazomtaden do yanan ni Yeso.

language1_text: When Jesus saw their faith, he said unto the sick of the palsy, Son, thy sins be forgiven thee.
language2_text: Macita na ni Yeso o kakdekdeng no onowned da am maniring do ji makapeyvangon a tao am, "Yarana nimavonas, mo keypong, o raraten mo."

language1_text: But there were certain of the scribes sitting there, and reasoning in their hearts,
language2_text: O amlisna do dang a mangnanao no iwawalam ni Ama ta do to am ikazyak da.

language1_text: Why doth this man thus speak blasphemies? who can forgive sins but God only?
language2_text: "Asyo ori a jyaninig ni Ama ta do to a yato manci no akman sang a ciring. Si Ama ta do to saon o makavonas so raraten am."

language1_text: And immediately when Jesus perceived in his spirit that they so reasoned within themselves, he said unto them, Why reason ye these things in your hearts?
language2_text: Mahaw na ni Yeso o onowned da. Maniring jira am, "Ikongo nyo ikakman sang so nakenakem.

language1_text: Whether is it easier to say to the sick of the palsy, Thy sins be forgiven thee; or to say, Arise, and take up thy bed, and walk?
language2_text: Masalisalit o kapanci ko no kavonas na rana no raraten no yameyngen eyto an? No apyapya o kapanci ko no, 'Peyvangon rana kapaciralay mo na do ititkehan mo a mangay rana.'

language1_text: But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power on earth to forgive sins, (he saith to the sick of the palsy, )
language2_text: Ko ipacita jinyo o oyowyat ko a Nipamnekan na ni Ama ta do to a tao a manvonas so raraten no tao do karawan." Makarahan am maniring do ji makapeyvangon a tao am,

language1_text: I say unto thee, Arise, and take up thy bed, and go thy way into thine house.
language2_text: "Ko ipanci jimo am, Peyvangon rana kahap mo rana so yamo nirayan a mangay do vahay nyo."

language1_text: And immediately he arose, took up the bed, and went forth before them all; insomuch that they were all amazed, and glorified God, saying, We never saw it on this fashion.
language2_text: So nipeyvangon na rana no tao a omahap so nirayan na a kapakowbot na rana. Pacimatan da no aro a tao am ori o nisavasavakan da nya a kazwazway da na si Ama ta do to. Maniring sira am, "Namen pa jya nimakacita so akman sya vazay."

language1_text: And he went forth again by the sea side; and all the multitude resorted unto him, and he taught them.
language2_text: Ipirwa na kangay ni Yeso do rako a meybebneng a ranom a ngaranan da Cyadidi am aro sira o tao a meylovolovot do tangain na. Am ori o ninanawan na sira.

language1_text: And as he passed by, he saw Levi the son of Alphæ us sitting at the receipt of custom, and said unto him, Follow me. And he arose and followed him.
language2_text: Mangonong am macita na o mapeyvazay so deyking a tao. Iya rana am anak ni Alevey a meyngaran so Diwey a omlisna do torotorwan no deyking a vahay. Maniring jya si Yeso am, "Macilolo ka jyaken an." Makarahan am meytatanek rana si Diwey a kapacilolo na rana ji Yeso.

language1_text: And it came to pass, that, as Jesus sat at meat in his house, many publicans and sinners sat also together with Jesus and his disciples: for there were many, and they followed him.
language2_text: Mavitos o vazay ori am mangay rana koman si Yeso do vahay ni Diwey. No kano nang am aro sira o mapeyvazay so deyking a kano aro a meyraraten a tao a macihza jya. O karwan da am macihza ji Yeso a kano macinanao jya a kahahanghang da rana koman.

language1_text: And when the scribes and Pharisees saw him eat with publicans and sinners, they said unto his disciples, How is it that he eateth and drinketh with publicans and sinners?
language2_text: Macita da si Yeso no tao a macyagom do Vadisay a mangnanao no iwawalam ni Ama ta do to a macihanghang do meyraraten a tao am ahesen da rana sira o macinanao jya. Maniring sira am, "Ikongo na ipacihanghang do mapeyvazay so deyking a kano aro a yameyraraten a tao ang."

language1_text: When Jesus heard it, he saith unto them, They that are whole have no need of the physician, but they that are sick: I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.
language2_text: Mamizing na ni Yeso am nanawen na sira. Maniring am, "O apya so kataotao a tao am ji da ngala o mangavavaw a tao an. Ta o meyngen a tao o komala so koysang. O peypeypangayan no ko nyai am beken a ko manara so ji meyraraten a tao. Ta o yameyraraten a tao am ori o yako nyai."

language1_text: And the disciples of John and of the Pharisees used to fast: and they come and say unto him, Why do the disciples of John and of the Pharisees fast, but thy disciples fast not?
language2_text: Ipisa am o macinanao ji Yowani a kano tao a macyagom do Vadisay am ji sira mangakaday no tomakatakaw amnakenakem si Ama ta do to. Maniring o tao ji Yeso am, "Ikongo da ji mangakadai no yamacinanao ji Yowani a kano tao a macyagom do Vadisay. Am asyo sira o yamacinanao jimo a yamangakaday."

language1_text: And Jesus said unto them, Can the children of the bridechamber fast, while the bridegroom is with them? as long as they have the bridegroom with them, they cannot fast.
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso am, "No macikaop pa do pamaringan da so kanen no matarek so vahay a mahakay am manngwa, koman sira o cinirara na tao an? Jyabo kaji da nganan do ipacihanghang na jira.

language1_text: But the days will come, when the bridegroom shall be taken away from them, and then shall they fast in those days.
language2_text: Am no marateng rana o araraw a irakep da so mahakay ori am manoyong rana kaji da mangakadayan do kasinalaw da nya.

language1_text: No man also seweth a piece of new cloth on an old garment: else the new piece that filled it up taketh away from the old, and the rent is made worse.
language2_text: "Abo tao a mapatapang so vayo a milakayob do adan a ayob. Ta ji macimangno. So ikapising no adan a ayob ang. So ikarakorako na pa no kazamitan na.

language1_text: And no man putteth new wine into old bottles: else the new wine doth burst the bottles, and the wine is spilled, and the bottles will be marred: but new wine must be put into new bottles.
language2_text: Abo tao a mangap so vayo a potaw cyo a paglowen do adan a kolit no baka, ta zombak. Am ori an o paglowan so vayo a potaw cyo do vayo a kolit no baka an."

language1_text: And it came to pass, that he went through the corn fields on the sabbath day; and his disciples began, as they went, to pluck the ears of corn.
language2_text: Ipisa kapeywalam no tao am mangonong si Yeso a kano macinanao jya do nihakawan a mogi. Am to sira mangoztod so aknatahen da no macinanao ji Yeso.

language1_text: And the Pharisees said unto him, Behold, why do they on the sabbath day that which is not lawful?
language2_text: Maniring sira o tao a macyagom do Vadisay ji Yeso am, "Adan rana o akman sang a vazay do ipeywalam no tao!"

language1_text: And he said unto them, Have ye never read what David did, when he had need, and was an hungred, he, and they that were with him?
language2_text: Maniring jira si Yeso am, "Ikongo o mina vazay ni Tawey no kakcin na. Ji nyo pa nivilangan? No kano nang am makcin si Tawey a kano kararay na.

language1_text: How he went into the house of God in the days of Abiathar the high priest, and did eat the shewbread, which is not lawful to eat but for the priests, and gave also to them which were with him?
language2_text: Am ori o nisdep da do raralayan da ni Ama ta do to a koman so nipatanang da myanpaw. No kano nang am panirsirngen no mapatanatanang so nakem da si Ama ta do to o meyngaran so Apiyata. O iwawalam ta am o mapatanatanang so nakem da si Ama ta do to am ori o koman so sang. Am nikoman si Tawey so nipatanang da kanen a katoro na pa nya do nimacihza jya tao do kakcin da."

language1_text: And he said unto them, The sabbath was made for man, and not man for the sabbath:
language2_text: Maniring pa jira si Yeso am, "O araraw no ipeywalam no tao am omaing jinyo a tao a ikapya nyo. Am beken a cinatazak nyo a tao o kahap nyo so makakaday a icicirawat nyo do ipeywalam no tao.

language1_text: therefore the Son of man is Lord also of the sabbath.
language2_text: Am ori an o Nipamnekan na ni Ama ta do to a tao am iya o meymatmatngeh no ipeywalam no tao."

language1_text: And he entered again into the synagogue; and there was a man there which had a withered hand.
language2_text: Somdep do peyneynozyan si Yeso am amyan dang so asa ka tao a meykazakazain so lima.

language1_text: And they watched him, whether he would heal him on the sabbath day; that they might accuse him.
language2_text: Tatasa ka tao o amnakenakem so kapeykala da so karatan ni Yeso a iraherahet da sya. Am ori o niyan da do katangked na tomita so vazay na do kaskad da ji Yeso a mangiwakwak so tao do ipeywalam no tao.

language1_text: And he saith unto the man which had the withered hand, Stand forth.
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso do meykazakazain so lima tao am, "Sijya do tangain ko."

language1_text: And he saith unto them, Is it lawful to do good on the sabbath days, or to do evil? to save life, or to kill? But they held their peace.
language2_text: Makarahan am pacicin na sira o tomangay sya tao. Maniring am, "Ikongo o yata ahahapan sya do ipeywalam no tao. Manngwa, apyapya o kapanidong so tao an? No apyapya o kaji mamyayan so tao. Avyain sira an? No wakwaken sira." Mamizing da no aro a tao am abo meyzezyak.

language1_text: And when he had looked round about on them with anger, being grieved for the hardness of their hearts, he saith unto the man, Stretch forth thine hand. And he stretched it out: and his hand was restored whole as the other.
language2_text: Marahet o matamata na ni Yeso a tomita so aro a tao. Am ikeyngen na sira no onowned. Ta akman sira so veysen so onowned so kacigcigzang. Maniring rana si Yeso do meykazakazain so lima tao am, "Zanet pala o lima mo." Zaneten na am todapya rana.

language1_text: And the Pharisees went forth, and straightway took counsel with the Herodians against him, how they might destroy him.
language2_text: Makowbot sira o tao a macyagom do Vadisay do peyneynozyan am meysirisiring rana sira kano Helotyan a tao do civtan da ji Yeso.

language1_text: But Jesus withdrew himself with his disciples to the sea: and a great multitude from Galilee followed him, and from Judæ a,
language2_text: Karwan na rana do dang ni Yeso a kano macinanao jya a mangay do rako a meybebneng a ranom a meyngaran so Cyadidi. Macita da sira no aro a tao am macihza sira. Sira rana am apo sira do Cyadidi a kado Yotay,

language1_text: and from Jerusalem, and from Idumæ a, and from beyond Jordan; and they about Tyre and Sidon, a great multitude, when they had heard what great things he did, came unto him.
language2_text: a kado Yelosaleng a kado Itomiya kado katovangan no ayo a meyngaran so Yotan a kano meyvahay do Tayar a kado Siton a ili. O yai da no aro a tao a omrapong si Yeso am mamizing da abo so jya peyvazay.

language1_text: And he spake to his disciples, that a small ship should wait on him because of the multitude, lest they should throng him.
language2_text: Ikongo do tey yaro sira o tao, am ori o nipancyan na no macinanao jya meykala so vazangay, ta ihawa na o aro a tao somlin sya.

language1_text: For he had healed many; insomuch that they pressed upon him for to touch him, as many as had plagues.
language2_text: Ikongo do tey yaro o tao a niwakwakan na, am ori o ikatey yaro no meyngen a tao a mai do tangain na a mangay minan jya.

language1_text: And unclean spirits, when they saw him, fell down before him, and cried, saying, Thou art the Son of God.
language2_text: Macita da si Yeso no kovotan no kalamsoyan ni Satan a tao am meylilitod sira do tangain na kalololos da manci no, "Imo rana am Anak na imo no Tao do to."

language1_text: And he straitly charged them that they should not make him known.
language2_text: Am ioya na sira ni Yeso a mapatwaw so kanoyong na Anak ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: And he goeth up into a mountain, and calleth unto him whom he would: and they came unto him.
language2_text: Mangay do asa ka tokon si Yeso am lovoten na sira o nipamnekan na tao do tangain na. So nikamimin da amrapong sya.

language1_text: And he ordained twelve, that they should be with him, and that he might send them forth to preach,
language2_text: Pamnekan na sira o rarwa so ikakarwan na (12) am abneken na sira amlivolivon no ciriciring na. Maniring jira si Yeso am, "Ko inyo nipamnekan a macikaop jyaken. So ko tovoyan jinyo a meylimwang no ciriciring ko.

language1_text: and to have power to heal sicknesses, and to cast out devils:
language2_text: So iyan na rana no oyowyat nyo a mamozwaw so kalamsoyan na ni Satan."

language1_text: and Simon he surnamed Peter;
language2_text: Sira rana nipamnekan ni Yeso am si Simong. O nitoro na ni Yeso a ngaran na am si Pite,

language1_text: and James the son of Zebedee, and John the brother of James; and he surnamed them Boanerges, which is, The sons of thunder:
language2_text: a kano anak ni Sipitay a meyngaran so Yake a kani wari na meyngaran si Yowani. O ingaran na jira ni Yeso am Panici. O peypeypangayan na am akman so adey,

language1_text: and Andrew, and Philip, and Bartholomew, and Matthew, and Thomas, and James the son of Alphæ us, and Thaddæ us, and Simon the Canaanite,
language2_text: a kani Antele a kani Veydipo a kani Patolomaw a kani Matay a kani Tomase a kani Yake a anak ni Alevey a kani Tatay a kani Simong a macikagom do macioya do Loma a tao,

language1_text: and Judas Iscariot, which also betrayed him: and they went into an house.
language2_text: a kano tao do Isecyadi a meyngaran so Yota a nimanazang ni Yeso.

language1_text: And the multitude cometh together again, so that they could not so much as eat bread.
language2_text: Makaranes do vahay da si Yeso am mangay pa malovot o aro a tao do tangain na. Am ori o ji da rana makakakani ni Yeso a kano macinanao jya do kasanga da nira.

language1_text: And when his friends heard of it, they went out to lay hold on him: for they said, He is beside himself.
language2_text: Mamizing da o akman sang a vazay no inyapwan na kada wari na am naknakmen da o kangay da nya do vahay da. Ta mamizing da o ciring no tao a manci nya zomyak.

language1_text: And the scribes which came down from Jerusalem said, He hath Beelzebub, and by the prince of the devils casteth he out devils.
language2_text: Maniring sira o apo do Yelosaleng a mangnanao no iwawalam ni Ama ta do to a tao am, "Beken a yana kovotan ya ni Satan a meyngaran so Peysepo? Am ori o yana to makavozwawi so kalamsoyan na ni Satan?"

language1_text: And he called them unto him, and said unto them in parables, How can Satan cast out Satan?
language2_text: Makarahan am lovoten na sira ni Yeso o aro a tao do tangain na kapanci na nya jira so asa ka pehngehngayan na so ciring na a inanao na sira. Maniring jira am, "Jyabo kapamozwaw ni Satan so kalamsoyan na.

language1_text: And if a kingdom be divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.
language2_text: No maciraherahet sira so panyokodan o asa ka mahataw am jyabo kapya da.

language1_text: And if a house be divided against itself, that house cannot stand.
language2_text: No maciraherahet sira o asa ka vahay so nakem am mangay kapeyvwak da asa ka vahay.

language1_text: And if Satan rise up against himself, and be divided, he cannot stand, but hath an end.
language2_text: No si manoyong si Satan a masiraherahet so panyokodan am mangay kasakeb da.

language1_text: No man can enter into a strong man's house, and spoil his goods, except he will first bind the strong man; and then he will spoil his house.
language2_text: Abo tao a tondep a mangay tomakaw so apzapzatan na no makapya meykalokal a tao. No si myan saon so makavaod so meykalokal a tao am ori saon o ipakatakaw na so apzapzatan na am.

language1_text: Verily I say unto you, All sins shall be forgiven unto the sons of men, and blasphemies wherewith soever they shall blaspheme:
language2_text: "To ko na macitangayan jinyo am o makakaday a raraten a kano marahet a ciriciring no tao am todamimin pa ori a mavonas.

language1_text: but he that shall blaspheme against the Holy Ghost hath never forgiveness, but is in danger of eternal damnation:
language2_text: Am o omraherahet so Seyzi na ni Ama ta do to am to rana meyyonong a akman sang a jyavonas. Ta o akman rana sang a raraten no tao am to rana meyyonong o akman sang."

language1_text: because they said, He hath an unclean spirit.
language2_text: O pancyan na no akman sang a ciring ni Yeso am amyan so tao a manci no kakovot da jya no kalamsoyan ni Satan.

language1_text: There came then his brethren and his mother, and, standing without, sent unto him, calling him.
language2_text: Makarahan am mai sira o ina na kada wari na a meytatanek do pantaw. Am ori o nipanara da so tao a manci nya ji Yeso so kanimai da a komala sya.

language1_text: And the multitude sat about him, and they said unto him, Behold, thy mother and thy brethren without seek for thee.
language2_text: Maniring sira ji Yeso o macitangked jya tao am, "Sira amyan do pantaw sira ina mo a kada wari mo a yakomala jimo."

language1_text: And he answered them, saying, Who is my mother, or my brethren?
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso am, "Sino o ina ko a kada wari ko."

language1_text: And he looked round about on them which sat about him, and said, Behold my mother and my brethren!
language2_text: Maniring a tomita so amlisna do siri na tao am, "Citahey kamo, ta sira rana ito am ina ko a kano kakakteh ko.

language1_text: For whosoever shall do the will of God, the same is my brother, and my sister, and mother.
language2_text: Ta o mahap so vazay ni Ama ta do to a tao am abneken ko a kakteh ko a ina ko."

language1_text: And he began again to teach by the sea side: and there was gathered unto him a great multitude, so that he entered into a ship, and sat in the sea; and the whole multitude was by the sea on the land.
language2_text: Mangnanao si Yeso do rako a meybebneng a ranom a meyngaran so Cyadidi am tey yaro sira o tao a meysilisilin do katangked na. Am ori o to na rana zagpici do vazangay a amlisna a kahatahataw na do meybebneng a ranom no vazangay. O aro a tao am meytatanek sira do pamsan na.

language1_text: And he taught them many things by parables, and said unto them in his doctrine,
language2_text: Makarahan am nanawen na sira no aro a ciring a pehngehngain na. Maniring jira am,

language1_text: Hearken; Behold, there went out a sower to sow:
language2_text: "Pakamizngen nyo an. Amyan so asa ka tao a mangay manokos.

language1_text: and it came to pass, as he sowed, some fell by the way side, and the fowls of the air came and devoured it up.
language2_text: Manokos am amyan so zomsi do rarahan. Am mangay da toktokan no meyyasasalap.

language1_text: And some fell on stony ground, where it had not much earth; and immediately it sprang up, because it had no depth of earth:
language2_text: O karwan na am zomsi do kavatovatwan am amlida, ta amyan so alikey a tana do dang.

language1_text: but when the sun was up, it was scorched; and because it had no root, it withered away.
language2_text: No amdada o araw am mapseng do kaji na makayamotan, ta alikey o tana do dang.

language1_text: And some fell among thorns, and the thorns grew up, and choked it, and it yielded no fruit.
language2_text: O zomsi do katamtamkan na am tana amlida am ji malasi, ta kaongongan no aro a tamek.

language1_text: And other fell on good ground, and did yield fruit that sprang up and increased; and brought forth, some thirty, and some sixty, and some an hundred.
language2_text: O zomsi do apya so tanatana am apiya o kalidalida na a kapakapya na rana malasi. So iyan no malasi so sikatlo a ngarnan (30) a kano sikanem a ngarnan (60) a kano makapoo (100) so asi."

language1_text: And he said unto them, He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso am, "Amizngen nyo an, peyyanen nyo do onowned nyo ori an."

language1_text: And when he was alone, they that were about him with the twelve asked of him the parable.
language2_text: Maveyvow si Yeso am o niomamizing so ciring na tao am macihza sira do rarwa so ikakarwan a macinanao ji Yeso a mangay manahes no peypeypangayan na.

language1_text: And he said unto them, Unto you it is given to know the mystery of the kingdom of God: but unto them that are without, all these things are done in parables:
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso am, "O ji na nipatwaw pa peypeypangayan na no katalamozong na ninyo ni Ama ta do to am ipanci ko jinyo an. O karwan da no tao am nanawen ko sira no pehngehngayan ko so ciring ko.

language1_text: that seeing they may see, and not perceive; and hearing they may hear, and not understand; lest at any time they should be converted, and their sins should be forgiven them.
language2_text: Akman so ciring do Seysyo. Maniring am, 'Tana citacitahen da am akma dey jyacita. Tana amyamizngen da am ji da tenngi. Yabo da kasngesngenan jyaken. Makongo ko so wanjin a amvonas so raraten da.'"

language1_text: And he said unto them, Know ye not this parable? and how then will ye know all parables?
language2_text: Maniring jira si Yeso am, "Nyo jyatenngi o ko pehngehngain a ciring ko? No si akman kamo so sang am jyabo kapakateneng nyo do karwan no pehngehngayan ko so ciring ko a.

language1_text: The sower soweth the word.
language2_text: O na ipanokos no tao ori am ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: And these are they by the way side, where the word is sown; but when they have heard, Satan cometh immediately, and taketh away the word that was sown in their hearts.
language2_text: O nizomsi do rarahan am kapalangayan ori no tao a ji meyyahahay so nimamizing a ciring na ni Ama ta do to ahapen ni Satan do onowned da.

language1_text: And these are they likewise which are sown on stony ground; who, when they have heard the word, immediately receive it with gladness;
language2_text: O nizomsi do kavatovatwan am akman ori so tao a masaray a omamizing so ciring na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: and have no root in themselves, and so endure but for a time: afterward, when affliction or persecution ariseth for the word's sake, immediately they are offended.
language2_text: Am ji makayamot o ciring na ni Ama ta do to do onowned da. No masazi da o alalaw da kano peyrarehtan da sira, do kahap da so nanao ni Ama ta do to am makeykai a mablis o onowned da.

language1_text: And these are they which are sown among thorns; such as hear the word,
language2_text: O nizomsi rana do katamtamkan am tana amizngen da o ciring na ni Ama ta do to am,

language1_text: and the cares of this world, and the deceitfulness of riches, and the lusts of other things entering in, choke the word, and it becometh unfruitful.
language2_text: ji makapalasi, ta masanga sira no vazay da do karawan a kalita jira no peymeymasaodan da kano makakaday a ikeykakza da do karawan. Am ori o ikabengbeng no ciring na ni Ama ta do to do onowned da.

language1_text: And these are they which are sown on good ground; such as hear the word, and receive it, and bring forth fruit, some thirtyfold, some sixty, and some an hundred.
language2_text: O nizomsi rana do apya so tanatana am akman so tao a omamizing so ciring na ni Ama ta do a meyngongyod a meyhanhan nya do onowned da. So icyakman da so aro so asi a kayo."

language1_text: And he said unto them, Is a candle brought to be put under a bushel, or under a bed? and not to be set on a candlestick?
language2_text: Maniring pa si Yeso am, "Sino o mapangay so zampo do teyrahem no ireyrayan. Ji na pangaya o zampo do pakacittan sya no tao a.

language1_text: For there is nothing hid, which shall not be manifested; neither was any thing kept secret, but that it should come abroad.
language2_text: Abo ji meytotwaw a matayo a vazay. Akman sang, ta tana nyo jyatenngi sicyaikwaya o nanao ko jinyo am cyaha, ta katenngan nyo rana no makwa.

language1_text: If any man have ears to hear, let him hear.
language2_text: Amizngen nyo an, peyyanen nyo do onowned nyo ori an."

language1_text: And he said unto them, Take heed what ye hear: with what measure ye mete, it shall be measured to you: and unto you that hear shall more be given.
language2_text: Maniring pa jira am, "Peyyanen nyo do onowned nyo o yanyo nimamizing a ciring. O ahahapan nyo sya do icyatatao nyo am akman sang o ahahapan na sya jinyo ni Ama ta do to. So ikarwaro na pa no itoro na jinyo a yarana omamizing so nanao na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: For he that hath, to him shall be given: and he that hath not, from him shall be taken even that which he hath.
language2_text: Am ori o pakamizngan nyo sya an. Ta o mamizing so ciring na ni Ama ta do to am arwaro pa o makarapa jira ciring. Am o ji ngamizing so ciring na ni Ama ta do to am tana myan so alikey a katenngan da am to meykabobo jira ori."

language1_text: And he said, So is the kingdom of God, as if a man should cast seed into the ground;
language2_text: Maniring pa si Yeso am, "O italamozong ni Ama ta do to am akman so manokos a tao.

language1_text: and should sleep, and rise night and day, and the seed should spring and grow up, he knoweth not how.
language2_text: Mitkeh do mahep a kayokay na do maraw am ji na tenngi o ilida na rana no nitokos na.

language1_text: For the earth bringeth forth fruit of herself; first the blade, then the ear, after that the full corn in the ear.
language2_text: O tana am mapalida so makakaday a nipamowa na. No apiya rana o kalidalida na am mapka rana no asi na a kazako na rana.

language1_text: But when the fruit is brought forth, immediately he putteth in the sickle, because the harvest is come.
language2_text: No mazako rana o nimowa na am langin na rana no mapeymowamowa sya no ingiten, do kazako na rana no mowamowa na."

language1_text: And he said, Whereunto shall we liken the kingdom of God? or with what comparison shall we compare it?
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso do pacicyan na sira am, "Akman so wanjin o italamozong na ni Ama ta do to. Ikongo pehngehngayan ta sya.

language1_text: It is like a grain of mustard seed, which, when it is sown in the earth, is less than all the seeds that be in the earth:
language2_text: O italamozong ni Ama ta do to am akman so vettow no nappa so kalikelikey. No pamowahen no tao do tana am,

language1_text: but when it is sown, it groweth up, and becometh greater than all herbs, and shooteth out great branches; so that the fowls of the air may lodge under the shadow of it.
language2_text: amlida rana no kadadayan no araw. No omlida rana ori am abo makataha so sang a nappa so karakorako a mangay da peyvahayan no meyyasasalap."

language1_text: And with many such parables spake he the word unto them, as they were able to hear it.
language2_text: Aro o akman sang a payyaingen na ni Yeso a ciring na a inanao na so tao. To na mangozai o katenngan da no tao a inanao na sira.

language1_text: But without a parable spake he not unto them: and when they were alone, he expounded all things to his disciples.
language2_text: No myan do kalwalovotan am nanawen na sira no pehngehngain na a ciring. No maveyvow si Yeso a kano macinanao jya o pancyan na no peypeypangayan no nanao na.

language1_text: And the same day, when the even was come, he saith unto them, Let us pass over unto the other side.
language2_text: Do ahep na no kasaraw am maniring si Yeso do macinanao jya am, "Mangay tamo do katovangan no rako a meybebneng a ranom eya."

language1_text: And when they had sent away the multitude, they took him even as he was in the ship. And there were also with him other little ships.
language2_text: Makarahan am karwan da o aro a tao. Am nimanmanma rana si Yeso a nisomakay do vazangay. Mangay rana sira am amyan so karwan no vazangay a macizavoz jira.

language1_text: And there arose a great storm of wind, and the waves beat into the ship, so that it was now full.
language2_text: Makarahan am to na ngirasa sira no rako a pagpag. Am ori o nipeykabkas na rana. Makarahan am lokolokongan na rana o vazangay da kaji na rana a tengpahan no vazangay da.

language1_text: And he was in the hinder part of the ship, asleep on a pillow: and they awake him, and say unto him, Master, carest thou not that we perish?
language2_text: No kanang am amyan do maoji na si Yeso a tomangen so oo na mitkeh. Am ori o niyokayan da sya. Maniring sira am, "Mo Mangnanao, tamo na marahet. Manngwa, ka jyalaw?"

language1_text: And he arose, and rebuked the wind, and said unto the sea, Peace, be still. And the wind ceased, and there was a great calm.
language2_text: Meyvangon si Yeso am sirsirngen na rana o pagpag a kano paopaong na. So ji na nimeyyahahai a meyhanahanang.

language1_text: And he said unto them, Why are ye so fearful? how is it that ye have no faith?
language2_text: Maniring rana si Yeso do macinanao jya am, "Ikongo nyo ikanyahey. Nyo ji meyhanhanan si Ama ta do to?"

language1_text: And they feared exceedingly, and said one to another, What manner of man is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?
language2_text: Mamizing da am yeyyak da. Maniring sira do kadwan jira am, "Sinosino ya, na to ngamiznga pa no pagpag a kano abkas."

language1_text: And they came over unto the other side of the sea, into the country of the Gadarenes.
language2_text: Mangay sira do katovangan no rako a meybebneng a ranom a meyngaran so Cyadidi. Do dang rana am ili da no tao do Kelasen.

language1_text: And when he was come out of the ship, immediately there met him out of the tombs a man with an unclean spirit,
language2_text: Kapakaranes ni Yeso do pamsan na am makasazi so tao apo do kanitwan. O tao rana am kovotan no kalamsoyan ni Satan.

language1_text: who had his dwelling among the tombs; and no man could bind him, no, not with chains:
language2_text: Amyamyan ori do kanitwan. Abo makataid do tao ang. Tana vaoden da no vahalang am ji da vaod.

language1_text: because that he had been often bound with fetters and chains, and the chains had been plucked asunder by him, and the fetters broken in pieces: neither could any man tame him.
language2_text: Ta to na zavazavata o ivaod da sya. So ikabo no tao a makavaod sya.

language1_text: And always, night and day, he was in the mountains, and in the tombs, crying, and cutting himself with stones.
language2_text: Mangday so araw o kalololos na do kanitwan a kado taketakey a kapangap na so vato a izaza na so kataotao na.

language1_text: But when he saw Jesus afar off, he ran and worshipped him,
language2_text: Macita na si Yeso do marai pa am malalayo a mangay a kapeylilitod na do tangain ni Yeso,

language1_text: and cried with a loud voice, and said, What have I to do with thee, Jesus, thou Son of the most high God? I adjure thee by God, that thou torment me not.
language2_text: a kalolos na. Maniring am, "Ikongo mo gogadan nyaken, mo Yeso a Anak no ney manokdwan na Tao do to. Ko ipanci do Tao do to o kaji mo pasingsingtan jyaken."

language1_text: For he said unto him, Come out of the man, thou unclean spirit.
language2_text: O pancyan na no nang am nipanci na ni Yeso o kapakowbot na rana no kalamsoyan ni Satan do kataotao na.

language1_text: And he asked him, What is thy name? And he answered, saying, My name is Legion: for we are many.
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso am, "Sino ngaran mo." Maniring am, "O ngaran ko am Si Malavong, ta namen malavong."

language1_text: And he besought him much that he would not send them away out of the country.
language2_text: To mapasyasi ji Yeso a manci no kaji na vozwawan sira do dang.

language1_text: Now there was there nigh unto the mountains a great herd of swine feeding.
language2_text: No kanang am amyan do tokon so aro a kois a meykoskos.

language1_text: And all the devils besought him, saying, Send us into the swine, that we may enter into them.
language2_text: Maniring o aro a kalamsoyan ni Satan a mapasyasi ji Yeso am, "To mo rana novoya yamen do aro a kois ang a kangay namen a komovot jira."

language1_text: And forthwith Jesus gave them leave. And the unclean spirits went out, and entered into the swine: and the herd ran violently down a steep place into the sea, (they were about two thousand;) and were choked in the sea.
language2_text: Makarahan am apyahen na sira ni Yeso. Am ori o nipakowbot da na do kataotao na no tao ang a kangay da komovot do aro a kois. Ala adwa zivo (2000) o kois a nikomsoz do alalasyas a kangay da mehmes do rako a meybebneng a ranom a kamimin da mawakwak.

language1_text: And they that fed the swine fled, and told it in the city, and in the country. And they went out to see what it was that was done.
language2_text: Mina tongsoz rana o tomita so kois a tao kangay da na do ili a meylimwang no akman sang a vazay. Mamizing da no aro a tao am meypakokowbot sira tomita so vazay ang.

language1_text: And they come to Jesus, and see him that was possessed with the devil, and had the legion, sitting, and clothed, and in his right mind: and they were afraid.
language2_text: Makaranes sira ji Yeso am macita da o nikovotan no aro a kalamsoyan ni Satan a amlisna do dang a apiya rana so ayob a makownong rana do nakenakem na. Am ori o nikarahet da so onowned a to rana nyahey, ta tey arako oyowyat ni Yeso.

language1_text: And they that saw it told them how it befell to him that was possessed with the devil, and also concerning the swine.
language2_text: O nimakacita so nikovotan a tao a kano nikomsoz a kois am ononongan da rana do aro a tao o panpandan na.

language1_text: And they began to pray him to depart out of their coasts.
language2_text: Am ori o nipancyan da rana ni Yeso a komaro do dang.

language1_text: And when he was come into the ship, he that had been possessed with the devil prayed him that he might be with him.
language2_text: Zomagpit do vazangay si Yeso am mangay mapasyasi ji Yeso o nikovotan a tao a manci no kapehza na sya.

language1_text: Howbeit Jesus suffered him not, but saith unto him, Go home to thy friends, and tell them how great things the Lord hath done for thee, and hath had compassion on thee.
language2_text: Am ji na mya ni Yeso. Maniring jya am, "Angay rana do vahay nyo a kapanci mo nya do zipozipos nyo so na mina vazay jimo ni Ama ta do to a yamarilaw nimo."

language1_text: And he departed, and began to publish in Decapolis how great things Jesus had done for him: and all men did marvel.
language2_text: Mangay rana o tao ori am ipeylimwang na rana o ngaran ni Yeso do ngaranan da Meykasa ngarnan a ili, do kanimvozwaw na rana so kalamsoyan ni Satan do kataotao na. O makamizing sya aro a tao am isavasavak da o akman sang a vazay ni Yeso.

language1_text: And when Jesus was passed over again by ship unto the other side, much people gathered unto him: and he was nigh unto the sea.
language2_text: Somakay si Yeso do vazangay am mangay do katovangan no rako a meybebneng a ranom. Makaranes am meylovolovot o aro a tao do tangain na.

language1_text: And, behold, there cometh one of the rulers of the synagogue, Jairus by name; and when he saw him, he fell at his feet,
language2_text: Amyan do dang so asa ka meymatmatngeh no peyneynozyan a meyngaran so Yalo a nimacizavoz do aro a tao. Macita na si Yeso am mangay meylilitod do tangain ni Yeso a mapasyasi jya.

language1_text: and besought him greatly, saying, My little daughter lieth at the point of death: I pray thee, come and lay thy hands on her, that she may be healed; and she shall live.
language2_text: Maniring am, "Yatey makdeng o ingingnen no anak ko a mavakes. Mangay mo pa parapongen o lima mo jya keywakwak mo jya kapya na rana."

language1_text: And Jesus went with him; and much people followed him, and thronged him.
language2_text: Makarahan am macihza si Yeso jya mangay. Aro tao a meysilisilin a macihza jya.

language1_text: And a certain woman, which had an issue of blood twelve years,
language2_text: Amyan do dang so asa ka mavakes a makadwa so icyarwa (12) so awawan a to makaliliw so kataotao na gomcin no rala.

language1_text: and had suffered many things of many physicians, and had spent all that she had, and was nothing bettered, but rather grew worse,
language2_text: Nipasowsow na o kangangay na do pangavavawan am ji na apyan no ingingnen na, ta ipeypeyparahet na.

language1_text: when she had heard of Jesus, came in the press behind, and touched his garment.
language2_text: Mamizing na o vazay ni Yeso am ori o nipacislin na do aro a tao a kangay na do likod ni Yeso a minan do talili na.

language1_text: For she said, If I may touch but his clothes, I shall be whole.
language2_text: O nakenakem na am, "No si pinanan ko o ayob na am jya todapya rana o kataotao ko a."

language1_text: And straightway the fountain of her blood was dried up; and she felt in her body that she was healed of that plague.
language2_text: Makarahan am mina todapya rana o kataotao na do pakaliliwan na sya.

language1_text: And Jesus, immediately knowing in himself that virtue had gone out of him, turned him about in the press, and said, Who touched my clothes?
language2_text: Am to na rana tenngi ni Yeso o oyowyat a makowbot do kataotao na. Am ori o nipaolyan na so mata na do aro a tao. Maniring am, "Sino yaminan do ayob ko ang."

language1_text: And his disciples said unto him, Thou seest the multitude thronging thee, and sayest thou, Who touched me?
language2_text: Maniring sira o macinanao jya am, "Mo panangangayan nya. Mo jyacita o aro a tao a meysilisilin a mangay jimo? Mo kapanahes no niminan jimo."

language1_text: And he looked round about to see her that had done this thing.
language2_text: Am ori o nicittan na so sirisiri na. Cittan na so tao a niminan jya.

language1_text: But the woman fearing and trembling, knowing what was done in her, came and fell down before him, and told him all the truth.
language2_text: Katenngan na rana no mavakes o kapya na rana no kataotao na am to rana zikzik a manyahey. Am ori o nipeylilitod na do tangain ni Yeso a manci no kaniminan na jya.

language1_text: And he said unto her, Daughter, thy faith hath made thee whole; go in peace, and be whole of thy plague.
language2_text: Maniring jya si Yeso am, "Manganako, ka manoyong a yameyhanhan nyaken. Makapiya ka so onowned a mangay rana, ta yarana apya o ingingnen mo."

language1_text: While he yet spake, there came from the ruler of the synagogue's house certain which said, Thy daughter is dead: why troublest thou the Master any further?
language2_text: Ji pa vitos o ciring ni Yeso am mai o tao apo do vahay ni Yalo. Maniring sira ji Yalo am, "Ji mo na mancyan si Yeso, ta yarana nimawakwak o anak mo."

language1_text: As soon as Jesus heard the word that was spoken, he saith unto the ruler of the synagogue, Be not afraid, only believe.
language2_text: Am ji na ngazidan ni Yeso o ciring da. Maniring rana si Yeso do meymatmatngeh no peyneynozyan am, "Ji ka nyahey. Anoyngan mo yaken."

language1_text: And he suffered no man to follow him, save Peter, and James, and John the brother of James.
language2_text: Makarahan am palolwen na si Pite a kani Yake a kano kakteh na ni Yake a meyngaran so Yowani a mangay. Am ji na mya ni Yeso o tarek a tao a macihza jya.

language1_text: And he cometh to the house of the ruler of the synagogue, and seeth the tumult, and them that wept and wailed greatly.
language2_text: Makaranes sira do vahay no meymatmatngeh no peyneynozyan am macita na sira o aro a tao a meykabakabayo a omlavi jya.

language1_text: And when he was come in, he saith unto them, Why make ye this ado, and weep? the damsel is not dead, but sleepeth.
language2_text: Somdep si Yeso am maniring jira am, "Ji kamo lavi, ta yamitkeh. Nimakongo kwan nyo."

language1_text: And they laughed him to scorn. But when he had put them all out, he taketh the father and the mother of the damsel, and them that were with him, and entereth in where the damsel was lying.
language2_text: Mamizing da o ciring ni Yeso am no mangay o kaming da am mangay o kapeyoyaoya da. Makarahan am powboten na sira ni Yeso o aro a tao. O inyapwan na kano tatlo a macinanao jya o amyan do sahad na.

language1_text: And he took the damsel by the hand, and said unto her, Talitha cumi; which is, being interpreted, Damsel, I say unto thee, arise.
language2_text: Makarahan am ahapen na o lima no kanakan. Maniring jya am, "Tadita komi." O peypeypangayan na no nang am, "Ko ipanci imo a meyvangon, manganako."

language1_text: And straightway the damsel arose, and walked; for she was of the age of twelve years. And they were astonished with a great astonishment.
language2_text: Makarahan am meyvangon rana o kanakan a kalam na rana. No kano nang am adwa o ikasikarwa na no kakawakawan na no kanakan ang. So nipeyzokaban da no vazay ang no inyapwan na.

language1_text: And he charged them straitly that no man should know it; and commanded that something should be given her to eat.
language2_text: Maniring jira si Yeso am, "Ji nyo meyvehvehyan do tao o akman sang a vazay," kapanci na rana nira a mantan nya so kanen na.

language1_text: And he went out from thence, and came into his own country; and his disciples follow him.
language2_text: Karwan na ni Yeso do dang am meysinaoli a mangay rana do ili da a kapacihza da jya no macinanao jya.

language1_text: And when the sabbath day was come, he began to teach in the synagogue: and many hearing him were astonished, saying, From whence hath this man these things? and what wisdom is this which is given unto him, that even such mighty works are wrought by his hands?
language2_text: Marateng rana o ipeywalam no tao am mangnanao si Yeso do peyneynozyan. Aro tao a somavasavak no nimamizing da ciring ni Yeso. Maniring sira am, "Do wanjin na nipakamizngan so sang. Sino yamanta nya so teneng na ang. Asyo ori yato makapeyvazay so mapeyzokab a vazay.

language1_text: Is not this the carpenter, the son of Mary, the brother of James, and Joses, and of Juda, and Simon? and are not his sisters here with us? And they were offended at him.
language2_text: Beken a ori o meykeykawaz a tao asyo? Beken a iya o anak ni Madiya asyo? Beken a kaka na ni Yake a kani Yoseyvo a kani Yota kani Simong ori asyo? Da kapeyvahay do jya no wari na mavakes eya am." Makarahan am ikaoya da na si Yeso.

language1_text: But Jesus said unto them, A prophet is not without honour, but in his own country, and among his own kin, and in his own house.
language2_text: Maniring jira si Yeso am, "O panoyonoywan na ni Ama ta do to so ciring na tao am ikanig da sira no tao do peycyeylilyan na. Am kolalahen da sira no pacikeylyanan da kano pacivahayan da tao."

language1_text: And he could there do no mighty work, save that he laid his hands upon a few sick folk, and healed them.
language2_text: Am ori o ji na nimapeyvazai so mapeyzokab a vazay do ili da. So nikapereh no tao a niparapongan na so lima na a omiwakwak jira.

language1_text: And he marvelled because of their unbelief. And he went round about the villages, teaching.
language2_text: Am ori o nyeyyakan na nira, ta ji sira manganoyong o aro a tao. So ji na nimacimazai do kalivolivon na do peycyeylilyan na mangnanao so tao.

language1_text: And he called unto him the twelve, and began to send them forth by two and two; and gave them power over unclean spirits;
language2_text: Nilovot na sira o rarwa so ikakarwan a macinanao jya kateyrararwa da tovoin a kapanta na nira so oyowyat da ipamozwaw da so kalamsoyan ni Satan a komovot do tao.

language1_text: and commanded them that they should take nothing for their journey, save a staff only; no scrip, no bread, no money in their purse:
language2_text: Maniring jira am, "No mangay kamo am sisikod nyo o palolwen nyo. Ji kamo mapalolo so kanen nyo am nizpi nyo. Ji kamo meyyaomas.

language1_text: but be shod with sandals; and not put on two coats.
language2_text: Apya o kapeytokap nyo. Ji nyo peytapila o ayob nyo."

language1_text: And he said unto them, In what place soever ye enter into an house, there abide till ye depart from that place.
language2_text: Maniring pa jira am, "No makaranes kamo do asa ka ili am no masaray o tao a tomaotao jinyo am to kamo na ngisan do vahay da. No mangay kamo rana am ori o karwan nyo jira.

language1_text: And whosoever shall not receive you, nor hear you, when ye depart thence, shake off the dust under your feet for a testimony against them. Verily I say unto you, It shall be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrha in the day of judgment, than for that city.
language2_text: No mangay kamo do vahay da a kaji da raralayan ninyo a taotawwen a ji da ngamiznga so ciring am to nyo na ngaroi sira katoktok nyo so domket do ai nyo a tana, ta tovilan nyo jira meyraraten a tao a ji mamlis so nakenakem."

language1_text: And they went out, and preached that men should repent.
language2_text: Makarahan am mangay rana sira o macinanao ji Yeso a meylimwang no ciring na ni Ama ta do to a kavavaga da do aro a tao a mamlis rana komaro do peyraratenan da.

language1_text: And they cast out many devils, and anointed with oil many that were sick, and healed them.
language2_text: Aro o nivozwaw da a kalamsoyan ni Satan a komovot do tao a kakoris da no haneng do meyngen a tao. So nikaro no niwakwakan da meyngen a tao.

language1_text: And king Herod heard of him; (for his name was spread abroad:) and he said, That John the Baptist was risen from the dead, and therefore mighty works do shew forth themselves in him.
language2_text: Mamizing no panirsirngen a meyngaran so Helote o aro a vazay ni Yeso a meylimwang rana do peycyeylilyan na. Maniring sira o tao am, "Iya o nimanaktak a meyngaran so Yowani a yanimirwa mavyay. Am ori o na ikatey mowyat a yamapeyvazay so mapeyzokab a vazay."

language1_text: Others said, That it is Elias. And others said, That it is a prophet, or as one of the prophets.
language2_text: Maniring pa sira o tao am, "Iya rana am si Idiya." So iyan no tao a manci nya akmey tao no kakwa a panoyonoywan na so ciring ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: But when Herod heard thereof, he said, It is John, whom I beheaded: he is risen from the dead.
language2_text: Mamizing na o ciring ori no panirsirngen a meyngaran so Helote am maniring am, "Iya asyo o nimanaktak a si Yowani a nipotowan ko so oo a yarana nimirwa mavyay."

language1_text: For Herod himself had sent forth and laid hold upon John, and bound him in prison for Herodias' sake, his brother Philip's wife: for he had married her. For John had said unto Herod, It is not lawful for thee to have thy brother's wife.
language2_text: O cinawakwak na ni Yowani am o panirsirngen a meyngaran so Helote am to ney mehsa o mavakes no kakteh na a meyngaran so Veydipo. O ngaran no mavakes am si Helotiya. Masangib si Yowani a mazyak nya do kato ney papenan so kahanghang na no kakteh na. Am ori o nipanovoy ni Helote so tao no kanang a omrakep si Yowani a kangay da nya do pamemtengan. O cinawakwak na ni Yowani am o panirsirngen a meyngaran so Helote am to ney mehsa o mavakes no kakteh na a meyngaran so Veydipo. O ngaran no mavakes am si Helotiya. Masangib si Yowani a mazyak nya do kato ney papenan so kahanghang na no kakteh na. Am ori o nipanovoy ni Helote so tao no kanang a omrakep si Yowani a kangay da nya do pamemtengan.

language1_text: Therefore Herodias had a quarrel against him, and would have killed him; but she could not:
language2_text: Si Helotiya rana am to na peyyana do onowned na o oyyan na ni Yowani. Am ori o naknakman na so kawakwak na sya. Am ji na pakongo,

language1_text: for Herod feared John, knowing that he was a just man and an holy, and observed him; and when he heard him, he did many things, and heard him gladly.
language2_text: ta ikanig na ni Helote si Yowani. Ta abo karatan na. Am ori o ji na gogaji nya. Ta ikakza na amizngen o ipangnanao ni Yowani. Am mangday no amizngen na o ipangnanao ni Yowani o kaji nangnedan so ninyakan.

language1_text: And when a convenient day was come, that Herod on his birthday made a supper to his lords, high captains, and chief estates of Galilee;
language2_text: Marateng o araraw no cinatazak na tao ni Helote am naknakmen na rana ni Helotiya o kalita na ji Yowani. Makarahan am manaotao si Helote so aro a meynakem a tao a kapazagom na so panipanirsirngen da no tao do Cyadidi.

language1_text: and when the daughter of the said Herodias came in, and danced, and pleased Herod and them that sat with him, the king said unto the damsel, Ask of me whatsoever thou wilt, and I will give it thee.
language2_text: Makarahan am ipanci na ni Helotiya o anak na mavakes a maganam. Ikakza ni Helote a kano tao na o ganam na. Maniring si Helote do maganam a mavakes am, "No si amyan so amin mo jyaken am cyaha, ta itoro ko jimo."

language1_text: And he sware unto her, Whatsoever thou shalt ask of me, I will give it thee, unto the half of my kingdom.
language2_text: Maniring pa am, "Tana amin mo jyaken o kakteb no pongso ta ya am jyabo kaji ko norwan nya jimo a."

language1_text: And she went forth, and said unto her mother, What shall I ask? And she said, The head of John the Baptist.
language2_text: Makarahan am mangay na ahesen o ina na no mavakes ang. Maniring ji ina na am, "Ikongo amin ko." Maniring o ina na am, "Oo no nimanaktak a si Yowani."

language1_text: And she came in straightway with haste unto the king, and asked, saying, I will that thou give me by and by in a charger the head of John the Baptist.
language2_text: Meysinaoli o mavakes do panirsirngen a si Helote a manci nya jya. Maniring am, "Ji mo peyyahahaya o oo no nimanaktak a si Yowani a pangain do kakanan a itoro jyaken."

language1_text: And the king was exceeding sorry; yet for his oath's sake, and for their sakes which sat with him, he would not reject her.
language2_text: Mamizing na o ciring na no panirsirngen am ikeyngen na no oo. Am ji na rana pakongo, ta nimamizing da rana no aro a tao o ipanma na ciring. Am ori o ji na makapeyolii so nakem na do mavakes ang.

language1_text: And immediately the king sent an executioner, and commanded his head to be brought: and he went and beheaded him in the prison,
language2_text: Makarahan am ipanci na rana o lamlamsoy na mangay do pamemtengan a kapotow na ji Yowani,

language1_text: and brought his head in a charger, and gave it to the damsel: and the damsel gave it to her mother.
language2_text: kapangay na so oo na do kakanan a yangay do anak ni Helotiya a mavakes kangay na rana ji ina na.

language1_text: And when his disciples heard of it, they came and took up his corpse, and laid it in a tomb.
language2_text: Mamizing no macinanao ji Yowani o vazay da am mangay da pingsanan o kataotao na ni Yowani a kangay da rana mapakakasa sya.

language1_text: And the apostles gathered themselves together unto Jesus, and told him all things, both what they had done, and what they had taught.
language2_text: Meysinaoli sira ji Yeso o nipamnekan na a omlivolivon no ciriciring na am ipanci da rana ji Yeso o mina vazay da no kapeylimwang da no ciriciring na.

language1_text: And he said unto them, Come ye yourselves apart into a desert place, and rest a while: for there were many coming and going, and they had no leisure so much as to eat.
language2_text: Ikongo do tey yaro o tao, am ori o ikabo no ipeywalam da koman. Maniring si Yeso jira am, "Sijya kamo a kangay tamo meywalam do kabwan no tao."

language1_text: And they departed into a desert place by ship privately.
language2_text: Makarahan am zomagpit sira do vazangay a kangay da rana do kabwan no tao.

language1_text: And the people saw them departing, and many knew him, and ran afoot thither out of all cities, and outwent them, and came together unto him.
language2_text: Am macita da sira no aro a tao am to da rana tenngi o angayan da. Am ori o nipanmanma da rana no aro a tao do peycyeylilyan a mangay do angayan ni Yeso a kano macinanao jya.

language1_text: And Jesus, when he came out, saw much people, and was moved with compassion toward them, because they were as sheep not having a shepherd: and he began to teach them many things.
language2_text: Makaranes si Yeso do pamsan na am macita na o aro a tao akmey kagling a abo so omonong nira. Am ori o nikasyan na nira. Makarahan am nanawen na sira no aro a ciring.

language1_text: And when the day was now far spent, his disciples came unto him, and said, This is a desert place, and now the time is far passed:
language2_text: Maseyrem rana am mai sira o macinanao jya. Maniring sira ji Yeso am, "Yatey mahep rana. Yabo pa do jya o panazangan.

language1_text: send them away, that they may go into the country round about, and into the villages, and buy themselves bread: for they have nothing to eat.
language2_text: To ta rana mancyan sira meysyasyay a kangay da do ili a mangay manazang so kanen da."

language1_text: He answered and said unto them, Give ye them to eat. And they say unto him, Shall we go and buy two hundred pennyworth of bread, and give them to eat?
language2_text: Maniring jira si Yeso am, "Pantan kamo sira so kanen da." Maniring sira o macinanao jya am, "Manngwa, ipanta mo yamen saon so meycyalaklaksa a nizpi a ipangap namen so kanen da myanpaw?"

language1_text: He saith unto them, How many loaves have ye? go and see. And when they knew, they say, Five, and two fishes.
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso jira am, "Angay pala cita yapira o yada nipalolo a myanpaw." Citahen da am alima ka myanpaw a kano yadwa ka among.

language1_text: And he commanded them to make all sit down by companies upon the green grass.
language2_text: Makarahan am ipanci na rana ni Yeso o macinanao jya mapeykapyapinpin sira do katamtamkan,

language1_text: And they sat down in ranks, by hundreds, and by fifties.
language2_text: kalisna da rana no aro a tao. So niyan dang no kakapowan (100) a tao do asa ka lipenpenan. Amyan so kakaliman (50) do asa ka lipenpenan.

language1_text: And when he had taken the five loaves and the two fishes, he looked up to heaven, and blessed, and brake the loaves, and gave them to his disciples to set before them; and the two fishes divided he among them all.
language2_text: Todahen na ni Yeso o alima ka myanpaw a kano adwa ka among am tangarahen na rana o hanit a kasaray na rana nya ji Ama ta do to, a kakcikcil na rana so myanpaw a itoro do macinanao jya. Makarahan am vonongen da rana sya do aro a tao. Akman sang o among a itoro na do macinanao jya.

language1_text: And they did all eat, and were filled.
language2_text: So nikamimin da rana nikoman a mabsoy.

language1_text: And they took up twelve baskets full of the fragments, and of the fishes.
language2_text: Peykakasahen da na no macinanao jya o atda da myanpaw a kano among am adwa pa o ikarwa na ka yala no nimapanpan.

language1_text: And they that did eat of the loaves were about five thousand men.
language2_text: Vilangan da o mahakay a nikoman am kakaliman a ranaw (5000) sira.

language1_text: And straightway he constrained his disciples to get into the ship, and to go to the other side before unto Bethsaida, while he sent away the people.
language2_text: Mavitos o vazay na am to na rana panma ni Yeso o macinanao jya a somakay do vazangay a mangay do Peysayta a ili. Ta tovoin na pa sira o aro a tao a mangay rana.

language1_text: And when he had sent them away, he departed into a mountain to pray.
language2_text: Teyka na taitaiden o aro a tao ni Yeso am omangaz do tokon a meynozi.

language1_text: And when even was come, the ship was in the midst of the sea, and he alone on the land.
language2_text: Mahep rana am makanavak o vazangay do rako a meybebneng a ranom am maveyvow pa si Yeso do tokon a meynozi.

language1_text: And he saw them toiling in rowing; for the wind was contrary unto them: and about the fourth watch of the night he cometh unto them, walking upon the sea, and would have passed by them.
language2_text: Macita na o macinanao jya mazikna komaod so vazangay a somangoz so yanan da ranom. Toda jyaraw am mangonong si Yeso do ranom a mangay do macinanao jya.

language1_text: But when they saw him walking upon the sea, they supposed it had been a spirit, and cried out:
language2_text: Macita da no macinanao jya si Yeso a omalam do ranom am ipanci da anito. Am ori o nilololos da a manyahey.

language1_text: for they all saw him, and were troubled. And immediately he talked with them, and saith unto them, Be of good cheer: it is I; be not afraid.
language2_text: So nikamimin da nimanyahey a makacita sya. Maniring si Yeso jira am, "Ji kamo anyahey, ta yaken."

language1_text: And he went up unto them into the ship; and the wind ceased: and they were sore amazed in themselves beyond measure, and wondered.
language2_text: Makarahan am zomagpit rana do vazangay kapacioran na rana jira. Makarahan am mahanang rana. Am ori o nisavasavakan da nya no macinanao jya.

language1_text: For they considered not the miracle of the loaves: for their heart was hardened.
language2_text: Ta tana nimacita da rana o kaniomabsoy na so aro a tao am ji da pa tenngi o ka Tao do to na ni Yeso, do kaji da makazaban sya no onowned.

language1_text: And when they had passed over, they came into the land of Gennesaret, and drew to the shore.
language2_text: Makarahan am makaranes rana sira do Kenisale.

language1_text: And when they were come out of the ship, straightway they knew him,
language2_text: Meyhekas sira do vazangay am katovilan da rana si Yeso no aro a tao.

language1_text: and ran through that whole region round about, and began to carry about in beds those that were sick, where they heard he was.
language2_text: Mamizing da si Yeso amyan dang am ori o nipeypalapalalayo da a mangay a mahap so meykeyngeyngen a tao do itkehan da a mangay nira do yanan ni Yeso.

language1_text: And whithersoever he entered, into villages, or cities, or country, they laid the sick in the streets, and besought him that they might touch if it were but the border of his garment: and as many as touched him were made whole.
language2_text: Tana mangay si Yeso do likta ili a tana mangay do rako a ili am mamimin o meykeyngeyngen a tao a peypangain da do rararahan. Ta si ori pa o ipakapinan da do ayob ni Yeso do ipeyhavas na. Ta o minan do ayob ni Yeso a tao am todapya rana sira.

language1_text: Then came together unto him the Pharisees, and certain of the scribes, which came from Jerusalem.
language2_text: O tao a macyagom do Vadisay a kano nimapo do Yelosaleng a mangnanao no iwawalam ni Ama ta do to am mangay sira do tangain ni Yeso.

language1_text: And when they saw some of his disciples eat bread with defiled, that is to say, with unwashen, hands, they found fault.
language2_text: Macita da o macinanao ji Yeso a todangan a ji nimavanaw a ji nginara so tao a macyagom do Vadisay a mavanaw.

language1_text: For the Pharisees, and all the Jews, except they wash their hands oft, eat not, holding the tradition of the elders.
language2_text: Ta sira rana o tao a macyagom do Vadisay a kano tao do Yotay am to da vangovangona o icicirawat da no ineynapo da. O icicirawat no ineynapo da am no ji mavanaw am jyangan.

language1_text: And when they come from the market, except they wash, they eat not. And many other things there be, which they have received to hold, as the washing of cups, and pots, brasen vessels, and of tables.
language2_text: O nisazangan a kanekanen am no ji ngoyasi am ji da nganna. So ikaro na pa dang no iwawalam da vangovangonen da do kowyas da do ininoman da kano kama da kano makakaday a kakakanan da.

language1_text: Then the Pharisees and scribes asked him, Why walk not thy disciples according to the tradition of the elders, but eat bread with unwashen hands?
language2_text: Am ori o pacicyan da si Yeso no tao a macyagom do Vadisay a kano mangnanao so iwawalam ni Ama ta do to. Maniring sira am, "Ikongo da ji ngapi no macinanao jimo so icicirawat no ineynapo ta a yatodangan a yajya nimavanaw."

language1_text: He answered and said unto them, Well hath Esaias prophesied of you hypocrites, as it is written, This people honoureth me with their lips, But their heart is far from me.
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso am, "O ciring na ni Isayya jinyo a yatanwasiwasi am manoyong saon am. Ta maniring am, 'O aro a tao am da admadmain yaken no ciring da. Am onowned da am yameyparai jyaken.

language1_text: Howbeit in vain do they worship me, Teaching for doctrines the commandments of men.
language2_text: Da ipanci o ciring no tao a ciring ko. So yana ikabo no peypeypangayan no da kararalay nyaken.'"

language1_text: For laying aside the commandment of God, ye hold the tradition of men, as the washing of pots and cups: and many other such like things ye do.
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso am, "Nyo ikeykakza pa o icicirawat no ineynapo nyo a kano Ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to."

language1_text: And he said unto them, Full well ye reject the commandment of God, that ye may keep your own tradition.
language2_text: Maniring pa jira am, "Yakamo tey mateneng a yatomaosya so Ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to, do yanyo kahahap so icicirawat no ineynapo nyo.

language1_text: For Moses said, Honour thy father and thy mother; and, Whoso curseth father or mother, let him die the death:
language2_text: O ciring na ni Moyse jinyo am, 'Ikaglaw nyo a ikanig o inyapwan nyo.' Maniring pa am, 'Omavay so inyapwan na am to rana wakwaka.'

language1_text: but ye say, If a man shall say to his father or mother, It is Corban, that is to say, a gift, by whatsoever thou mightest be profited by me; he shall be free.
language2_text: No kamo maniring am, 'No amyan so tao a manci nya do inyapwan na so, O ipakan jinyo am yako ipeykingking ji Ama ta do to.'

language1_text: And ye suffer him no more to do ought for his father or his mother;
language2_text: No si myan so akman sang am ji na rana pakana o inyapwan na.

language1_text: making the word of God of none effect through your tradition, which ye have delivered: and many such like things do ye.
language2_text: O akman rana sang a icicirawat nyo am na rasain o Ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to. So yana ikaro pa no yakman sang a vazay nyo."

language1_text: And when he had called all the people unto him, he said unto them, Hearken unto me every one of you, and understand:
language2_text: Lovoten ni Yeso o aro a tao do tangain na am maniring jira am, "Mamimin kamo a omamizing so ciring ko a kapakateneng nyo jya.

language1_text: there is nothing from without a man, that entering into him can defile him: but the things which come out of him, those are they that defile the man.
language2_text: O isovo a kanen am ji mapeyraraten so tao. Ta o tomwaw a apo do onowned no tao am ori o mapeyraraten sya.

language1_text: If any man have ears to hear, let him hear.
language2_text: Amizngen nyo an, peyyanen nyo do onowned nyo ori an."

language1_text: And when he was entered into the house from the people, his disciples asked him concerning the parable.
language2_text: Karwan na ni Yeso o aro a tao a somdep do sahad. Ori o nipacicyan da pa sya no macinanao jya do kanadnad no ciring na.

language1_text: And he saith unto them, Are ye so without understanding also? Do ye not perceive, that whatsoever thing from without entereth into the man, it cannot defile him;
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso jira am, "Kamo akman sira ori a yaji makateneng jya? Nyo jyatenngi o kaji na mapeyraratenan so tao no isovo a kanen?

language1_text: because it entereth not into his heart, but into the belly, and goeth out into the draught, purging all meats?
language2_text: Ta o isovo a kanen am jyangay do onowned na. Ta mangay do velek na a kapeywadwad na rana nya." O peypeypangayan no ciring ni Yeso am ipanci na o kaji na mapeyraratenan so tao no isovo a kanen.

language1_text: And he said, That which cometh out of the man, that defileth the man.
language2_text: Maniring pa am, "O mapeyraraten so tao am apo do onowned no tao a makowbot.

language1_text: For from within, out of the heart of men, proceed evil thoughts, adulteries, fornications, murders,
language2_text: Ta o meytotwaw a apo do onowned a makakaday a raraten am ingingit na sya mangay mapeyvazay so kapanakaw na, kapanwakwak na,

language1_text: thefts, covetousness, wickedness, deceit, lasciviousness, an evil eye, blasphemy, pride, foolishness:
language2_text: kasagpyan na so aktokto, kapangagom na, kapangalalas na, kaji na apzatan do iwawalam na, kapanginanahet na, kapanamwad na, kapahama na so nakem na, kapamait na a meyraraten.

language1_text: all these evil things come from within, and defile the man.
language2_text: O yamakakaday a raraten na ori am mamimin ori a apo do onowned no tao a mapeyraraten so tao do tangain ni Ama ta do to."

language1_text: And from thence he arose, and went into the borders of Tyre and Sidon, and entered into an house, and would have no man know it: but he could not be hid.
language2_text: Karwan na do dang ni Yeso a kapeypangay na do macisngen do Tayar a kado Siton a ili a kasdep na do asa ka vahay, ta ji nakzan o kapakateneng da jya no tao. Am ji na pawaw o tao.

language1_text: For a certain woman, whose young daughter had an unclean spirit, heard of him, and came and fell at his feet:
language2_text: Amyan so asa ka mavakes a kanakan a kovotan no kalamsoyan ni Satan. O ina na am mangay a meylilitod do tangain ni Yeso, ta nimamizing na o aro a vazay na.

language1_text: the woman was a Greek, a Syrophenician by nation; and she besought him that he would cast forth the devil out of her daughter.
language2_text: Sira o meyina am ji sira macikeylyan do tao do Yotay, ta meyvahay sira do Vongnise a macinapnap do Sidiya. So nipasyasi no ina na ji Yeso amvozwaw so kalamsoyan ni Satan a komovot do anak na.

language1_text: But Jesus said unto her, Let the children first be filled: for it is not meet to take the children's bread, and to cast it unto the dogs.
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso jya am, "Panmanmahen o kabsoy so anak, ta malas o kawasik no kanen no anak do ino."

language1_text: And she answered and said unto him, Yes, Lord: yet the dogs under the table eat of the children's crumbs.
language2_text: Maniring o mavakes am, "Manoyong ori mo Panirsirngen. Am o meycyakakas a kanen no anak am kanen ori no ino."

language1_text: And he said unto her, For this saying go thy way; the devil is gone out of thy daughter.
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso jya am, "Yatey manoyong o ciring mo. So to mo rana angai, ta yarana nimavozwaw o kalamsoyan ni Satan a nikomovot do anak mo."

language1_text: And when she was come to her house, she found the devil gone out, and her daughter laid upon the bed.
language2_text: Makarahan am mangay rana o mavakes ang do vahay da. Makaranes am macita na rana o anak na miray do ireyrayan na, do mina kakaro na rana jya no kalamsoyan ni Satan.

language1_text: And again, departing from the coasts of Tyre and Sidon, he came unto the sea of Galilee, through the midst of the coasts of Decapolis.
language2_text: Karwan na ni Yeso o ili a meyngaran so Tayar a kapangonong na do ili a meyngaran so Siton a nimapo do Meykasa ngarnan a ili a meypangay rana do rako a meybebneng a ranom a meyngaran so Cyadidi.

language1_text: And they bring unto him one that was deaf, and had an impediment in his speech; and they beseech him to put his hand upon him.
