language2_text: Macita na ni Yeso o macihanghang jya a tao mangay omlisna do apya a lilisnan am nipanci na jira o payyaingen na sya.

language1_text: When thou art bidden of any man to a wedding, sit not down in the highest room; lest a more honourable man than thou be bidden of him;
language2_text: Maniring am, "No nipanoyon da inyo no mamaring so kanen a tao am ji kanyo lisna do pamanongan na an. Ta amyan pa so meyneynakem pa ka ninyo a tao da an.

language1_text: and he that bade thee and him come and say to thee, Give this man place; and thou begin with shame to take the lowest room.
language2_text: Ta maraherahet o kapanci na ninyo no meykanekanen a tao amlisna do lilisnan no ji meynakem a tao. No si akman sang am jyabo kaji nyo meylatlatlatan a komaro do lilisnan nyo.

language1_text: But when thou art bidden, go and sit down in the lowest room; that when he that bade thee cometh, he may say unto thee, Friend, go up higher: then shalt thou have worship in the presence of them that sit at meat with thee.
language2_text: No ipanoyon da inyo am mangay kamo amlisna do ney manowji rana lilisnan an. Apyapya kananala nyo so meykanekanen a tao a mapalisna jinyo do pipya lilisnan, ta ori o ji nyo meylatlatlaci do tangain no aro a tao da.

language1_text: For whosoever exalteth himself shall be abased; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted.
language2_text: Ta o mapakarakarang a tao am mangay na pavevehen ni Ama ta do to. O ji makazyazyak a tao am peypakatkaten na sira ni Ama ta do to."

language1_text: Then said he also to him that bade him, When thou makest a dinner or a supper, call not thy friends, nor thy brethren, neither thy kinsmen, nor thy rich neighbours; lest they also bid thee again, and a recompence be made thee.
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso do tomaotao sya a tao am, "No manaotao ka am ji ka manaid so kagagan mo a kano kakteh mo a kano zipos mo a kano katenngan a tao a kataib mo. Ta patonggalan da o kanekanen mo.

language1_text: But when thou makest a feast, call the poor, the maimed, the lame, the blind:
language2_text: No manaid ka am taidan mo sira o ji makahakaw a tao a kano makasapa tao a mavota a mapilay a tao.

language1_text: and thou shalt be blessed; for they cannot recompense thee: for thou shalt be recompensed at the resurrection of the just.
language2_text: Ta ori o ikapya mo, ta sira rana ori am abo patoplis da jimo. No mirwa a mavyay o pipya so nakenakem am patoplisan na ni Ama ta do to."

language1_text: And when one of them that sat at meat with him heard these things, he said unto him, Blessed is he that shall eat bread in the kingdom of God.
language2_text: Mamizing na no asa ka tao a macihanghang ji Yeso am amyan so ciring na jya. Maniring am, "Tey rako o sarasaray da no macihanghang do italamozong ni Ama ta do to a tao."

language1_text: Then said he unto him, A certain man made a great supper, and bade many:
language2_text: Tovisan na ori ni Yeso am payyaingan na o asa ka ciring. Maniring am, "Amyan so meykanekanen a tao a manaid so aro a tao na.

language1_text: and sent his servant at supper time to say to them that were bidden, Come; for all things are now ready.
language2_text: Marateng o araraw no ipamaring da so kanen am manovoy so lamlamsoy na do nitaidan na tao. Maniring jira am, 'Sijya kamo na, ta yana nipeykakasa o aro a kanekanen.'

language1_text: And they all with one consent began to make excuse. The first said unto him, I have bought a piece of ground, and I must needs go and see it: I pray thee have me excused.
language2_text: Am mamimin sira ji ngonot jya. Maniring o asa ka tao am, 'Ko kapanazang pa so hakawan. So ko yangay a tomita pa sya. So ji mo ngozai jyaken an.'

language1_text: And another said, I have bought five yoke of oxen, and I go to prove them: I pray thee have me excused.
language2_text: Maniring o asa ka tao am, 'Yako nimanazang so yasa ngarnan a baka. Ko yangay abwabwangen pa sira do ko palaman sira. Kapakamo mo am ji ko angay.'

language1_text: And another said, I have married a wife, and therefore I cannot come.
language2_text: Maniring o asa ka tao am, 'Ko kapapapen pa. Am ori o ji ko angai.'

language1_text: So that servant came, and shewed his lord these things. Then the master of the house being angry said to his servant, Go out quickly into the streets and lanes of the city, and bring in hither the poor, and the maimed, and the halt, and the blind.
language2_text: Meysinaoli o lamlamsoy na am ipanci na o ciring da do lawpan na. Mamizing na am to na meyoyaoya. Maniring do lamlamsoy na am, 'To ka nangay do ili a manara so ji makahakaw a tao a kano makasapa kano mavota kano meycyapilapilay.'

language1_text: And the servant said, Lord, it is done as thou hast commanded, and yet there is room.
language2_text: Meyratateng am to na mangozai no lamlamsoy na o ciring na. Meysinaoli am ipanci na do lawpan na, 'Ko na nimimin a nipeyvazay o ciring mo am yapa myan so lilisnan a yakabwan no tao.'

language1_text: And the lord said unto the servant, Go out into the highways and hedges, and compel them to come in, that my house may be filled.
language2_text: Maniring o lawpan do lamlamsoy na am, 'To ka nangay do rararahan a manara so tao kapno da do vahay ko.

language1_text: For I say unto you, That none of those men which were bidden shall taste of my supper.
language2_text: Ko pa ciring jinyo am o ney manma na nitaidan ko a tao am abwata jira o tomaham do nipanam ko a kanen.'"

language1_text: And there went great multitudes with him: and he turned, and said unto them,
language2_text: Aro sira tao a macihza ji Yeso. Paolin na o mata na sira am amyan so ciring na jira. Maniring am,

language1_text: If any man come to me, and hate not his father, and mother, and wife, and children, and brethren, and sisters, yea, and his own life also, he cannot be my disciple.
language2_text: "O mai jyaken a tao a kapahamahama da so inyapwan da kano kahanghangan da kano ananak da kano kakakteh da kano kataotao da ikaglaw am ji sira meyngongyod a abneken ko a macilolo jyaken.

language1_text: And whosoever doth not bear his cross, and come after me, cannot be my disciple.
language2_text: No myan so manyahey no kawakwak no kataotao da a macilolo jyaken am ji ko sira abneka a meyngongyod a macilolo jyaken.

language1_text: For which of you, intending to build a tower, sitteth not down first, and counteth the cost, whether he have sufficient to finish it?
language2_text: Sino jinyo o ji nakenakem so paringen na a rako a vahay, manngwa, makanet o yamaog ko sya an? No ji makanet.

language1_text: Lest haply, after he hath laid the foundation, and is not able to finish it, all that behold it begin to mock him,
language2_text: Ta no teyka na rana o aiyai na a paringen na a kabo rana no yamaog sya am jyabo kapakamaog pa sya. No macita da no tao am jyabo kaji da namwadan sya,

language1_text: saying, This man began to build, and was not able to finish.
language2_text: a manci no, 'Asyo tao eya a to nivang do vazay na a ji pakavosa.'

language1_text: Or what king, going to make war against another king, sitteth not down first, and consulteth whether he be able with ten thousand to meet him that cometh against him with twenty thousand?
language2_text: No myan so asa ka panirsirngen a mapalolo so asa laksa (10, 000) tao a mangay a omarap so mapalolo so adwa laksa (20, 000) tao am jyabo kaji na naknakman so kaji da makasangahan sira.

language1_text: Or else, while the other is yet a great way off, he sendeth an ambassage, and desireth conditions of peace.
language2_text: No naknakmen na o kaji na makasangahan sira am jyabo kaji na manovoyan so asa ka tao a mangay a mapasyahahap so nakenakem da.

language1_text: So likewise, whosoever he be of you that forsaketh not all that he hath, he cannot be my disciple.
language2_text: Akman kamo so sang an. Ta no si likodan nyo o makakaday a vazay nyo am ori o ikanoyong nyo a macilolo jyaken.

language1_text: Salt is good: but if the salt have lost his savour, wherewith shall it be seasoned?
language2_text: "O asin rana ya am abo karatan na an. Am no si tomavang ori am ikongo pavowin a kapait na.

language1_text: It is neither fit for the land, nor yet for the dunghill; but men cast it out. He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.
language2_text: So ikabwata no angangayan na rana. Apyapya rana kato patpehan sya do tana a iwasik. Am ori o amizngan nyo sya an, peyyanen nyo do onowned nyo ori an."

language1_text: Then drew near unto him all the publicans and sinners for to hear him.
language2_text: O mapeyvazay so deyking a kano aro a meyraraten a tao am mai sira do tangain ni Yeso a omamizing so ciring na.

language1_text: And the Pharisees and scribes murmured, saying, This man receiveth sinners, and eateth with them.
language2_text: Am ori o nipeyyahhahes da no tao a macyagom do Vadisay a kano mangnanao no iwawalam na ni Ama ta do to. Maniring sira am, "Ikongo yana ipacihanghang do aro a meyraraten a tao."

language1_text: And he spake this parable unto them, saying,
language2_text: Meyratateng am ipanci na jira ni Yeso o payyaingen na sya.

language1_text: What man of you, having an hundred sheep, if he lose one of them, doth not leave the ninety and nine in the wilderness, and go after that which is lost, until he find it?
language2_text: Maniring jira am, "No si myan jinyo so mapalam so asa poo (100) a kagling a kavozaw no asa am makongo so wanjin ori. Jyabo kaji na tongriyan do asyam so ipakapoo (99) a kagling a kangay na komala so nimavozaw a asa ka kagling na.

language1_text: And when he hath found it, he layeth it on his shoulders, rejoicing.
language2_text: No makala na am jyabo kaji na narayan a somabway nya ioli a.

language1_text: And when he cometh home, he calleth together his friends and neighbours, saying unto them, Rejoice with me; for I have found my sheep which was lost.
language2_text: No ioli na rana am rarahen na o kagagan na kano kataib na kapanci na rana no, 'Ko masaray, ta ko rana nimakala o yanimavozaw a kagling ko. Sijya kamo, ta isaray tamo pa.'

language1_text: I say unto you, that likewise joy shall be in heaven over one sinner that repenteth, more than over ninety and nine just persons, which need no repentance.
language2_text: Ko pa ciring jinyo am no mamlis o asa ka meyraraten a tao am arakorako pa o sarasaray do teyngato a kano asyam so ipakapoo (99) a tanwasiwasi a tao a jyakza no kapamlis da.

language1_text: Either what woman having ten pieces of silver, if she lose one piece, doth not light a candle, and sweep the house, and seek diligently till she find it?
language2_text: "No si amyan so asa ka mavakes a meynizpi so asa poo a kabo na no asa ngarnan am makongo so wanjin ori. Jyabo kaji na meyzampwan amviyas do vahay na kalan na sya.

language1_text: And when she hath found it, she calleth her friends and her neighbours together, saying, Rejoice with me; for I have found the piece which I had lost.
language2_text: No makala na am rarahen na o kagagan na kano kataib na kapanci na nya jira so, 'Ko masaray, ta ko nimakala o yanimabo a nizpi ko. Sijya kamo, ta isaray tamo pa.'

language1_text: Likewise, I say unto you, there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner that repenteth.
language2_text: Ko pa ciring jinyo am o tinsi na ni Ama ta do to am akman so sang a somaray no asa ka mamlis a meyraraten a tao."

language1_text: And he said, A certain man had two sons:
language2_text: Tongtongan na o ciring na ni Yeso am ipanci na pa o payyaingen na sya. Maniring jira am, "Amyan so asa ka tao a meytaodtod so rarwa ka mahakay.

language1_text: and the younger of them said to his father, Father, give me the portion of goods that falleth to me. And he divided unto them his living.
language2_text: Maniring o ananak do ama na am, 'Mo ama, to mo na norwan jyaken o vonong ko do kangangay ta.' Meyratateng am vonongen na o kangangay na do rarwa ka anak na.

language1_text: And not many days after the younger son gathered all together, and took his journey into a far country, and there wasted his substance with riotous living.
language2_text: Makanateng so araraw am nimimin na no ananak o vonong na nipamalit na so nizpi. Mahap na o nizpi am karwan na rana o vahay da kangay na matarek do asa ka ili. Meyratateng am to nazestes do araraw o peyvwakan na so nizpi na do peyyowyawan na.

language1_text: And when he had spent all, there arose a mighty famine in that land; and he began to be in want.
language2_text: Magid o nizpi na am nimacinao o kapeykakcin do dang. Am ori o nikatey rahet na abo so ipangakaday.

language1_text: And he went and joined himself to a citizen of that country; and he sent him into his fields to feed swine.
language2_text: Am ori o nyangay na macivahay do tao do dang. Meyratateng am tovoin na no pacivahain na mapakapakan so korang,

language1_text: And he would fain have filled his belly with the husks that the swine did eat: and no man gave unto him.
language2_text: kaji na rana nganan so yorahen da do kabo no tao a marilaw nya.

language1_text: And when he came to himself, he said, How many hired servants of my father's have bread enough and to spare, and I perish with hunger!
language2_text: Mownay am manakenakem. Am ori o nipancyan na no, 'Yajyavilangi o lamlamsoy ni ama. Yajyagiji o kanekanen da do vahay namen. Am ikongo yako ipacikekcin do jya.

language1_text: I will arise and go to my father, and will say unto him, Father, I have sinned against heaven, and before thee,
language2_text: Apyapya rana o kapeysinaoli ko ji ama kapanci ko nya jya so, Mo ama, ko nyalalasan si Ama ta do do a yako kalalas jimo an.

language1_text: and am no more worthy to be called thy son: make me as one of thy hired servants.
language2_text: Ji mo abneka yaken a anak mo. To mo na abneka yaken a lamlamsoy mo.'

language1_text: And he arose, and came to his father. But when he was yet a great way off, his father saw him, and had compassion, and ran, and fell on his neck, and kissed him.
language2_text: Meyratateng am meytatanek rana a meysinaoli do ama na. Marai pa do vahay da am to na cita no ama na karilaw na nya. So nipalalayo na amrapong sya kayapet na sya apwapwen.

language1_text: And the son said unto him, Father, I have sinned against heaven, and in thy sight, and am no more worthy to be called thy son.
language2_text: Maniring o anak na am, 'Mo ama, ko nyalalasan si Ama ta do to a yako kalalas do akman jimoo. So ji mo na abneki jyaken a anak mo an.'

language1_text: But the father said to his servants, Bring forth the best robe, and put it on him; and put a ring on his hand, and shoes on his feet:
language2_text: Maniring o ama na do lamlamsoy na am, 'Pangapey kamo so ney yapiya na ayob na, kapasaong nyo jya so tamtamek namen, kapantan nyo nya so tokap na,

language1_text: and bring hither the fatted calf, and kill it; and let us eat, and be merry:
language2_text: kangay nyo mangap so singasingeh no vinyay namen a pamaringan ta so kanen.

language1_text: for this my son was dead, and is alive again; he was lost, and is found. And they began to be merry.
language2_text: Ta o anak ko rana ya am yakmey nimawakwak a na kavyay rana. Ta yakmey nimabo a apzapzatan a na kapeytotwaw rana.' Am ori o nipakapya da nisomaray nya.

language1_text: Now his elder son was in the field: and as he came and drew nigh to the house, he heard musick and dancing.
language2_text: "Omoli rana o rakerakeh a anak na nimapo do hakawan da am mamizing na rana o somaray do vahay da.

language1_text: And he called one of the servants, and asked what these things meant.
language2_text: Am ori o nitawagan na do asa ka lamlamsoy da pacicin.

language1_text: And he said unto him, Thy brother is come; and thy father hath killed the fatted calf, because he hath received him safe and sound.
language2_text: Maniring o lamlamsoy na am, 'Na nimacita ni ama mo si wari mo a yapya so kataotao a yanimai rana. Am ori o na nipangapan nya so ney yapiya na do vinyay nyo.'

language1_text: And he was angry, and would not go in: therefore came his father out, and intreated him.
language2_text: Mamizing na no rakerakeh a anak na am to rana meyoyaoya. Am ori o ji na nisomdepi. Mamizing na ni ama na am ipanci na macilimot jira.

language1_text: And he answering said to his father, Lo, these many years do I serve thee, neither transgressed I at any time thy commandment: and yet thou never gavest me a kid, that I might make merry with my friends:
language2_text: Maniring do ama na am, 'To mo na naknakman, ta yako rana jyatenngi o zikzikna ko so vazay ta a yaji mapasobna do ciriciring mo. Am ikongo nakenakem mo jyaken. Yabwata pa o asa ka kagling a mo mina nakem jyaken a ipanaotao ko so kagagan ko.

language1_text: but as soon as this thy son was come, which hath devoured thy living with harlots, thou hast killed for him the fatted calf.
language2_text: Am si wari rana am yana nipeyvwak o kangangay mo do na peyvozawan. Yameysinaoli am yamo ipangap so ney yapiya na vinyay ta.'

language1_text: And he said unto him, Son, thou art ever with me, and all that I have is thine.
language2_text: Maniring o ama na am, 'Manganako, imo rana am ka macivahay jyaken an. O kangangay ko am miminen mo ori a amoonen an.

language1_text: It was meet that we should make merry, and be glad: for this thy brother was dead, and is alive again; and was lost, and is found.
language2_text: Am si wari mo rana am yakmey nimawakwak a na kavyay an. Yakmey yanimabo a apzapzatan a na kapeytotwaw rana an. Am ori o ji na alasi no kasaray ta nya an.'"

language1_text: And he said also unto his disciples, There was a certain rich man, which had a steward; and the same was accused unto him that he had wasted his goods.
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso do macinanao jya am, "Amyan so asa ka lamlamsoy no katenngan a tao. Amyan so tao a omraherahet sya. Maniring do katenngan a tao am, 'Na to peyvwaka o warawara mo no lamlamsoy mo.'

language1_text: And he called him, and said unto him, How is it that I hear this of thee? give an account of thy stewardship; for thou mayest be no longer steward.
language2_text: Mamizing no lawpan da am tawagan na a mai. Maniring jya am, 'Yamyan so ko nimamizing a vazay mo. Itoro mo na jyaken o vatvatek no peymasaodan ko, ta ji ko na pahanhana imo a tomalamozong nya.'

language1_text: Then the steward said within himself, What shall I do? for my lord taketh away from me the stewardship: I cannot dig; to beg I am ashamed.
language2_text: Mamizing no lamlamsoy na am manakenakem do onowned na. 'Si pagcinen na yaken no lawpan am ikongo pa vazay ko. Si amhakakaw ko am jyabo ko oyowyat a. Si macyakakan ko am ji ko asnek.

language1_text: I am resolved what to do, that, when I am put out of the stewardship, they may receive me into their houses.
language2_text: No si abo vazay ko am apyapya rana o kato ko na macivahayan do manci nyaken a kagagan ko.'

language1_text: So he called every one of his lord's debtors unto him, and said unto the first, How much owest thou unto my lord?
language2_text: Meyratateng am mangay na kakadain sira a ipanci o nimamood do lawpan na so nizpi. Maniring do asa am, 'Yapira o nivood mo do lawpan ko.'

language1_text: And he said, An hundred measures of oil. And he said unto him, Take thy bill, and sit down quickly, and write fifty.
language2_text: Maniring am, 'Yasa poo (100) ka vakvaklit no haneng.' Maniring o lamlamsoy na am, 'O nivood mo ori am pahephepan ta, kalima na rana ngarnan (50).'

language1_text: Then said he to another, And how much owest thou? And he said, An hundred measures of wheat. And he said unto him, Take thy bill, and write fourscore.
language2_text: Maniring do asa am, 'Yapira jimo.' Maniring am, 'Yasa poo (100) a kalavalavat no mogis.' Maniring o lamlamsoy na am, 'O nivood mo ori am pahephepan ta, kawao na rana ngarnan (80).'

language1_text: And the lord commended the unjust steward, because he had done wisely: for the children of this world are in their generation wiser than the children of light.
language2_text: Mamizing na no lawpan na am isaray na o lamlamsoy ori, do katey mapatak na a mangamaog so vazay a ipeypapyan na so kataotao na." Maniring pa si Yeso am, "Ko pa ciring jinyo am o ji manaralay a tao sicyakwaya am akman sang o ahahapan da so vazay da. So ikateneteneng da kano manaralay a tao.

language1_text: And I say unto you, Make to yourselves friends of the mammon of unrighteousness; that, when ye fail, they may receive you into everlasting habitations.
language2_text: Ko pa ciring jinyo am apyapya o kapanidong nyo do karawan so ipangoyongoyod da tao, ta no marateng o araraw nyo am pasdepen na inyo ni Ama ta do to do vahay na do teyngato.

language1_text: He that is faithful in that which is least is faithful also in much: and he that is unjust in the least is unjust also in much.
language2_text: "O ji liklik so alikey a vazay a tao am ipeyhanhan o akman sang a mapeyvazay so rako a vazay. O ji ngezkezsang no alikey a vazay a kapangalalas na am ji meyhanhanan o akman sang a mapakavos so rako a vazay.

language1_text: If therefore ye have not been faithful in the unrighteous mammon, who will commit to your trust the true riches?
language2_text: No marahet o ahahapan nyo so peymasaodan nyo do karawan am jyabo kapahanhan na jinyo ni Ama ta do to a tomalamozong no peymeymasaodan na do teyngato a.

language1_text: And if ye have not been faithful in that which is another man's, who shall give you that which is your own?
language2_text: No si ji nyo a patakan o apzapzatan da no karwan no tao am jyabo katoro da nya jinyo so meyngongyod a peymeymasaodan nyo a.

language1_text: No servant can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to the one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.
language2_text: "Abo o lamlamsoy a meyvazay do rarwa ka lawpan. No ikanig na o asa am ikaoya na o asa. No ikaoya na o asa am ikaglaw na o asa. Marahet o kapasaklang nyo ji Ama ta do to an, a tongdeng do peynizpi nyo an."

language1_text: And the Pharisees also, who were covetous, heard all these things: and they derided him.
language2_text: Mamizing da no tao a macyagom do Vadisay o ciring na ni Yeso am ipeykeykaming da, ta ikakza da o nizpi.

language1_text: And he said unto them, Ye are they which justify yourselves before men; but God knoweth your hearts: for that which is highly esteemed among men is abomination in the sight of God.
language2_text: Maniring jira si Yeso am, "Kanyo mapakapyapya so nakem do tangain no tao. Am si Ama ta do to rana am yamanita so onowned no tao an. Ta o ipanci no tao a ney makdeng na vazay am ipanci na ni Ama ta do to a jyakdeng.

language1_text: The law and the prophets were until John: since that time the kingdom of God is preached, and every man presseth into it.
language2_text: "Oyowyat no nitaid ni Moyse a kano panoyonoywan na so ciring ni Ama ta do to am o nimanaktak a si Yowani o pamindan na a kapeylimwang rana no Mapasaray a Ciriciring, do na katalamozong ninyo ni Ama ta do to. Ta abo tao a jyakza no katalamozong na nira.

language1_text: And it is easier for heaven and earth to pass, than one tittle of the law to fail.
language2_text: Am makeykeykai pa o hanit a kano karawan a mabo a kano asa ka ciring na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: Whosoever putteth away his wife, and marrieth another, committeth adultery: and whosoever marrieth her that is put away from her husband committeth adultery.
language2_text: "O mapakaro so kahanghangan na mavakes a kapapapen na pa so karwan no tao am raraten na ori. O mapapapen so nipakaro da mavakes am raraten na ori."

language1_text: There was a certain rich man, which was clothed in purple and fine linen, and fared sumptuously every day:
language2_text: Maniring pa si Yeso am, "No kakwa pa am amyan so asa ka katenngan a tao. Mangday do araraw kapeyyayob na so pipiya ayob a kakan na so ney yapipiya a kanekanen.

language1_text: and there was a certain beggar named Lazarus, which was laid at his gate, full of sores,
language2_text: Am amyan so asa ka ipangoyongoyod da tao a meyngaran so Lasalo a meykanokanoka so kataotao a miray do pangengneban na no mabsoy a tao,

language1_text: and desiring to be fed with the crumbs which fell from the rich man's table: moreover the dogs came and licked his sores.
language2_text: a komakzeb so meycyakakas do kanen na. O nokanoka na am mangay da laposan no inoino.

language1_text: And it came to pass, that the beggar died, and was carried by the angels into Abraham's bosom: the rich man also died, and was buried;
language2_text: Mawakwak o ipangoyongoyod da tao ori am yangay da no tinsi do tangain ni Apolahan. Mawakwak o katenngan a tao ori am ibobo no tao.

language1_text: and in hell he lift up his eyes, being in torments, and seeth Abraham afar off, and Lazarus in his bosom.
language2_text: Amyan do kararatan a makaliliw so kataotao na am to na cita do teyngato si Apolahan a kani Lasalo.

language1_text: And he cried and said, Father Abraham, have mercy on me, and send Lazarus, that he may dip the tip of his finger in water, and cool my tongue; for I am tormented in this flame.
language2_text: Meyratateng am tawagan na. Maniring am, 'Mo Apolahan, kasyasi mo pa yaken an. Tovoin mo pa si Lasalo a mapaiteng so likta ranom a itneb ko so tetehnan ko, ta ko tey rahet so kataotao do apoy eya.'

language1_text: But Abraham said, Son, remember that thou in thy lifetime receivedst thy good things, and likewise Lazarus evil things: but now he is comforted, and thou art tormented.
language2_text: Am maniring si Apolahan am, 'Manganako, mo pa manakem no kapeyigegen mo do karawan asyo an, a to meypanpan do kanekanen mo an. Am si Lasalo am abo ipangakaday na do araraw. Am sicyaikwaya am yamyan rana do jya yamacikasaray jyamen, a imo am ka amlavi so onowned.

language1_text: And beside all this, between us and you there is a great gulf fixed: so that they which would pass from hence to you cannot; neither can they pass to us, that would come from thence.
language2_text: Jingwan so sang am mey ta kongwen o yamapeytawa jyaten a rako a alalasyas. Tana ikasi namen rana imo am jyabo kapakagcin namen so yamapeytawa jyaten eyto.'

language1_text: Then he said, I pray thee therefore, father, that thou wouldest send him to my father's house:
language2_text: Maniring o katenngan a tao am, 'No komwan mo akay am tovoin mo pa si Lasalo. Ta mangay do vahay da ama,

language1_text: for I have five brethren; that he may testify unto them, lest they also come into this place of torment.
language2_text: a kapamizing na pa so yalalima a kakteh ko, ta maraherahet o kai da pa macitovong jyaken a makaliliw so kataotao da.'

language1_text: Abraham saith unto him, They have Moses and the prophets; let them hear them.
language2_text: Maniring si Apolahan am, 'Cyaha, ta yamyan so da pangozayan a ciriciring na ni Moyse a kano panoyonoywan na so ciring ni Ama ta do to.'

language1_text: And he said, Nay, father Abraham: but if one went unto them from the dead, they will repent.
language2_text: Maniring o nikatenngan a tao am, 'Ji kakman sang mo akay, ta jyabo kaji da panoyngan so nimeyvangon a tao a mangay jira. Am ori o ipamlis da rana.'

language1_text: And he said unto him, If they hear not Moses and the prophets, neither will they be persuaded, though one rose from the dead.
language2_text: Maniring pa jya si Apolahan am, 'Tana myan so meyvangon a tao a mangay jira a kaji da nganoyngan do ciring na ni Moyse a kano panoyonoywan na so ciring ni Ama ta do to am jyabo kapanganoyong da.'"

language1_text: Then said he unto the disciples, It is impossible but that offences will come: but woe unto him, through whom they come!
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso do macinanao jya am, "O raraten no tao am kangay na ori. Am o tao a yapwan na am ney rako na o oyaoya na no akman sang a tao ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: It were better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck, and he cast into the sea, than that he should offend one of these little ones.
language2_text: Ta o akman rana sang a tao am apyapya rana o kapila jya mangay itbong do awa. Ta maraherahet o kapeypalanginan na no ji makapatak nya a tao do peyraratenan da.

language1_text: Take heed to yourselves: If thy brother trespass against thee, rebuke him; and if he repent, forgive him.
language2_text: Azimanen nyo an. No meyraraten o kakteh nyo am vavagan nyo an. No si mamlis am to nyo peykabobwa o raraten na.

language1_text: And if he trespass against thee seven times in a day, and seven times in a day turn again to thee, saying, I repent; thou shalt forgive him.
language2_text: No ipipito a meyraraten jinyo do kasaraw a kapangday na manci nya jinyo so, 'Cyaha, ta mamlis ko na,' am to nyo peykabobwa o raraten na jinyo an."

language1_text: And the apostles said unto the Lord, Increase our faith.
language2_text: Maniring sira o nipamnekan na ni Yeso a omlivolivon no ciriciring na am, "Ipanta mo yamen so rako a onowned namen ji Ama ta do to an."

language1_text: And the Lord said, If ye had faith as a grain of mustard seed, ye might say unto this sycamine tree, Be thou plucked up by the root, and be thou planted in the sea; and it should obey you.
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso am, "Tana akman kamo so alikey a vettow no nappa so kakdekdeng no nakem am tana to mo nirsirnga o kayo a manci no, 'To ka botbot a kangay mo amlida do awa,' am jyabo kaji na ngonotan jinyo a.

language1_text: But which of you, having a servant plowing or feeding cattle, will say unto him by and by, when he is come from the field, Go and sit down to meat?
language2_text: "No si myan jinyo so tao a mapeylamlamsoy so meymowamowa kano mapamangamangan so kagling am no nimapo rana do vazay na am manngwa, ipanci nyo jya o, 'Lisna jito a kakan mo.'

language1_text: And will not rather say unto him, Make ready wherewith I may sup, and gird thyself, and serve me, till I have eaten and drunken; and afterward thou shalt eat and drink?
language2_text: Jyabo kakman nyo sang a. Ji nyo mancyan jya o, 'Alici rana o ayob mo a kapanotong mo pa nyaken so yaven ko. Si mabsoy ko rana am ori o yakan mo.'

language1_text: Doth he thank that servant because he did the things that were commanded him? I trow not.
language2_text: No teyka na rana o vazay na no lamlamsoy am manngwa, isaray na no lawpan na jya? Jyabo a.

language1_text: So likewise ye, when ye shall have done all those things which are commanded you, say, We are unprofitable servants: we have done that which was our duty to do.
language2_text: Akman kamo so sang an. No teyka nyo a peyvazain o vazay na jinyo ni Ama ta do to am ji kanyo mapakazwazway an. Ta adan ori a vazay no omraralay ni Ama ta do to a tao."

language1_text: And it came to pass, as he went to Jerusalem, that he passed through the midst of Samaria and Galilee.
language2_text: Meypangay si Yeso do Yelosaleng am meyhatay do peyyawwan no Samadiya kano Cyadidi.

language1_text: And as he entered into a certain village, there met him ten men that were lepers, which stood afar off:
language2_text: So nyangay na do asa ka ili do dang. Amyan so asa ngarnan (10) a omlabyab so kolit a tao a mangay sominmo sya. Am ori o nipeytatanek da do marai pa,

language1_text: and they lifted up their voices, and said, Jesus, Master, have mercy on us.
language2_text: amlololos a manci no, "Mo Yeso, Panirsirngen namen, ikasyasi mo pa yamen eya an."

language1_text: And when he saw them, he said unto them, Go shew yourselves unto the priests. And it came to pass, that, as they went, they were cleansed.
language2_text: Macita na sira ni Yeso am ipanci na jira o, "Angay kamo ipacita o kataotao nyo do mapatanatanang so nakem ji Ama ta do to." Mangay sira am todapya rana sira.

language1_text: And one of them, when he saw that he was healed, turned back, and with a loud voice glorified God,
language2_text: Maliliw na no asa ka tao jira o kanimapya na rana no kataotao na am meysinaoli pa a somaray nya ji Ama ta do to,

language1_text: and fell down on his face at his feet, giving him thanks: and he was a Samaritan.
language2_text: a kapeylilitod na do tangain na ni Yeso a somaray nya jya. O tao rana ori am tao do Samadiya.

language1_text: And Jesus answering said, Were there not ten cleansed? but where are the nine?
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso do aro a tao am, "Da kasa ngarnan no yanimapya so kataotao ori am wanjin jya sira o yasasyam.

language1_text: There are not found that returned to give glory to God, save this stranger.
language2_text: Ikongo na ikaveyvow a yasomaray nya ji Ama ta do to a beken a Isedi a tao."

language1_text: And he said unto him, Arise, go thy way: thy faith hath made thee whole.
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso jya am, "Tanek rana kangay mo na. Ta yaka manoyong a meyhanhan ni Ama ta do to. So mo ikapya rana no kataotao."

language1_text: And when he was demanded of the Pharisees, when the kingdom of God should come, he answered them and said, The kingdom of God cometh not with observation:
language2_text: Amyan so tao a macyagom do Vadisay a mapacici si Yeso. Naknakmen da o ipakateneng da do ipakasasnad na no talamozongan na no tao ni Ama ta do to. Maniring si Yeso am, "O talamozongan na ninyo ni Ama ta do to am beken a todacita no mata ori an.

language1_text: neither shall they say, Lo here! or, lo there! for, behold, the kingdom of God is within you.
language2_text: Abwata o tao a manci no, 'Cita pala, ta yamyan do jya.' Ta o italamozong na ni Ama ta do to am yamyan do onowned no tao."

language1_text: And he said unto the disciples, The days will come, when ye shall desire to see one of the days of the Son of man, and ye shall not see it.
language2_text: Maniring pa do macinanao jya am, "No marateng o araraw na am tana ikeykakza nyo o kapakacita nyo jyaken a mai a omahap jinyo am jyabo kapakacita nyo jyaken a.

language1_text: And they shall say to you, See here; or, see there: go not after them, nor follow them.
language2_text: Amyan so tao a manci nya jinyo so, 'Cita pala, ta yamyan do kwang si Yeso.' 'Cita pala, ta yamyan do jya.' Am ji nyo ngonoci sira an.

language1_text: For as the lightning, that lighteneth out of the one part under heaven, shineth unto the other part under heaven; so shall also the Son of man be in his day.
language2_text: Ta o araraw na no yai ko a Nipamnekan na ni Ama ta do to am abo ji makacita sya tao, akmey meycicilat a maniray.

language1_text: But first must he suffer many things, and be rejected of this generation.
language2_text: Am manmanma o keyyan no aro a alalaw ko do peymakarwan da jyaken no tao sicyakwaya.

language1_text: And as it was in the days of Noe, so shall it be also in the days of the Son of man.
language2_text: No meygegcin o Nipamnekan na ni Ama ta do to a tao am akman so cinasasaodan da da Noya no kakwa.

language1_text: They did eat, they drank, they married wives, they were given in marriage, until the day that Noe entered into the ark, and the flood came, and destroyed them all.
language2_text: No kaji na pa meykehnepan am to sirangned so ninyakan a kapazagzagpit da mangay do araraw no isdep da rana da Noya do avang da. Am meykehnep rana am nimamimin sira nimabalinas.

language1_text: Likewise also as it was in the days of Lot; they did eat, they drank, they bought, they sold, they planted, they builded;
language2_text: O araraw na no ipeysinaoli ko am akman no kapeyigegen na pa ni Lote. O tao no kano nang am nikoman sira. Nimanazang sira. Nimhakakaw sira. Nimeypinapinan sira.

language1_text: but the same day that Lot went out of Sodom it rained fire and brimstone from heaven, and destroyed them all.
language2_text: Marateng o araw no ikaro na ni Lote do Sotoma am pakasen na rana ni Ama ta do to o apoy a kano makwat a vato a kamimin da nimaliman.

language1_text: Even thus shall it be in the day when the Son of man is revealed.
language2_text: O araraw no yai ko a Nipamnekan na ni Ama ta do to a tao am akman so sang.

language1_text: In that day, he which shall be upon the housetop, and his stuff in the house, let him not come down to take it away: and he that is in the field, let him likewise not return back.
language2_text: "O araraw na no nang am jindep do vahay da o myan do atep no vahay a mangap so apzapzatan. Akman sang o myan do nihakawan da, ta ji sira to ngoli.

language1_text: Remember Lot's wife.
language2_text: Naknakmen nyo o mavakes na ni Lote a nimapaoli so mata na a kapeyvaliw na a tomigzang a asin.

language1_text: Whosoever shall seek to save his life shall lose it; and whosoever shall lose his life shall preserve it.
language2_text: Omnakenakem so ipeypapya na tao am ji na meypapyan ori. O mawakwak no vazay ko am dompeh jira o ikavyay no pahad da.

language1_text: I tell you, in that night there shall be two men in one bed; the one shall be taken, and the other shall be left.
language2_text: Ko pa ciring jinyo am do ahep no nang do ipeysinaoli ko am o rarwa ka tao a mitkeh do asa ka ititkehan am o asa jira o ahapen ko. O asa am vezeden ko.

language1_text: Two women shall be grinding together; the one shall be taken, and the other left.
language2_text: O rarwa ka mavakes a manworod so kanen da am asa ahapen ko. O asa am vezeden ko.

language1_text: Two men shall be in the field; the one shall be taken, and the other left.
language2_text: [O rarwa ka mahakay do nihakawan da am asa o ahapen ko. O asa am vezeden ko.]"

language1_text: And they answered and said unto him, Where, Lord? And he said unto them, Wheresoever the body is, thither will the eagles be gathered together.
language2_text: Pacicin da no macinanao jya. Maniring sira am, "Mo Panirsirngen, do wanjin mangay na kasasnadan no akman sang a vazay ang." Maniring si Yeso jira am, "O yanan no nimawakwak a omalalam am ori o pacilolwan da no meyyasasalap."

language1_text: And he spake a parable unto them to this end, that men ought always to pray, and not to faint;
language2_text: Ipanci na jira ni Yeso o payyaingen na sya ipait na sira a meynozi.

language1_text: saying, There was in a city a judge, which feared not God, neither regarded man:
language2_text: Maniring jira am, "Amyan do asa ka ili so mapacicici a tao. Ji na raralayan si Ama ta do to a ji mapanadnad so icyatatao na.

language1_text: and there was a widow in that city; and she came unto him, saying, Avenge me of mine adversary.
language2_text: Amyan do ili ang so asa ka vao a mavakes a masangib a mapasyasi jya a manci no alalaw na.

language1_text: And he would not for a while: but afterward he said within himself, Though I fear not God, nor regard man;
language2_text: Am to na nazibwan no mapacicici a tao. Meyratateng am manakenakem do onowned na am, 'Tana ji ko manaralay a ji mapanadnad so icyatatao ko am,

language1_text: yet because this widow troubleth me, I will avenge her, lest by her continual coming she weary me.
language2_text: yako na ikacilo o vao eya. So ikapyapya rana no kato ko na nidongan sya. Ta maraherahet o kagolo na so cicilwan ko.'"

language1_text: And the Lord said, Hear what the unjust judge saith.
language2_text: Maniring pa jira si Yeso am, "Amizngen nyo pala o ciriciring na no mapacici a ji manaralay a tao an.

language1_text: And shall not God avenge his own elect, which cry day and night unto him, though he bear long with them?
language2_text: Manngwa, ji na amiznga ni Ama ta do to o meyhanhan nya mapasyasi jya do araraw a kado ahehep? Manngwa, peypananayan na sira sidongen?

language1_text: I tell you that he will avenge them speedily. Nevertheless when the Son of man cometh, shall he find faith on the earth?
language2_text: Ko pa ciring jinyo am makeykai na inyo a sidongen. Am no meysinaoli ko am manngwa, makakala ko so manoyong a meyhanhan nyaken do karawan eya?"

language1_text: And he spake this parable unto certain which trusted in themselves that they were righteous, and despised others:
language2_text: Ipangamaog na sira o mapakazwazway a ji mapanadnad a tao so payyaingen na sya ni Yeso.

language1_text: Two men went up into the temple to pray; the one a Pharisee, and the other a publican.
language2_text: Maniring am, "Amyan so rarwa ka tao a mangay meynozi do rako a panaralayan. O asa ka tao am macyagom do Vadisay. O asa am mapeyvazay so deyking a tao.

language1_text: The Pharisee stood and prayed thus with himself, God, I thank thee, that I am not as other men are, extortioners, unjust, adulterers, or even as this publican.
language2_text: Meytatanek a meynozi o tao a macyagom do Vadisay am ipanci na o, 'Mo Ama do to, ko isaray imo, ta ko jyakman so karwan no tao a yamangagom, mangzakza so icyatatao na, manlita. Ko jyakman so mapeyvazay so deyking a tao a yameyraraten.

language1_text: I fast twice in the week, I give tithes of all that I possess.
language2_text: Ko mangday do ikapito no araw a ipidwa jyangan. Yako kapasina so asa ka vovonongan a yako ipeykingking jimo.'

language1_text: And the publican, standing afar off, would not lift up so much as his eyes unto heaven, but smote upon his breast, saying, God be merciful to me a sinner.
language2_text: Am o mapeyvazay so deyking a tao ori am meytatanek do ngoso no rako a panaralayan. Ji nadkeci o katangara na so hanit a mapalogod so moing na a manci no, 'Mo Ama do to, ikasyasi mo pa yaken a yameyraraten a tao an.'"

language1_text: I tell you, this man went down to his house justified rather than the other: for every one that exalteth himself shall be abased; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted.
language2_text: Maniring pa si Yeso am, "Ko pa ciring jinyo am no si mangay sira o yararwa ka tao ori am o abneken a apya so iyangay a tao do tangain na ni Ama ta do to am o yamapeyvazay so deyking a tao ori an. So ikabeken a tao a macyagom do Vadisay ori. Ta si Ama ta do to am peypavevehen na sira o mapakarakarang so nakem a tao a kapeypakatkat na sira so ji makazyazyak a tao an."

language1_text: And they brought unto him also infants, that he would touch them: but when his disciples saw it, they rebuked them.
language2_text: Amyan so tao a mangay no ananak da ji Yeso a kapanci da ni Yeso a amapwapo sira no lima na. Macita da no macinanao jya am ioya da sira.

language1_text: But Jesus called them unto him, and said, Suffer little children to come unto me, and forbid them not: for of such is the kingdom of God.
language2_text: Am si Yeso am rarahen na o kanakan a mai do tangain na. Maniring am, "Mai sira o kanakan jyaken do jya an. Ji nyo zazaci sira an. Ta o italamozong na rana ni Ama ta do to a tao am akman sira so kanakan eya.

language1_text: Verily I say unto you, Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child shall in no wise enter therein.
language2_text: Pakanakmen nyo an. No ji kamo akman so kanakan so onowned a meyhanhan ni Ama ta do to am ji na inyo nalamozongan ni Ama ta do to an."

language1_text: And a certain ruler asked him, saying, Good Master, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?
language2_text: Amyan so asa ka panirsirngen no tao do Yotay a mangay a mapacici si Yeso. Maniring am, "Ko imo katenngan a tey yapya a mangnanao a tao. Manngwa, makongo ko so wanjin a kapakahap ko so to meyyonong a ikavyay no pahad ko."

language1_text: And Jesus said unto him, Why callest thou me good? none is good, save one, that is, God.
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso jya am, "Ikongo mo pancyan nyaken a tey yapya. Abo ikararwa na ni Ama ta do to a tey yapya an.

language1_text: Thou knowest the commandments, Do not commit adultery, Do not kill, Do not steal, Do not bear false witness, Honour thy father and thy mother.
language2_text: Mo jyatenngi o iwawalam ni Ama ta do to? 'Ji ka to mangzakza so tao. Ji ka manwakwak. Ji ka manakaw. Ji ka mangamaog so malas a ciring. Ikaglaw mo a ikanig o inyapwan mo.'"

language1_text: And he said, All these have I kept from my youth up.
language2_text: Maniring o tao ori am, "Nimapo no kalyalikey ko a kangay na sicyaikwaya o ko nipeyvazay so akman sang."

language1_text: Now when Jesus heard these things, he said unto him, Yet lackest thou one thing: sell all that thou hast, and distribute unto the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven: and come, follow me.
language2_text: Mamizing na ni Yeso o ciring na am patonggalan na. Maniring am, "Am yasa ka vazay pa o mo jya nimahap. Miminen mo a ipanazang o kangangay mo a itoro do ipangoyongoyod da tao. Ta ori o iyan na no keynakman mo do teyngato, a kapacilolo mo rana jyaken."

language1_text: And when he heard this, he was very sorrowful: for he was very rich.
language2_text: Mamizing na o ciring ni Yeso am marahet o aktokto na, ta tey yaro o kangangay na.

language1_text: And when Jesus saw that he was very sorrowful, he said, How hardly shall they that have riches enter into the kingdom of God!
language2_text: Macita na ni Yeso o kamoymoyngan na am ipanci na o, "Tey masalit o meynakem a tao a italamozong na ni Ama ta do to an.

language1_text: For it is easier for a camel to go through a needle's eye, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.
language2_text: Mowwamek pa o meykavokovokoz so likod a baka a lomyos do lala no rayom a kano aro so peymeymasaodan a tao a macikaop do italamozong na ni Ama ta do to."

language1_text: And they that heard it said, Who then can be saved?
language2_text: Mamizing da no tao o ciring na ni Yeso am tonggalan da. Maniring sira am, "No akman so sang am sino o patazadangen na ni Ama ta do to do teyngato."

language1_text: And he said, The things which are impossible with men are possible with God.
language2_text: Maniring jira si Yeso am, "O ji da amaog no tao am mamaog na ni Ama ta do to an."

language1_text: Then Peter said, Lo, we have left all, and followed thee.
language2_text: Maniring si Pite am, "Namen to ngaroi o kavavahay namen a namen kapacilolo jimo."

language1_text: And he said unto them, Verily I say unto you, There is no man that hath left house, or parents, or brethren, or wife, or children, for the kingdom of God's sake,
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso am, "Ka jyalas. Am ko pa ciring jinyo am o to ngaro do kavavahay da kano kahanghangan na kano kakakteh na kano inyapwan na kano ananak na mahap so vazay ni Ama ta do to am,

language1_text: who shall not receive manifold more in this present time, and in the world to come life everlasting.
language2_text: arwaro pa o padpehen na jya sicyakwaya. No makwa kapeyvangon no tao am mahap na rana o to meyyonong a ikavyay no pahad na an."

language1_text: Then he took unto him the twelve, and said unto them, Behold, we go up to Jerusalem, and all things that are written by the prophets concerning the Son of man shall be accomplished.
language2_text: Lovoten na ni Yeso o macinanao jya a kapanci na nya jira so, "Tanyo meypangay do Yelosaleng. O mina ciring da no panoyonoywan na so ciring ni Ama ta do to a omagaz jyaken a Nipamnekan na ni Ama ta do to a tao am mamimin rana a mangononong an.

language1_text: For he shall be delivered unto the Gentiles, and shall be mocked, and spitefully entreated, and spitted on:
language2_text: Ta itoro da yaken do beken a tao do Yotay. So peyyaliliman da jyaken, peymetdehan da jyaken, kacicipa da jyaken,

language1_text: and they shall scourge him, and put him to death: and the third day he shall rise again.
language2_text: kasipsipzot da pa jyaken a wakwaken. Am no si ikatlo na araw am mirwa ko pa a mavyay."

language1_text: And they understood none of these things: and this saying was hid from them, neither knew they the things which were spoken.
language2_text: Am ji da azab o ciring na ni Yeso no macinanao jya.

language1_text: And it came to pass, that as he was come nigh unto Jericho, a certain blind man sat by the way side begging:
language2_text: Meypasngen rana si Yeso do Yedike a ili am amyan so asa ka mavota tao amhezsad do siri no rarahan a macikakanen.

language1_text: and hearing the multitude pass by, he asked what it meant.
language2_text: Mamizing na o aro a meyhatay a tao am pacicin na sira.

language1_text: And they told him, that Jesus of Nazareth passeth by.
language2_text: Maniring sira o tao jya am, "Yameyhatay do jya o tao do Nasale a meyngaran si Yeso."

language1_text: And he cried, saying, Jesus, thou Son of David, have mercy on me.
language2_text: Am ori o nilololos na a manci no, "Imo rana mo Yeso a sivovoong ni Tawey am kasyasi mo pa yaken an."

language1_text: And they which went before rebuked him, that he should hold his peace: but he cried so much the more, Thou Son of David, have mercy on me.
language2_text: Ori o nioyyan da nya no manma mangonong a tao do kalololos na. Am ikavevevek na amlololos a manci no, "Imo rana sivovoong ni Tawey am kasyasi mo pa yaken an."

language1_text: And Jesus stood, and commanded him to be brought unto him: and when he was come near, he asked him,
language2_text: Am ori o niseyked na ni Yeso a manci no tao a mai no mavota tao do tangain na. Macisngen o tao ori am pacicin na ni Yeso. Maniring am,

language1_text: saying, What wilt thou that I shall do unto thee? And he said, Lord, that I may receive my sight.
language2_text: "Ikongo mo kakzeben jyaken." Maniring o tao ori am, "Mo Panirsirngen, ko ikakza o ko kapakacita."

language1_text: And Jesus said unto him, Receive thy sight: thy faith hath saved thee.
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso jya am, "To ka na makacita an. Ta yaka manoyong a meyhanhan ni Ama ta do to. Ori o mo ikapya rana."

language1_text: And immediately he received his sight, and followed him, glorifying God: and all the people, when they saw it, gave praise unto God.
language2_text: So to na rana makacitai no tao. Meyratateng am macilolo rana ji Yeso, kasaray na nya ji Ama ta do to do pangonongan na. Macita da no aro a tao o vazay ori am abo ji naray nya ji Ama ta do to.

language1_text: And Jesus entered and passed through Jericho.
language2_text: Makaranes si Yeso do Yedike am,

language1_text: And, behold, there was a man named Zacchæ us, which was the chief among the publicans, and he was rich.
language2_text: amyan dang so asa ka panirsirngen no mapeyvazay so deyking a meyngaran so Sakay a tey yaro so nizpi a tao.

language1_text: And he sought to see Jesus who he was; and could not for the press, because he was little of stature.
language2_text: To na ji ngamoga ni Sakay o kapakacita na si Yeso, ta akman so wanjin o tao ori, kwan na. Am ikongo do tey maveveh, am ori o ji na makaslislini do aro a tao a tomita si Yeso.

language1_text: And he ran before, and climbed up into a sycomore tree to see him: for he was to pass that way.
language2_text: Ori o nipalalayo na mangay do pamanongan na kangay na komalat do asa ka kayo a tomita si Yeso. Ta makeykai si Yeso rana a mangonong dang.

language1_text: And when Jesus came to the place, he looked up, and saw him, and said unto him, Zacchæ us, make haste, and come down; for to day I must abide at thy house.
language2_text: Makaranes si Yeso do yanan na ori am to na nangara si Sakay. Maniring jya am, "Mo Sakay, agcin rana, ta mangay ko do vahay nyo sicyaraw eya."

language1_text: And he made haste, and came down, and received him joyfully.
language2_text: Ori o nipeygegcin na rana ni Sakay a masaray a tomaotao si Yeso.

language1_text: And when they saw it, they all murmured, saying, That he was gone to be guest with a man that is a sinner.
language2_text: Macita da no aro a tao am marahet sira so aktokto a manci no, "Na todangai no nya do vahay no meyraraten a tao."

language1_text: And Zacchæ us stood, and said unto the Lord; Behold, Lord, the half of my goods I give to the poor; and if I have taken any thing from any man by false accusation, I restore him fourfold.
language2_text: Am makaranes sira do vahay ni Sakay am taotawwen na si Yeso a kapacisirsiring na rana jya. Maniring am, "Mo Panirsirngen, to ko peyhataya o kangangay ko a itoro do ipangoyongoyod da tao. No si myan so tao a nipangamkaman ko so asa ranaw (100) am paolyan ko so apat a ranaw (400)."

language1_text: And Jesus said unto him, This day is salvation come to this house, forsomuch as he also is a son of Abraham.
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso jya am, "Yana nipanta inyo ni Ama ta do to so vayo a onowned nyo a asa ka vahay. Ta meyyangay kanyo a kano ineynapo nyo a si Apolahan a meyhanhan ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: For the Son of man is come to seek and to save that which was lost.
language2_text: O ko nyai rana ya am yako meykala so meyraraten a tao a kapatastas ko sira do teyngato."

language1_text: And as they heard these things, he added and spake a parable, because he was nigh to Jerusalem, and because they thought that the kingdom of God should immediately appear.
language2_text: Makapya sira omamizing so ciring na ni Yeso am mangamaog so payyaingen na ciring na. Am no kanang am makeykai rana si Yeso a makaranes do Yelosaleng. Naknakmen da am, "Ala oya rana o papwen na so katalamozong na nyaten ni Ama ta do to."

language1_text: He said therefore, A certain nobleman went into a far country to receive for himself a kingdom, and to return.
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso am, "Amyan so asa ka meynakem a tao mangay do marai a ili, ta omanam o kapanlanlag da nya a panirsirngen da.

language1_text: And he called his ten servants, and delivered them ten pounds, and said unto them, Occupy till I come.
language2_text: Meyratateng am lovoten na sira o asa ngarnan a lamlamsoy na a kaponged na sira so teyhesa ka nizpi a vowawan a kapanci na nya jira so, 'Inyo rana manga keypong do ikabo ko am ahapen nyo o nizpi a kapeyparo nyo sya an.'

language1_text: But his citizens hated him, and sent a message after him, saying, We will not have this man to reign over us.
language2_text: Ikongo do pacioyyan da ori no keylyan da, am ori o nipanovoy da so tao a mangay manci nya do rako a panirsirngen da so kaji dakzan nya a panirsirngen da.

language1_text: And it came to pass, that when he was returned, having received the kingdom, then he commanded these servants to be called unto him, to whom he had given the money, that he might know how much every man had gained by trading.
language2_text: Mahap na o panirsirngen no meynakem a tao am meysinaoli rana do vahay da. Meyratateng am lovoten na sira o nipanta na so nizpi a vowawan a lamlamsoy na a kapacici na sira so nipeyparo da nizpi.

language1_text: Then came the first, saying, Lord, thy pound hath gained ten pounds.
language2_text: Maniring o asa am, 'Lawpan, ko ipacininizpi o mo nitoro jyaken a nizpi am nimeyparo so asa poo a nizpi.'

language1_text: And he said unto him, Well, thou good servant: because thou hast been faithful in a very little, have thou authority over ten cities.
language2_text: Maniring o lawpan am, 'Ka tey mapatak. Ta yamo jya to nazibwan o likta vazay mo jyaken. Am ori o pamnekan ko nimo so asa ngarnan a ili a yaponged mo.'

language1_text: And the second came, saying, Lord, thy pound hath gained five pounds.
language2_text: "Mai o ikararwa no lamlamsoy na am ipanci na, 'Lawpan, o mo nitoro jyaken a nizpi am alima ka nizpi o na nipeyparwan.'

language1_text: And he said likewise to him, Be thou also over five cities.
language2_text: Maniring o lawpan jya am, 'Yaponged mo o alima ka ili an.'

language1_text: And another came, saying, Lord, behold, here is thy pound, which I have kept laid up in a napkin:
language2_text: Mai o ikatlo no lamlamsoy na am ipanci na, 'Lawpan, o mo nitoro jyaken a nizpi am yapa myan do jya. Ko nipakapya ya nikekeh no milakayob.

language1_text: for I feared thee, because thou art an austere man: thou takest up that thou layedst not down, and reapest that thou didst not sow.
language2_text: Ta ko imo ikanyahey a tey malalansoken a tao a yamapamoon so beken a monganay jimo a yakomali so beken a mo nipamowa.'

language1_text: And he saith unto him, Out of thine own mouth will I judge thee, thou wicked servant. Thou knewest that I was an austere man, taking up that I laid not down, and reaping that I did not sow:
language2_text: Maniring o lawpan jya am, 'Imo rana ya am yaka tey rahet a lamlamsoy ko an. Meysinaoli o ciriciring mo a iraherahet ko jimo an. Ta mo katenngan yaken a malalansoken a tao a mapamoon so beken a monganay jyaken a komali so beken a nipamowa ko am,

language1_text: wherefore then gavest not thou my money into the bank, that at my coming I might have required mine own with usury?
language2_text: ikongo ji mo na todangai nya peyyananaken a kapalovot mo so ananak na itoro jyaken do nyai ko na.'

language1_text: And he said unto them that stood by, Take from him the pound, and give it to him that hath ten pounds.
language2_text: Maniring rana do meytatanek do sirisiri a lamlamsoy na am, 'Pehsey kamo o nizpi na a katoro nyo nya do yanimakanizpi so yasa poo a lamlamsoy ko ang.'

language1_text: (And they said unto him, Lord, he hath ten pounds.)
language2_text: Maniring o aro a lamlamsoy na jya am, 'Lawpan, yana myan so yasa poo a nizpi na ang.'

language1_text: For I say unto you, That unto every one which hath shall be given; and from him that hath not, even that he hath shall be taken away from him.
language2_text: Maniring o lawpan am, 'Ko pa ciring jinyo am o yanan na am rapan ko pa an. O kabwan na am miminen ko a ahapen o apeleh a amyan jya an.

language1_text: But those mine enemies, which would not that I should reign over them, bring hither, and slay them before me.
language2_text: Omrahet jyaken a panirsirngen da am yai nyo sira kawakwak nyo sira do tangain ko.'"

language1_text: And when he had thus spoken, he went before, ascending up to Jerusalem.
language2_text: Mateyka na o aro a ciring na ni Yeso am meypangay rana sira do Yelosaleng.

language1_text: And it came to pass, when he was come nigh to Bethphage and Bethany, at the mount called the mount of Olives, he sent two of his disciples,
language2_text: To da ji makaranes do Peyvake a kado Potani do asa ka tokon a meyngaran so Kanlan am tovoin na o rarwa ka macinanao jya manma.

language1_text: saying, Go ye into the village over against you; in the which at your entering ye shall find a colt tied, whereon yet never man sat: loose him, and bring him hither.
language2_text: Maniring jira am, "Angay kamo do tanyo anamen a ili. Si mangay kamo am makacita kamo so asa ka ji da pa nyavangan no tao alikey a baka a makedked do dang. Am ovain nyo an a kalak nyo sya yai.

language1_text: And if any man ask you, Why do ye loose him? thus shall ye say unto him, Because the Lord hath need of him.
language2_text: No si myan so manci nya tao jinyo so, 'Nyo ovayan so baka ang,' am ipanci nyo jira o, 'Yamyan so na patakan nya no Panirsirngen ta.'"

language1_text: And they that were sent went their way, and found even as he had said unto them.
language2_text: Mangay sira am jyalas o nipanci ni Yeso jira.

language1_text: And as they were loosing the colt, the owners thereof said unto them, Why loose ye the colt?
language2_text: Ovain da o baka am pacicin na sira no mapeybaka sya. Maniring jira am, "Nyo ovayan so baka ang."

language1_text: And they said, The Lord hath need of him.
language2_text: Maniring sira am, "Yamyan so na patakan nya no Panirsirngen ta."

language1_text: And they brought him to Jesus: and they cast their garments upon the colt, and they set Jesus thereon.
language2_text: Meyratateng am ovain da na o baka a yangay do tangain na ni Yeso, karasay da no ayob da do likod no baka a kapasakay da na si Yeso.

language1_text: And as he went, they spread their clothes in the way.
language2_text: Meypangay sira am ahapen da no aro a tao o aywayob da irasay da do pangonongan na.

language1_text: And when he was come nigh, even now at the descent of the mount of Olives, the whole multitude of the disciples began to rejoice and praise God with a loud voice for all the mighty works that they had seen;
language2_text: Omosok rana sira do tokon a meyngaran so Kanlan am amlololos sira o aro a macilolo jya tao a somaray nya ji Ama ta do to, do aro a nimacita da mina vazay ni Yeso.

language1_text: saying, Blessed be the King that cometh in the name of the Lord: peace in heaven, and glory in the highest.
language2_text: Maniring sira am, "Azwazwain ta o Panirsirngen ta a nitovoy ni Ama ta do to. So iyan na do teyngato no sarasaray a kano azwazway a mangay jimo, mo Ama do to."

language1_text: And some of the Pharisees from among the multitude said unto him, Master, rebuke thy disciples.
language2_text: Maniring sira ji Yeso o macizavoz do aro a tao a macyagom do Vadisay am, "Mo Mangnanao, pancyaney sira o yamacilolo jimo, ta ji sira meykazyazyak."

language1_text: And he answered and said unto them, I tell you that, if these should hold their peace, the stones would immediately cry out.
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso am, "Ko pa ciring jinyo am no si ji sira meyzezyak am o vato rana ito am to macipalit a somaray nyaken."

language1_text: And when he was come near, he beheld the city, and wept over it,
language2_text: Toda ji makaranes do Yelosaleng am macita na o ili. Am ori o nilavyan na do tao do dang.

language1_text: saying, If thou hadst known, even thou, at least in this thy day, the things which belong unto thy peace! but now they are hid from thine eyes.
language2_text: Maniring am, "Inaoy si katenngan nyo sicyaraw eya o ikapya no onowned nyo. Ta yakanyo akmey mavota sicyaikwaya.

language1_text: For the days shall come upon thee, that thine enemies shall cast a trench about thee, and compass thee round, and keep thee in on every side,
language2_text: No marateng o araraw na am mai o kavosoyan nyo a tao a omlimot jinyo a kaji nyo makasawayan.

language1_text: and shall lay thee even with the ground, and thy children within thee; and they shall not leave in thee one stone upon another; because thou knewest not the time of thy visitation.
language2_text: So ikamimin nyo a kano ananak nyo a balinasen da. Akman sang o vahavahay nyo. Ta abo o asa ka vato a madwadon. Ta ji nyo a tenngi o ikasasnad no aryarilaw na jinyo ni Ama ta do to."

language1_text: And he went into the temple, and began to cast out them that sold therein, and them that bought;
language2_text: Somdep si Yeso do rako a panaralayan am powboten na sira o meypananazangan a tao.

language1_text: saying unto them, It is written, My house is the house of prayer; but ye have made it a den of thieves.
language2_text: Maniring jira am, "O ciring na ni Ama ta do to a domket do Seysyo am, 'O raralayan nyo nyaken a vahay am peyneynozyan ori no aro a tao.' Am nyo to peyvaliw a da peyvahayan no manakaw a tao."

language1_text: And he taught daily in the temple. But the chief priests and the scribes and the chief of the people sought to destroy him,
language2_text: Mangday do araraw si Yeso a mangnanao so tao do rako a panaralayan. O panipanirsirngen no mapatanatanang so nakem da si Ama ta do to a kano mangnanao no iwawalam ni Ama ta do to a kano kamanrarakehan da am naknakmen da o kawakwak da sya.

language1_text: and could not find what they might do: for all the people were very attentive to hear him.
language2_text: Am kaji da makatenngan jya rakpen, ta aro tao a makza no ipangnanao na.

language1_text: And it came to pass, that on one of those days, as he taught the people in the temple, and preached the gospel, the chief priests and the scribes came upon him with the elders,
language2_text: Ipisa kapangnanao na ni Yeso no Mapasaray a Ciriciring do rako a panaralayan am amyan so panipanirsirngen no mapatanatanang so nakem da si Ama ta do to a kano mangnanao no iwawalam ni Ama ta do to a kano kamanrarakehan da a mangay tomita sya,

language1_text: and spake unto him, saying, Tell us, by what authority doest thou these things? or who is he that gave thee this authority?
language2_text: kapacici da sya. Maniring sira am, "Do wanjin na kapwan no oyowyat mo a yamapeyvazay so yamapeyzokab a vazay ang. Sinosino nitoro jimo a oyowyat ang. Pancyan pala jyamen."

language1_text: And he answered and said unto them, I will also ask you one thing; and answer me:
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso jira am, "Pacicin ko pala inyo an. Pancyan kamo pala jyaken.

language1_text: The baptism of John, was it from heaven, or of men?
language2_text: Oyowyat na no nimanaktak a si Yowani am yanimapo ji Ama ta do to an? No yanimapo do tao."

language1_text: And they reasoned with themselves, saying, If we shall say, From heaven; he will say, Why then believed ye him not?
language2_text: Am ori o kazyakan da nya. Maniring sira do kadwan jira am, "Kongwen tamo ori a patovisan. No si ipanci ta o kapo na ji Ama ta do to am ji na panenesha yaten ni Yeso a ji nganoyong ji Yowani a.

language1_text: But and if we say, Of men; all the people will stone us: for they be persuaded that John was a prophet.
language2_text: Am no si kwan ta o kapo na do tao am jyabo kaji da ngagsahan jyaten no tao a. Ta da anoyngan si Yowani a panoyonoywan na so ciring ni Ama ta do to."

language1_text: And they answered, that they could not tell whence it was.
language2_text: Meyratateng am maniring sira ji Yeso am, "Namen jyatenngi o na nikapwan no oyowyat na."

language1_text: And Jesus said unto them, Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things.
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso jira am, "No komwan am ji ko mancyan jinyo o na nikapwan no oyowyat ko a yamapeyvazay so aro a vazay."

language1_text: Then began he to speak to the people this parable; A certain man planted a vineyard, and let it forth to husbandmen, and went into a far country for a long time.
language2_text: Meyratateng am ipanci na jira ni Yeso o payyaingen na sya. Maniring am, "Amyan so asa ka tao a meycibcib so mowan na so potaw. Am ikongo do mangay meykownayan do matarek a ili, am ori o nitorwan na no nihakawan na do tao a vooden da.

language1_text: And at the season he sent a servant to the husbandmen, that they should give him of the fruit of the vineyard: but the husbandmen beat him, and sent him away empty.
language2_text: Mazako asi na no nimowa na am manovoy so asa ka lamlamsoy na macipamozas jira so vonong na. O nimvood so nihakawan na tao ori am nipakapya da nisipsipzotan o lamlamsoy na no nang. Ori o to na meysinaoli abo so nyahap.

language1_text: And again he sent another servant: and they beat him also, and entreated him shamefully, and sent him away empty.
language2_text: Ipirwa o mapeynihakawan sya manovoy so lamlamsoy na am akman so sang, ta nisipsipzotan da a panyanigen a katovoy da rana sya abwata so paciralayan.

language1_text: And again he sent a third: and they wounded him also, and cast him out.
language2_text: Ipitlo na no mapeynihakawan sya a manovoy so lamlamsoy na mangay am nipakakasi da a kazaza da sya padondonen do zazacit no nihakawan na.

language1_text: Then said the lord of the vineyard, What shall I do? I will send my beloved son: it may be they will reverence him when they see him.
language2_text: Maniring rana o mapeynihakawan sya am, 'Meypanngonngo ko so wanjin eya. Apyapya o kato ko na novoyan so anak ko a mangay, ta ala ikeykanig da pa.'

language1_text: But when the husbandmen saw him, they reasoned among themselves, saying, This is the heir: come, let us kill him, that the inheritance may be our's.
language2_text: Am macita da no nimvood so nihakawan na tao o anak na no mapeynihakawan sya am meysirisiring sira. Maniring sira am, 'Iya ya o yaomamoon so nihakawan na. So wakwakan ta na sya, kamoon tamo so nihakawan na.'

language1_text: So they cast him out of the vineyard, and killed him. What therefore shall the lord of the vineyard do unto them?
language2_text: Meyratateng am lolwen da yangay do kwang a kawakwak da rana sya. Manngo kamo. Kongkongwen na paro o nimvood so nihakawan na tao ang no mapeynihakawan sya.

language1_text: He shall come and destroy these husbandmen, and shall give the vineyard to others. And when they heard it, they said, God forbid.
language2_text: Jyabo kaji na balinasan sira a kapapalit na so tao a amvood so nihakawan na." Mamizing da no aro a tao o ciriciring na am ipanci da o, "Jyabo kato na akmanan sang no vazay a."

language1_text: And he beheld them, and said, What is this then that is written, The stone which the builders rejected, The same is become the head of the corner?
language2_text: Citahen na sira ni Yeso am pacicin na sira. Maniring am, "No si ipanci nyo o kabo no akman sang a vazay ni Ama ta do to am ikongo na peypeypangayan no nivatvatkan do Seysyo. Ta maniring am, 'O Vato a niwalit da no mapatnek so vahay am nimeyvoga a ney makdeng na aslet no ai no vahay.'

language1_text: Whosoever shall fall upon that stone shall be broken; but on whomsoever it shall fall, it will grind him to powder.
language2_text: O meyhabak rana do Vato ori am to rana zemek o tototowang na. O kakasan no Vato a tao am akman sang, ta meyramis o kataotao na."

language1_text: And the chief priests and the scribes the same hour sought to lay hands on him; and they feared the people: for they perceived that he had spoken this parable against them.
language2_text: O mangnanao no iwawalam ni Ama ta do to a kano panipanirsirngen da no mapatanatanang so nakem da si Ama ta do to am makazazap da o nanao ni Yeso a paingen na jira. Am ori o naknakman da so karakep da sya. Am ikanyahey da o aro a tao.

language1_text: And they watched him, and sent forth spies, which should feign themselves just men, that they might take hold of his words, that so they might deliver him unto the power and authority of the governor.
language2_text: Am ori o to da macyozai jya. So nipantan da no tao so nizpi a to napyapya so nakem a mapacici si Yeso. Ta kalahen da o ciriciring na amraherahet so seyvo.

language1_text: And they asked him, saying, Master, we know that thou sayest and teachest rightly, neither acceptest thou the person of any, but teachest the way of God truly:
language2_text: Maniring sira ji Yeso am, "Mo Mangnanao, namen katenngan o nanao mo a yatey manoyong. Namen katenngan imo a yamapeyyangangay so tao. Namen katenngan imo a yamanoyong a yamangnanao no ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: Is it lawful for us to give tribute unto Cæ sar, or no?
language2_text: Ipanci mo pala jyamen do iwawalam ta. Apya o katoro namen so deyking do panirsirngen no Loma a meyngaran so Kaysa?"

language1_text: But he perceived their craftiness, and said unto them, Why tempt ye me?
language2_text: Katenngan na ni Yeso o keyleylamdam da sya. Am ori o nipancyan na no,

language1_text: Shew me a penny. Whose image and superscription hath it? They answered and said, Cæ sar's.
language2_text: "Inya kamo pala so asa ka nizpi, ta citahen ko." Meyratateng am maniring jira am, "Sino ngaran na kano asyasing a yadomket do nizpi ang." Maniring sira am, "Si Kaysa."

language1_text: And he said unto them, Render therefore unto Cæ sar the things which be Cæ sar's, and unto God the things which be God's.
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso jira am, "O monganay ji Kaysa am itoro nyo ji Kaysa. O monganay ji Ama ta do to am itoro nyo ji Ama ta do to."

language1_text: And they could not take hold of his words before the people: and they marvelled at his answer, and held their peace.
language2_text: So ikabo no makala da do ciriciring ni Yeso a iraherahet da sya do tangain da no tao. Ta nipeyzokab da o nitovis na jira ni Yeso. Am ori o ji da na meyzezyaki.

language1_text: Then came to him certain of the Sadducees, which deny that there is any resurrection; and they asked him,
language2_text: Aro o tao a macyagom do Satokay a mangay a mapacici si Yeso. Sira rana ori am ji nganoyong do keypirwa pa mavyay no nimawakwak rana tao.

language1_text: saying, Master, Moses wrote unto us, If any man's brother die, having a wife, and he die without children, that his brother should take his wife, and raise up seed unto his brother.
language2_text: Maniring sira am, "Mo Mangnanao, o nanao ni Moyse am no mawakwak o tao a kabo no anak na am pasakain no kakteh na o mavakes na a keyyan no komownongan no kakteh na rakeh do karawan.

language1_text: There were therefore seven brethren: and the first took a wife, and died without children.
language2_text: No kakwa pa am amyan so papito a meyketeketeh. Mapapapen o rakeh jira am ji nimeytaodtod a kawakwak na rana.

language1_text: And the second took her to wife, and he died childless.
language2_text: Mawakwak rana am pasakain na o mavakes ang no tomonton jira. Mawakwak ori am abo taodtod na.

language1_text: And the third took her; and in like manner the seven also: and they left no children, and died.
language2_text: O ikatatlo da am akman sang a kato da twatontonan a meyketeketeh a mahap so mina kahanghangan no mina rakeh jira. Mawakwak sira am abwata o mina taodtod da.

language1_text: Last of all the woman died also.
language2_text: Mownay am mawakwak rana o mavakes ang.

language1_text: Therefore in the resurrection whose wife of them is she? for seven had her to wife.
language2_text: Manngwa, no marateng o araraw no keypirwa mavyay no tao am sino jira ang o manoyong a mapeykahanghangan so sang. Ta nimamimin sira o papito a meyketeketeh ori a nimapasakay sya."

language1_text: And Jesus answering said unto them, The children of this world marry, and are given in marriage:
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso jira am, "O tao do karawan sicyakwaya am yamapapapen o mahakay. Sira macivahavahay o mavakes.

language1_text: but they which shall be accounted worthy to obtain that world, and the resurrection from the dead, neither marry, nor are given in marriage:
language2_text: O tao a peyvangonen ni Ama ta do to no makwa a mangay do teyngato am ji sira meypinazagpit an.

language1_text: neither can they die any more: for they are equal unto the angels; and are the children of God, being the children of the resurrection.
language2_text: Ta akman sira so tinsi do yanan ni Ama ta do to a jyawakwak rana. Anak na sira ni Ama ta do to, ta nipeyvangon na sira.

language1_text: Now that the dead are raised, even Moses shewed at the bush, when he calleth the Lord the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.
language2_text: Do nivatvatkan na ni Moyse a ciriciring am katenngan ta o kanoyong da nimavyay rana no nimawakwak a tao. Ta nimamizing na o ciring ni Ama ta do to do amlila tazici a manci no, 'Yaken rana am Tao do to na yaken ni Apolahan a kani Isa kani Yakebo.'

language1_text: For he is not a God of the dead, but of the living: for all live unto him.
language2_text: O peypeypangayan no ciriciring eya am si Ama ta do to rana am Tao do to da no mavyay a omanoyong jya tao. Tana nimawakwak rana, avyain na sira. Ta o tao rana do tangain ni Ama ta do to am mamimin a mavyay sira."

language1_text: Then certain of the scribes answering said, Master, thou hast well said.
language2_text: Amyan so mangnanao no iwawalam ni Ama ta do to a manci no, "Mo Mangnanao, yatey yapya o ciriciring mo."

language1_text: And after that they durst not ask him any question at all.
language2_text: Nimacipinda no kano nang o kaji da na makadketan ji Yeso a pacicin.

language1_text: And he said unto them, How say they that Christ is David's son?
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso jira am, "Ikongo da pancyan no Misayya no tao a sivovoong ni Tawey.

language1_text: And David himself saith in the book of Psalms, The LORD said unto my Lord, Sit thou on my right hand,
language2_text: Ta maniring si Tawey do nivatvatkan a anwanood am, 'Maniring si Ama ta do to do Panirsirngen ko am: Amlisna ka do wanan ko,

language1_text: Till I make thine enemies thy footstool.
language2_text: mangay si balinasen ko sira o macioya jimo a tao.'

language1_text: David therefore calleth him Lord, how is he then his son?
language2_text: Abneken na ni Tawey a Panirsirngen na o Misayya am ikongo peysivovoongan na syaha."

language1_text: Then in the audience of all the people he said unto his disciples,
language2_text: Amizngen da pa no aro a tao o ciriciring na ni Yeso am amyan pa so ciring na do macinanao jya. Maniring jira am,

language1_text: Beware of the scribes, which desire to walk in long robes, and love greetings in the markets, and the highest seats in the synagogues, and the chief rooms at feasts;
language2_text: "Azimanen nyo sira o mangnanao no iwawalam ni Ama ta do to an. Ta da ikakza o da kapeyyaywayob so pipya ayob a mangonong do rararahan a komakzeb so tao a omraralay nira. No somdep sira do peyneynozyan am mangay sira amlisna do lilisnan no meynakem a tao. Akman so sang no macyakakan sira, ta amlisna sira do pamanongan na.

language1_text: which devour widows' houses, and for a shew make long prayers: the same shall receive greater damnation.
language2_text: Littan da o vao a mavakes do kahap da so kangangay da, kato da ngidan so inozi da mapakapyapya so nakem. Sira rana ori am mangay o kangay na jira no rako a peyoyaoyyan na ni Ama ta do to."

language1_text: And he looked up, and saw the rich men casting their gifts into the treasury.
language2_text: Mangay si Yeso do rako a panaralayan am macita na sira aro so nizpi a tao a mapakozong so kingking da.

language1_text: And he saw also a certain poor widow casting in thither two mites.
language2_text: Meyratateng am to na cita o asa ka vao a mavakes a meykingking so adwa ka nizpi.

language1_text: And he said, Of a truth I say unto you, that this poor widow hath cast in more than they all:
language2_text: Maniring am, "Ko pa ciring jinyo am o kingking na no vao a tao eya am yarwaro pa kano kingking da no karwan no tao.

language1_text: for all these have of their abundance cast in unto the offerings of God: but she of her penury hath cast in all the living that she had.
language2_text: Ta o karwan no tao am sira mangap so hepan da, da ipeykingking ji Ama ta do to. Am o vao a mavakes rana ya am kakwakwan na yabo so ipangakaday am yana makto o nizpi na ipeykingking."

language1_text: And as some spake of the temple, how it was adorned with goodly stones and gifts, he said,
language2_text: Ikazyak da no aro a tao o rako a panaralayan a nyamaog no ney yapiya na vato a kano makakaday a nakem da si Ama ta do to. Maniring si Yeso jira am,

language1_text: As for these things which ye behold, the days will come, in the which there shall not be left one stone upon another, that shall not be thrown down.
language2_text: "O nyo macita rana ya am no marateng o araraw na am jyabo kavezed na no asa ka vato do jya, do kazdazday da sya."

language1_text: And they asked him, saying, Master, but when shall these things be? and what sign will there be when these things shall come to pass?
language2_text: Maniring sira am, "Mo Mangnanao, no mango am makaranes o akman so sang a vazay. No masasnad o akman so sang a vazay am ikongo tovilan namen jya."

language1_text: And he said, Take heed that ye be not deceived: for many shall come in my name, saying, I am Christ; and the time draweth near: go ye not therefore after them.
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso am, "Azimanen nyo an. Ta ji kamo a litai an. Ta mangay o keyyan no aro a tao amvood so ngaran ko a manci no, 'Yaken am si Kizisto ko,' a kapanci da pa no, 'Yamasngen rana o araraw no kavosan no karawan.' Am ji nyo ngonoci sira an.

language1_text: But when ye shall hear of wars and commotions, be not terrified: for these things must first come to pass; but the end is not by and by.
language2_text: Tana mamizing nyo o meyliliman a meyyarap am ji kanyo anyaheyan, ta manmanma pa o akman sang a alalaw an. Am beken pa ori o ikavos no karawan."

language1_text: Then said he unto them, Nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom:
language2_text: Maniring pa jira am, "Masyahahap sira o peycyamahamahatawan na.

language1_text: and great earthquakes shall be in divers places, and famines, and pestilences; and fearful sights and great signs shall there be from heaven.
language2_text: So iyan na no rako a kanini a kano rako abcil a kano ingingnen, kapeytotwaw na pa no ikeykanyahey no tao apo do hanit a keyyan na pa no rako a taztazmamaw.
