language2_text: Karahan am ipanci na ni Veydipo o ka si Yeso na no agagazan no nivilangan na a kananao na sya no Mapasaray a Ciriciring ni Yeso.

language1_text: And as they went on their way, they came unto a certain water: and the eunuch said, See, here is water; what doth hinder me to be baptized?
language2_text: Meyratateng am manahan sira do masngen do ranom. Maniring o tao do Isopiya am, "Yamyan jya so ranom. Apya o kataktak mo jyaken do jya?"

language1_text: And Philip said, If thou believest with all thine heart, thou mayest. And he answered and said, I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God.
language2_text: [Maniring si Veydipo am, "Si manoyong o onowned mo am ori o taktakan ko jimo." Maniring am, "Ko anoyngan si Yeso a Kizisto a Anak ni Ama ta do to."]

language1_text: And he commanded the chariot to stand still: and they went down both into the water, both Philip and the eunuch; and he baptized him.
language2_text: Am ori o nipaseykedan na so aleleh a kapacihza na ji Veydipo a mangay do ranom a kataktak na jya.

language1_text: And when they were come up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord caught away Philip, that the eunuch saw him no more: and he went on his way rejoicing.
language2_text: Karwan da rana o ranom am ahapen na no Seyzi si Veydipo. Am ori o ji na nimakacitai rana sya no tao do Isopiya. Mangay rana ori am masaray rana o onowned na.

language1_text: But Philip was found at Azotus: and passing through he preached in all the cities, till he came to Cæ sarea.
language2_text: Nimacita da rana no tao si Veydipo do Atsoto a ili a kalivon na so peycyeylilyan na peylimwangan no Mapasaray a Ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to mangay no kapakaranes na rana do ili do Kaysadiya.

language1_text: And Saul, yet breathing out threatenings and slaughter against the disciples of the Lord, went unto the high priest,
language2_text: No kanang rana am ji namtadan ni Sawlo o kalalaw na so omraralay ni Yeso a tao a zakaten. Am ori o nyangay na do rako a panirsirngen no mapatanatanang so nakem da si Ama ta do to,

language1_text: and desired of him letters to Damascus to the synagogues, that if he found any of this way, whether they were men or women, he might bring them bound unto Jerusalem.
language2_text: ta kakzeben na o kapeyteygami na no tomalamozong no aro a peyneynozyan da no tao do Yotay do Tamaseke a ili a manci no kapya da sya omrakep so amraralay ni Yeso a tao, tana mahakay a tana mavakes am miminen na sira yangay do pamemtengan do Yelosaleng.

language1_text: And as he journeyed, he came near Damascus: and suddenly there shined round about him a light from heaven:
language2_text: Masngen rana do Tamaseke am to ngyan so zezak apo do teyngato a tomiray sya.

language1_text: and he fell to the earth, and heard a voice saying unto him, Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me?
language2_text: Am ori o nikavazakwang na do teyrahem a kapakamizing na so macisirsiring jya. Maniring am, "Sawlo, Sawlo, ikongo mo pakakasyan jyaken."

language1_text: And he said, Who art thou, Lord? And the Lord said, I am Jesus whom thou persecutest: it is hard for thee to kick against the pricks.
language2_text: Maniring am, "Mo Panirsirngen, sino ka." Maniring am, "Yaken rana am si Yeso ko a yamo pakakasin.

language1_text: And he trembling and astonished said, Lord, what wilt thou have me to do? And the Lord said unto him, Arise, and go into the city, and it shall be told thee what thou must do.
language2_text: Peyvangon rana mangay do ili, ta yamyan so asa ka tao a manci nya jimo so vazay ko jimo."

language1_text: And the men which journeyed with him stood speechless, hearing a voice, but seeing no man.
language2_text: O kararay ni Sawlo am tey maonib sira, ji rana makapeyzezyak, ta amyan so mamizing da am ji da cita.

language1_text: And Saul arose from the earth; and when his eyes were opened, he saw no man: but they led him by the hand, and brought him into Damascus.
language2_text: Meyvangon si Sawlo am peyvezezngen na o mata na am ji makacita. Ori o nyalakan da sya no kararay na yangay do Tamaseke.

language1_text: And he was three days without sight, and neither did eat nor drink.
language2_text: So nipakatlo na araw a jya nimakacita, jya nimangakaday.

language1_text: And there was a certain disciple at Damascus, named Ananias; and to him said the Lord in a vision, Ananias. And he said, Behold, I am here, Lord.
language2_text: Amyan do Tamaseke so asa ka omraralay ni Yeso a tao a meyngaran si Ananiya. Nimapacita jya si Yeso. Maniring am, "Ananiya." Maniring am, "Ikongo o mo kakzeben jyaken, mo Panirsirngen."

language1_text: And the Lord said unto him, Arise, and go into the street which is called Straight, and enquire in the house of Judas for one called Saul, of Tarsus: for, behold, he prayeth,
language2_text: Maniring si Yeso am, "Mangay ka do ngaranan da so Matazineng a rarahan. Ta myan do vahay ni Yota o asa ka tao do Tasose a meyngaran si Sawlo a yameynozi dang.

language1_text: and hath seen in a vision a man named Ananias coming in, and putting his hand on him, that he might receive his sight.
language2_text: Nipaziman ko na jya o katovoy ko jimo a mangay a somidong sya a mapaopta so lima mo a kapakacita na rana."

language1_text: Then Ananias answered, Lord, I have heard by many of this man, how much evil he hath done to thy saints at Jerusalem:
language2_text: Maniring si Ananiya am, "Mo Panirsirngen, ko nimamizing rana do aro a tao o marahet a vazay na do keyyan da no aro a nipakakasi na a omraralay nimo do Yelosaleng.

language1_text: and here he hath authority from the chief priests to bind all that call on thy name.
language2_text: Iya rana am nipya da no panipanirsirngen no mapatanatanang so nakem da si Ama ta do to a mangay a omrakep so omraralay nimo a tao."

language1_text: But the Lord said unto him, Go thy way: for he is a chosen vessel unto me, to bear my name before the Gentiles, and kings, and the children of Israel:
language2_text: Maniring jya si Yeso am, "Mangay ka, ta ko nipamnekan si Sawlo a mahap so vazay ko a meylimwang no ngaran ko do beken a tao do Yotay a kano aro a panipanirsirngen, pacyangayan nyo a Isedi a tao.

language1_text: for I will shew him how great things he must suffer for my name's sake.
language2_text: Ta pazimanen ko jya o karo no alalaw na do ipeyvazay na jyaken."

language1_text: And Ananias went his way, and entered into the house; and putting his hands on him said, Brother Saul, the Lord, even Jesus, that appeared unto thee in the way as thou camest, hath sent me, that thou mightest receive thy sight, and be filled with the Holy Ghost.
language2_text: Am ori o nyangay na rana ni Ananiya. Somdep rana do vahay am paoptahen na o lima na do kataotao na ni Sawlo. Maniring am, "Mo kakteh, o mo nimacita do rarahan a Panirsirngen ta si Yeso am na nitovoy yaken a mai a tomazogaw nimo. Ta kakzeben na imo a makacita rana a italamozong no Seyzi."

language1_text: And immediately there fell from his eyes as it had been scales: and he received sight forthwith, and arose, and was baptized.
language2_text: Mamizing na ni Sawlo o ciring na am mina todakas do mata na o akmey isis no among. So nipakacita na rana. Am ori o nipeyvangon na rana kataktak da jya.

language1_text: And when he had received meat, he was strengthened. Then was Saul certain days with the disciples which were at Damascus.
language2_text: So nipangakaday na rana a kowyat na rana no kataotao na. Kadadayan na so araraw am amyan pa si Sawlo do Tamaseke a macihza jira do omraralay ni Yeso,

language1_text: And straightway he preached Christ in the synagogues, that he is the Son of God.
language2_text: a kangay na do aro a peyneynozyan a meylimwang ni Yeso a manoyong a Anak na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: But all that heard him were amazed, and said; Is not this he that destroyed them which called on this name in Jerusalem, and came hither for that intent, that he might bring them bound unto the chief priests?
language2_text: Mamizing da no aro a tao am isavasavak da. Ori o nipancyan da nya do kadwan jira so, "Beken a oya asyo o nimapakakasi so omraralay ni Yeso a tao do Yelosaleng? O na nyai do jya am ala na littan sira a yavaoden a yangay na do panipanirsirngen no mapatanatanang so nakem da si Ama ta do to do Yelosaleng."

language1_text: But Saul increased the more in strength, and confounded the Jews which dwelt at Damascus, proving that this is very Christ.
language2_text: So ikatey mateneng na ni Sawlo a mangnanao a jyamogaw a macinekanekad jira a manci ni Yeso a Misayya. Am ori o ji da makatenngi jya pasapan no aro a tao do Yotay do Tamaseke.

language1_text: And after that many days were fulfilled, the Jews took counsel to kill him:
language2_text: Kadadayan na do araraw am ipeysirsiring da o kazakat da si Sawlo no tao do Yotay.

language1_text: but their laying await was known of Saul. And they watched the gates day and night to kill him.
language2_text: So ipangday da do maraw a kado mahep omavat ji Sawlo a zakaten no makowbot do ili. Am keyyan no tao a nimanci nya ji Sawlo.

language1_text: Then the disciples took him by night, and let him down by the wall in a basket.
language2_text: Am ori o nitontonan da sya no sinjya do mahep do rako a yala do likod no makarang a atoy no ili da kakaro na rana dang.

language1_text: And when Saul was come to Jerusalem, he assayed to join himself to the disciples: but they were all afraid of him, and believed not that he was a disciple.
language2_text: Makaranes si Sawlo do Yelosaleng am naknakmen na o kapacikaop na do omraralay ni Yeso a tao. Am nikanyahey da, ta ji da anoyngi o kanoyong na rana omanoyong ji Yeso.

language1_text: But Barnabas took him, and brought him to the apostles, and declared unto them how he had seen the Lord in the way, and that he had spoken to him, and how he had preached boldly at Damascus in the name of Jesus.
language2_text: Am kanisomidong na sya ni Parnapo a mangay tomita so nipamnekan ni Yeso a omlivolivon no ciriciring na a kapanci na nya jira so mina kapakacita na ni Sawlo si Yeso do rarahan a nisomirisiring sya a kapanci na pa nya jira so kaji na mogawan ni Sawlo a meylimwang ni Yeso do Tamaseke.

language1_text: And he was with them coming in and going out at Jerusalem.
language2_text: Am ori o nikabwangan da rana ji Sawlo no nipamnekan ni Yeso a omlivolivon no ciriciring na. So ji na nimamogawi a meylimwang ni Yeso do Yelosaleng.

language1_text: And he spake boldly in the name of the Lord Jesus, and disputed against the Grecians: but they went about to slay him.
language2_text: No kanang am nimacisirsiring a kapacinekanekad na do tao do Yotay a meyzezyak so ciring da no tao do Sila. Am naknakmen da o kazakat da si Sawlo.

language1_text: Which when the brethren knew, they brought him down to Cæ sarea, and sent him forth to Tarsus.
language2_text: Katenngan da no akma ney kakteh do cinai o akman sang a vazay am yangay da do Kaysadiya katovoy da sya mangay rana do meyngongyod a ili da do Tasose.

language1_text: Then had the churches rest throughout all Judæ a and Galilee and Samaria, and were edified; and walking in the fear of the Lord, and in the comfort of the Holy Ghost, were multiplied.
language2_text: No kanang rana am abo rana o ikalaw da no omraralay ni Yeso a tao do Yotay a kado Cyadidi a kado Samadiya. So nikakdeng da rana so nakem ji Yeso. Ta arako o nisidongan na sira no Seyzi. Am ori o nikaro no tao a omanoyong ji Yeso. So nikapiya no icicirawat da rana omahap so vazay na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: And it came to pass, as Peter passed throughout all quarters, he came down also to the saints which dwelt at Lydda.
language2_text: Si Pite rana am nilivolivon na o peycyeylilyan na angayan na tomazogaw no omraralay ni Yeso a tao. Makaranes do Dita am,

language1_text: And there he found a certain man named Æ neas, which had kept his bed eight years, and was sick of the palsy.
language2_text: macita na dang o asa ka tao a meyngaran si Aynayya. Iya rana am nimakasapa tao, mina kawao (8) a kawan a jya nimeyvavangon.

language1_text: And Peter said unto him, Æ neas, Jesus Christ maketh thee whole: arise, and make thy bed. And he arose immediately.
language2_text: Maniring jya si Pite am, "Mo Aynayya, peyvangon rana kahap so ireyrayan mo. Ta na rana nipeypapya imo ni Yeso Kizisto." So nikapya na rana.

language1_text: And all that dwelt at Lydda and Saron saw him, and turned to the Lord.
language2_text: Macita da ori no aro a tao a meyvahay do Dita kado Salon am anoyngan da rana si Yeso.

language1_text: Now there was at Joppa a certain disciple named Tabitha, which by interpretation is called Dorcas: this woman was full of good works and almsdeeds which she did.
language2_text: Do Yepey rana ili da am amyan so asa ka mavakes a omraralay ni Yeso a meyngaran si Tapitay. O ngaran na do ciring no Sila am si Tocya. Peypeypangayan na am ibosbosan. Aro apiya vazay na, ta sidongen na sira o abo so nizpi a tao.

language1_text: And it came to pass in those days, that she was sick, and died: whom when they had washed, they laid her in an upper chamber.
language2_text: Amyan si Pite do Dita am meyngen a kawakwak na rana ni Tapitay. Am ori o niryosan da sya kapangay da sya do kavava no vahay na.

language1_text: And forasmuch as Lydda was nigh to Joppa, and the disciples had heard that Peter was there, they sent unto him two men, desiring him that he would not delay to come to them.
language2_text: Manovoy sira so rarwa ka tao a mangay ji Pite, ta mamizing da si Pite amyan do Dita. Maniring sira am, "Makeykai ka mangay do ili namen."

language1_text: Then Peter arose and went with them. When he was come, they brought him into the upper chamber: and all the widows stood by him weeping, and shewing the coats and garments which Dorcas made, while she was with them.
language2_text: So nipacihza da rana ji Pite a mangay do Dita. Makaranes sira am yangay da do kavava no vahay na ni Tapitay. So nikamimin da no vao a mavakes amlimot sya amlavi a mapacita no nitapang na ni Tapitay a ayob da no kapeyigegen na pa do karawan.

language1_text: But Peter put them all forth, and kneeled down, and prayed; and turning him to the body said, Tabitha, arise. And she opened her eyes: and when she saw Peter, she sat up.
language2_text: Karahan am powboten na sira ni Pite a kapeylilitod na meynozi a somazap so kataotao na ni Tapitay. Maniring am, "Mo Tapitay, peyvangon rana." Meyratateng am meyvezezeng o mata na a makacita si Pite kapeyvangon na rana amlisna.

language1_text: And he gave her his hand, and lifted her up, and when he had called the saints and widows, presented her alive.
language2_text: Am ori o nyalakan na so lima na ni Pite a patanken a kapanci na no aro a vao a mavakes a kano karwan da omraralay ni Yeso a somdep rana. So nipakacittan da rana si Tapitay a nimirwa a mavyay.

language1_text: And it was known throughout all Joppa; and many believed in the Lord.
language2_text: O akman rana sang a vazay am nimamizing da rana no tao do Yepey. Ori o nipeyparo da rana no tao a omanoyong ji Yeso do Yepey.

language1_text: And it came to pass, that he tarried many days in Joppa with one Simon a tanner.
language2_text: Si Pite rana am todavezed do dang a macivahay ji Simong. O vazay ni Simong am mapakapkapya so nihab da kolit no baka.

language1_text: There was a certain man in Cæ sarea called Cornelius, a centurion of the band called the Italian band,
language2_text: Amyan so asa ka tao do Kaysadiya a ili a meyngaran si Kenaylyo a panirsirngen da no asa lipenpenan a itaysang do Itadi.

language1_text: a devout man, and one that feared God with all his house, which gave much alms to the people, and prayed to God alway.
language2_text: Tana beken a tao do Yotay ori am manoyong o nakenakem na ji Ama ta do to a ka nira asa ka vahay. Rako o sidongan na so ji makahakaw a tao do Yotay a kasangib na meynozi ji Ama ta do to.

language1_text: He saw in a vision evidently about the ninth hour of the day an angel of God coming in to him, and saying unto him, Cornelius.
language2_text: Ipisa do makoyab do ikatlo no toki am nimapacita jya o asa ka tinsi ni Ama ta do to. Maniring am, "Mo Kenaylyo."

language1_text: And when he looked on him, he was afraid, and said, What is it, Lord? And he said unto him, Thy prayers and thine alms are come up for a memorial before God.
language2_text: To na nita o tinsi, ta ikamogaw na. Maniring am, "Mo Panirsirngen, ikongo mo ipanci ang." Maniring o tinsi am, "Na imo manakem ni Ama do to, ta nimamizing na o inozi mo. Na katenngan o mo panidongan so ji makahakaw a tao.

language1_text: And now send men to Joppa, and call for one Simon, whose surname is Peter:
language2_text: Am ori o ipanovoy mo so tao a mangay do Yepey a manci no meyngaran so Simong Pite a mai.

language1_text: he lodgeth with one Simon a tanner, whose house is by the sea side: he shall tell thee what thou oughtest to do.
language2_text: Yamyan do vahay ni Simong a mapakapkapya so nihab da kolit no baka. Yamasngen do pasalan o vahay da."

language1_text: And when the angel which spake unto Cornelius was departed, he called two of his household servants, and a devout soldier of them that waited on him continually;
language2_text: Karwan na rana no tinsi am ipanci ni Kenaylyo o rarwa ka lamlamsoy na mai a kano asa ka itaysang do Itadi a manoyong so nakenakem ji Ama ta do to,

language1_text: and when he had declared all these things unto them, he sent them to Joppa.
language2_text: kapanci na nya jira so ciring no tinsi a katovoy na sira mangay do Yepey.

language1_text: On the morrow, as they went on their journey, and drew nigh unto the city, Peter went up upon the housetop to pray about the sixth hour:
language2_text: Mararaw do ikadwa na araw am masngen rana sira do Yepey o nitovoy ni Kenaylyo. Si Pite rana am meynozi do atep no vahay da.

language1_text: and he became very hungry, and would have eaten: but while they made ready, he fell into a trance,
language2_text: Makcin rana am naknakmen na o kakan na. Manotong pa sira am to ngyan so nipacita na jya ni Ama ta do to do akmey tateynep na.

language1_text: and saw heaven opened, and a certain vessel descending unto him, as it had been a great sheet knit at the four corners, and let down to the earth:
language2_text: So nipakacita na so hanit a meywang a kakasan no akmey tontonen da milakayob do teyrahem.

language1_text: wherein were all manner of fourfooted beasts of the earth, and wild beasts, and creeping things, and fowls of the air.
language2_text: Do avak na am amyan so meycyamadadayan a omalalam a kano volay a kano meyyasasalap.

language1_text: And there came a voice to him, Rise, Peter; kill, and eat.
language2_text: Amyan so meyzezyak a manci nya. Maniring am, "Mo Pite, peytatanek rana kapanzakat mo so yakan mo."

language1_text: But Peter said, Not so, Lord; for I have never eaten any thing that is common or unclean.
language2_text: Am maniring si Pite am, "Mo Panirsirngen, taosya, ta ji ko pa nikoman so sang, ta oya am ji namen ngangana a tao do Yotay."

language1_text: And the voice spake unto him again the second time, What God hath cleansed, that call not thou common.
language2_text: Maniring pa jya am, "O ipanci ni Ama ta do to apya kanen am ji mo mancyan a ji ngangana an."

language1_text: This was done thrice: and the vessel was received up again into heaven.
language2_text: So nikeypitlo na makamizing sya makacita sya a kahap na rana sya ni Ama ta do to do teyngato.

language1_text: Now while Peter doubted in himself what this vision which he had seen should mean, behold, the men which were sent from Cornelius had made enquiry for Simon's house, and stood before the gate,
language2_text: Naknakmen na ni Pite do onowned na o peypeypangayan no nimacita na am to sira makaranes o nitovoy na ni Kenaylyo a tao do vahay ni Simong.

language1_text: and called, and asked whether Simon, which was surnamed Peter, were lodged there.
language2_text: Maniring sira am, "Yamyan so asa ka tao a meyngaran so Simong Pite a yamisan do jya?"

language1_text: While Peter thought on the vision, the Spirit said unto him, Behold, three men seek thee.
language2_text: Naknakmen na pa ni Pite o peypeypangayan no nimacita na ori am maniring jya o Seyzi am, "Yamyan so yatatlo a ka tao a yakomala jimo.

language1_text: Arise therefore, and get thee down, and go with them, doubting nothing: for I have sent them.
language2_text: Meyhekas ka kapacihza mo jira. Ji mo a ratan, ta yaken o nitomovoy sira do jya."

language1_text: Then Peter went down to the men which were sent unto him from Cornelius; and said, Behold, I am he whom ye seek: what is the cause wherefore ye are come?
language2_text: Am ori o nipeyhekas na ni Pite. Maniring jira am, "Yaken o nyo kalahen ang. Ikongo nyo ipanci."

language1_text: And they said, Cornelius the centurion, a just man, and one that feareth God, and of good report among all the nation of the Jews, was warned from God by an holy angel to send for thee into his house, and to hear words of thee.
language2_text: Maniring sira am, "Na nitovoy yamen ni Kenaylyo a panirsirngen da no asa lipenpenan a itaysang do Itadi. Iya rana am na iraralay si Ama ta do to. Da ikanig no tao do Yotay, ta tey yapya o nakenakem na so tao. Nipaziman na rana jya no asa ka tinsi o kai mo do vahay na. Ta amizngen na o inanao mo sya."

language1_text: Then called he them in, and lodged them. And on the morrow Peter went away with them, and certain brethren from Joppa accompanied him.
language2_text: Am ori o nipasdepan na sira ni Pite a kapeysan na sira. Ikadwa na araw am macihza jira si Pite a kano tatasa akma ney kakteh do cinai a meyili do Yepey.

language1_text: And the morrow after they entered into Cæ sarea. And Cornelius waited for them, and had called together his kinsmen and near friends.
language2_text: Ikatlo na araw am makaranes rana sira do Kaysadiya. Am amyan rana do dang si Kenaylyo a kano zipozipos na kano kagakagagan na amnanala sya.

language1_text: And as Peter was coming in, Cornelius met him, and fell down at his feet, and worshipped him.
language2_text: Somdep si Pite am mangay si Kenaylyo do tangain na kapeylilitod na amraralay nya.

language1_text: But Peter took him up, saying, Stand up; I myself also am a man.
language2_text: Maniring si Pite jya am, "Peytatanek rana. Ji ka akman sang, ta meyyangay ta tao."

language1_text: And as he talked with him, he went in, and found many that were come together.
language2_text: So nipeysirisiring da somdep do vahay ni Kenaylyo. Meyratatang am macita na ni Pite o aro a tao a meylovolovot do sahad na.

language1_text: And he said unto them, Ye know how that it is an unlawful thing for a man that is a Jew to keep company, or come unto one of another nation; but God hath shewed me that I should not call any man common or unclean.
language2_text: Maniring jira am, "Nyo katenngan an, ta do iwawalam namen a tao do Yotay am ji namen a mya o kangay namen a komawalam jinyo a beken a tao do Yotay. Am kanimanci na nya jyaken ni Ama ta do to no kakyab. Ta maniring am, 'Ji mo a ratan sira o beken a tao do Yotay. Ta ji meycyapyapinpinan o nyamamaog ko a tao do karawan.'

language1_text: Therefore came I unto you without gainsaying, as soon as I was sent for: I ask therefore for what intent ye have sent for me?
language2_text: Am ori o ko na ji raci so ko kapacikaop jinyo do jya. Am ikongo nyo pancyan nyaken a mai do jya."

language1_text: And Cornelius said, Four days ago I was fasting until this hour; and at the ninth hour I prayed in my house, and, behold, a man stood before me in bright clothing,
language2_text: Maniring si Kenaylyo am, "Yakapat araw rana o hanga na no nipeynozi ko do vahay namen do ikatlo no toki do makoyab am to ngyan so asa ka tao a maniray so ayob a meytatanek do tangain ko.

language1_text: and said, Cornelius, thy prayer is heard, and thine alms are had in remembrance in the sight of God.
language2_text: Maniring am, 'Mo Kenaylyo, na nimamizing ni Ama ta do to o inozi mo. Na katenngan imo a yamanidong so tao.

language1_text: Send therefore to Joppa, and call hither Simon, whose surname is Peter; he is lodged in the house of one Simon a tanner by the sea side: who, when he cometh, shall speak unto thee.
language2_text: So ipanovoy mo so tao a mangay do Yepey a manci no meyngaran si Simong Pite a mai. Iya rana am yamisan do vahay ni Simong a mapakapkapya so nihab da kolit no baka. Yamasngen do pasalan o vahay da.'

language1_text: Immediately therefore I sent to thee; and thou hast well done that thou art come. Now therefore are we all here present before God, to hear all things that are commanded thee of God.
language2_text: Am ori o nipanovoy ko so tao a manci nimo. Ko masaray, ta ka nimai rana. Yamen rana sicyaikwaya am namen malovot do tangain ni Ama ta do to a yaomamizing so nipanci na jimo a inanao na jyamen."

language1_text: Then Peter opened his mouth, and said, Of a truth I perceive that God is no respecter of persons:
language2_text: Maniring si Pite am, "Ko katenngan si Ama ta do to a mapeyyangangay so tao.

language1_text: but in every nation he that feareth him, and worketh righteousness, is accepted with him.
language2_text: Tana tao do Yotay a tana beken a tao do Yotay am miminen na sira ikaglaw o omraralay nya a tao a mangononong do ciring na.

language1_text: The word which God sent unto the children of Israel, preaching peace by Jesus Christ: (he is Lord of all:)
language2_text: Nyo katenngan rana o Mapasaray a Ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to a nipeylimwang na jyamen a Isedi a tao. Ori rana am na ipanta yaten so ikapiya no onowned ta. So ikabo na rana no oyyan na nyaten ni Ama ta do to, ta nitovoy na si Yeso Kizisto a Panirsirngen no tao do peycyamahamahatawan na.

language1_text: that word, I say, ye know, which was published throughout all Judæ a, and began from Galilee, after the baptism which John preached;
language2_text: Nyo na katenngan an, mateyka si Yowani a omononong do kapanaktak na am papwen na rana do Cyadidi a macinapnap do Yotay o keyyan no mapeyzokab a vazay.

language1_text: how God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Ghost and with power: who went about doing good, and healing all that were oppressed of the devil; for God was with him.
language2_text: Nioyatan na no Seyzi si Yeso a tao do Nasale. So nilivolivon na mangiwakwak so meykeyngeyngen a tao a mamozwaw so kalamsoyan ni Satan a komovot do tao, do kapacikaop na jya ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: And we are witnesses of all things which he did both in the land of the Jews, and in Jerusalem; whom they slew and hanged on a tree:
language2_text: Yamen rana am yongkad na, ta nimacita namen o vazay ni Yeso do Yelosaleng a kado peycyeylilyan na do Yotay. Nipadket da do jyojika si Yeso kawakwak na.

language1_text: him God raised up the third day, and shewed him openly;
language2_text: Am ikatlo na araw am nivyay na ni Ama ta do to a kapacita na nya jyamen,

language1_text: not to all the people, but unto witnesses chosen before of God, even to us, who did eat and drink with him after he rose from the dead.
language2_text: a kapacihanghang namen jya koman no keypirwa na mavyay. Beken a mamimin o tao a nimakacita sya, ta yamen a nipamnekan ni Ama ta do to o nimakacita sya a meylimwang nya.

language1_text: And he commanded us to preach unto the people, and to testify that it is he which was ordained of God to be the Judge of quick and dead.
language2_text: Nipakoyokoy na jyamen o kapeylimwang namen no kanoyong na ni Yeso a nipamnekan ni Ama ta do to a mapacici so mavyay a kano nimawakwak a tao.

language1_text: To him give all the prophets witness, that through his name whosoever believeth in him shall receive remission of sins.
language2_text: Si Yeso o pakacirngan da so ciring da no panoyonoywan na so ciring ni Ama ta do to no kakwa. Ipanci da o ka si Yeso no makavonas so raraten no omanoyong jya tao."

language1_text: While Peter yet spake these words, the Holy Ghost fell on all them which heard the word.
language2_text: Mangononong si Pite am oyatan no Seyzi o omamizing so ciring na tao.

language1_text: And they of the circumcision which believed were astonished, as many as came with Peter, because that on the Gentiles also was poured out the gift of the Holy Ghost.
language2_text: Am ori o nipeyzokab da no tao do Yepey a omraralay ni Yeso a nimacihza ji Pite, ta nipanta na sira ni Ama ta do to so Seyzi o beken a tao do Yotay.

language1_text: For they heard them speak with tongues, and magnify God. Then answered Peter,
language2_text: Ta nimamizing da o kapeyzezyak da so macitarek a ciring a apo do Seyzi a somaray ni Ama ta do to. Maniring si Pite am,

language1_text: Can any man forbid water, that these should not be baptized, which have received the Holy Ghost as well as we?
language2_text: "Yana nioyatan sira no Seyzi akman jyaten. Am ori o ji ta raci sira taktakan."

language1_text: And he commanded them to be baptized in the name of the Lord. Then prayed they him to tarry certain days.
language2_text: So pancyan na nira ni Pite a mangozay do ngaran ni Yeso Kizisto a tomaktak jira.

language1_text: And the apostles and brethren that were in Judæ a heard that the Gentiles had also received the word of God.
language2_text: O nipamnekan ni Yeso a omlivolivon no ciriciring na kano aro a sinjya do Yotay am mamizing da o beken a tao do Yotay a omanoyong rana do ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: And when Peter was come up to Jerusalem, they that were of the circumcision contended with him,
language2_text: Meysinaoli si Pite do Yelosaleng am nioya da no tey makdeng a omahap so iwawalam da no tao do Yotay.

language1_text: saying, Thou wentest in to men uncircumcised, and didst eat with them.
language2_text: Maniring sira am, "Ikongo o yamo nisan do vahay da no beken a tao do Yotay. Ikongo mo ipacihanghang jira."

language1_text: But Peter rehearsed the matter from the beginning, and expounded it by order unto them, saying,
language2_text: Karahan am ononongan na rana jira o niyapoyapwan no akman sang a vazay.

language1_text: I was in the city of Joppa praying: and in a trance I saw a vision, A certain vessel descend, as it had been a great sheet, let down from heaven by four corners; and it came even to me:
language2_text: Maniring jira am, "Meynozi ko do Yepey am nimakacita ko so apo ji Ama ta do to a milakayob a tontonen da apo do teyngato.

language1_text: upon the which when I had fastened mine eyes, I considered, and saw fourfooted beasts of the earth, and wild beasts, and creeping things, and fowls of the air.
language2_text: Citahen ko am amyan do sahad na so meycyamadadayan a omalalam a kano volay a kano meyyasasalap,

language1_text: And I heard a voice saying unto me, Arise, Peter; slay and eat.
language2_text: a kapakamizing ko so macisirsiring jyaken. Maniring am, 'Mo Pite, peytatanek rana kapanzakat mo so yakan mo.'

language1_text: But I said, Not so, Lord: for nothing common or unclean hath at any time entered into my mouth.
language2_text: Am maniring ko am, 'Mo Panirsirngen, taosya, ta ji ko nikoman so sang, ta ji namen ngangana ori a tao do Yotay.'

language1_text: But the voice answered me again from heaven, What God hath cleansed, that call not thou common.
language2_text: Pirwa na so kapanci na nya jyaken am maniring am, 'O ipanci ni Ama ta do to a apya kanen am ji mo mancyan a ji ngangana.'

language1_text: And this was done three times: and all were drawn up again into heaven.
language2_text: O akman rana sang a vazay am ipitlo a mavahangso a kahap da rana sya do hanit.

language1_text: And, behold, immediately there were three men already come unto the house where I was, sent from Cæ sarea unto me.
language2_text: Todey macinao sira makasasnad do nisanan ko a vahay o tatlo a ka beken a tao do Yotay a nitovoy da apo do Kaysadiya a nikomala jyaken.

language1_text: And the Spirit bade me go with them, nothing doubting. Moreover these six brethren accompanied me, and we entered into the man's house:
language2_text: So nipancyan na nyaken no Seyzi so kaji ko ratan so kapacihza ko jira. O ananem eya akma tey kakteh do cinai a mina kararay ko a nyo macita eya am nipehza ko sira jyaken a mangay do Kaysadiya kasdep namen do vahay da Kenaylyo.

language1_text: and he shewed us how he had seen an angel in his house, which stood and said unto him, Send men to Joppa, and call for Simon, whose surname is Peter;
language2_text: Ipanci na jyamen ni Kenaylyo o nimacita na asa ka tinsi a nimeytatanek do vahay da. Maniring jya am, 'Manovoy ka so tao a mangay do Yepey a manci no asa ka tao a meyngaran si Simong Pite a mai jya.

language1_text: who shall tell thee words, whereby thou and all thy house shall be saved.
language2_text: Ta yamyan so na ipanci jinyo a omagaz do kapatazadang na jinyo do teyngato ni Ama ta do to a asa ka vahay.'

language1_text: And as I began to speak, the Holy Ghost fell on them, as on us at the beginning.
language2_text: Nanawen ko sira am to meyhekas jira o Seyzi akman no ka ori pa so kapeyhekas na jyaten no Seyzi.

language1_text: Then remembered I the word of the Lord, how that he said, John indeed baptized with water; but ye shall be baptized with the Holy Ghost.
language2_text: Ori o nipakanakman ko so mina ciring na no Panirsirngen ta a si Yeso. Maniring am, 'Si Yowani rana am nitaktakan na inyo no ranom. Am do kadadayan no araraw am meyhekas jinyo o Seyzi.'

language1_text: Forasmuch then as God gave them the like gift as he did unto us, who believed on the Lord Jesus Christ; what was I, that I could withstand God?
language2_text: So nikanoyong ni Ama ta do to a yatomoro no Seyzi do beken a tao do Yotay, akman jyaten a nipanta na so Seyzi no kanoyong ta ji Yeso Kizisto a Panirsirngen ta. A yako ikongo a kato ko makazazatan do vazay ni Ama ta do to."

language1_text: When they heard these things, they held their peace, and glorified God, saying, Then hath God also to the Gentiles granted repentance unto life.
language2_text: Mamizing da o ciring na jira am ji da rana namwada, ta isaray da si Ama ta do to. Maniring sira am, "Yamanoyong si Ama ta do to a yamarilaw no beken a tao do Yotay a nimamlis rana a na torwan no to meyyonong a ikavyay no pahad da."

language1_text: Now they which were scattered abroad upon the persecution that arose about Stephen travelled as far as Phenice, and Cyprus, and Antioch, preaching the word to none but unto the Jews only.
language2_text: Wakwaken da si Setiven am peyvwaken da na o omraralay ni Yeso a tao. Am ori o nikarwan da do Yelosaleng a mangay tomayo do Vongnise a kado Saypolose a kado Antia a kapeylimwang da no ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to do tao do Yotay.

language1_text: And some of them were men of Cyprus and Cyrene, which, when they were come to Antioch, spake unto the Grecians, preaching the Lord Jesus.
language2_text: Am o tatasa ka tao do Saypolose a pongso a kado Cidinay am nimangay sira do Antia a meylimwang no ciriciring ni Yeso do beken a Yotay.

language1_text: And the hand of the Lord was with them: and a great number believed, and turned unto the Lord.
language2_text: Amyan jira o oyowyat ni Ama ta do to. Am ori o nipeyparo da no tao a omraralay ni Yeso.

language1_text: Then tidings of these things came unto the ears of the church which was in Jerusalem: and they sent forth Barnabas, that he should go as far as Antioch.
language2_text: Mamizing da no omraralay ni Yeso do Yelosaleng o akman sang a vazay am tovoin da si Parnapo a mangay do Antia.

language1_text: Who, when he came, and had seen the grace of God, was glad, and exhorted them all, that with purpose of heart they would cleave unto the Lord.
language2_text: Makaranes rana am tey masaray, ta nimacita na o aryarilaw na sira ni Ama ta do to. Ori o nipaitan na sira to ngotokot so nakenakem ji Yeso.

language1_text: For he was a good man, and full of the Holy Ghost and of faith: and much people was added unto the Lord.
language2_text: Si Parnapo rana am tey yapya o nakenakem na, ta nioyatan no Seyzi. Am ori o ikakdeng na meyhanhan ni Ama ta do to. Ori nipeyparo da no tao a omanoyong ji Yeso.

language1_text: Then departed Barnabas to Tarsus, for to seek Saul:
language2_text: Meyratateng am mangay rana si Parnapo do Tasose a komala si Sawlo.

language1_text: and when he had found him, he brought him unto Antioch. And it came to pass, that a whole year they assembled themselves with the church, and taught much people. And the disciples were called Christians first in Antioch.
language2_text: Makala na rana am palolwen na mangay do Antia. So nipakasa kawan da macikaop do aro a sinjya amnanao sira. Nimacipinda no kano nang o kangaran da rana jira a "omraralay ni Kizisto" do Antia.

language1_text: And in these days came prophets from Jerusalem unto Antioch.
language2_text: No kanang rana am amyan so manoyonoyo so ciring ni Ama ta do to a apo do Yelosaleng a mangay do Antia.

language1_text: And there stood up one of them named Agabus, and signified by the Spirit that there should be great dearth throughout all the world: which came to pass in the days of Claudius Cæ sar.
language2_text: Amyan jira so asa ka tao a meyngaran si Acyapo. Maniring do aro a tao am, "Nipaziman na jyaken no Seyzi o keyyan no omanam a rako a abcil do karawan." (So nipangononong no ciring na no kapeypanirsirngen da si Kelawti.)

language1_text: Then the disciples, every man according to his ability, determined to send relief unto the brethren which dwelt in Judæ a:
language2_text: Am ori o nikamimin da no amraralay ni Yeso a tao a mapeysinsinmo so nizpi a itoro da do akma dey kakteh do cinai a meyvahay do Yotay. To da palololwa do karwaro no nizpi da o panaoben da.

language1_text: Which also they did, and sent it to the elders by the hands of Barnabas and Saul.
language2_text: O nilovot da na nizpi am nipahanhan da si Parnapo a kani Sawlo a mangay nya do panipanirsirngen da do kyokay do Yelosaleng.

language1_text: Now about that time Herod the king stretched forth his hands to vex certain of the church.
language2_text: No kanang rana am nipakakasi na no panirsirngen da a meyngaran so Helote o omraralay ni Yeso a tao,

language1_text: And he killed James the brother of John with the sword.
language2_text: a kawakwak na sya no ipangan si Yake a kakteh na ni Yowani.

language1_text: And because he saw it pleased the Jews, he proceeded further to take Peter also. (Then were the days of unleavened bread.)
language2_text: Macita na sira o tao do Yotay a masaray no akman sang a vazay am mey na rakpen pa si Pite. No kanang am mamaring sira so kanen a koman so jya nimimway a pang.

language1_text: And when he had apprehended him, he put him in prison, and delivered him to four quaternions of soldiers to keep him; intending after Easter to bring him forth to the people.
language2_text: Marakep na si Pite am pasdepen na do pamemtengan a kapahanhan na so meykalsong a tomita sya. Amyan so meykapat a lipenpenan a teypapapat a mapalipalit a tomita sya. Ta naknakmen na ni Helote o kapacici na sya wakwaken do tangain no aro a tao, no mateyka rana sira mamaring so kanen do Iyeci.

language1_text: Peter therefore was kept in prison: but prayer was made without ceasing of the church unto God for him.
language2_text: Am ori o to na peyyani pa si Pite do pamemtengan. So ikakdeng da no omraralay ni Yeso a meynozi nya.

language1_text: And when Herod would have brought him forth, the same night Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, bound with two chains: and the keepers before the door kept the prison.
language2_text: Makasahep rana a kapowbot na si Pite ni Helote a pacicin a wakwaken am mitkeh si Pite do panavavakan da no rarwa meykalsong a mavaod no adwa ka vahalang. O pazevngen am amyan dang so mamzat a meykalsong.

language1_text: And, behold, the angel of the Lord came upon him, and a light shined in the prison: and he smote Peter on the side, and raised him up, saying, Arise up quickly. And his chains fell off from his hands.
language2_text: Am to ngyan so asa ka tinsi ni Ama ta do to a meytatanek. So nicirayan na so pamemtengan a kapinan na do pakaw na ni Pite a yokain. Maniring am, "Kayokay rana." Meyratateng am mina todazavat do lima na ni Pite o nivaod da sya.

language1_text: And the angel said unto him, Gird thyself, and bind on thy sandals. And so he did. And he saith unto him, Cast thy garment about thee, and follow me.
language2_text: Maniring pa o tinsi jya am, "Peyyabtek rana kapeytokap mo." Karahan am meyyabtek rana kapeytokap na ni Pite. Maniring jya o tinsi am, "Peytalili rana o magorogod mo a kapacihza mo jyaken."

language1_text: And he went out, and followed him; and wist not that it was true which was done by the angel; but thought he saw a vision.
language2_text: So nionotan na jya ni Pite a makowbot do pamemtengan. Am ji na tenngi o kanoyong na no vazay na no tinsi, ta ipanci na tateynep na.

language1_text: When they were past the first and the second ward, they came unto the iron gate that leadeth unto the city; which opened to them of his own accord: and they went out, and passed on through one street; and forthwith the angel departed from him.
language2_text: Peyliktawan da o manmanma mamzat a kano ikararwa na am makaranes rana sira do niparing da vahalang a pangengneban a macimingket do ili da. Mina todeywangi. Am ori o nipakowbotan da rana mangonong do asa ka rarahan. Am to na nangpawa ni Pite o tinsi, do kabo na rana do katangked na.

language1_text: And when Peter was come to himself, he said, Now I know of a surety, that the Lord hath sent his angel, and hath delivered me out of the hand of Herod, and from all the expectation of the people of the Jews.
language2_text: Katenngan na rana ni Pite am maniring am, "Ko na katenngan sicyaikwaya o na kanoyong ni Ama ta do to a nimapahanhan so tinsi na a omahap jyaken a komaro do ahapan na so inawan ko ni Helote a kano peymetdehan da jyaken no aro a tao do Yotay."

language1_text: And when he had considered the thing, he came to the house of Mary the mother of John, whose surname was Mark; where many were gathered together praying.
language2_text: Am ori o nyangay na do vahay da Madiya, ina na ni Yowani Make. Do dang rana am kalwalovotan da a meynozi nya.

language1_text: And as Peter knocked at the door of the gate, a damsel came to hearken, named Rhoda.
language2_text: Pokpoken na o pazevngen ni Pite am makowbot o asa ka mavakes a lamlamsoy da a meyngaran so Lota.

language1_text: And when she knew Peter's voice, she opened not the gate for gladness, but ran in, and told how Peter stood before the gate.
language2_text: Katovilan na o izezyak na ni Pite am masaray. Am ori o nyangay na do karwan da. Maniring am, "Yamyan si Pite do pantaw."

language1_text: And they said unto her, Thou art mad. But she constantly affirmed that it was even so. Then said they, It is his angel.
language2_text: Maniring sira jya am, "Ka zomyak ang." Am ji na ablisi o ipanci na. Maniring pa sira jya am, "Ala pahad na ori ni Pite."

language1_text: But Peter continued knocking: and when they had opened the door, and saw him, they were astonished.
language2_text: So nikownay ni Pite do pantaw. Iwangan da am manoyong a si Pite. Am ori o nipeyzokaban da nya.

language1_text: But he, beckoning unto them with the hand to hold their peace, declared unto them how the Lord had brought him out of the prison. And he said, Go shew these things unto James, and to the brethren. And he departed, and went into another place.
language2_text: Kasdep na ni Pite am patalahen na o lima na. Maniring jira am, "Ji kamo meyzezyak, ta ononongan ko na o panpandan no na nipasawayan jyaken ni Ama ta do to do pamemtengan." Maniring pa jira am, "Ipanci nyo pa ji Yake a kano akma nyoy kakteh do cinai." Teyka na ononongan ni Pite o cinasasaodan na am mangay rana do asa ka ili.

language1_text: Now as soon as it was day, there was no small stir among the soldiers, what was become of Peter.
language2_text: Pezak rana am ikazyak da no aro a meykalsong, ta ji da tenngi o nyangayan ni Pite.

language1_text: And when Herod had sought for him, and found him not, he examined the keepers, and commanded that they should be put to death. And he went down from Judæ a to Cæ sarea, and there abode.
language2_text: Am ori o nipancyan na nira ni Helote a komala sya. Am ji da kala. Karahan am pacicin na sira o aro a mamzamzat. Maniring jira am, "Nyo nikongo ori ang." Am abo o asa ka tao a mapasapa jya. Meyoyaoya am to rana manovoy so tao a amzakat sira. Meyratateng am karwan na rana ni Helote o Yotay a mangay a meyvahay do Kaysadiya.

language1_text: And Herod was highly displeased with them of Tyre and Sidon: but they came with one accord to him, and, having made Blastus the king's chamberlain their friend, desired peace; because their country was nourished by the king's country.
language2_text: No kanang am nimakdeng si Helote a nimwoya no tao do Tayar a kado Siton. Am ori o nyangay da ji Polaseto a mapasyasi jya somidong sira macisirsiring ji Helote, ta si Polaseto rana am tomalamozong no vahay na ni Helote. Am ori o nipacihza na jira a mangay ji Helote a mapeyyalalap so nakem da ji Helote. Ta o kanekanen da am apo do ili ni Helote.

language1_text: And upon a set day Herod, arrayed in royal apparel, sat upon his throne, and made an oration unto them.
language2_text: O araw no nipancyan na nira am meyyaywayob rana so ayob no panirsirngen amlisna do lilisnan no panirsirngen a kapangononong na do aro a tao.

language1_text: And the people gave a shout, saying, It is the voice of a god, and not of a man.
language2_text: Mamizing da o ciring na am amlololos o aro a tao. Maniring sira am, "Beken a izezyak no tao ya, ta izezyak no tao do to."

language1_text: And immediately the angel of the Lord smote him, because he gave not God the glory: and he was eaten of worms, and gave up the ghost.
language2_text: Nikakza na ni Helote o kararalay da nya no tao. Meyratateng am mina to meyhekas o tinsi ni Ama ta do to ambakbak jya, ta ji na azwazwaya si Ama ta do to. Am ori o nipanmanma na a nimowwed a kazakat na rana.

language1_text: But the word of God grew and multiplied.
language2_text: Ori rana o nipeylimwang no ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to do dang.

language1_text: And Barnabas and Saul returned from Jerusalem, when they had fulfilled their ministry, and took with them John, whose surname was Mark.
language2_text: Mateyka da rana o vazay da da Parnapo a kani Sawlo do Yelosaleng am palolwen da si Yowani Make a kapeysinaoli da do Antia.

language1_text: Now there were in the church that was at Antioch certain prophets and teachers; as Barnabas, and Simeon that was called Niger, and Lucius of Cyrene, and Manaen, which had been brought up with Herod the tetrarch, and Saul.
language2_text: O kyokay do Antia am amyan so panoyonoywan na so ciring ni Ama ta do to a kano mangnanao a tao. Sira rana am si Parnapo a kani Simoyang a ngaranan da si Vaheng a kano tao do Cidinay a meyngaran so Lociye a kani Manaeng a nipavahay ni ama na ni Helote a panirsirngen do Cyadidi a kani Sawlo.

language1_text: As they ministered to the Lord, and fasted, the Holy Ghost said, Separate me Barnabas and Saul for the work whereunto I have called them.
language2_text: No kararalay da ni Ama ta do to a ji mangakaday am maniring jira o Seyzi am, "Pamnekan nyo si Parnapo a kani Sawlo a mapeyvazay so vazay ko."

language1_text: And when they had fasted and prayed, and laid their hands on them, they sent them away.
language2_text: Mateyka sira meynozi a ji mangakaday am paoptahen da o lima da ji Parnapo a kani Sawlo a ipowyat da sira do vazay da katovoy da rana sira mangay do peycyeylilyan na.

language1_text: So they, being sent forth by the Holy Ghost, departed unto Seleucia; and from thence they sailed to Cyprus.
language2_text: Nipahanhan na no Seyzi si Parnapo a kani Sawlo. Am ori o niosok da mangay do Silyoci a kavang da do avang a mangay do Saypolose a pongso.

language1_text: And when they were at Salamis, they preached the word of God in the synagogues of the Jews: and they had also John to their minister.
language2_text: Makaranes sira do Salami a ili am ipeylimwang da o ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to do aro a peyneynozyan da no tao do Yotay. No kanang am nimacihza jira si Yowani Make a somidong sira do vazay da.

language1_text: And when they had gone through the isle unto Paphos, they found a certain sorcerer, a false prophet, a Jew, whose name was Bar-jesus:
language2_text: Nilivolivon da o pongso do Saypolose. Makaranes sira do Pavo a ili am masazi da dang o asa ka tao do Yotay a meyngaran so Pa-Yeso a mamnek a tao. Ipanci na o kataotao na a panoyonoywan na so ciring ni Ama ta do to. Am malas ori.

language1_text: which was with the deputy of the country, Sergius Paulus, a prudent man; who called for Barnabas and Saul, and desired to hear the word of God.
language2_text: Kagagan na o mateneng a panirsirngen no Saypolose a meyngaran si Secyo Pawlo. Nipanci na si Parnapo a kani Sawlo a mai, ta kakzeben na o kamizing na so ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: But Elymas the sorcerer (for so is his name by interpretation) withstood them, seeking to turn away the deputy from the faith.
language2_text: Am ji na nipya no mamnek a tao. (O ngaran na do Sila am si Idima.) Ta naknakmen na o kazazat na jya a omanoyong ji Yeso.

language1_text: Then Saul, (who also is called Paul, ) filled with the Holy Ghost, set his eyes on him,
language2_text: No kanang rana am nioyatan no Seyzi si Sawlo. (Mamlis rana am meyngaran so Pawlo.) Ori o mina to na pasilapi jya a citahen.

language1_text: and said, O full of all subtilty and all mischief, thou child of the devil, thou enemy of all righteousness, wilt thou not cease to pervert the right ways of the Lord?
language2_text: Maniring jya am, "Imo rana ya am kamo meyyangay so nakenakem a kani Satan a yaji ngahap so vazay ni Ama ta do to, do mo kapanlita a yaomalalas do ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: And now, behold, the hand of the Lord is upon thee, and thou shalt be blind, not seeing the sun for a season. And immediately there fell on him a mist and a darkness; and he went about seeking some to lead him by the hand.
language2_text: So ipeydedna na jimo no peyoyaoyyan ni Ama ta do to. So ikownay mo a mavota ji makacita so araw." Makarahan am jya nimeyyahahay si Idima a masari so citahen a kavota na rana. So nipeykazakazazap na meykala so tao a komalay sya.

language1_text: Then the deputy, when he saw what was done, believed, being astonished at the doctrine of the Lord.
language2_text: Macita na ni Secyo Pawlo o akman sang a vazay am anoyngan na rana si Yeso, do kapeyzokab na no oyowyat no ipangnanao da a omagaz ji Yeso.

language1_text: Now when Paul and his company loosed from Paphos, they came to Perga in Pamphylia: and John departing from them returned to Jerusalem.
language2_text: Meyratateng am mavang sira Pawlo do avang a apo do Pavo a mangay do Peyke a ili a macinapnap do Pangveydiya. Makaranes sira do dang am karwan na sira ni Yowani Make a kapeysinaoli na mangay do Yelosaleng.

language1_text: But when they departed from Perga, they came to Antioch in Pisidia, and went into the synagogue on the sabbath day, and sat down.
language2_text: Am sira Pawlo a kani Parnapo am to sira meysosonong a mangay do asa ka ili a meyngaran so Antia a macinapnap do Pisitiya. O araw na no ipeywalam no tao am mangay sira do peyneynozyan a omamizing so ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: And after the reading of the law and the prophets the rulers of the synagogue sent unto them, saying, Ye men and brethren, if ye have any word of exhortation for the people, say on.
language2_text: Mateyka na vilangan no asa ka tao o nivatvatkan ni Moyse a kano nivatvatkan no panoyonoywan na so ciring ni Ama ta do to am manovoy o panipanirsirngen no peyneynozyan so tao a mapacici sira. Maniring am, "Inyo rana yararwa am si myan so ipait nyo jyamen am ipanci nyo an."

language1_text: Then Paul stood up, and beckoning with his hand said, Men of Israel, and ye that fear God, give audience.
language2_text: Ori nipeytatanek ni Pawlo a mapatala so lima na. Maniring am, "Inyo rana Isedi a tao a ka ninyo a yamraralay ni Ama ta do to am amizngen nyo an.

language1_text: The God of this people of Israel chose our fathers, and exalted the people when they dwelt as strangers in the land of Egypt, and with an high arm brought he them out of it.
language2_text: O Tao do to ta Isedi a tao am na nipamnekan o ineynapo ta amraralay nya. No keyyan da do beken a ili da do Ayci am nipasaod na sira. Meyratateng am agagen na sira no oyowyat na a komaro dang.

language1_text: And about the time of forty years suffered he their manners in the wilderness.
language2_text: No keyyan da pa do kabwan no nihakawan no tao so sikapat a ngarnan (40) so awawan am tana ji da ngamiznga si Ama ta do to am apzatan na sira.

language1_text: And when he had destroyed seven nations in the land of Chanaan, he divided their land to them by lot.
language2_text: Am ori o nibalinasan da so apito a ka ili do Cyanan, ta nisidong na sira no oyowyat na katoro na nya jira so ili da. No kangay da do Ayci a mangay no keyyan da rana do Cyanan am sikalima o ikasikalima na poo (450) no awawan na.

language1_text: And after that he gave unto them judges about the space of four hundred and fifty years, until Samuel the prophet.
language2_text: "Meyratateng am ipamnek na sira so mapalipalit a amyokod nira mangay no kapeypanirsirngen na ni Samoar. Iya rana am panoyonoywan na so ciring ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: And afterward they desired a king: and God gave unto them Saul the son of Cis, a man of the tribe of Benjamin, by the space of forty years.
language2_text: No kanang am ikakza da o keyyan no asa ka panirsirngen da. So nipamnekan na ji Sawlo anak ni Cise sivovoong ni Penyaming a meypanirsirngen so sikapat a ngarnan (40) so awawan.

language1_text: And when he had removed him, he raised up unto them David to be their king; to whom also he gave testimony, and said, I have found David the son of Jesse, a man after mine own heart, which shall fulfil all my will.
language2_text: Pakarwen na ni Ama ta do to si Sawlo am pamnekan na si Tawey a panirsirngen da. Maniring si Ama ta do to am, 'Yako ikaglaw si Tawey anak ni Yesi, ta na miminen o vazay ko ahapen.'

language1_text: Of this man's seed hath God according to his promise raised unto Israel a Saviour, Jesus:
language2_text: Si Tawey rana am ineynapo na ni Yeso a nitovoy ni Ama ta do to a mapatazadang jyaten do teyngato a sivosivovoong ni Isedi. Ta ori o nipanci na no kakwa pa ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: when John had first preached before his coming the baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel.
language2_text: No kaji na pa mangnanawan ni Yeso am nimanma rana si Yowani a mapaziman so Isedi a tao a komaro do peyraratenan da kataktak na jira.

language1_text: And as John fulfilled his course, he said, Whom think ye that I am? I am not he. But, behold, there cometh one after me, whose shoes of his feet I am not worthy to loose.
language2_text: Makeykai rana o vazay ni Yowani a komavos am ipanci na jira. Maniring am, 'Nyo katenngan yaken an? Yaken rana am beken a mapatazadang jinyo do teyngato a nyo pananalahen a mai. Ta yamyan pa so yamai a maizaizay pa ka nyaken. So ikabo no pacicingayan ko jya a omovay so iktan no tokap na.'"

language1_text: Men and brethren, children of the stock of Abraham, and whosoever among you feareth God, to you is the word of this salvation sent.
language2_text: Maniring pa jira si Pawlo am, "Manga kakteh a sivosivovoong na ni Apolahan a ka ninyo a yamraralay ni Ama ta do to a beken a tao do Yotay, yaten o nipeylimwangan na no ciriciring a omagaz do kapatazadang na jyaten do teyngato ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: For they that dwell at Jerusalem, and their rulers, because they knew him not, nor yet the voices of the prophets which are read every sabbath day, they have fulfilled them in condemning him.
language2_text: Am o yameyvahay do Yelosaleng a tao a kano panipanirsirngen da am da jyatenngi si Yeso a nitovoy ni Ama ta do to a mapatazadang jyaten. Tana yamangday do ipeywalam no tao o na keyyan no da mamizing do peyneynozyan da am da jyatenngi o peypeypangayan no nivatvatkan no panoyonoywan na so ciring ni Ama ta do to a omagaz ji Yeso. So nipangononong no mina ciring da no panoyonoywan na so ciring ni Ama ta do to, do mina kapanci da ni Yeso a wakwaken.

language1_text: And though they found no cause of death in him, yet desired they Pilate that he should be slain.
language2_text: Tana ji da kala o karatan na izakat da sya am pakotokoten da ji Pilato o kazakat da sya.

language1_text: And when they had fulfilled all that was written of him, they took him down from the tree, and laid him in a sepulchre.
language2_text: Mangononong rana o nivatvatkan do Seysyo a omagaz ji Yeso am akasen da rana do jyojika kapakakasa da sya do heseb na.

language1_text: But God raised him from the dead:
language2_text: Am nivyay na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: and he was seen many days of them which came up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem, who are his witnesses unto the people.
language2_text: O mina kararay na apo do Cyadidi a mangay do Yelosaleng am nimacita da si Yeso a nimirwa a mavyay do sikapat a ngarnan (40) so araraw. Sira ori nimeylimwang ni Yeso jyaten a tao do Yotay, do kanimakacita da sya.

language1_text: And we declare unto you glad tidings, how that the promise which was made unto the fathers, God hath fulfilled the same unto us their children, in that he hath raised up Jesus again; as it is also written in the second psalm, Thou art my Son, this day have I begotten thee.
language2_text: Sicyaraw rana ya am namen ipeylimwang jinyo o Mapasaray a Ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to. O nipanci na pa ni Ama ta do to do ineynapo ta am yana nimangononong jyaten an. Ta na nivyay si Yeso ni Ama ta do to akman so nivatvatkan do ikadwa na no Anwanood. Maniring am, 'Imo am Anak ko imo an. So peylimwangan ko nimo sicyaraw eya do yamo kapeyyama jyaken.'Sicyaraw rana ya am namen ipeylimwang jinyo o Mapasaray a Ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to. O nipanci na pa ni Ama ta do to do ineynapo ta am yana nimangononong jyaten an. Ta na nivyay si Yeso ni Ama ta do to akman so nivatvatkan do ikadwa na no Anwanood. Maniring am, 'Imo am Anak ko imo an. So peylimwangan ko nimo sicyaraw eya do yamo kapeyyama jyaken.'

language1_text: And as concerning that he raised him up from the dead, now no more to return to corruption, he said on this wise, I will give you the sure mercies of David.
language2_text: Si Ama ta do to rana a nimapeyvangon sya do heseb na a ji mamyapya nya mirwa a mawakwak am maniring am, 'To ko peynara ji Tawey o aryarilaw ko jinyo.'

language1_text: Wherefore he saith also in another psalm, Thou shalt not suffer thine Holy One to see corruption.
language2_text: Maniring pa si Tawey do nivatvatkan a Anwanood am, 'Mo ji mamyapyan o kataotao no nipamnekan mo a tao a macirapa do tana.'

language1_text: For David, after he had served his own generation by the will of God, fell on sleep, and was laid unto his fathers, and saw corruption:
language2_text: No kapeyigegen na pa ni Tawey am aro mina vazay na ji Ama ta do to. Mawakwak am patangkeden da o heseb na do heseb da no ineynapo na. So nipacirapa no kataotao na do tana.

language1_text: but he, whom God raised again, saw no corruption.
language2_text: Am si Yeso am jya nimakman so sang o kataotao na, ta nivyay na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: Be it known unto you therefore, men and brethren, that through this man is preached unto you the forgiveness of sins: and by him all that believe are justified from all things, from which ye could not be justified by the law of Moses.
language2_text: Manga kakteh, naknakmen nyo an. No si ji nyo meyhanhanan si Yeso am jyavonas o raraten nyo. O iwawalam na ni Moyse am ji na agag inyo do peyraratenan nyo an. Am yaomanoyong ji Yeso a tao am oyatan na sira a komaro do peyraratenan da. Manga kakteh, naknakmen nyo an. No si ji nyo meyhanhanan si Yeso am jyavonas o raraten nyo. O iwawalam na ni Moyse am ji na agag inyo do peyraratenan nyo an. Am yaomanoyong ji Yeso a tao am oyatan na sira a komaro do peyraratenan da.

language1_text: Beware therefore, lest that come upon you, which is spoken of in the prophets;
language2_text: Am ori o apzatan nyo do onowned nyo. Ta meydedna jinyo o peyoyaoyyan na ni Ama ta do to a domket do vakong da no panoyonoywan na so ciring ni Ama ta do to. Maniring sira am,

language1_text: Behold, ye despisers, and wonder, and perish: For I work a work in your days, A work which ye shall in no wise believe, though a man declare it unto you.
language2_text: 'Inyo a yamangolala a tao am amizngen nyo an. Amyan so macita nyo a ikanyahey nyo a vazay a pasingsingtan ko jinyo. Tana yamyan so tao a mapaziman sya jinyo am nyo ji nganoyngi.'"

language1_text: And when the Jews were gone out of the synagogue, the Gentiles besought that these words might be preached to them the next sabbath.
language2_text: Mateyka rana mangononong si Pawlo am karwan da rana kani Parnapo o peyneynozyan. Maniring sira o niomamizing sya a tao am, "Si ipisa kapeywalam no tao am mai kamo pa omnanao jyamen."

language1_text: Now when the congregation was broken up, many of the Jews and religious proselytes followed Paul and Barnabas: who, speaking to them, persuaded them to continue in the grace of God.
language2_text: Meysyasyay rana sira am aro tao a macilolo ji Pawlo a kani Parnapo. Ipait da sira a to ngotokot so nakem a meyhanhan ni Ama ta do to a yasomidong sira. Sira rana am tao do Yotay a kano beken a tao do Yotay a mahap rana so iwawalam no tao do Yotay.

language1_text: And the next sabbath day came almost the whole city together to hear the word of God.
language2_text: Ipisa kapeywalam no tao am mamimin sira o tao a nimangay a omamizing so ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: But when the Jews saw the multitudes, they were filled with envy, and spake against those things which were spoken by Paul, contradicting and blaspheming.
language2_text: Am macita da no tao do Yotay o karo da no meylovolovot a tao am ikeynanahet da sira. Am ori o rehrehtan da si Pawlo a kano ciriciring na.

language1_text: Then Paul and Barnabas waxed bold, and said, It was necessary that the word of God should first have been spoken to you: but seeing ye put it from you, and judge yourselves unworthy of everlasting life, lo, we turn to the Gentiles.
language2_text: Am ikakdekdeng ni Pawlo a kani Parnapo a meyzezyak a omnanao sira. Maniring sira am, "O ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to am nimanma kamo a peylimwangan nya. Am nyo kaji nganoyngan jya. Nyo to nazibwan o na kapanta ninyo ni Ama ta do to so to meyyonong a ikavyay no pahad nyo. Am ori o namen karwan rana jinyo a mangay do beken a tao do Yotay.

language1_text: For so hath the Lord commanded us, saying, I have set thee to be a light of the Gentiles, That thou shouldest be for salvation unto the ends of the earth.
language2_text: Ta yamyan so na nipakolivava rana jyamen ni Ama ta do to a ciring na. Maniring jyamen am, 'Ko na nipamnekan inyo a akma dey zezngang no beken a tao do Yotay. Ipeylimwang nyo do peycyamahamahatawan na o kapatazadang ko sira do teyngato.'"

language1_text: And when the Gentiles heard this, they were glad, and glorified the word of the Lord: and as many as were ordained to eternal life believed.
language2_text: Mamizing da no beken a tao do Yotay am masaray sira. Ori o nyazwazwayan da so ciring na ni Ama ta do to. Sira rana aro a tao am nakenakem na ni Ama ta do to o kapamnek na jira a mahap so to meyyonong a ikavyay no pahad da, do kanoyong da rana ji Yeso.

language1_text: And the word of the Lord was published throughout all the region.
language2_text: So nikamimin da rana do peycyeylilyan na makamizing so ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: But the Jews stirred up the devout and honourable women, and the chief men of the city, and raised persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and expelled them out of their coasts.
language2_text: Am pasozisozin da no tao do Yotay o maizay a mahakay a kano meynakem a mavakes a omraralay ni Ama ta do to a mapakakasi si Pawlo a kani Parnapo. Ori o nipowbotan da sira do ili da.

language1_text: But they shook off the dust of their feet against them, and came unto Iconium.
language2_text: Am ori o nitoktokan da so tana do ai da da Pawlo a kani Parnapo a itovil da jira meyraraten a ji mamlis so nakenakem. Meyratateng am karwan da rana sira a mangay do Ikenyan.

language1_text: And the disciples were filled with joy, and with the Holy Ghost.
language2_text: Masasaray sira o amraralay ni Yeso a tao do Antia do kowyat na jira no Seyzi.

language1_text: And it came to pass in Iconium, that they went both together into the synagogue of the Jews, and so spake, that a great multitude both of the Jews and also of the Greeks believed.
language2_text: Makaranes si Pawlo a kani Parnapo do Ikenyan a ili am mangay sira do peyneynozyan da no tao do Yotay a mangnanao. So nikaro no tao do Yotay a kano beken a tao do Yotay a omanoyong rana ji Yeso.

language1_text: But the unbelieving Jews stirred up the Gentiles, and made their minds evil affected against the brethren.
language2_text: Am o jyakey a manganoyong a tao do Yotay am pasozisozin da sira o beken a tao do Yotay a macioya do amraralay ni Yeso.

language1_text: Long time therefore abode they speaking boldly in the Lord, which gave testimony unto the word of his grace, and granted signs and wonders to be done by their hands.
language2_text: Am mownay pa dang si Pawlo a kani Parnapo. Ji sira nimamogaw a meylimwang ni Yeso. Ta nioyatan na sira ni Ama ta do to. Am aro o mapeyzokab a vazay da yongkad no ipeylimwang da pangangarilawan na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: But the multitude of the city was divided: and part held with the Jews, and part with the apostles.
language2_text: So nipeypinpin da no tao do dang. O asa lipenpenan am macikagom do tao do Yotay. O asa lipenpenan am macyagom da Pawlo a kani Parnapo a omanoyong do nanao da.

language1_text: And when there was an assault made both of the Gentiles, and also of the Jews with their rulers, to use them despitefully, and to stone them,
language2_text: Am o tao do Yotay a kano panipanirsirngen da kano kararay da beken a tao do Yotay am naknakmen da o kapaciliman da ji Pawlo a kani Parnapo a agsagsahan.

language1_text: they were ware of it, and fled unto Lystra and Derbe, cities of Lycaonia, and unto the region that lieth round about:
language2_text: Mamizing ni Pawlo a kani Parnapo am somazok sira do Disetela kado Tepey a ili a macinapnap do Dikawniya kado macisngen dang a ili,

language1_text: and there they preached the gospel.
language2_text: kapeylimwang da dang no Mapasaray a Ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: And there sat a certain man at Lystra, impotent in his feet, being a cripple from his mother's womb, who never had walked:
language2_text: Amyan do Disetela so asa ka mahakay a nimeycicinda a ji makalam no katazak na tao.

language1_text: the same heard Paul speak: who stedfastly beholding him, and perceiving that he had faith to be healed,
language2_text: Amizngen na o ipangnanao na ni Pawlo am to na ningkaji ni Pawlo. Milamdam na ni Pawlo a meyhanhan ni Ama ta do to am iwakwakan na.

language1_text: said with a loud voice, Stand upright on thy feet. And he leaped and walked.
language2_text: Maniring jya am, "Peytatanek rana," a kapeytatanek na rana omalam.

language1_text: And when the people saw what Paul had done, they lifted up their voices, saying in the speech of Lycaonia, The gods are come down to us in the likeness of men.
language2_text: Macita da o vazay ni Pawlo no aro a tao am amlololos sira meyzezyak so ciriciring no Dikawniya a ji da tenngi a amizngen da Pawlo. Maniring sira am, "Asyo sira ya yakmey mina to meyhekas a tao do to."

language1_text: And they called Barnabas, Jupiter; and Paul, Mercurius, because he was the chief speaker.
language2_text: Karahan am ngaranan da sira no ngaran no tao do to da. O ningaran da ji Parnapo am si Sose. Si Pawlo am si Hemeyse, ta iya o meyzezyak.

language1_text: Then the priest of Jupiter, which was before their city, brought oxen and garlands unto the gates, and would have done sacrifice with the people.
language2_text: Amyan do siri no ili da so raralayan da ni Sose. No kanang amyan so asa ka tao a mapatanatanang so pazos da mangalak so baka meytaktakzes so savong no kayo a mangay do samorangan no ili da a amzakat so baka a omraralay ni Pawlo a kani Parnapo.

language1_text: Which when the apostles, Barnabas and Paul, heard of, they rent their clothes, and ran in among the people, crying out,
language2_text: Milamdam na ni Parnapo a kani Pawlo o nakenakem da no aro a tao am marahet o onowned da. Am ori o nizamitan da so talili da kangay da do tangain da no aro a tao. Maniring sira am,

language1_text: and saying, Sirs, why do ye these things? We also are men of like passions with you, and preach unto you that ye should turn from these vanities unto the living God, which made heaven, and earth, and the sea, and all things that are therein:
language2_text: "Ikongo nyo icyakman so sang so vazay jyamen. Namen akman jinyo saon a tao am. O namen nyai jya am namen ipeylimwang jinyo o Mapasaray a Ciriciring ni Yeso. Namen ikakza inyo a komaro do ji meyngongyod a iraralay nyo. Apyapya pa o kararalay nyo no manoyong a Tao do to. Iya rana am nimangamamaog so karawan a kano meycyamadadayan.

language1_text: who in times past suffered all nations to walk in their own ways.
language2_text: No kakwa pa am nipya na inyo a beken a tao do Yotay a to ngonongonong do nakenakem nyo.

language1_text: Nevertheless he left not himself without witness, in that he did good, and gave us rain from heaven, and fruitful seasons, filling our hearts with food and gladness.
language2_text: Am yaro makakaday a yapya vazay na yongkad na jinyo a yamarilaw ninyo. Na ipanta inyo so cimoy. Na nipasaod o mowamowa nyo. Na absoin inyo. Na pasarain o onowned nyo."

language1_text: And with these sayings scarce restrained they the people, that they had not done sacrifice unto them.
language2_text: Tana ipeypanci da Pawlo o ka beken a tao do to da am ji sira aza o taotao a omraralay nira.

language1_text: And there came thither certain Jews from Antioch and Iconium, who persuaded the people, and, having stoned Paul, drew him out of the city, supposing he had been dead.
language2_text: Am o tao do Yotay a nimapo do Ikenyan a kado Antia a macinapnap do Pisitiya am paksozen da o aro a tao a kagsegseh da ji Pawlo. Ipanci da nimazakat rana. Am ori o nilolwan da sya yangay do siri no ili da.

language1_text: Howbeit, as the disciples stood round about him, he rose up, and came into the city: and the next day he departed with Barnabas to Derbe.
language2_text: Limoten da no amraralay ni Yeso a tao am to meytatanek a meyvangon a kangay na rana do ili da. Ikadwa na araw am mangay rana sira kani Parnapo do Tepey.

language1_text: And when they had preached the gospel to that city, and had taught many, they returned again to Lystra, and to Iconium, and Antioch,
language2_text: Makaranes sira do Tepey am ipeylimwang da o Mapasaray a Ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to. Am ori o nipeyparo da no tao a omanoyong rana ji Yeso. Meyratateng am meysinaoli rana sira mangay do Disetela kado Ikenyan a kado Antia ili a macinapnap do Pisitiya.

language1_text: confirming the souls of the disciples, and exhorting them to continue in the faith, and that we must through much tribulation enter into the kingdom of God.
language2_text: So nikakadayan da so amraralay ni Yeso a tao a paiten so nakem a to ngotokot a amraralay ni Ama ta do to. Maniring sira jira am, "Yaten rana a yamraralay ni Yeso am aro masapa ta alalaw no macikaop ta do italamozong na ni Ama ta do to."

language1_text: And when they had ordained them elders in every church, and had prayed with fasting, they commended them to the Lord, on whom they believed.
language2_text: Meyratateng am mamnek sira so panipanirsirngen da do peycyakyokyokayan na a madaday do teyhesa ka ili. Ji sira mangakaday a meynozi nira ji Ama ta do to.

language1_text: And after they had passed throughout Pisidia, they came to Pamphylia.
language2_text: Mangay rana sira am meyhatay sira do Pisitiya. Mownay am makaranes sira do Pangveydiya.

language1_text: And when they had preached the word in Perga, they went down into Attalia:
language2_text: So nipangnanao da do Peyke. Meyratateng am meypangay sira do Atadiya.

language1_text: and thence sailed to Antioch, from whence they had been recommended to the grace of God for the work which they fulfilled.
language2_text: Komavos rana o vazay da do dang am somakay sira do avang a meysinaoli do Antia. Ta do dang nipamnekan na jira ni Ama ta do to a mahap so vazay na. So nikavos na rana no vazay da.

language1_text: And when they were come, and had gathered the church together, they rehearsed all that God had done with them, and how he had opened the door of faith unto the Gentiles.
language2_text: Makaranes rana sira do Antia am lovoten da sira o sinjya a kapanci da nya jira so nisidongan na sira ni Ama ta do to do vazay da. Ta o ipeylimwang da do tao a ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to am nyanoyngan da no beken a tao do Yotay.

language1_text: And there they abode long time with the disciples.
language2_text: So nikownay da dang da Pawlo a kani Parnapo a macikaop do akma dey kakteh do cinai do Antia.

language1_text: And certain men which came down from Judæ a taught the brethren, and said, Except ye be circumcised after the manner of Moses, ye cannot be saved.
language2_text: Amyan so tao a apo do Yotay a nimai do Antia a omnanao so sinjya do dang. Maniring sira am, "No si ji nyo mangozai o iwawalam na ni Moyse a amyongkad do kataotao nyo a meyngongyod a Isedi am ji na patazadanga inyo ni Ama ta do to do teyngato."

language1_text: When therefore Paul and Barnabas had no small dissension and disputation with them, they determined that Paul and Barnabas, and certain other of them, should go up to Jerusalem unto the apostles and elders about this question.
language2_text: Si Pawlo a kani Parnapo am nimakdeng sira nimacigalagal jira do akman sang a malas a nanao. Am ori o nipamnekan da ji Pawlo a kani Parnapo a kano tatasa ka sinjya a mangay do Yelosaleng a macisirsiring nya do nipamnekan ni Yeso a omlivolivon no ciriciring na kano panipanirsirngen do kyokay.

language1_text: And being brought on their way by the church, they passed through Phenice and Samaria, declaring the conversion of the Gentiles: and they caused great joy unto all the brethren.
language2_text: Meyratateng am tovoin da rana sira no akma dey kakteh do cinai a mangay. So nyangay da tomazogaw no sinjya do Vongnise a kado Samadiya. Maniring sira jira am, "Yaro rana o beken a tao do Yotay a yarana omanoyong ji Yeso." Mamizing da ori am masaray sira.

language1_text: And when they were come to Jerusalem, they were received of the church, and of the apostles and elders, and they declared all things that God had done with them.
language2_text: Makaranes rana sira do Yelosaleng am taotawwen da sira no akma dey kakteh do cinai a kano panipanirsirngen da do kyokay a kano nipamnekan ni Yeso a omlivolivon no ciriciring na. So niononongan da jya da Pawlo a kani Parnapo so nisidongan na sira ni Ama ta do to do vazay da.

language1_text: But there rose up certain of the sect of the Pharisees which believed, saying, That it was needful to circumcise them, and to command them to keep the law of Moses.
language2_text: Maniring o tatasa ka amraralay ni Yeso a tao a macyagom do Vadisay am, "Jyabo kaji da yongkadan do kataotao da no beken a tao do Yotay a mangozay do iwawalam ni Moyse a."

language1_text: And the apostles and elders came together for to consider of this matter.
language2_text: Meyratateng am peysirisiring da no nipamnekan ni Yeso a omlivolivon no ciriciring na kano panipanirsirngen da do kyokay o ciring da no tao a macyagom do Vadisay.

language1_text: And when there had been much disputing, Peter rose up, and said unto them, Men and brethren, ye know how that a good while ago God made choice among us, that the Gentiles by my mouth should hear the word of the gospel, and believe.
language2_text: So nikownay da nimeysirisiring. Meyratateng am meytatanek si Pite. Maniring jira am, "Manga kakteh, nyo katenngan yaken a na nipamnekan ni Ama ta do to a mangay a mapamizing so beken a tao do Yotay no Mapasaray a Ciriciring.

language1_text: And God, which knoweth the hearts, bare them witness, giving them the Holy Ghost, even as he did unto us;
language2_text: Si Ama ta do to rana am katenngan na o onowned no tao. So nitorwan na no Seyzi do beken a tao do Yotay, akman jyaten a nitorwan na nya,

language1_text: and put no difference between us and them, purifying their hearts by faith.
language2_text: pacittan na no kapeyyangangay na jyaten a patazadangen do teyngato. Na nivonas o raraten da no beken a tao do Yotay, do da kanoyong rana ji Yeso.

language1_text: Now therefore why tempt ye God, to put a yoke upon the neck of the disciples, which neither our fathers nor we were able to bear?
language2_text: Nyo ileylamdamen si Ama ta do to? Nyo pancyan no kamimin no iwawalam ta tao do Yotay a ahapen da no yamraralay ni Yeso a beken a tao do Yotay? To ko na macitangain jinyo am ji da nimataptap no ineynapo ta o iwawalam ni Moyse a pangozayan.

language1_text: But we believe that through the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ we shall be saved, even as they.
language2_text: Yaten rana am meyyangay ta kano beken a tao do Yotay a patazadangen ni Ama ta do to do teyngato, do ta kapeyhanhan no pangangarilawan na ni Yeso a Panirsirngen ta."

language1_text: Then all the multitude kept silence, and gave audience to Barnabas and Paul, declaring what miracles and wonders God had wrought among the Gentiles by them.
language2_text: So ikabo no meykazyazyak a tao a omamizing so ononongan ni Parnapo a kani Pawlo, do kapeyzokab da no vazay da do beken a tao do Yotay, ta nisidong na sira ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: And after they had held their peace, James answered, saying, Men and brethren, hearken unto me:
language2_text: Mateyka sira a mangononong am meyzezyak si Yake. Maniring am, "Manga kakteh, amizngen nyo an.

language1_text: Simeon hath declared how God at the first did visit the Gentiles, to take out of them a people for his name.
language2_text: O nipanci ni Simong Pite no kacitai ori am na nipanci o kanimamnek na ni Ama ta do to do beken a tao do Yotay a omanoyong jya.

language1_text: And to this agree the words of the prophets; as it is written,
language2_text: O akman sang a vazay am mina todey mangononong do nivatvatkan da no panoyonoywan na so ciring ni Ama ta do to no kakwa. Maniring am,

language1_text: After this I will return, And will build again the tabernacle of David, which is fallen down; And I will build again the ruins thereof, And I will set it up:
language2_text: 'No makwa am meysinaoli ko pa a mapatnek so yakma raney nimazkem a vahay ni Tawey.

language1_text: That the residue of men might seek after the Lord, And all the Gentiles, upon whom my name is called, Saith the Lord, who doeth all these things.
language2_text: Ta ori o ikamimin da omanop jyaken no nipamnekan ko a beken a tao do Yotay.

language1_text: Known unto God are all his works from the beginning of the world.
language2_text: Ori rana am ciring na ni Ama ta do to a nipamizing na jira no kakwa pa.'"

language1_text: Wherefore my sentence is, that we trouble not them, which from among the Gentiles are turned to God:
language2_text: Maniring pa si Yake am, "O nakenakem ko am taosya o kapeyparo ta so vazay da no yarana amraralay ni Ama ta do to a beken a tao do Yotay.
