language1_text: but that we write unto them, that they abstain from pollutions of idols, and from fornication, and from things strangled, and from blood.
language2_text: Apyapya pa o kapeyteygami ta nira a manci no kaji da nganan so nipazos da. Taosya o kapangzakza da so icyatatao da. Taosya o kakan da so rala no vinyay a kano nivitkeh da vinyay a nimazakat a jya nimvoyog so rala.

language1_text: For Moses of old time hath in every city them that preach him, being read in the synagogues every sabbath day.
language2_text: Ta nimakalapo no kakwa do ipeywalam no tao o keyyan no tao do peyneynozyan amvilang do iwawalam ni Moyse. So na icyakman sang do peycyeylilyan na a yada ipeylimwang do tao."

language1_text: Then pleased it the apostles and elders, with the whole church, to send chosen men of their own company to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas; namely, Judas surnamed Barsabas, and Silas, chief men among the brethren:
language2_text: No kanang am mamnek sira o nipamnekan ni Yeso a omlivolivon no ciriciring na kano panipanirsirngen do kyokay a kano amraralay ni Yeso a tao so pahanhanen da macihza ji Pawlo a kani Parnapo a mangay do Antia. So nipamnekan da ji Sila kani Yota. O kasaing no ngaran ni Yota am si Pasapa. Ikanig da sira ori no akma dey kakteh do cinai.

language1_text: and they wrote letters by them after this manner; The apostles and elders and brethren send greeting unto the brethren which are of the Gentiles in Antioch and Syria and Cilicia:
language2_text: O peypeypangayan no domket a ciring do teygami ori am:" Kokay kamo akma nameney kakteh do cinai a beken a tao do Yotay a yamyan do Antia ka ninyo a yamyan do Sidiya ka ninyo a yamyan do Cidicya. Yamen a kakteh nyo a nipamnekan ni Yeso a omlivolivon no ciriciring na kano panipanirsirngen do kyokay am namen meyteygami jinyo.

language1_text: forasmuch as we have heard, that certain which went out from us have troubled you with words, subverting your souls, saying, Ye must be circumcised, and keep the law: to whom we gave no such commandment:
language2_text: Namen nimamizing sira o yatatasa ka tao a mangononong so malas a yanyo ikarahet so onowned. Am yabo o asa ka tao a namen nitovoy.

language1_text: it seemed good unto us, being assembled with one accord, to send chosen men unto you with our beloved Barnabas and Paul,
language2_text: Am ori o namen nipeysirsirngan nya no kapanovoy namen so mangay jinyo do dang. So da ipacihza ji Parnapo a kani Pawlo a akma tey kakteh do cinai,

language1_text: men that have hazarded their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.
language2_text: ta sira rana am da ji hawan o inawan da a mahap so vazay ni Yeso Kizisto a Panirsirngen ta.

language1_text: We have sent therefore Judas and Silas, who shall also tell you the same things by mouth.
language2_text: O namen nipamnekan rana am si Yota kani Sila. Sira o namen hanhan a manci no ciring namen do teygami eya.

language1_text: For it seemed good to the Holy Ghost, and to us, to lay upon you no greater burden than these necessary things;
language2_text: Ta namen ipeyhanhan o Seyzi a macyanoyong jyamen a ji mapeyparo so vazay nyo. O makekdeng rana a ciring o itoro namen jinyo a pangozayan nyo.

language1_text: that ye abstain from meats offered to idols, and from blood, and from things strangled, and from fornication: from which if ye keep yourselves, ye shall do well. Fare ye well.
language2_text: Taosya o kakan nyo so nipazos da. Taosya o kakan nyo so rala no vinyay a kano nivitkeh da vinyay a nimazakat a jya nimvoyog so rala. Taosya o kapangzakza nyo so icyatatao nyo. Si pangozayan nyo ori am ipeypapya nyo ori. Inaoy si apzatan na inyo ni Ama ta do to."

language1_text: So when they were dismissed, they came to Antioch: and when they had gathered the multitude together, they delivered the epistle:
language2_text: Mangay rana sira o nipamnekan da do Antia am lovoten da rana sira o yamraralay ni Yeso a katoro da no teygami da jira.

language1_text: which when they had read, they rejoiced for the consolation.
language2_text: Vilangan da rana o teygami da jira am masasaray sira, ta apiya o ciring da ipait da sira.

language1_text: And Judas and Silas, being prophets also themselves, exhorted the brethren with many words, and confirmed them.
language2_text: Si Yota kani Sila am mateneng sira mangononong so ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to. Am ori o ikaro no ciriciring da ipowyat da so onowned da no akma dey kakteh do cinai.

language1_text: And after they had tarried there a space, they were let go in peace from the brethren unto the apostles.
language2_text: So nikownay da dang a nimiseysan. Mangay rana sira am taitaiden da sira no akma dey kakteh do cinai a meysinaoli rana do Yelosaleng.

language1_text: Notwithstanding it pleased Silas to abide there still.
language2_text: [Am si Sila am mina todavezed do dang.]

language1_text: Paul also and Barnabas continued in Antioch, teaching and preaching the word of the Lord, with many others also.
language2_text: Si Pawlo a kani Parnapo am amyan pa sira do Antia amnanao so tao a meylimwang ni Yeso. So nikaro no mina kararay da somidong sira do vazay da.

language1_text: And some days after Paul said unto Barnabas, Let us go again and visit our brethren in every city where we have preached the word of the Lord, and see how they do.
language2_text: Kadadayan na rana do araraw am ipanci na ni Pawlo ji Parnapo o kapeysinaoli da do aro a ili a nipeylimwangan da rana no ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to a tomita so akma dey kakteh do cinai.

language1_text: And Barnabas determined to take with them John, whose surname was Mark.
language2_text: Naknakmen na ni Parnapo si Yowani Make a palolwen da macihza jira.

language1_text: But Paul thought not good to take him with them, who departed from them from Pamphylia, and went not with them to the work.
language2_text: Am ji na mya ni Pawlo. Ta no keypisa am jya nimakey a macihza jira si Yowani Make. Am ori o nipacisyay na jira do Pangveydiya.

language1_text: And the contention was so sharp between them, that they departed asunder one from the other: and so Barnabas took Mark, and sailed unto Cyprus;
language2_text: Am ori o ji da nimacipasovoi do vazay da. Karahan am to sira meysyay rana. Si Parnapo rana am nipalolo na si Make a mavang do avang a mangay do Saypolose a pongso.

language1_text: and Paul chose Silas, and departed, being recommended by the brethren unto the grace of God.
language2_text: Si Pawlo rana am nipamnekan na si Sila a macihza jya. Karwan da sira o akma dey kakteh do cinai am ipeynozi da sira ji Ama ta do to a omzat jira.

language1_text: And he went through Syria and Cilicia, confirming the churches.
language2_text: So nilivonan da so peycyeylilyan na do Sidiya kado Cidicya a mapait so onowned da no akma dey kakteh do cinai.

language1_text: Then came he to Derbe and Lystra: and, behold, a certain disciple was there, named Timotheus, the son of a certain woman, which was a Jewess, and believed; but his father was a Greek:
language2_text: Mangay sira do Tepey a kado Disetela am amyan dang so asa ka tao a amraralay ni Yeso a meyngaran si Timotay. O ina na am tao do Yotay a amraralay ni Yeso. Am o ama na am tao do Sila.

language1_text: which was well reported of by the brethren that were at Lystra and Iconium.
language2_text: Ikanig da si Timotay no akma dey kakteh do cinai do Disetela kado Ikenyan.

language1_text: Him would Paul have to go forth with him; and took and circumcised him because of the Jews which were in those quarters: for they knew all that his father was a Greek.
language2_text: Palolwen na ni Pawlo si Timotay am yongkadan na o kataotao na no iwawalam no tao do Yotay, ta panadnaden na o tao do dang a makateneng ji ama na a beken a tao do Yotay.

language1_text: And as they went through the cities, they delivered them the decrees for to keep, that were ordained of the apostles and elders which were at Jerusalem.
language2_text: Omrateng sira do peycyeylilyan na am ipanci da o mina kaygi da do Yelosaleng no nipamnekan ni Yeso a omlivolivon no ciriciring na kano panipanirsirngen do kyokay do dang a panginginaran da.

language1_text: And so were the churches established in the faith, and increased in number daily.
language2_text: Am ori o nipeypahagnat da so onowned do peycyakyokyokayan na. So nipangday da so araraw a meyparo no omanoyong rana ji Yeso a tao.

language1_text: Now when they had gone throughout Phrygia and the region of Galatia, and were forbidden of the Holy Ghost to preach the word in Asia,
language2_text: Ikongo do ji na mya sira no Seyzi a mangay a meylimwang no ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to do Yasiya, am ori o nipangonong da do Vodicya kado Cyalatay.

language1_text: after they were come to Mysia, they assayed to go into Bithynia: but the Spirit suffered them not.
language2_text: Makaranes sira do Misiya am naknakmen da o kangay da do Potiniya a ili. Am ji na mya sira no Seyzi.

language1_text: And they passing by Mysia came down to Troas.
language2_text: Am ori o to da hatasi so Misiya a kangay da do Teloya.

language1_text: And a vision appeared to Paul in the night; There stood a man of Macedonia, and prayed him, saying, Come over into Macedonia, and help us.
language2_text: Mahep rana am amyan so nipacita na ji Pawlo ni Ama ta do to, do akma ney tateynep. Macita na do akmey tateynep o asa ka tao do Maciton a meytatanek a mapasyasi jya. Maniring am, "Mai kamo do Maciton a somidong jyamen."

language1_text: And after he had seen the vision, immediately we endeavoured to go into Macedonia, assuredly gathering that the Lord had called us for to preach the gospel unto them.
language2_text: Macita na ni Pawlo o akmey tateynep am ori o nikakeykai namen rana a nimangay do Maciton. Ta katenngan namen si Ama ta do to a manci nyamen a mangay meylimwang no Mapasaray a Ciriciring na do tao do dang.

language1_text: Therefore loosing from Troas, we came with a straight course to Samothracia, and the next day to Neapolis;
language2_text: Nimavang namen do avang do Teloya kapasongay da sya mangay do Samotake. Ikadwa na araw am makaranes namen do Niyapodi.

language1_text: and from thence to Philippi, which is the chief city of that part of Macedonia, and a colony: and we were in that city abiding certain days.
language2_text: So nyangay namen do rako a ili do Maciton a meyngaran so Veydipi. O ili ori am italamozong no Loma. So niseysan namen dang.

language1_text: And on the sabbath we went out of the city by a river side, where prayer was wont to be made; and we sat down, and spake unto the women which resorted thither.
language2_text: Ipeywalam no tao am mangay namen do ayo do siri no ili da, ta nimamizing namen do dang o angayan da meynozi no tao do Yotay. Makaranes namen dang am nanawen namen sira o aro a mavakes a nimalovot dang.

language1_text: And a certain woman named Lydia, a seller of purple, of the city of Thyatira, which worshipped God, heard us: whose heart the Lord opened, that she attended unto the things which were spoken of Paul.
language2_text: Amyan jira ang so asa ka mavakes apo do Tiyatila a meyngaran si Ditiya. O vazay na am macinginangina no masingat a akmey nikowpasan a vangkoro a milakayob. Makdeng o nakenakem na ji Ama ta do to. Mamizing na o ipangnanao ni Pawlo a ciring ni Yeso am mina todeywangi o onowned na, do kanisomidong na sya ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: And when she was baptized, and her household, she besought us, saying, If ye have judged me to be faithful to the Lord, come into my house, and abide there. And she constrained us.
language2_text: Teyka namen a taktakan o mavakes ori a kano macivahay jya tao am maniring jyamen am, "No si milamdam nyo yaken so onowned a yameyngongyod a omanoyong ji Yeso am mai kamo a misan do vahay ko an." So nitaidan na jyamen a peysanen.

language1_text: And it came to pass, as we went to prayer, a certain damsel possessed with a spirit of divination met us, which brought her masters much gain by soothsaying:
language2_text: Ipisa am mangay namen do ayo a meynozi am amyan so nimasinmo namen do rarahan a mavakes a lamlamsoy da. Mahaw na o vazay no makwa, ta nikovotan no kalamsoyan ni Satan. So ikaro no mahap na nizpi a itoro do mapeylamlamsoy sya a tao.

language1_text: The same followed Paul and us, and cried, saying, These men are the servants of the most high God, which shew unto us the way of salvation.
language2_text: So to na maciloloi jyamen do rarahan a amlololos. Maniring am, "Sira rana ya am da ahapen o vazay no ney manokdwan na Tao do to. Yada ipeylimwang o Tao do to a mapatazadang jyaten do teyngato."

language1_text: And this did she many days. But Paul, being grieved, turned and said to the spirit, I command thee in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her. And he came out the same hour.
language2_text: Mangday do araraw a amlololos. Ikarahet na ni Pawlo am to meyvazingowngaw a tomita sya. Maniring do nikomovot jya am, "Ko pangozayan o ngaran na ni Yeso Kizisto a manci nimo a makowbot rana do kataotao na." Am ori o nipakowbot na rana no nikomovot jya.

language1_text: And when her masters saw that the hope of their gains was gone, they caught Paul and Silas, and drew them into the marketplace unto the rulers,
language2_text: Katenngan da na no pacivahayan na no mavakes ang o kabo rana no peynizpyan da am rakpen da si Pawlo a kani Sila a lololwen a yangay do panipanirsirngen do ili da.

language1_text: and brought them to the magistrates, saying, These men, being Jews, do exceedingly trouble our city,
language2_text: Maniring sira am, "Sira rana tao do Yotay am da peyzavozavozen o icicirawat do ili ta ya.

language1_text: and teach customs, which are not lawful for us to receive, neither to observe, being Romans.
language2_text: Ta sira mangononong so ta ikarahet a tao do Loma."

language1_text: And the multitude rose up together against them: and the magistrates rent off their clothes, and commanded to beat them.
language2_text: So ikamimin da no aro a tao a macioya jira. O panipanirsirngen da am nipakaro da o talili da Pawlo a kani Sila a kapanci da no tao a somipsipzot jira.

language1_text: And when they had laid many stripes upon them, they cast them into prison, charging the jailor to keep them safely:
language2_text: Mateyka da sira sipsipzotan am pasdepen da sira do pamemtengan a kapanci da no mamzamzat a ominlid so ivaod na sira.

language1_text: who, having received such a charge, thrust them into the inner prison, and made their feet fast in the stocks.
language2_text: Am ori o nipaneban na rana jira do zosok na rana no pamemtengan a kapasopit na so ai da do kayo a kaji da makapeygonagonayan.

language1_text: And at midnight Paul and Silas prayed, and sang praises unto God: and the prisoners heard them.
language2_text: Avak no ahep am meynozi si Pawlo a kani Sila kapeyyanwanood da somaray ni Ama ta do to. O kararay da nipteng da am to da ngamiznga sira.

language1_text: And suddenly there was a great earthquake, so that the foundations of the prison were shaken: and immediately all the doors were opened, and every one's bands were loosed.
language2_text: Meyratateng am to ngyan so rako a kanini. Am ori o nikagonagonay no pamemtengan a kapeycyeyweywang na no pangengneban. O nivaod da sira vahalang do lima da am to meycyazavazavat.

language1_text: And the keeper of the prison awaking out of his sleep, and seeing the prison doors open, he drew out his sword, and would have killed himself, supposing that the prisoners had been fled.
language2_text: Mayokay o mamzat jira am to na cita o pangengneban a nimeywang. Ipanci na o kanisomaway da rana no nipteng da tao. Am ori o nipangap na so ipangan na ipanma na do kataotao na.

language1_text: But Paul cried with a loud voice, saying, Do thyself no harm: for we are all here.
language2_text: Macita na ni Pawlo am tawagan na. Maniring am, "Ji mo manomai o kataotao mo. Cyaha, ta namen mamimin a yapa myan do jya."

language1_text: Then he called for a light, and sprang in, and came trembling, and fell down before Paul and Silas,
language2_text: O mamzamzat rana am manovoy so tao a mangap so zampo. Somdep rana am manyahey a to na nizikzik a mangay meylilitod do tangain da da Pawlo a kani Sila.

language1_text: and brought them out, and said, Sirs, what must I do to be saved?
language2_text: Meyratateng am powboten na sira. Maniring jira am, "Manga kahakay, makongo ko so wanjin a kapakahap ko so to meyyonong a ikavyay no pahad ko."

language1_text: And they said, Believe on the Lord Jesus Christ, and thou shalt be saved, and thy house.
language2_text: Maniring sira jya am, "Anoyngan mo si Yeso a Panirsirngen ta. Ta ori o ipakahap nyo so to meyyonong a ikavyay no pahad nyo a asa ka vahay."

language1_text: And they spake unto him the word of the Lord, and to all that were in his house.
language2_text: Meyratateng am nanawen da sira asa ka vahay no ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: And he took them the same hour of the night, and washed their stripes; and was baptized, he and all his, straightway.
language2_text: No kanang na am nioyasan na no mamzamzat o nipeyzazan da Pawlo a kani Sila. Meyratateng am mamimin sira asa ka vahay a nitaktakan da,

language1_text: And when he had brought them into his house, he set meat before them, and rejoiced, believing in God with all his house.
language2_text: a kapanci da ni Pawlo a kani Sila a macyakan jira do vahay da. So ikasaray da asa ka vahay, do kaniomanoyong da rana ji Ama ta do to.

language1_text: And when it was day, the magistrates sent the serjeants, saying, Let those men go.
language2_text: Ikadwa na araw do pezak am manovoy o panipanirsirngen da so meykalsong a manci no kapasaway da si Pawlo a kani Sila.

language1_text: And the keeper of the prison told this saying to Paul, The magistrates have sent to let you go: now therefore depart, and go in peace.
language2_text: Maniring o mamzamzat ji Pawlo am, "Na ipanci no panipanirsirngen o na kapasaway jimo a kani Sila. So to nyo na makowboci a somaliway."

language1_text: But Paul said unto them, They have beaten us openly uncondemned, being Romans, and have cast us into prison; and now do they thrust us out privily? nay verily; but let them come themselves and fetch us out.
language2_text: Am maniring si Pawlo do meykalsong am, "Yamen am tao namen do Loma. Am ikongo da todey nipsipzoci jyamen, a da katodey angneban jyamen do pamemtengan a yabo so karatan. Ikongo da taywan sya do taotao so da kapasaway jyamen. So ikarahet no akman sang. Am ori o pancyan nyo no panipanirsirngen, ta mai sira a mapowbot jyamen."

language1_text: And the serjeants told these words unto the magistrates: and they feared, when they heard that they were Romans.
language2_text: Meyratateng am mangay na ipanci no meykalsong do panipanirsirngen da. Mamizing da si Pawlo a kani Sila a tao do Loma am mamogaw sira.

language1_text: And they came and besought them, and brought them out, and desired them to depart out of the city.
language2_text: Am ori o nyangay da do pamemtengan a meyminaminasi nira kapowbot da rana sira komaro do ili da.

language1_text: And they went out of the prison, and entered into the house of Lydia: and when they had seen the brethren, they comforted them, and departed.
language2_text: Makowbot rana si Pawlo a kani Sila do pamemtengan am mangay sira do vahay ni Ditiya. So nipakacita da dang so akma dey kakteh do cinai kapait da sira so nakenakem da ji Yeso a kangay da rana.

language1_text: Now when they had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia, they came to Thessalonica, where was a synagogue of the Jews:
language2_text: Meyhatay si Pawlo a kani Sila do peycyeylilyan na do Anveypodi a kado Apoloniya am makaranes rana sira do Tesalonicya. Amyan dang so peyneynozyan da no tao do Yotay.

language1_text: and Paul, as his manner was, went in unto them, and three sabbath days reasoned with them out of the scriptures,
language2_text: So to na mangozai ni Pawlo do mina iwawalam na no kakwa pa mangay do peyneynozyan. Ipitlo do ipeywalam no tao a macinekanekad do tao a mangnanao no nivatvatkan a Ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to,

language1_text: opening and alleging, that Christ must needs have suffered, and risen again from the dead; and that this Jesus, whom I preach unto you, is Christ.
language2_text: a kaononong na ji Kizisto a nipakakasi da a wakwaken a kavyay na rana sya ni Ama ta do to. Maniring pa am, "Si Yeso rana ko ipeylimwang jinyo am manoyong a Misayya a nitovoy ni Ama ta do to do teyrahem."

language1_text: And some of them believed, and consorted with Paul and Silas; and of the devout Greeks a great multitude, and of the chief women not a few.
language2_text: Mamizing da no tatasa ka tao do Yotay am to da na anoyngi kapacihza da ji Pawlo a kani Sila. So nikaro no omraralay ni Ama ta do to a tao do Sila kano meynakem a mavakes do dang a omanoyong rana ji Yeso.

language1_text: But the Jews which believed not, moved with envy, took unto them certain lewd fellows of the baser sort, and gathered a company, and set all the city on an uproar, and assaulted the house of Jason, and sought to bring them out to the people.
language2_text: Am o meyili dang a tao do Yotay a ji nganoyong ji Yeso am ikeynanahet da sira. Am ori o nilovotan da so abwata so vazavazay a tao a kano marahet so nakenakem a kapeyzavozavoz da sira so aro a tao a kasdep da do vahay ni Yeson a komala si Pawlo a kani Sila. Ta naknakmen da o kangay da nira do tangain no aro a tao.

language1_text: And when they found them not, they drew Jason and certain brethren unto the rulers of the city, crying, These that have turned the world upside down are come hither also;
language2_text: Am ji da kala sira. Am to da rana rakpa si Yeson a kano karwan da sinjya a lolwen a yangay do panipanirsirngen da. Maniring sira am, "O tao rana yamapeyzavozavoz so tao do peycyamahamahatawan na am sira rana nimakaranes do jya.

language1_text: whom Jason hath received: and these all do contrary to the decrees of Cæ sar, saying that there is another king, one Jesus.
language2_text: Si Yeson am nipeysan na sira do vahay na. So nikamimin da ji nimahap so ciring na ni Kaysa. Ta maniring sira am yamyan so yasa ka panirsirngen a meyngaran si Yeso."

language1_text: And they troubled the people and the rulers of the city, when they heard these things.
language2_text: Mamizing da no tao a kano panipanirsirngen am ikarahet da.

language1_text: And when they had taken security of Jason, and of the other, they let them go.
language2_text: Meyratateng am patorwan da no panipanirsirngen si Yeson a kano kararay na so nizpi. Ori o nipasawayan da rana sira.

language1_text: And the brethren immediately sent away Paul and Silas by night unto Berea: who coming thither went into the synagogue of the Jews.
language2_text: Mahep rana am yangay da si Pawlo a kani Sila no akma dey kakteh do cinai do Peyloya. Makaranes rana sira do dang am somdep sira do peyneynozyan no tao do Yotay.

language1_text: These were more noble than those in Thessalonica, in that they received the word with all readiness of mind, and searched the scriptures daily, whether those things were so.
language2_text: O tao rana dang am apyapya sira kano sinjya do Tesalonicya. Ta makdeng sira omamizing so ipangnanao da Pawlo. Masangib sira do araraw a tomita so Seysyo. Kakzeben da katenngan o kanoyong na kalas na no ipanci na ni Pawlo.

language1_text: Therefore many of them believed; also of honourable women which were Greeks, and of men, not a few.
language2_text: Am ori o nikaro no nimanganoyong a tao do Yotay a kano meynakem a mavakes do Sila kano tao do Sila mahakay.

language1_text: But when the Jews of Thessalonica had knowledge that the word of God was preached of Paul at Berea, they came thither also, and stirred up the people.
language2_text: Am mamizing da no tao do Yotay a meyili do Tesalonicya si Pawlo a meylimwang no ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to do Peyloya am mangay sira o tao do Yotay a mapeyvonag so aro a mangamizing a tao.

language1_text: And then immediately the brethren sent away Paul to go as it were to the sea: but Silas and Timotheus abode there still.
language2_text: Am ori o nyangayan da ni Pawlo no sinjya do minato. Si Sila kani Timotay am nimavezed sira do Peyloya.

language1_text: And they that conducted Paul brought him unto Athens: and receiving a commandment unto Silas and Timotheus for to come to him with all speed, they departed.
language2_text: Makaranes sira do Yatyan o nimacihza ji Pawlo am meysinaoli rana sira do Peyloya a manci no nipakoyokoy na jira ni Pawlo, ta kakzeben na si Sila kani Timotay a makeykai a mangay jya.

language1_text: Now while Paul waited for them at Athens, his spirit was stirred in him, when he saw the city wholly given to idolatry.
language2_text: Nanalahen na ni Pawlo si Sila kani Timotay do Yatyan am macita na o ili da kakakadayan no ji meyngongyod a tao do to da. So nikaratan na nya no onowned.

language1_text: Therefore disputed he in the synagogue with the Jews, and with the devout persons, and in the market daily with them that met with him.
language2_text: Am ori o nipacinekanekad na do tao do Yotay a kano omraralay ni Ama ta do to a beken a tao do Yotay do peyneynozyan. So nikasangib na do araraw a macinekanekad do masazi na tao do rarahan.

language1_text: Then certain philosophers of the Epicureans, and of the Stoicks, encountered him. And some said, What will this babbler say? other some, He seemeth to be a setter forth of strange gods: because he preached unto them Jesus, and the resurrection.
language2_text: Amyan dang so mangnanao no nanao ni Ipikolo a kani Sitoke. Sira rana am nimai sira macinekanekad ji Pawlo. Maniring o kadwan jira am, "Ikongo na ipanci no nya a yajyapsepsek ang." Amyan so manci no, "Yana ipanci o da iraralay no tarek a pongso." Ta o ipeylimwang na ni Pawlo am si Yeso a kano keypirwa na nimavyay.

language1_text: And they took him, and brought him unto Areopagus, saying, May we know what this new doctrine, whereof thou speakest, is?
language2_text: Am ori o nihapan da si Pawlo no aro a panipanirsirngen da do peykeykaygyan da a ngaranan da so Adipako. Maniring sira jya am, "Namen kakzeben o namen kapakateneng do yavayo a mo ipangnanao.

language1_text: For thou bringest certain strange things to our ears: we would know therefore what these things mean.
language2_text: Ta namen jyatenngi pa o akman sang a nanao. So pancyan mo nya jyamen so agagazan na."

language1_text: (For all the Athenians and strangers which were there spent their time in nothing else, but either to tell, or to hear some new thing.)
language2_text: O pancyan da no akman sang am o tao do Yatyan a kano apo do tarek a ili a misan dang a tao am ji da mapakdengi o kapeyvazay da. Ta o ikakza da am kapakamizing da so yeyyak da no cicilwan a ciring.

language1_text: Then Paul stood in the midst of Mars' hill, and said, Ye men of Athens, I perceive that in all things ye are too superstitious.
language2_text: So nipeytatanek ni Pawlo do Adipako a peykeykaygyan da. Maniring jira am, "Inyo rana tao do Yatyan am ko katenngan inyo a yatey makdeng a yamanaralay no tao do to nyo.

language1_text: For as I passed by, and beheld your devotions, I found an altar with this inscription, TO THE UNKNOWN GOD. Whom therefore ye ignorantly worship, him declare I unto you.
language2_text: Ko na nilivon o ili nyo a yatomita so nyo iraralay. So ko nipakacita so nyo nipariparing a papazosan nyo. O yadomket a vatvatek am, 'Jyasingkaji a tao do to.' Sicyaikwa rana ya am ko ipanci jinyo o nyo pa jyatenngi so ngaran a meyngongyod a Tao do to.

language1_text: God that made the world and all things therein, seeing that he is Lord of heaven and earth, dwelleth not in temples made with hands;
language2_text: Iya rana am nimangamamaog so hanit a kano teyrahem a kano meycyamadadayan. So ikanoyong na Panirsirngen do sinokob no hanit. Iya rana am yaji meyvahay do niparing no tao a panaralayan.

language1_text: neither is worshipped with men's hands, as though he needed any thing, seeing he giveth to all life, and breath, and all things;
language2_text: Iya rana am na ji ngakzeba o tao a somidong sya. Iya o na kapwan no ikavyay no kataotao ta kano meycyamadadayan a kalahen ta tao.

language1_text: and hath made of one blood all nations of men for to dwell on all the face of the earth, and hath determined the times before appointed, and the bounds of their habitation;
language2_text: Iya o nimangamamaog so asa ka tao a cinapodpodan da no yamavonong do peycyamahamahatawan na tao do teyrahem, a na kapamnek do awawan da no iyan da do karawan a kano yanan da pongso.

language1_text: that they should seek the Lord, if haply they might feel after him, and find him, though he be not far from every one of us:
language2_text: O na ikakman sang am na kakzeben ni Ama ta do to o kapakateneng da jya no tao. So ta jyahawangi ji Ama ta do to.

language1_text: for in him we live, and move, and have our being; as certain also of your own poets have said, For we are also his offspring.
language2_text: Ta maniring o asa ka tao am, 'Iya o yapwan no inawan ta do karawan a yaomzat jyaten.' Maniring pa sira o mateneng a tao a macikeylyan jinyo am, 'Yaten rana am akma ney anak yaten.'

language1_text: Forasmuch then as we are the offspring of God, we ought not to think that the Godhead is like unto gold, or silver, or stone, graven by art and man's device.
language2_text: "No manoyong ta akma ney anak am ji ta naknakma o kapehngay ta si Ama ta do to do nipariparing no tao no apya so kolit a kano kayo a kano veysen a pehngehngain da ji Ama ta do to.

language1_text: And the times of this ignorance God winked at; but now commandeth all men every where to repent:
language2_text: No kaji da pa makatenngan ji Ama ta do to no tao am ji na naknakma o raraten da. Am sicyaikwaya am na ikakza o tao a yamamlis a komaro rana do peyraratenan da.

language1_text: because he hath appointed a day, in the which he will judge the world in righteousness by that man whom he hath ordained; whereof he hath given assurance unto all men, in that he hath raised him from the dead.
language2_text: Ta na nipamnekan o araraw na ni Ama ta do to a tomovoy so nipamnekan na a mapacici so tao do teyrahem. Ta iya rana am ji mapeycyakaban so tao. So na jyalasi no kanimawakwak na a kapirwa na sya avyain ni Ama ta do to."

language1_text: And when they heard of the resurrection of the dead, some mocked: and others said, We will hear thee again of this matter.
language2_text: Mamizing da si Pawlo a manci no keyyan no nimawakwak a tao a nimirwa mavyay am ipeykeykaming da. Maniring o tatasa jira am, "Namen tey kakza pa yamizngen o mo ipangnanao."

language1_text: So Paul departed from among them.
language2_text: Meyratateng am karwan na rana ni Pawlo o peykeykaygyan da.

language1_text: Howbeit certain men clave unto him, and believed: among the which was Dionysius the Areopagite, and a woman named Damaris, and others with them.
language2_text: So niyan no tao a omanoyong ji Yeso a kapacihza da rana ji Pawlo. O asa am asa ka panirsirngen da do Adipako a meyngaran si Tinisyo a kano asa ka mavakes a meyngaran si Tamadi a kano karwan da tao.

language1_text: After these things Paul departed from Athens, and came to Corinth;
language2_text: Karwan na ni Pawlo do Yatyan am mangay rana do Kedinto.

language1_text: and found a certain Jew named Aquila, born in Pontus, lately come from Italy, with his wife Priscilla; (because that Claudius had commanded all Jews to depart from Rome:) and came unto them.
language2_text: Makaranes do dang am makasazi so asa ka tao do Yotay a nimatazak a tao do Pento a meyngaran si Akwila. O kadwan na do vahay am meyngaran si Paycila. Kapo da pa do Itadi, ta o panirsirngen a meyngaran si Kelawti am ipanci na o tao do Yotay a komaro do Loma. So nyangay na ni Pawlo a tomita sira.

language1_text: And because he was of the same craft, he abode with them, and wrought: for by their occupation they were tentmakers.
language2_text: So nipacivahay na jira macipeyvazay jira, ta meyyangay o vazay da mapakapkapya so vilad a vahay.

language1_text: And he reasoned in the synagogue every sabbath, and persuaded the Jews and the Greeks.
language2_text: Mangday so ipeywalam no tao yangay ni Pawlo do peyneynozyan a macinekanekad, kananao na so tao do Yotay a kano tao do Sila. Ta kakdain na sira omanoyong ji Yeso.

language1_text: And when Silas and Timotheus were come from Macedonia, Paul was pressed in the spirit, and testified to the Jews that Jesus was Christ.
language2_text: Mai rana sira Sila kani Timotay a nimapo do Maciton am masangib si Pawlo a meylimwang nya do tao do Yotay so kanoyong na ni Yeso a Misayya a nitovoy na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: And when they opposed themselves, and blasphemed, he shook his raiment, and said unto them, Your blood be upon your own heads; I am clean: from henceforth I will go unto the Gentiles.
language2_text: Am ji da ngamiznga, ta o karaherahet da sya. Am ori o nitoktokan na ni Pawlo do talili na so ibeybek. Maniring pa jira am, "Si amyan so oyaoyyan na ninyo ni Ama ta do to no makwa am beken a yaken o raraten an, ta monganay jinyo an. To ko na papwa sicyaraw eya o kangay ko na a mangnanao so beken a tao do Yotay."

language1_text: And he departed thence, and entered into a certain man's house, named Justus, one that worshipped God, whose house joined hard to the synagogue.
language2_text: Meyratateng am karwan na rana sira ni Pawlo a kangay na meyvahay do vahay ni Tito Yoseto. Iya rana am beken a tao do Yotay a omraralay ni Ama ta do to. O vahay na am macitangked do peyneynozyan.

language1_text: And Crispus, the chief ruler of the synagogue, believed on the Lord with all his house; and many of the Corinthians hearing believed, and were baptized.
language2_text: O tomalamozong no peyneynozyan a meyngaran si Kedisepo a ka nira asa ka vahay am nimamimin sira omanoyong ji Yeso a kano aro a tao do Kedinto a nimakamizing so nipangnanao ni Pawlo a omanoyong rana ji Yeso a kataktak da jira.

language1_text: Then spake the Lord to Paul in the night by a vision, Be not afraid, but speak, and hold not thy peace:
language2_text: Ipisa kahep na am meygegcin ji Pawlo o ciring ni Yeso akma ney tateynep. Maniring am, "Ji ka mogaw. Ji mo amtadan o kapangnanao mo,

language1_text: for I am with thee, and no man shall set on thee to hurt thee: for I have much people in this city.
language2_text: ta amyan ko a macikaop jimo. So ikabo no makagogad nimo. Ta do ili rana ya am sira aro o tao meypaza pa omanoyong jyaken."

language1_text: And he continued there a year and six months, teaching the word of God among them.
language2_text: So niyan na dang so kasisi so ikadwa kawan ni Pawlo a mangnanao no ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: And when Gallio was the deputy of Achaia, the Jews made insurrection with one accord against Paul, and brought him to the judgment seat,
language2_text: No kapeypanirsirngen da si Cyadien do Akayya a pongso am meylovolovot sira o tao do Yotay amwoya ni Pawlo. Karahan am lolwen da a yangay do pacicicyan.

language1_text: saying, This fellow persuadeth men to worship God contrary to the law.
language2_text: Maniring sira am, "Iya rana am na ipanci do tao o kaji ngapan so iwawalam ta a tao do Yotay. Yamacitarek o na ipangnanao so tao a yana ipanop so tao ji Ama ta do to."

language1_text: And when Paul was now about to open his mouth, Gallio said unto the Jews, If it were a matter of wrong or wicked lewdness, O ye Jews, reason would that I should bear with you:
language2_text: Naknakmen na ni Pawlo o kapeyzezyak na am to na amizing si Cyadien a mapacici so aro a tao do Yotay. Maniring am, "No si marahet o akman so sang a vazay am to ko ngamiznga inyo.

language1_text: but if it be a question of words and names, and of your law, look ye to it; for I will be no judge of such matters.
language2_text: Am o nyo ikazyak am yaomagaz do adan a iwawalam nyo. So to nyo rana mapeyvazai sya, ta ko jyakzan eya peyvazain."

language1_text: And he drave them from the judgment seat.
language2_text: So nipowbotan na sira do pacicicyan,

language1_text: Then all the Greeks took Sosthenes, the chief ruler of the synagogue, and beat him before the judgment seat. And Gallio cared for none of those things.
language2_text: karakep da si Sotenay a tomalamozong no peyneynozyan a kabakbak da jya do pantaw no pacicicyan. Am ji na nikazyak ni Cyadien o akman sang a vazay.

language1_text: And Paul after this tarried there yet a good while, and then took his leave of the brethren, and sailed thence into Syria, and with him Priscilla and Aquila; having shorn his head in Cenchrea: for he had a vow.
language2_text: Nimownay pa si Pawlo do Kedinto. Meyratateng am karwan na rana sira o akma ney kakteh do cinai a karara na si Paycila kani Akwila a omavang do avang a mangay do Sidiya. Makaranes sira do Kengkedi am mey na tedtedan o avok na, akma ney yongkad do kanimanci na rana no makdeng a mina ciring na ji Ama ta do to.

language1_text: And he came to Ephesus, and left them there: but he himself entered into the synagogue, and reasoned with the Jews.
language2_text: Makaranes rana sira do Ivoso am taitaiden na rana sira Paycila kani Akwila kangay na rana do peyneynozyan a macinekanekad do tao do Yotay.

language1_text: When they desired him to tarry longer time with them, he consented not;
language2_text: Taidan da si Pawlo a mownay pa dang amyan am ji na mya ni Pawlo.

language1_text: but bade them farewell, saying, I must by all means keep this feast that cometh in Jerusalem: but I will return again unto you, if God will. And he sailed from Ephesus.
language2_text: Karwan na sira am amyan so ciring na jira. Maniring jira am, "No si apyahen ni Ama ta do to am pirwan ko pa o kai ko do jya." Meyratateng am somakay rana do avang a komaro do Ivoso.

language1_text: And when he had landed at Cæ sarea, and gone up, and saluted the church, he went down to Antioch.
language2_text: Makaranes si Pawlo do Kaysadiya am mangay do Yelosaleng a tomita so akma ney kakteh do cinai a kangay na rana do Antia.

language1_text: And after he had spent some time there, he departed, and went over all the country of Galatia and Phrygia in order, strengthening all the disciples.
language2_text: So nikownay na dang a kangay na rana do peycyeylilyan na do Cyalatay a kado Vodicya a mapait so onowned da no yamraralay ni Yeso a tao.

language1_text: And a certain Jew named Apollos, born at Alexandria, an eloquent man, and mighty in the scriptures, came to Ephesus.
language2_text: Amyan so asa ka tao do Yotay a meyngaran si Apolo a meyili do Yadisanta nimangay do Ivoso. Iya rana am tey mateneng a mangnanao a mateneng do Seysyo.

language1_text: This man was instructed in the way of the Lord; and being fervent in the spirit, he spake and taught diligently the things of the Lord, knowing only the baptism of John.
language2_text: Amyan so nimnanao sya no ciring a omagaz ji Yeso. Am ori o ikowyat na mangnanao. Am o nipangnanao ni Yowani a nimanaktak o katenngan na.

language1_text: And he began to speak boldly in the synagogue: whom when Aquila and Priscilla had heard, they took him unto them, and expounded unto him the way of God more perfectly.
language2_text: Ori o ji na rana mogawi a mangnanao do peyneynozyan. Mamizing ni Paycila kani Akwila am rarahen da mangay do vahay da kapanci da no ji na pa nimamizing a nanao a omagaz ji Yeso. Ori o nikapiya na rana no ipangnanao na.

language1_text: And when he was disposed to pass into Achaia, the brethren wrote, exhorting the disciples to receive him: who, when he was come, helped them much which had believed through grace:
language2_text: Meyratateng am naknakmen na ni Apolo o kangay na do Akayya. Ori o nisidongan da sya no akma ney kakteh do cinai do Ivoso a meyteygami nira no omanoyong ji Yeso do Akayya tomaotao sya no mangay jira. Makaranes rana dang si Apolo am arako o nisidongan na sira so nimakahap rana so pangangarilawan na ni Ama ta do to a tao.

language1_text: for he mightily convinced the Jews, and that publickly, shewing by the scriptures that Jesus was Christ.
language2_text: Ta mowyat a mapasapa do macinekanekad jya tao do Yotay a manci no Seysyo, do kanoyong ni Yeso a Misayya a nitovoy ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: And it came to pass, that, while Apollos was at Corinth, Paul having passed through the upper coasts came to Ephesus: and finding certain disciples,
language2_text: Amyan rana si Apolo do Kedinto am meypangay pa si Pawlo do Ivoso. So nipeyliktaw na do Vodicya. Ori o nipakasazi na dang so amraralay ni Yeso Kizisto a tao.

language1_text: he said unto them, Have ye received the Holy Ghost since ye believed? And they said unto him, We have not so much as heard whether there be any Holy Ghost.
language2_text: Maniring si Pawlo jira am, "Manngwa, nimeydedna jinyo o Seyzi no kanoyong nyo ji Yeso Kizisto an?" Maniring sira am, "Namen pa jya nimamizing o Seyzi."

language1_text: And he said unto them, Unto what then were ye baptized? And they said, Unto John's baptism.
language2_text: Maniring si Pawlo am, "No ori am sino nyo pangozayan a tomaktak jinyo." Maniring sira am, "O nipangnanao ni Yowani a nimanaktak o namen katenngan."

language1_text: Then said Paul, John verily baptized with the baptism of repentance, saying unto the people, that they should believe on him which should come after him, that is, on Christ Jesus.
language2_text: Maniring si Pawlo am, "O nipanaktak na ni Yowani am yongkad da do mina kapamlis da rana so onowned. O nipanci na pa do Isedi a tao ni Yowani am, 'Anoyngan nyo o yamanownowjyan pa ka nyaken a yamai a meyngaran si Yeso.'"

language1_text: When they heard this, they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.
language2_text: Mamizing da o ciring na ni Pawlo am pangozayan da o ngaran ni Yeso to rana mya so kataktak da jira,

language1_text: And when Paul had laid his hands upon them, the Holy Ghost came on them; and they spake with tongues, and prophesied.
language2_text: kakadain na sira paoptan na so lima na ni Pawlo. Karahan am meydedna jira o Seyzi. So nipeyzezyak da so matarek a ciriciring no Seyzi a kapeylimwang da no ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: And all the men were about twelve.
language2_text: Sira rana am rarwa sira so ikakarwan o tao.

language1_text: And he went into the synagogue, and spake boldly for the space of three months, disputing and persuading the things concerning the kingdom of God.
language2_text: So nipakatlo na vehan dang ni Pawlo a to ngyan do peyneynozyan a macinekanekad jira a manci no agagazan no italamozong na ni Ama ta do to a mapanod so tao a omanoyong ji Yeso Kizisto.

language1_text: But when divers were hardened, and believed not, but spake evil of that way before the multitude, he departed from them, and separated the disciples, disputing daily in the school of one Tyrannus.
language2_text: Am tatasa jira o ji mapownot so nakem da amraherahet so nipangnanao ni Pawlo a omagaz ji Yeso Kizisto. Am ori o nipalolwan na so sinjya ni Pawlo a komaro jira. So nipangday da so araw a meysirisiring do pangananawan na vahay no meyngaran so Tilano a tao.

language1_text: And this continued by the space of two years; so that all they which dwelt in Asia heard the word of the Lord Jesus, both Jews and Greeks.
language2_text: O akman rana sang a vazay am mina kadwa kawan. Tana tao do Yotay a tana tao do Sila am nimamimin sira o meyvahay do Yasiya a nimakamizing so ciring ni Yeso Kizisto.

language1_text: And God wrought special miracles by the hands of Paul:
language2_text: Nioyatan na ni Ama ta do to si Pawlo a meyvazay so aro a mapeyzokab a vazay.

language1_text: so that from his body were brought unto the sick handkerchiefs or aprons, and the diseases departed from them, and the evil spirits went out of them.
language2_text: Am ori o nyahapan da no tao so nipeyveynget ni Pawlo a pangain do kataotao da no meyngen a tao a kapya da rana a kavozwaw da no kalamsoyan ni Satan a komovot do tao.

language1_text: Then certain of the vagabond Jews, exorcists, took upon them to call over them which had evil spirits the name of the Lord Jesus, saying, We adjure you by Jesus whom Paul preacheth.
language2_text: So niyan da no tao do Yotay a omlivolivon a amvozwaw so kalamsoyan ni Satan. Sira rana am tana ji da anoyngi si Yeso am ikakza da pangozayan o ngaran ni Yeso. Ori nisirsirngan da so kalamsoyan ni Satan. Maniring sira am, "Namen pangozayan o ngaran no ipeylimwang ni Pawlo a si Yeso a amvozwaw jinyo."

language1_text: And there were seven sons of one Sceva, a Jew, and chief of the priests, which did so.
language2_text: O nimapeyvazay so sang am papito a ka anak na no asa ka panirsirngen da no mapatanatanang so nakem da si Ama ta do to a meyngaran so Sekaywa.

language1_text: And the evil spirit answered and said, Jesus I know, and Paul I know; but who are ye?
language2_text: Tovisan na no kalamsoyan ni Satan sira am, "Namen kasingkadan si Yeso. Namen katenngan si Pawlo am sino kamo ang."

language1_text: And the man in whom the evil spirit was leaped on them, and overcame them, and prevailed against them, so that they fled out of that house naked and wounded.
language2_text: O nikovotan rana no kalamsoyan ni Satan a mahakay am mina to zagzag a nimbakbak jira, kapeyzaza da a kapisipising no talili da. Ori nipeypalalayo da a makowbot do vahay ang.

language1_text: And this was known to all the Jews and Greeks also dwelling at Ephesus; and fear fell on them all, and the name of the Lord Jesus was magnified.
language2_text: Mamizing da no meyvahay do Ivoso a tao do Yotay a kano tao do Sila o akman sang a vazay am manyahey sira. Niminda dang o kapeypakdeng da rana omraralay ni Yeso.

language1_text: And many that believed came, and confessed, and shewed their deeds.
language2_text: So nikaro no amraralay ni Yeso a tao a mai a mapatwaw so nikaratan da no kakwa do tangain no aro a tao.

language1_text: Many of them also which used curious arts brought their books together, and burned them before all men: and they counted the price of them, and found it fifty thousand pieces of silver.
language2_text: Aro o makahaw a tao a mai no vakong da kasleb da sya. Vilangan da am to ngyan so ikalima na laksa (50, 000) no nizpi a ngina na.

language1_text: So mightily grew the word of God and prevailed.
language2_text: So nipeylimwang na rana do dang no ciriciring na ni Yeso. Ori nipeyparo da no omanoyong jya tao.

language1_text: After these things were ended, Paul purposed in the spirit, when he had passed through Macedonia and Achaia, to go to Jerusalem, saying, After I have been there, I must also see Rome.
language2_text: Komavos o aro a vazay am ipanci na ni Pawlo o kapangonong na do Maciton a kado Akayya a mangay do Yelosaleng. Maniring am, "Si makaranes ko do dang am mangay ko pa do Loma."

language1_text: So he sent into Macedonia two of them that ministered unto him, Timotheus and Erastus; but he himself stayed in Asia for a season.
language2_text: So nipanman na so rarwa ka somidong sya si Timotay a kani Ilato a mangay do Maciton. Si Pawlo am mina todavezed do Yasiya.

language1_text: And the same time there arose no small stir about that way.
language2_text: No kanang do Ivoso am amyan so nimakdeng a vazay a ikazyak da. Ori rana am omagaz do kownot da ji Yeso Kizisto.

language1_text: For a certain man named Demetrius, a silversmith, which made silver shrines for Diana, brought no small gain unto the craftsmen;
language2_text: Amyan so asa ka meyngaran si Temolyo a mapakapkapya so gizit a ipamaring na so likta panaralayan da raralayan da no meyngaran so Atemey. Ikongo do aro tao a macipeyvazay jya, am ori o ikaro no nizpi a mahap da.

language1_text: whom he called together with the workmen of like occupation, and said, Sirs, ye know that by this craft we have our wealth.
language2_text: Si Temolyo rana am lovoten na o aro a lamlamsoy na kano tao a akman sya so vazay. Maniring jira am, "Manga keypong, nyo katenngan o na karo no nizpi a ta mahap.

language1_text: Moreover ye see and hear, that not alone at Ephesus, but almost throughout all Asia, this Paul hath persuaded and turned away much people, saying that they be no gods, which are made with hands:
language2_text: Ko ipanci jinyo am nyo na nimamizing, nyo na nimacita o icicirawat na kano vazay na ni Pawlo. Ta maniring asyo am, 'O nipariparing rana no tao a iraralay da am beken a meyngongyod a Tao do to.' O akman sang a ciring am da to nganoyngi no aro a tao do Ivoso a kado Yasiya.

language1_text: so that not only this our craft is in danger to be set at nought; but also that the temple of the great goddess Diana should be despised, and her magnificence should be destroyed, whom all Asia and the world worshippeth.
language2_text: Ko citahen rana o vazay ta am yamyan so ikarahet na. Ta o iraralay ta Atemey am yato meypapereh rana sira o tao a yaomraralay nya. Ta do Yasiya rana kado peycyamahamahatawan na am yato meypabo rana o na kadmayan no yata iraralay."

language1_text: And when they heard these sayings, they were full of wrath, and cried out, saying, Great is Diana of the Ephesians.
language2_text: Mamizing da no aro a tao o akman sang a ciring am meyoyaoya rana sira. Maniring rana sira am, "O iraralay ta do Ivoso a Atemey am tey maizay."

language1_text: And the whole city was filled with confusion: and having caught Gaius and Aristarchus, men of Macedonia, Paul's companions in travel, they rushed with one accord into the theatre.
language2_text: Ori o nipeyvonag da asa ka ili a karakep da so kararay ni Pawlo a rarwa meyili do Maciton a meyngaran si Cyayo a kani Aditako a kalololo da sira yangay do rako a peylovolovotan da.

language1_text: And when Paul would have entered in unto the people, the disciples suffered him not.
language2_text: Kakdain na ni Pawlo o kangay na jira am ji da mya no sinjya.

language1_text: And certain of the chief of Asia, which were his friends, sent unto him, desiring him that he would not adventure himself into the theatre.
language2_text: O tatasa panipanirsirngen da no Yasiya a kagagan na ni Pawlo am manovoy sira so tao a omzazat ji Pawlo a jyangay do peylovolovotan da, ta ikanginanawa da.

language1_text: Some therefore cried one thing, and some another: for the assembly was confused; and the more part knew not wherefore they were come together.
language2_text: No kanang am amlololos sira o aro a tao a meyzavozavoz so ciriciring. So ikaro no ji makateneng jya tao do agagazan no kalovot da do dang.

language1_text: And they drew Alexander out of the multitude, the Jews putting him forward. And Alexander beckoned with the hand, and would have made his defence unto the people.
language2_text: O tao do Yotay am padondonen da si Yadisanta a mangay do tangain da. Maniring sira aro a tao am, "Iya ya o yamapeyvazay sya." Am ori o nipatalan na so lima na ni Yadisanta a manci no ciring na do aro a tao.

language1_text: But when they knew that he was a Jew, all with one voice about the space of two hours cried out, Great is Diana of the Ephesians.
language2_text: Am katovilan da si Yadisanta a tao do Yotay. Am ori o nilololos da. Maniring sira am, "Ney maizay na o Atemey a iraralay ta do Ivoso!" So nikadwa na ka toki no nilololos da.

language1_text: And when the townclerk had appeased the people, he said, Ye men of Ephesus, what man is there that knoweth not how that the city of the Ephesians is a worshipper of the great goddess Diana, and of the image which fell down from Jupiter?
language2_text: Mownay am o meyvatvatek a panirsirngen do ili da am ori o nimapeyreherehes sira. Maniring jira am, "Inyo rana Ivoso a tao am sino ji makateneng jya, do ka yaten no yamzat do panaralayan no maizay a ta iraralay a Atemey a kano vato a kataotao na nimeyhekas apo do hanit.

language1_text: Seeing then that these things cannot be spoken against, ye ought to be quiet, and to do nothing rashly.
language2_text: Si pacyanoyngan nyo o akman sang a vazay am meyreherehes kamo na an. Taosya o kapatarek nyo so marahet a vazay nyo. Ahapen nyo o apiya pangtoktwan nyo.

language1_text: For ye have brought hither these men, which are neither robbers of churches, nor yet blasphemers of your goddess.
language2_text: Ta o nyo nyai yararwa ka tao do jya am yabwata o nitakaw da do panaralayan. Yabo da niraherahet so tao do to ta.

language1_text: Wherefore if Demetrius, and the craftsmen which are with him, have a matter against any man, the law is open, and there are deputies: let them implead one another.
language2_text: Si myan so ikazyak da da Temolyo a kano macivazay jya a tao am pamnekan da o araraw no ipeysirsiring da do pacicicyan. Ta ori o amizngan da so ciring da no panirsirngen.

language1_text: But if ye enquire any thing concerning other matters, it shall be determined in a lawful assembly.
language2_text: Si myan pa so ikarahet nyo am nanalahen nyo o araraw no ipeykeykaygi, kakavos na rana.

language1_text: For we are in danger to be called in question for this day's uproar, there being no cause whereby we may give an account of this concourse.
language2_text: O ta nipeyvonag rana sicyaraw eya am jyabo kaji da oyyan nyaten no panirsirngen do Loma, do na kabo no peypeypangayan na."

language1_text: And when he had thus spoken, he dismissed the assembly.
language2_text: Teyka na o ciring na am peysyasyain na sira o aro a tao.

language1_text: And after the uproar was ceased, Paul called unto him the disciples, and embraced them, and departed for to go into Macedonia.
language2_text: Meyrehes rana o nipeyvonag da am lovoten na sira ni Pawlo o amraralay ni Yeso, kapait na sira kataitaid na rana sira. So nikarwan na rana dang a mangay do Maciton.

language1_text: And when he had gone over those parts, and had given them much exhortation, he came into Greece,
language2_text: So nilivonan na so ili da pangonongan a mapait so sinjya, kangay na rana do Akayya.

language1_text: and there abode three months. And when the Jews laid wait for him, as he was about to sail into Syria, he purposed to return through Macedonia.
language2_text: So nisan na dang so katlo a vehan. Vovwan na o kavang na do avang a mangay do Sidiya am to na sapa o tao do Yotay a omvovo jya zakaten. Am ori o nipancyan na no kato na rana meysinaoli a meyliktaw do Maciton.

language1_text: And there accompanied him into Asia Sopater of Berea; and of the Thessalonians, Aristarchus and Secundus; and Gaius of Derbe, and Timotheus; and of Asia, Tychicus and Trophimus.
language2_text: O nimacihza jya am tao do Peyloya, anak na ni Pilo a meyngaran so Sopate a kano tao do Tesalonicya a meyngaran so Aditako a kani Sikongto a kano tao do Tepey a meyngaran so Cyayo a kano tao do Yasiya a meyngaran so Timotay a kani Ticiko a kani Teloveymo.

language1_text: These going before tarried for us at Troas.
language2_text: So nikehzehza da manma mangay do Teloya ili a amnanala jyamen.

language1_text: And we sailed away from Philippi after the days of unleavened bread, and came unto them to Troas in five days; where we abode seven days.
language2_text: Mahatas rana o nipamaring da so kanen do yakan da so ji nimimway a pang am nimapo namen do Veydipi. Kalima araw namen a niomavang do avang am makaranes namen do Teloya. So nipakacita namen rana so kararay namen a nimanmanma a nimangay. Karahan am misan namen do dang so kapito araw.

language1_text: And upon the first day of the week, when the disciples came together to break bread, Paul preached unto them, ready to depart on the morrow; and continued his speech until midnight.
language2_text: Makoyab do niciyo am malovot namen a kano akma nameney kakteh do cinai a mahahanghang a makanakem si Yeso a nimawakwak no raraten ta. So todavaki jya do ahep ni Pawlo a mangnanao, ta imong na o kangay na rana do ikadwa na araw.

language1_text: And there were many lights in the upper chamber, where they were gathered together.
language2_text: Aro zampo do ikatlo na vava no vahay a peylovolovotan namen.

language1_text: And there sat in a window a certain young man named Eutychus, being fallen into a deep sleep: and as Paul was long preaching, he sunk down with sleep, and fell down from the third loft, and was taken up dead.
language2_text: Amyan so asa ka malavayo a tao a meyngaran si Yotike a amlisna do ngoso no pazevngen. Ikongo do tey naro o ipangnanao ni Pawlo, am ori o nikakaha na ni Yotike. Karahan am todey manazasaz a makas do teyrahem. Citahen da am abo rana o inawan na.

language1_text: And Paul went down, and fell on him, and embracing him said, Trouble not yourselves; for his life is in him.
language2_text: So nyangay na ni Pawlo a kasapopo na sya. Maniring am, "Ji nyo alawan an, ta yana mavyay an."

language1_text: When he therefore was come up again, and had broken bread, and eaten, and talked a long while, even till break of day, so he departed.
language2_text: Tomanggeh rana si Pawlo do kavava no vahay am ahapen na o myanpaw a kakan na sya a kapangnanao na rana. So nyangay na do madagdag no ipangnanao na a kakaro na rana jira.

language1_text: And they brought the young man alive, and were not a little comforted.
language2_text: So nikavyay na rana no malavayo a tao ang. So nikasaray da no tao a mangay nya do vahay da.

language1_text: And we went before to ship, and sailed unto Assos, there intending to take in Paul: for so had he appointed, minding himself to go afoot.
language2_text: Nimanmanma namen a omavang do avang a mangay do Aso. Si Pawlo am to mangonong do rarahan. Ipanci na o kangay namen masinsinmo do Aso a ili.

language1_text: And when he met with us at Assos, we took him in, and came to Mitylene.
language2_text: Makaranes namen do Aso am masinmo namen si Pawlo. Am ori o nipavangan namen sya do avang, kangay namen rana do Mitidini.

language1_text: And we sailed thence, and came the next day over against Chios; and the next day we arrived at Samos, and tarried at Trogyllium; and the next day we came to Miletus.
language2_text: Ikadwa na araw am makaranes namen do Cio. Ikatlo na araw am nimangay namen someyked do Samo. Ikapat na araw am makaranes namen rana do Midito.

language1_text: For Paul had determined to sail by Ephesus, because he would not spend the time in Asia: for he hasted, if it were possible for him, to be at Jerusalem the day of Pentecost.
language2_text: Nakenakem na ni Pawlo o kaji namen neykedan do Ivoso, ta ihawa na kasengseng namen do Yasiya, ta meybezbez si Pawlo a mangay do Yelosaleng. Ta ikakza na o kapakapis na so pamaringan da so kanen no tao do Yotay do Osinci.

language1_text: And from Miletus he sent to Ephesus, and called the elders of the church.
language2_text: Amyan si Pawlo do Midito am manovoy so tao a mangay do Ivoso a manci no panipanirsirngen do kyokay a mai a tomita sya.

language1_text: And when they were come to him, he said unto them, Ye know, from the first day that I came into Asia, after what manner I have been with you at all seasons,
language2_text: Mai rana sira am pacisirsirngan na rana sira ni Pawlo. Maniring jira am, "Nyo katenngan o icicirawat ko no ka ori pa so kangay ko do Yasiya.

language1_text: serving the Lord with all humility of mind, and with many tears, and temptations, which befell me by the lying in wait of the Jews:
language2_text: Ko ji pahamaha o nakenakem ko do ko kahap so vazay na ni Ama ta do to. Tana peyrarehten da yaken no tao do Yotay, tana kalahen da yaken a zakaten am ji ko a mamman. O kapeyvazay ko so vazay ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: and how I kept back nothing that was profitable unto you, but have shewed you, and have taught you publickly, and from house to house,
language2_text: Nyo katenngan manga keypong, no ko myan do peylovolovotan no tao a kado peycyakavakavahayan am ko nanawen inyo. Ko miminen o apya ciring a yako ivavaga jinyo. So ikabo no ko taywen jinyo.

language1_text: testifying both to the Jews, and also to the Greeks, repentance toward God, and faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ.
language2_text: Tana tao do Yotay a tana tao do Sila am yako inyo to peyyangangaya a yananawen, do ko kakza ninyo a mamlis so nakem a omanoyong ji Yeso Kizisto a Panirsirngen ta.

language1_text: And now, behold, I go bound in the spirit unto Jerusalem, not knowing the things that shall befall me there:
language2_text: So ko na karwan jinyo sicyaikwaya a mangay do Yelosaleng, ta onotan ko o ipanci na jyaken no Seyzi. Am ji ko a tenngi o masapa ko dang a vazay.

language1_text: save that the Holy Ghost witnesseth in every city, saying that bonds and afflictions abide me.
language2_text: O ko katenngan am o na nipaziman jyaken no Seyzi do kapteng da jyaken, do karo no alalaw ko.

language1_text: But none of these things move me, neither count I my life dear unto myself, so that I might finish my course with joy, and the ministry, which I have received of the Lord Jesus, to testify the gospel of the grace of God.
language2_text: Am ko jyalawan o inawan ko. Ta ko kakakzeb so kakavos na no vazay ko a na nitoro jyaken ni Yeso Kizisto a Panirsirngen ta. So peylimwangan ko no Mapasaray a Ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to a omagaz do pangangarilawan na.

language1_text: And now, behold, I know that ye all, among whom I have gone preaching the kingdom of God, shall see my face no more.
language2_text: "No keyyan ko pa jinyo am nipanci ko na jinyo o omagaz do italamozong na ni Ama ta do to. Am ko na to mancyan jinyo am ji nyo na cita yaken.

language1_text: Wherefore I take you to record this day, that I am pure from the blood of all men.
language2_text: To ko na macitangain jinyo manga keypong am no si myan jinyo so ji nganoyong ji Yeso Kizisto am nakenakem na rana.

language1_text: For I have not shunned to declare unto you all the counsel of God.
language2_text: Ta yabo rana o ko taywen a nanao ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: Take heed therefore unto yourselves, and to all the flock, over the which the Holy Ghost hath made you overseers, to feed the church of God, which he hath purchased with his own blood.
language2_text: So ipeypepzat nyo an. Ahapen nyo o nitoro na jinyo no Seyzi a marilaw no kadwan jinyo. Ta sira rana am nipalit na no rala no Anak na ni Ama ta do to a yarana macikaop jya.

language1_text: For I know this, that after my departing shall grievous wolves enter in among you, not sparing the flock.
language2_text: Ta ko katenngan si karwan ko rana inyo am amyan so mangalalas a tao a mai a omnanao jinyo a mapeycyakawad jinyo a amraralay ni Yeso a tao.

language1_text: Also of your own selves shall men arise, speaking perverse things, to draw away disciples after them.
language2_text: Ta no makwa am amyan do tangain nyo so mangononong so malas amlita do amraralay ni Yeso Kizisto a tao. No amyan so akman sang a tao am ji nyo ngonoci.

language1_text: Therefore watch, and remember, that by the space of three years I ceased not to warn every one night and day with tears.
language2_text: Ori o apzatan nyo do onowned nyo an. Manakem nyo o ninanao ko jinyo a nimeykaoo ninyo an. Ta mina katlo a kawan ko a mangday so araraw a kano ahep a amnanao jinyo.

language1_text: And now, brethren, I commend you to God, and to the word of his grace, which is able to build you up, and to give you an inheritance among all them which are sanctified.
language2_text: "Sicyaikwaya am ko na to norwan inyo ji Ama ta do to. Ta ko ipeyhanhan o pangangarilawan na ni Ama ta do to a somidong jinyo a to ngotokot so nakem a meyhanhan nya. No si makman kamo sang am mahap nyo na o igeygeglaw na so omraralay nya tao.

language1_text: I have coveted no man's silver, or gold, or apparel.
language2_text: Yaken rana am yabo pa o yako nikamkam a nizpi a kano ayob da no tao.

language1_text: Yea, ye yourselves know, that these hands have ministered unto my necessities, and to them that were with me.
language2_text: Ta nyo katenngan yaken a yamowyat a meyvazay a omyaw no velek ko a yaomlam so kararay ko.

language1_text: I have shewed you all things, how that so labouring ye ought to support the weak, and to remember the words of the Lord Jesus, how he said, It is more blessed to give than to receive.
language2_text: Am ori o inaran nyo jyaken an. So ipakowyat nyo a meyvazay an. Ta ori o ipakasidong nyo so ji makahakaw a tao. Manakem nyo o mina ciring na jyaten ni Yeso a Panirsirngen ta. Ta maniring si Yeso am, 'Rakorako pa o sarasaray no onowned no mangazaw a kano azawen da tao.'"

language1_text: And when he had thus spoken, he kneeled down, and prayed with them all.
language2_text: Teyka na ori a ciring ni Pawlo am mamimin sira meylilitod a meynozi.

language1_text: And they all wept sore, and fell on Paul's neck, and kissed him,
language2_text: So nikamimin da meycyalavilavi a komopkop si Pawlo adkanan a taitaiden,

language1_text: sorrowing most of all for the words which he spake, that they should see his face no more. And they accompanied him unto the ship.
language2_text: do kapakanakem da so ciring ni Pawlo a manci no kaji da rana makacittan sya. So nikeyngen no onowned da. So nikamimin da macihza ji Pawlo a mapasakay sya do avang.

language1_text: And it came to pass, that after we were gotten from them, and had launched, we came with a straight course unto Coos, and the day following unto Rhodes, and from thence unto Patara:
language2_text: Mateyka namen sira taitaiden am somakay namen rana do avang a mangay do Kese a pongso. Ikadwa na araw am makaranes namen do Lotaw a ikatlo na araw am mangay namen do Patala.

language1_text: and finding a ship sailing over unto Phenicia, we went aboard, and set forth.
language2_text: Amyan namen do Patala am masazi namen o asa ka avang a mangay do Vongnise. So nipacisakay namen jira.

language1_text: Now when we had discovered Cyprus, we left it on the left hand, and sailed into Syria, and landed at Tyre: for there the ship was to unlade her burden.
language2_text: O angayan namen am masngen do Saypolose a pongso. Niliklik namen o Saypolose a pongso a mangay do Sidiya a pongso a kapeygegcin namen do Tayar a ili. Ta mapagcigcin sira dang so warawara.

language1_text: And finding disciples, we tarried there seven days: who said to Paul through the Spirit, that he should not go up to Jerusalem.
language2_text: Nimakacita namen dang so sinjya. Ori o nisan namen dang so kapito araw. Mangay rana si Pawlo am pakeken da si Pawlo a jyangay do Yelosaleng, ta amyan dang so nipanci na no Seyzi a ikanginanawa na ni Pawlo.

language1_text: And when we had accomplished those days, we departed and went our way; and they all brought us on our way, with wives and children, till we were out of the city: and we kneeled down on the shore, and prayed.
language2_text: Karwan namen rana sira am macihza sira jyamen o sinjya a kapalolo da so katovong da do vahay a kano anak da mangay a tomaitaid jyamen. So nikalovot namen a meylilitod do pasalan a meynozi ji Ama ta do to,

language1_text: And when we had taken our leave one of another, we took ship; and they returned home again.
language2_text: a kataitaid namen rana sira kavang namen rana do avang. O sinjya am mangay rana sira do kavahayan da.

language1_text: And when we had finished our course from Tyre, we came to Ptolemais, and saluted the brethren, and abode with them one day.
language2_text: So nisongay na rana no avang apo do Tayar a mangay do Todimay. Makaranes namen do dang am mangay namen itazogaw sira o sinjya a kapacisan namen jira so kasahep.

language1_text: And the next day we that were of Paul's company departed, and came unto Cæ sarea: and we entered into the house of Philip the evangelist, which was one of the seven; and abode with him.
language2_text: Ikadwa na araw am karwan namen rana dang a mangay do Kaysadiya. So nirateng namen do vahay ni Veydipo. Iya rana am vazay na o kapeylimwang na no Mapasaray a Ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to. Iya rana am ikapapito da no nipamnekan da a somidong so vazay do kyokay do Yelosaleng no kakwa. Karahan am misan namen do dang.

language1_text: And the same man had four daughters, virgins, which did prophesy.
language2_text: Amyan so papat a mavakes a anak na a jya nimacivahavahay pa. Sira rana am mamimin sira mateneng a mangononong so ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: And as we tarried there many days, there came down from Judæ a a certain prophet, named Agabus.
language2_text: Asa ka peywalam no tao o nisan namen dang. Amyan so asa ka tao a meyngaran si Acyapo a panoyonoywan na so ciring ni Ama ta do to apo do Yotay.

language1_text: And when he was come unto us, he took Paul's girdle, and bound his own hands and feet, and said, Thus saith the Holy Ghost, So shall the Jews at Jerusalem bind the man that owneth this girdle, and shall deliver him into the hands of the Gentiles.
language2_text: Nimai a tomita jyamen. Mai ori am ahapen na o abtek na ni Pawlo a kato na ngonangan do lima na kano ai na a vaoden. Maniring am, "Yamaniring o Seyzi am, 'O mapeyyabtek rana so sya am vaoden da no tao do Yotay do Yelosaleng a katoro da nya do beken a tao do Yotay.'"

language1_text: And when we heard these things, both we, and they of that place, besought him not to go up to Jerusalem.
language2_text: Mamizing namen o akman sang a ciring na am ji namen novoya si Pawlo a mangay do Yelosaleng.

language1_text: Then Paul answered, What mean ye to weep and to break mine heart? for I am ready not to be bound only, but also to die at Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus.
language2_text: Am maniring si Pawlo am, "Ikongo nyo lavyan jyaken a ko ikarahet no onowned. Cyaha, ta ko ahapen o vazay ni Yeso a Panirsirngen ta. Tana vaoden da yaken do Yelosaleng a mawakwak do dang am cyaha, ta nakenakem ko an."

language1_text: And when he would not be persuaded, we ceased, saying, The will of the Lord be done.
language2_text: Ji namen a pasovoy si Pawlo am to namen rana a macipanadngi. Maniring namen am, "Inaoy no si mangononong o ahahapan na sya ni Ama ta do to."

language1_text: And after those days we took up our carriages, and went up to Jerusalem.
language2_text: Meyratateng am ahapen namen rana o apzapzatan namen a mangay do Yelosaleng.

language1_text: There went with us also certain of the disciples of Cæ sarea, and brought with them one Mnason of Cyprus, an old disciple, with whom we should lodge.
language2_text: Amyan so apo do Kaysadiya a sinjya a macilolo jyamen a kangay da nyamen do vahay na ni Nason a tao do Saypolose pongso. Iya rana am nimeycicinda amraralay ni Yeso Kizisto.

language1_text: And when we were come to Jerusalem, the brethren received us gladly.
language2_text: Makaranes namen do Yelosaleng am aro dang o sinjya a magaga a tomaotao jyamen.

language1_text: And the day following Paul went in with us unto James; and all the elders were present.
language2_text: Ikadwa na araw am macihza namen ji Pawlo a mangay tomita si Yake. O panipanirsirngen rana do kyokay am amyan sira dang.

language1_text: And when he had saluted them, he declared particularly what things God had wrought among the Gentiles by his ministry.
language2_text: So nipeyminaminasyan na nira ni Pawlo a kapanci na no vazay na ni Ama ta do to jya do beken a tao do Yotay, do mina kapeylimwang na no ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to jira.

language1_text: And when they heard it, they glorified the Lord, and said unto him, Thou seest, brother, how many thousands of Jews there are which believe; and they are all zealous of the law:
language2_text: Mamizing da no akma nameney kakteh do cinai am isaray da ji Ama ta do to. Am maniring sira ji Pawlo am, "Mo kakteh, do namen naknakman sya am ala sira rana amlaksa o tao a omanoyong ji Yeso Kizisto a tao do Yotay. Sira rana ori am makdeng sira mahap so iwawalam na ni Moyse.

language1_text: and they are informed of thee, that thou teachest all the Jews which are among the Gentiles to forsake Moses, saying that they ought not to circumcise their children, neither to walk after the customs.
language2_text: Mamizing da imo a nimangnanao so tao do Yotay a meyili do beken a ili da no tao do Yotay am nipanci mo kono o kataosya da so iwawalam ni Moyse. Nipanci mo kono o kataosya da rana so kayongkad do kanakan.

language1_text: What is it therefore? the multitude must needs come together: for they will hear that thou art come.
language2_text: No si mamizing da imo no tao do Yotay a nimai do jya a kai da do jya mapacici jyamen am ikongo ipasapa namen jira.

language1_text: Do therefore this that we say to thee: We have four men which have a vow on them;
language2_text: Hapen mo o ciring namen jimo an. Amyan so papat a ka tao a nimyan so ciring ji Ama ta do to.

language1_text: them take, and purify thyself with them, and be at charges with them, that they may shave their heads: and all may know that those things, whereof they were informed concerning thee, are nothing; but that thou thyself also walkest orderly, and keepest the law.
language2_text: Palolwen mo sira a macihza jimo a mangay omahap so iwawalam ta tao do Yotay a katoro mo so nizpi do akdawan da jira. Golgolan da o oo da. Ta yongkad no kapangononong no mina ciring da si Ama ta do to. Ta si makman kamo sang am panoyngen da rana imo no tao a jya nimanci no akman sang a vazay, do kapacyanoyong mo do iwawalam no tao do Yotay.

language1_text: As touching the Gentiles which believe, we have written and concluded that they observe no such thing, save only that they keep themselves from things offered to idols, and from blood, and from strangled, and from fornication.
language2_text: Yamen rana am nipeyteygami namen sira o yaomanoyong ji Yeso Kizisto a beken a tao do Yotay, do kaji da nganan so nipazos da, kaji da nganan so rala no vinyay kano nivitkeh da vinyay a nimazakat a jya nimvoyog so rala. Taosya o kapangzakza da so icyatatao da."

language1_text: Then Paul took the men, and the next day purifying himself with them entered into the temple, to signify the accomplishment of the days of purification, until that an offering should be offered for every one of them.
language2_text: Ikadwa na araw am palolwen na sira o papat a ka tao ang ni Pawlo a mangay mahap so iwawalam da no tao do Yotay. So nyangay ni Pawlo do rako a panaralayan a mapaziman sya do mapatanatanang so nakem da si Ama ta do to a mapatanang na nira so nakem da si Ama ta do to no papat a kararay na.

language1_text: And when the seven days were almost ended, the Jews which were of Asia, when they saw him in the temple, stirred up all the people, and laid hands on him,
language2_text: Makeykai rana komavos o ikapito na araw am amyan so tao do Yotay apo do Yasiya a nimakacita si Pawlo do rako a panaralayan. Karahan am manara sira so aro a tao a kapeyvonag da sira. Ori o nirakpan da si Pawlo.

language1_text: crying out, Men of Israel, help: This is the man, that teacheth all men every where against the people, and the law, and this place: and further brought Greeks also into the temple, and hath polluted this holy place.
language2_text: Maniring sira am, "Inyo rana Isedi a tao am sidongen nyo yamen an. Ta si Pawlo rana am yaro na nipanci a macisala do iwawalam ta, na niraherahet yaten a Isedi a tao a na kapazagom pa sya a yarehrehten so iwawalam na ni Moyse a kano rako a panaralayan ta. Ta sicyaikwa rana ya am na todey rara sira a yasomdep o beken a tao do Yotay do rako a panaralayan ta. So ikanoyong na nya ya meyraraten."

language1_text: (For they had seen before with him in the city Trophimus an Ephesian, whom they supposed that Paul had brought into the temple.)
language2_text: O pancyan da no akman sang am nimacita da si Pawlo a kano asa ka tao do Ivoso a meyngaran si Teloveymo do Yelosaleng. Am ori o nipatolinan da sya ji Pawlo a nimapalolo sya somdep do rako a panaralayan.

language1_text: And all the city was moved, and the people ran together: and they took Paul, and drew him out of the temple: and forthwith the doors were shut.
language2_text: Meyratateng am meyvonag sira o asa ka ili a karanes da mai no aro a tao amrakep si Pawlo. Karahan am powboten da do rako a panaralayan a kaslet da rana jya.

language1_text: And as they went about to kill him, tidings came unto the chief captain of the band, that all Jerusalem was in an uproar.
language2_text: To da ji wakwaka si Pawlo am keyyan no asa ka panirsirngen no itaysang no Loma a nimakamizing sya.

language1_text: Who immediately took soldiers and centurions, and ran down unto them: and when they saw the chief captain and the soldiers, they left beating of Paul.
language2_text: Karahan am mapalolo so aro a itaysang a mangay do meyvonag a tao. Macita da no aro a tao o panirsirngen da no itaysang a kano aro a itaysang am iptad da rana o kabakbak da ji Pawlo,

language1_text: Then the chief captain came near, and took him, and commanded him to be bound with two chains; and demanded who he was, and what he had done.
language2_text: kangay na omrakep si Pawlo no panirsirngen da no itaysang kavaod da sya no nipeylalin da adwa ka vahalang. Maniring am, "Sino ka ya. Ikongo vazay mo ang."

language1_text: And some cried one thing, some another, among the multitude: and when he could not know the certainty for the tumult, he commanded him to be carried into the castle.
language2_text: Maniring sira o aro a tao a amlololos am, "Ori a ori o kakwan na no vazay no nya." Ikongo do meysaksaklang o ipanci da, am ori o ji na makatenngi jya no panirsirngen no itaysang so niyapoyapwan no vazay ang. Meyratateng am ipanci na o itaysang a somdep nya do sahad.

language1_text: And when he came upon the stairs, so it was, that he was borne of the soldiers for the violence of the people.
language2_text: Amyan sira do zazakdangan am ikongo do tey masosozi sira o aro a tao, am ori o nikasamosamozongan da ji Pawlo no aro a itaysang a isdep do sahad.

language1_text: For the multitude of the people followed after, crying, Away with him.
language2_text: Am macilolo pa sira o aro a tao a amlololos. Maniring sira am, "Zakaten ta si Pawlo!"

language1_text: And as Paul was to be led into the castle, he said unto the chief captain, May I speak unto thee? Who said, Canst thou speak Greek?
language2_text: Toda jindep sira do vahay da no itaysang am maniring si Pawlo do panirsirngen da am, "Apyahen mo keyyan no asa ka ciring ko?" Tovisan na no panirsirngen am, "Mo katenngan o ciring no tao do Sila?

language1_text: Art not thou that Egyptian, which before these days madest an uproar, and leddest out into the wilderness four thousand men that were murderers?
language2_text: Beken a tao ka do Ayci asyo a nimraherahet so seyvo a nimapalolo so kakapatan a ranaw (4000) a mararahet so nakenakem a tao a nitomayo do kabwan no nihakawan no tao?"

language1_text: But Paul said, I am a man which am a Jew of Tarsus, a city in Cilicia, a citizen of no mean city: and, I beseech thee, suffer me to speak unto the people.
language2_text: Maniring si Pawlo am, "Yaken rana am tao do Yotay ko a nimatazak a tao do Tasose a rako a ili do Cidicya. Apyahen mo yaken a macisirsiring do aro a tao?"

language1_text: And when he had given him licence, Paul stood on the stairs, and beckoned with the hand unto the people. And when there was made a great silence, he spake unto them in the Hebrew tongue, saying,
language2_text: So nipyan na sya no panirsirngen no itaysang. Meyratateng am meytatanek si Pawlo do zazakdangan a mapatala so lima na do aro a tao. Am ori o ji da nimeykazyazyaki no aro a tao. Karahan am sirsirngen na sira ni Pawlo no ciring da no Sipolay. Maniring si Pawlo am,

language1_text: Men, brethren, and fathers, hear ye my defence which I make now unto you.
language2_text: "Manga maran, manga kakteh, amizngen nyo o ko ipanci jinyo, manga keypong an."

language1_text: (And when they heard that he spake in the Hebrew tongue to them, they kept the more silence: and he saith, )
language2_text: Mamizing da si Pawlo a meyzezyak so ciring da no Sipolay am yeyyak da. Meyratateng am mangononong rana si Pawlo. Maniring am,
