language1_text: I am verily a man which am a Jew, born in Tarsus, a city in Cilicia, yet brought up in this city at the feet of Gamaliel, and taught according to the perfect manner of the law of the fathers, and was zealous toward God, as ye all are this day.
language2_text: "Yaken rana am tao do Yotay ko a nimatazak a tao do Tasose a macinapnap do Cidicya am nimamno ko do Yelosaleng eya. Nimeyvilang ko ji Cyamadi a tey mateneng a mangnanao no iwawalam ta tao do Yotay. Ori o nikakman ko jinyo a makdeng a omahap so iwawalam no ineynapo ta.

language1_text: And I persecuted this way unto the death, binding and delivering into prisons both men and women.
language2_text: No kakwa pa am makdeng ko a nimapakakasi so amraralay ni Yeso a tao. So niyan no nimawakwak ko jira ang. Tana mavakes a tana mahakay am abo o ji ko rakpa jira a pain do pamemtengan.

language1_text: As also the high priest doth bear me witness, and all the estate of the elders: from whom also I received letters unto the brethren, and went to Damascus, to bring them which were there bound unto Jerusalem, for to be punished.
language2_text: To nyo mancyan do panirsirngen da no mapatanatanang so nakem da si Ama ta do to a kano kamanrarakehan, ta sira ang o nimakacita jyaken a nimanta nyaken so teygami a mangay do Tamaseke a omya jyaken a omrakep so amraralay ni Yeso a tao a yangay do Yelosaleng a bakbakan.

language1_text: And it came to pass, that, as I made my journey, and was come nigh unto Damascus about noon, suddenly there shone from heaven a great light round about me.
language2_text: "Tod ko a ji makaranes do Tamaseke do peyignan no araw am to ngyan so mazngang apo do teyngato a tomiray jyaken.

language1_text: And I fell unto the ground, and heard a voice saying unto me, Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me?
language2_text: Am ori o nikavazakwang ko do teyrahem. Karahan am amyan so ciring. Maniring am, 'Mo Sawlo, mo Sawlo, ikongo yamo pakakasyan jyaken.'

language1_text: And I answered, Who art thou, Lord? And he said unto me, I am Jesus of Nazareth, whom thou persecutest.
language2_text: Maniring ko jya am, 'Mo Panirsirngen, sino ka.' Maniring am, 'Yaken rana am si Yeso ko a tao do Nasale a yamo pakakasin.'

language1_text: And they that were with me saw indeed the light, and were afraid; but they heard not the voice of him that spake to me.
language2_text: O kararay ko am nimacita da o maniray. O zezyak a nimamizing ko am ji da nimamizing.

language1_text: And I said, What shall I do, Lord? And the Lord said unto me, Arise, and go into Damascus; and there it shall be told thee of all things which are appointed for thee to do.
language2_text: Pacicin ko am, 'Mo Panirsirngen, meypanngonngo ko so wanjin eya.' Maniring jyaken o Panirsirngen ta am, 'Peyvangon rana kangay mo do Tamaseke, ta amyan dang so asa ka tao a manci nya jimo so kakzeben na ni Ama ta do to a vazay mo.'

language1_text: And when I could not see for the glory of that light, being led by the hand of them that were with me, I came into Damascus.
language2_text: Ikongo do tey macimat o zezngangen na, am ori o nikakowap ko. Karahan am to da rana ngalaya yaken no kararay ko a yangay do Tamaseke.

language1_text: And one Ananias, a devout man according to the law, having a good report of all the Jews which dwelt there,
language2_text: "Amyan dang so asa ka tao a meyngaran si Ananiya. Iya rana ori am manoyong a mahap so iwawalam ni Moyse. So kanigan da nya no tao do Yotay amyan do Tamaseke.

language1_text: came unto me, and stood, and said unto me, Brother Saul, receive thy sight. And the same hour I looked up upon him.
language2_text: Mai ori jyaken am maniring am, 'Mo Sawlo, akma koy kakteh do cinai, makacita ka rana.' No kanang rana am mina to ko na makacita.

language1_text: And he said, The God of our fathers hath chosen thee, that thou shouldest know his will, and see that Just One, and shouldest hear the voice of his mouth.
language2_text: Maniring jyaken am, 'Yana nipamnekan imo no Tao do to da no ineynapo ta a mahap so vazay na, do mo kanimakacita si Yeso a Anak na ni Ama ta do to, do kanimakamizing mo so ciring ni Yeso.

language1_text: For thou shalt be his witness unto all men of what thou hast seen and heard.
language2_text: Imo rana am ipeylimwang mo do aro a tao o mo nimacita kano mo nimamizing.

language1_text: And now why tarriest thou? arise, and be baptized, and wash away thy sins, calling on the name of the Lord.
language2_text: Am ori o ji mo meypahahai. Peyvangon rana a kapamlis mo na so nakenakem. Tawagan mo o ngaran ni Yeso a omvonas so raraten mo a kataktak da jimo.' Ori o ciring na jyaken ni Ananiya.

language1_text: And it came to pass, that, when I was come again to Jerusalem, even while I prayed in the temple, I was in a trance; and saw him saying unto me, Make haste, and get thee quickly out of Jerusalem: for they will not receive thy testimony concerning me.
language2_text: "Kadadayan na so araraw am meyoli ko a mangay do Yelosaleng a mangay meynozi do rako a panaralayan. Meyratateng am akma raney tateynep ko si Yeso a to ko a cita. Maniring jyaken am, 'Makeykai ka komaro do Yelosaleng an. Ta o tao rana jya am da jyakzan a yamizngen o mo ipeylimwang jira a ciriciring ko.' "Kadadayan na so araraw am meyoli ko a mangay do Yelosaleng a mangay meynozi do rako a panaralayan. Meyratateng am akma raney tateynep ko si Yeso a to ko a cita. Maniring jyaken am, 'Makeykai ka komaro do Yelosaleng an. Ta o tao rana jya am da jyakzan a yamizngen o mo ipeylimwang jira a ciriciring ko.'

language1_text: And I said, Lord, they know that I imprisoned and beat in every synagogue them that believed on thee:
language2_text: Maniring ko am, 'Mo Panirsirngen, da mamimin yaken no tao a yakatenngan a yamapakakasi so aro a yamraralay nimo do peyneynozyan.

language1_text: and when the blood of thy martyr Stephen was shed, I also was standing by, and consenting unto his death, and kept the raiment of them that slew him.
language2_text: No kawakwak da so nimeylimwang no ciriciring mo a meyngaran so Setiven am nimacizanod ko jira a tomita so aywayob da.'

language1_text: And he said unto me, Depart: for I will send thee far hence unto the Gentiles.
language2_text: Maniring jyaken si Yeso am, 'To ka nangay. Ko na to novoya imo a mangay do ili da no beken a tao do Yotay a meylimwang no ciriciring ko.'"

language1_text: And they gave him audience unto this word, and then lifted up their voices, and said, Away with such a fellow from the earth: for it is not fit that he should live.
language2_text: Mamizing da no tao o niononongan ni Pawlo am amlololos sira manci no, "Zakaten ta si Pawlo. Zakaten ta si Pawlo. Jyabo kavyay so akman sya ya."

language1_text: And as they cried out, and cast off their clothes, and threw dust into the air,
language2_text: So nilololos da mapatalatala so ayob da kapeymeymozasik da so tana.

language1_text: the chief captain commanded him to be brought into the castle, and bade that he should be examined by scourging; that he might know wherefore they cried so against him.
language2_text: O panirsirngen no itaysang no Loma am iyokod na si Pawlo a isdep do vahay da no itaysang a kasipsipzot da jya pacicin. Ta si ori pa o patwawan na ni Pawlo so karatan na.

language1_text: And as they bound him with thongs, Paul said unto the centurion that stood by, Is it lawful for you to scourge a man that is a Roman, and uncondemned?
language2_text: To da ji nipsipzoci am maniring si Pawlo do itaysang amyan dang am, "Manngwa, manoyong a iwawalam nyo a Loma o kapanmanma nyo a mamakbak so tao do Loma an? No manmanma o kakala nyo so karatan na."

language1_text: When the centurion heard that, he went and told the chief captain, saying, Take heed what thou doest: for this man is a Roman.
language2_text: Mamizing na no itaysang o ciring ni Pawlo am to rana angay a komala so panirsirngen da. Maniring jya am, "Ka nimeypanngonngo eya. Mo jyatenngi ori a tao do Loma?"

language1_text: Then the chief captain came, and said unto him, Tell me, art thou a Roman? He said, Yea.
language2_text: Karahan am mangay na citahen no panirsirngen si Pawlo. Maniring am, "Ka manoyong a tao do Loma ya an?" Maniring si Pawlo am, "Noon."

language1_text: And the chief captain answered, With a great sum obtained I this freedom. And Paul said, But I was free born.
language2_text: Maniring ji Pawlo o panirsirngen no itaysang am, "Yaken rana am yaro o nizpi a yako ningina do kataotao ko. Ori o ko rana ipeyngongyod a tao do Loma." Maniring si Pawlo am, "Nimapo no katazak a tao ko o ka Loma ko."

language1_text: Then straightway they departed from him which should have examined him: and the chief captain also was afraid, after he knew that he was a Roman, and because he had bound him.
language2_text: Mamizing da no omvovo ji Pawlo a bakbakan am mina to da rana ngaroi. So nikalaw na no panirsirngen da no itaysang, ta katenngan na si Pawlo a tao do Loma a todey vaoda.

language1_text: On the morrow, because he would have known the certainty wherefore he was accused of the Jews, he loosed him from his bands, and commanded the chief priests and all their council to appear, and brought Paul down, and set him before them.
language2_text: Ikongo do kakzeben na no panirsirngen da no itaysang o kapakateneng na do oyyan da ni Pawlo no tao do Yotay, am ori o niovayan na so nivaod da sya do ikadwa na araw a kalovot na so panipanirsirngen no mapatanatanang so nakem da si Ama ta do to a kano macipeykaygi jira a kamanrarakehan a kapowbot da si Pawlo a patanken do tangain da.

language1_text: And Paul, earnestly beholding the council, said, Men and brethren, I have lived in all good conscience before God until this day.
language2_text: Singkadan na sira ni Pawlo o macipeykaygi a tao. Maniring jira am, "Manga kakteh, o iwawalam ko no kalyalikey ko am abo pasagpyanan ko so nakenakem ko do tangain ni Ama ta do to a yato ngai sicyaraw eya an."

language1_text: And the high priest Ananias commanded them that stood by him to smite him on the mouth.
language2_text: Mamizing na no panirsirngen da no mapatanatanang so nakem da si Ama ta do to a meyngaran so Ananiya am manara so tao a somiplang so ngoso ni Pawlo.

language1_text: Then said Paul unto him, God shall smite thee, thou whited wall: for sittest thou to judge me after the law, and commandest me to be smitten contrary to the law?
language2_text: Maniring si Pawlo jya am, "Mangay o kapasingesinget na jimo ni Ama ta do to, do mo kaji raralayan nya. Ta imo rana am mo jya nyahap o iwawalam ta mapacici jyaken. So mo ikalas so iwawalam a yato manci no tao a yasomiplang jyaken."

language1_text: And they that stood by said, Revilest thou God's high priest?
language2_text: Maniring sira o macitangked jya tao am, "Yaka makongo a yajyasnesnek no panirsirngen no mapatanatanang so nakem ta si Ama ta do to."

language1_text: Then said Paul, I wist not, brethren, that he was the high priest: for it is written, Thou shalt not speak evil of the ruler of thy people.
language2_text: Maniring si Pawlo am, "Manga kakteh, no ko nikatenngan ori a panirsirngen no mapatanatanang so nakem si Ama ta do to am ko jya nioya. Ta o ciring do Seysyo am, 'Ji nyo ngavaya o panirsirngen nyo.'"

language1_text: But when Paul perceived that the one part were Sadducees, and the other Pharisees, he cried out in the council, Men and brethren, I am a Pharisee, the son of a Pharisee: of the hope and resurrection of the dead I am called in question.
language2_text: To na rana tenngi ni Pawlo o kapeypinpin da no tao a macyagom do Satokay a kano macyagom do Vadisay. Am ori o nilolos na do peykeykaygyan da. Maniring am, "Manga kakteh, yaken rana am ko macyagom do Vadisay. O ineynapo ko am macyagom do Vadisay. O nyo pacicyan jyaken sicyaraw eya am ko kanoyong do keypirwa mavyay no nimawakwak a tao an."

language1_text: And when he had so said, there arose a dissension between the Pharisees and the Sadducees: and the multitude was divided.
language2_text: Kapakamizing da so ciring ni Pawlo am meygalagalagal sira o tao a macyagom do Vadisay a kano macyagom do Satokay. So nipeykadwa no nakenakem da a ji macipaswasovoy do kadwan jira.

language1_text: For the Sadducees say that there is no resurrection, neither angel, nor spirit: but the Pharisees confess both.
language2_text: Ta ji da nganoyngi no tao a macyagom do Satokay o keypirwa da mavyay no nimawakwak a tao. Ji da nganoyngi o keyyan no tinsi a kano keyyan no pahad no tao. Am o tao a macyagom do Vadisay am miminen da ori a anoyngan.

language1_text: And there arose a great cry: and the scribes that were of the Pharisees' part arose, and strove, saying, We find no evil in this man: but if a spirit or an angel hath spoken to him, let us not fight against God.
language2_text: So nikarakorako pa no ilololosan da. So nipeytatanek da no karwan da no tao a macyagom do Vadisay a mangnanao no iwawalam ni Ama ta do to. Maniring sira am, "Namen jyakala o na karatan no tao eya. Tana yamyan so tinsi a kano pahad a macisirsiring jya am ta karatan nya."

language1_text: And when there arose a great dissension, the chief captain, fearing lest Paul should have been pulled in pieces of them, commanded the soldiers to go down, and to take him by force from among them, and to bring him into the castle.
language2_text: Ikeykavevek da amlololos. Ikongo do peypazapazangan da rana si Pawlo, am ori o nipanovoy na no panirsirngen no itaysang so itaysang a mangay omvozcin sya jira a isdep do sahad.

language1_text: And the night following the Lord stood by him, and said, Be of good cheer, Paul: for as thou hast testified of me in Jerusalem, so must thou bear witness also at Rome.
language2_text: Mahep rana am mai si Yeso do katangked ni Pawlo. Maniring am, "Ji ka onib, mo Pawlo an. To mo peynara no kapeylimwangan mo nyaken do Yelosaleng a meylimwang nyaken do Loma."

language1_text: And when it was day, certain of the Jews banded together, and bound themselves under a curse, saying that they would neither eat nor drink till they had killed Paul. And they were more than forty which had made this conspiracy.
language2_text: Ikadwa na araw do penzak am kakapatan (40) sira o tao do Yotay a nimeysirisiring. Maniring sira am, "Si ji ta zakat si Pawlo am jyabo kapangakaday ta." Ikadwa na araw do penzak am kakapatan (40) sira o tao do Yotay a nimeysirisiring. Maniring sira am, "Si ji ta zakat si Pawlo am jyabo kapangakaday ta."

language1_text: And they came to the chief priests and elders, and said, We have bound ourselves under a great curse, that we will eat nothing until we have slain Paul.
language2_text: Meyratateng am mangay sira do panipanirsirngen no mapatanatanang so nakem da si Ama ta do to a kano kamanrarakehan. Maniring sira am, "Namen rana teyka a meysirisiring. No si ji namen a zakat si Pawlo am ji namen mangakaday.

language1_text: Now therefore ye with the council signify to the chief captain that he bring him down unto you to morrow, as though ye would enquire something more perfectly concerning him: and we, or ever he come near, are ready to kill him.
language2_text: Inyo rana panipanirsirngen am ipanci nyo o panirsirngen no itaysang no Loma a mai ni Pawlo do jya, akma nyoy pacicin a komala so karatan na. A yamen am avatan namen do jya wakwaken si mai do jya."

language1_text: And when Paul's sister's son heard of their lying in wait, he went and entered into the castle, and told Paul.
language2_text: Mamizing na o ciring ori no manganak no kakteh ni Pawlo am mangay do vahay no itaysang a mangay manci nya ji Pawlo.

language1_text: Then Paul called one of the centurions unto him, and said, Bring this young man unto the chief captain: for he hath a certain thing to tell him.
language2_text: Am ori o nipanara na ni Pawlo so asa ka itaysang. Maniring jya am, "Palolwen mo o malavayo a tao ito a mangay do panirsirngen nyo, ta yamyan so na ipanci jya."

language1_text: So he took him, and brought him to the chief captain, and said, Paul the prisoner called me unto him, and prayed me to bring this young man unto thee, who hath something to say unto thee.
language2_text: Am ori o nipalolwan na sya mangay do panirsirngen da. Maniring am, "Si Pawlo rana yata nipteng eya am na ipanci yaken a yamapalolo so tao eya mangay a tomita jimo. Ta yamyan so na ipanci jimo."

language1_text: Then the chief captain took him by the hand, and went with him aside privately, and asked him, What is that thou hast to tell me?
language2_text: So nikalayan na sya no panirsirngen so malavayo a tao ang a pahawahen na a sirsirngen. Maniring am, "Ikongo mo ipanci jyaken."

language1_text: And he said, The Jews have agreed to desire thee that thou wouldest bring down Paul to morrow into the council, as though they would enquire somewhat of him more perfectly.
language2_text: Maniring am, "Da nipeysirisiring no tao do Yotay o kapya mo si Pawlo simaraw a mangay do rako a peykeykaygyan, akma dey pacicin.

language1_text: But do not thou yield unto them: for there lie in wait for him of them more than forty men, which have bound themselves with an oath, that they will neither eat nor drink till they have killed him: and now are they ready, looking for a promise from thee.
language2_text: Am ji mo ngonoci sira an, ta yamyan so kakapatan (40) a tao a yaomavat jya wakwaken. Ta o ciring da am, 'No si ji ta wakwaka si Pawlo am ji ta mangakaday.' Imo rana o da ahesen."

language1_text: So the chief captain then let the young man depart, and charged him, See thou tell no man that thou hast shewed these things to me.
language2_text: Maniring jya o panirsirngen da no itaysang am, "Ji mo mancyan do tao o kanimanci mo nya jyaken so akman sya vazay an." Meyratateng am tovoin na rana mangay.

language1_text: And he called unto him two centurions, saying, Make ready two hundred soldiers to go to Cæ sarea, and horsemen threescore and ten, and spearmen two hundred, at the third hour of the night;
language2_text: Am ori o nipanara na no panirsirngen no itaysang so rarwa ka lamlamsoy na. Maniring jira am, "Meykala kamo so adwa poo (200) a itaysang a kano kakapitwan (70) a omavang do baka a itaysang a kapeykala nyo pa so adwa poo (200) a meycinalolot a macihza jira. Ta simahep do ikasyam no toki am yangay nyo si Pawlo do Kaysadiya,

language1_text: and provide them beasts, that they may set Paul on, and bring him safe unto Felix the governor.
language2_text: a kapeykala nyo ni Pawlo so avangan na baka a kapacihza nyo jya a rarayan a mangay ji Veydise a kabtekan ta panirsirngen."

language1_text: And he wrote a letter after this manner:
language2_text: Meyratateng am meyteygami jya o panirsirngen ang. Maniring am,

language1_text: Claudius Lysias unto the most excellent governor Felix sendeth greeting.
language2_text: "Yaken rana am si Kelawti Disiya. Ko ipeyteygami imo a panirsirngen namen. Maran kong mo Veydise.

language1_text: This man was taken of the Jews, and should have been killed of them: then came I with an army, and rescued him, having understood that he was a Roman.
language2_text: Si Pawlo rana ya am yada nirakep no tao do Yotay. Da naknakmen o da kawakwak sya. Am katenngan ko rana tao do Loma si Pawlo am ori o nipanara ko so itaysang a yamangay nya jimo.

language1_text: And when I would have known the cause wherefore they accused him, I brought him forth into their council:
language2_text: Si Pawlo am nyangay ko do rako a peykeykaygyan. Ta ko naknakmen o ko kakala so agagazan no da oyyan nya.

language1_text: whom I perceived to be accused of questions of their law, but to have nothing laid to his charge worthy of death or of bonds.
language2_text: O nioyyan da nya am ipanci da o kaji na ngapan no iwawalam da no tao do Yotay. Am ko jyatenngi o peypeypangayan no da wakwakan sya, da aptengan sya.

language1_text: And when it was told me how that the Jews laid wait for the man, I sent straightway to thee, and gave commandment to his accusers also to say before thee what they had against him. Farewell.
language2_text: Mamizing ko o keyyan no amvovo jya wakwaken am ori o ko peyteygamyan nimo a omzat jya. O ko nipanci do tao do Yotay am, 'Mangay kamo pa do kabtekan ta panirsirngen a manci no agagazan no yanyo nirakpan si Pawlo.'"

language1_text: Then the soldiers, as it was commanded them, took Paul, and brought him by night to Antipatris.
language2_text: Karahan am yangay da rana si Pawlo no aro a itaysang do Antipate do mahep.

language1_text: On the morrow they left the horsemen to go with him, and returned to the castle:
language2_text: Ikadwa na araw am meysinaoli rana sira o katey da no itaysang do vahay da. Omavang do baka a itaysang am ori o macihza ji Pawlo.

language1_text: who, when they came to Cæ sarea, and delivered the epistle to the governor, presented Paul also before him.
language2_text: Makaranes sira do Kaysadiya am itoro da rana o teygami do kabtekan da panirsirngen a katoro da ni Pawlo jya.

language1_text: And when the governor had read the letter, he asked of what province he was. And when he understood that he was of Cilicia;
language2_text: Vilangan na no panirsirngen o teygami am pacicin na o nikapwan na ili ni Pawlo. Ori o nipakatenngan na rana jya tao do Cidicya.

language1_text: I will hear thee, said he, when thine accusers are also come. And he commanded him to be kept in Herod's judgment hall.
language2_text: Maniring am, "Si makaranes rana sira o tao a yamraherahet jimo am pacicin ko imo." Meyratateng am ipanci na o itaysang a amzat jya do vahay no mina panirsirngen da a meyngaran so Helote.

language1_text: And after five days Ananias the high priest descended with the elders, and with a certain orator named Tertullus, who informed the governor against Paul.
language2_text: Ikalima na araw am o panirsirngen no mapatanatanang so nakem da si Ama ta do to a meyngaran so Ananiya kano aro a kamanrarakehan a kano meyngaran si Tetolo a mapacicici a nimai do Kaysadiya kangay da do kabtekan da panirsirngen a meyngaran so Veydise a manci no karatan ni Pawlo.

language1_text: And when he was called forth, Tertullus began to accuse him, saying, Seeing that by thee we enjoy great quietness, and that very worthy deeds are done unto this nation by thy providence,
language2_text: Karahan am powboten da si Pawlo do pacicicyan a kapanci na no aro a karatan na ni Pawlo ni Tetolo. Maniring am, "Mo Veydise a panirsirngen, imo rana am yaka tey mateneng a mimong nyamen. Am ori o namen ikapiya do keymiminili namen. Yaro yapiya vazay mo do keymiminili namen.

language1_text: we accept it always, and in all places, most noble Felix, with all thankfulness.
language2_text: So namen sarayan no karilawan mo nyamen.

language1_text: Notwithstanding, that I be not further tedious unto thee, I pray thee that thou wouldest hear us of thy clemency a few words.
language2_text: Yabo a yamasalit a ko isanga jimo am amizngen mo pa o alinged a ciring namen.

language1_text: For we have found this man a pestilent fellow, and a mover of sedition among all the Jews throughout the world, and a ringleader of the sect of the Nazarenes:
language2_text: Namen katenngan si Pawlo a na yapwan no ipeyvonag no tao do Yotay do peycyamahamahatawan na, a panirsirngen da no tao a yaomanoyong ji Yeso a tao do Nasale.

language1_text: who also hath gone about to profane the temple: whom we took, and would have judged according to our law.
language2_text: Iya rana am nimanara so beken a tao do Yotay a somdep do rako a panaralayan. Am ori o namen nirakpan sya. [Naknakmen namen o kahap namen so iwawalam namen a oyyan namen nya am,

language1_text: But the chief captain Lysias came upon us, and with great violence took him away out of our hands,
language2_text: mina kazazat na jyamen no panirsirngen no itaysang a meyngaran si Disiya.

language1_text: commanding his accusers to come unto thee: by examining of whom thyself mayest take knowledge of all these things, whereof we accuse him.
language2_text: Na nipanci yamen ni Disiya o kangay namen ni Pawlo jimo.] Si pacicin mo o tao ito am to mo na tenngi o peypeypangayan no nirakpan namen sya."

language1_text: And the Jews also assented, saying that these things were so.
language2_text: O macikaop rana jira tao do Yotay am mamimin sira amraherahet si Pawlo. To da macyanoyngi o nipanci na ni Tetolo.

language1_text: Then Paul, after that the governor had beckoned unto him to speak, answered, Forasmuch as I know that thou hast been of many years a judge unto this nation, I do the more cheerfully answer for myself:
language2_text: No kano nang am nipya na ni Veydise si Pawlo a manci no kanoyngan na. Maniring si Pawlo am, "Ko katenngan imo a yarana meyyawawan a yatomalamozong no pongso ta ya. Am ori o ko sarayan nimo a pacisirsirngan a yamanci no kabo no karatan ko.

language1_text: because that thou mayest understand, that there are yet but twelve days since I went up to Jerusalem for to worship.
language2_text: Jyabo mo kaji makatenngan do mina vazay ko no kangay ko a meynozi do Yelosaleng a.

language1_text: And they neither found me in the temple disputing with any man, neither raising up the people, neither in the synagogues, nor in the city:
language2_text: Jyabo kanimakacita da jyaken do rako a panaralayan a macingasangas do aro a tao a. Jyabo kanimakacita da jyaken a nimapeyvonag so tao do peyneynozyan a kado rarahan a.

language1_text: neither can they prove the things whereof they now accuse me.
language2_text: So na ikabo no yongkad no da iraherahet jyaken.

language1_text: But this I confess unto thee, that after the way which they call heresy, so worship I the God of my fathers, believing all things which are written in the law and in the prophets:
language2_text: Am yasa ka vazay pa o ko ji naywa jimo. Ori rana am ko anoyngan o da iraralay no ineynapo namen. Ko anoyngan o iwawalam ni Moyse a kano nivatvatkan da no panoyonoywan na so ciring ni Ama ta do to. So na ikanoyong no ko kahap so yada ipanci a malas a nanao.

language1_text: and have hope toward God, which they themselves also allow, that there shall be a resurrection of the dead, both of the just and unjust.
language2_text: Ko akman sira yaomanoyong do keypirwa da mavyay no nimawakwak rana tao, tana marahet a tana yapya so vazay a tao am to sira meyyangangay a mirwa mavyay.

language1_text: And herein do I exercise myself, to have always a conscience void of offence toward God, and toward men.
language2_text: Am ori o ko ikakdekdeng a mahap so yapiya vazay do tangain ni Ama ta do to a kado tangain no tao.

language1_text: Now after many years I came to bring alms to my nation, and offerings.
language2_text: "Yarana meyyawawan o ko nikarwan do Yelosaleng. Am o ko nipeysinaoli a mangay do Yelosaleng am ko yangay o kingking da no akma koy kakteh do cinai a da isidong so tao do Yelosaleng. So nyangay ko pa do rako a panaralayan a mapatanang so nakem ko si Ama ta do to.

language1_text: Whereupon certain Jews from Asia found me purified in the temple, neither with multitude, nor with tumult.
language2_text: Mateyka ko a mahap so iwawalam namen am nimacita da yaken no tao do rako a panaralayan. Am abo tao a nipeyvonag ko.

language1_text: Who ought to have been here before thee, and object, if they had ought against me.
language2_text: No kanang am amyan do dang so tao do Yotay a apo do Yasiya. Inaoy no yasira myan do jya a manci no karatan ko.

language1_text: Or else let these same here say, if they have found any evil doing in me, while I stood before the council,
language2_text: Am ipanci da pala no yamyan jya a panipanirsirngen o ko karatan a nimamizing da ciring ko do rako a peykeykaygyan do Yelosaleng.

language1_text: except it be for this one voice, that I cried standing among them, Touching the resurrection of the dead I am called in question by you this day.
language2_text: Ko naknakmen am yakmey yasa da pacioyyan jyaken, do mina kapanci ko no kanoyong ko do keypirwa no nimawakwak a tao a mavyay."

language1_text: And when Felix heard these things, having more perfect knowledge of that way, he deferred them, and said, When Lysias the chief captain shall come down, I will know the uttermost of your matter.
language2_text: Si Veydise rana am katenngan na o vazay da no amraralay ni Yeso. Am ori o ji na nimyai rana so tao a meyzezyak. Maniring do mangamizing a tao am, "Nanalahen ta pa o panirsirngen no itaysang a meyngaran so Disiya a kapacici ko na jimo."

language1_text: And he commanded a centurion to keep Paul, and to let him have liberty, and that he should forbid none of his acquaintance to minister or come unto him.
language2_text: Karahan am ipanci na o itaysang a amzat ji Pawlo a kapya da so kagagan na tomazogaw nya. So ji da nimvaoji pa sya no kanang.

language1_text: And after certain days, when Felix came with his wife Drusilla, which was a Jewess, he sent for Paul, and heard him concerning the faith in Christ.
language2_text: Kadadayan na so araraw am mai sira Veydise a kano mavakes na a tao do Yotay a meyngaran so Tosila a omrara si Pawlo a manci no peypeypangayan na no kanoyong na ji Yeso Kizisto.

language1_text: And as he reasoned of righteousness, temperance, and judgment to come, Felix trembled, and answered, Go thy way for this time; when I have a convenient season, I will call for thee.
language2_text: Karahan am ononongan na rana ni Pawlo jira a meyyaven do vahay o kapiya no icicirawat a omzat do onowned mangay do ikarateng no araraw na no ipeykapyapinpin na so tao ni Ama ta do to. Mamizing na ori ni Veydise am manyahey rana o onowned na. Maniring ji Pawlo am, "Angay rana. No ipanci ko imo am mai ka."

language1_text: He hoped also that money should have been given him of Paul, that he might loose him: wherefore he sent for him the oftener, and communed with him.
language2_text: O pancyan na no akman sang am kakzeben na si Pawlo a mantan nya so nizpi. Am ori o ikasangib na amrara si Pawlo.

language1_text: But after two years Porcius Festus came into Felix' room: and Felix, willing to shew the Jews a pleasure, left Paul bound.
language2_text: Marateng o kadwa kawan am palitan na si Veydise no meyngaran so Pocyo Veyseto a meypanirsirngen. Am ikongo do kakzeben na ni Veydise no kaglaw da nya no tao do Yotay, am ori o ji na nimapasawai si Pawlo do pamemtengan.

language1_text: Now when Festus was come into the province, after three days he ascended from Cæ sarea to Jerusalem.
language2_text: Macipalit o kabtekan da do Kaysadiya a panirsirngen a meyngaran so Veyseto am mangay rana do Yelosaleng do ikatlo na araw.

language1_text: Then the high priest and the chief of the Jews informed him against Paul, and besought him,
language2_text: O panipanirsirngen da rana no mapatanatanang so nakem da si Ama ta do to a kano kamanrarakehan da no tao do Yotay am mangononong sira so malas a iraherahet da si Pawlo,

language1_text: and desired favour against him, that he would send for him to Jerusalem, laying wait in the way to kill him.
language2_text: a kapanci da ni Veyseto a omya so tao a mangay ni Pawlo do Yelosaleng. Ta naknakmen da o kavat da ji Pawlo do rarahan a zakaten da sya.

language1_text: But Festus answered, that Paul should be kept at Cæ sarea, and that he himself would depart shortly thither.
language2_text: Am maniring jira si Veyseto am, "Yapa myan si Pawlo do pamemtengan do Kaysadiya. Cyaha, ta makeykai ko a meysinaoli do dang.

language1_text: Let them therefore, said he, which among you are able, go down with me, and accuse this man, if there be any wickedness in him.
language2_text: So pancyan nyo no kamanrarakehan a macihza jyaken a kapanci da no karatan no tao ang, no si makaranes sira do dang."

language1_text: And when he had tarried among them more than ten days, he went down unto Cæ sarea; and the next day sitting on the judgment seat commanded Paul to be brought.
language2_text: Mina kapito araw si Veyseto a nimyan do dang a kapeysinaoli na rana a mangay do Kaysadiya. Ikadwa na araw am iwangan na o pacicicyan a kai da rana ni Pawlo do tangain na.

language1_text: And when he was come, the Jews which came down from Jerusalem stood round about, and laid many and grievous complaints against Paul, which they could not prove.
language2_text: Mai rana si Pawlo am o apo do Yelosaleng aro a tao am limoten da a kapanci da no itawwen da ciring a iraherahet da sya. Am abo do dang o manoyong a ciring da.

language1_text: While he answered for himself, Neither against the law of the Jews, neither against the temple, nor yet against Cæ sar, have I offended any thing at all.
language2_text: So nitovisan na jira ni Pawlo. Maniring am, "Yabo o ko mina vazay a yamacisala do iwawalam namen a tao do Yotay. Ko jya niraherahet o rako a panaralayan namen do Yelosaleng a kano rako a panirsirngen ta do Loma."

language1_text: But Festus, willing to do the Jews a pleasure, answered Paul, and said, Wilt thou go up to Jerusalem, and there be judged of these things before me?
language2_text: Am kakdain na ni Veyseto o karilaw da nya no tao do Yotay. Maniring ji Pawlo am, "Manngwa, apyahen mo o kangay mo do Yelosaleng a pacicin ko dang an?"

language1_text: Then said Paul, I stand at Cæ sar's judgment seat, where I ought to be judged: to the Jews have I done no wrong, as thou very well knowest.
language2_text: Maniring si Pawlo am, "Ko myan do tangain mo a yamo pacicin sicyaraw eya a nitovoy ni Kaysa a panirsirngen no Loma. So ko to ngyani do jya pacicin mo. Yamo katenngan yaken a yabo so yacinaratan do tao do Yotay.

language1_text: For if I be an offender, or have committed any thing worthy of death, I refuse not to die: but if there be none of these things whereof these accuse me, no man may deliver me unto them. I appeal unto Cæ sar.
language2_text: No si myan so kalasan ko a jya niomonot do iwawalam ta am cyaha, to nyo na zakata yaken. Am si abo o kalasan ko am ji ko mya o kapacici da jyaken no tao do Yotay. Si Kaysa apyahen ko a mapacici jyaken."

language1_text: Then Festus, when he had conferred with the council, answered, Hast thou appealed unto Cæ sar? unto Cæ sar shalt thou go.
language2_text: Mateyka ni Veyseto a ahesen o kararay na am maniring ji Pawlo am, "No mo ikakza o mo kangay do rako a panirsirngen do Loma am to ko na novoya imo a mangay dang."

language1_text: And after certain days king Agrippa and Bernice came unto Cæ sarea to salute Festus.
language2_text: Kadadayan na so araraw am mangay si Aglipa a panirsirngen a kano mavakes a meyngaran si Peynici do Kaysadiya a somaray ni Veyseto, do mina kapamnek da jya panirsirngen da.

language1_text: And when they had been there many days, Festus declared Paul's cause unto the king, saying, There is a certain man left in bonds by Felix:
language2_text: Makanateng o araraw no niyan da dang am ipanci na rana ni Veyseto o vazay ni Pawlo ji Aglipa. Maniring am, "Yamyan jya so yasa ka tao a nipteng na ni Veydise.

language1_text: about whom, when I was at Jerusalem, the chief priests and the elders of the Jews informed me, desiring to have judgment against him.
language2_text: No kangay ko do Yelosaleng am amyan so ciring a niraherahet da sya no panipanirsirngen no mapatanatanang so nakem da si Ama ta do to a kano kamanrarakehan da no tao do Yotay. Ipanci da yaken a omzakat sya.

language1_text: To whom I answered, It is not the manner of the Romans to deliver any man to die, before that he which is accused have the accusers face to face, and have licence to answer for himself concerning the crime laid against him.
language2_text: Am maniring ko jira am, 'No pangozayan o iwawalam no tao do Loma am no jya nipacici pa kabo no asa ka ciring a nipanci na a omagaz do karatan na am masalit o kato wakwakan so akman sang a tao.'

language1_text: Therefore, when they were come hither, without any delay on the morrow I sat on the judgment seat, and commanded the man to be brought forth.
language2_text: No kai da am ji ko nipeyyahahay, ta ikadwa na araw am iwangan ko o pacicicyan a kapacici ko si Pawlo.

language1_text: Against whom when the accusers stood up, they brought none accusation of such things as I supposed:
language2_text: Patwawen da o iraherahet da si Pawlo a ciring da am abo do teywara o karatan na do amizngan ko sya.

language1_text: but had certain questions against him of their own superstition, and of one Jesus, which was dead, whom Paul affirmed to be alive.
language2_text: O da oyyan nya am ji na nionotan o iwawalam da no tao do Yotay. Ta onotan na o asa ka tao a meyngaran si Yeso a nimawakwak rana. Am ipanci na ni Pawlo o kanimirwa na mavyay no nang.

language1_text: And because I doubted of such manner of questions, I asked him whether he would go to Jerusalem, and there be judged of these matters.
language2_text: O akman rana sya a vazay am ko jyatenngi o ko ahahapan sya. Pacicin ko si Pawlo am, 'Manngwa, apyahen mo kangay mo do Yelosaleng a pacicin an?'

language1_text: But when Paul had appealed to be reserved unto the hearing of Augustus, I commanded him to be kept till I might send him to Cæ sar.
language2_text: Am jyakey si Pawlo, ta ikakza na o rako a panirsirngen ta do Loma a mapacici sya. Maniring ko ji Pawlo am, 'No komwan am to mo na panala o araraw no angayan da nimo do Loma.'"

language1_text: Then Agrippa said unto Festus, I would also hear the man myself. To morrow, said he, thou shalt hear him.
language2_text: Maniring si Aglipa ji Veyseto am, "Amizngen ko pala o ciring na." Maniring si Veyseto am, "Amizngen mo simaraw."

language1_text: And on the morrow, when Agrippa was come, and Bernice, with great pomp, and was entered into the place of hearing, with the chief captains, and principal men of the city, at Festus' commandment Paul was brought forth.
language2_text: Ikadwa na araw am nimai si Aglipa kani Peynici a meyyayob so apiya ayob da somdep do rako a peykeykaygyan. O macihza rana jira am panipanirsirngen no itaysang a kano maizay a tao do ili da. Meyratateng am nipanci ni Veyseto o tao a mai ni Pawlo.

language1_text: And Festus said, King Agrippa, and all men which are here present with us, ye see this man, about whom all the multitude of the Jews have dealt with me, both at Jerusalem, and also here, crying that he ought not to live any longer.
language2_text: Maniring si Veyseto do aro a tao am, "O tao rana ya am oya o yada ipanci a zakaten no tao do Yotay do Yelosaleng a kado jya.

language1_text: But when I found that he had committed nothing worthy of death, and that he himself hath appealed to Augustus, I have determined to send him.
language2_text: Nyamizing ko na o ciring na am abo teywara a karatan na. O na ikakza no tao eya am pacicin no rako a panirsirngen do Loma. Am ori o ko na to novoi sya mangay do Loma.

language1_text: Of whom I have no certain thing to write unto my lord. Wherefore I have brought him forth before you, and specially before thee, O king Agrippa, that, after examination had, I might have somewhat to write.
language2_text: Am yabo o ko nivatvatkan a karatan na a citahen no panirsirngen no Loma. Am ori o ko nyayyan nya jimo, mo Aglipa a panirsirngen namen, a ka ninyo a aro a tao a yaomamizing sya. Ta sidongen nyo pa yaken a manci no karatan na, kavatvatek ko jya. Ta ori o iyan no vatvatkan ko a citahen no panirsirngen do Loma.

language1_text: For it seemeth to me unreasonable to send a prisoner, and not withal to signify the crimes laid against him.
language2_text: Ta no ko naknakmen am no ji pa tenngi o karatan no nirakep a tao am marahet o kato rana novoyan sya do rako a panirsirngen ta."

language1_text: Then Agrippa said unto Paul, Thou art permitted to speak for thyself. Then Paul stretched forth the hand, and answered for himself:
language2_text: Maniring si Aglipa ji Pawlo am, "Ji ka nig a manci no ciring mo." So nipaztaznekan na so lima na ni Pawlo a manci no ciring na.

language1_text: I think myself happy, king Agrippa, because I shall answer for myself this day before thee touching all the things whereof I am accused of the Jews:
language2_text: Maniring am, "Ko masaray a yameytatanek do tangain mo, mo Aglipa a panirsirngen, a yamanci no da raherahetan jyaken no tao do Yotay.

language1_text: especially because I know thee to be expert in all customs and questions which are among the Jews: wherefore I beseech thee to hear me patiently.
language2_text: Ta mo katenngan o iwawalam da no tao do Yotay a kano da kazyakan nyaken. Am ori o amizngan mo so ciring ko.

language1_text: My manner of life from my youth, which was at the first among mine own nation at Jerusalem, know all the Jews;
language2_text: "O iwawalam ko no kalyalikey ko, na kai sicya rarakeh ko na ya do ili namen a kado Yelosaleng am yada mamimin a katenngan no tao do Yotay.

language1_text: which knew me from the beginning, if they would testify, that after the most straitest sect of our religion I lived a Pharisee.
language2_text: No si manakem da o mina vazay ko no kakwa am anoyngan da rana yaken a tey makdeng so nakem a tao a macyagom do Vadisay a ji mapasala do iwawalam namen a tao do Yotay.

language1_text: And now I stand and am judged for the hope of the promise made of God unto our fathers:
language2_text: Sicyaraw rana ya am ko myan do tangain nyo a nyo pacicin, ta ko anoyngan o kanoyong na no nipanci na ni Ama ta do to do ineynapo ta do keypirwa da mavyay no nimawakwak a tao.

language1_text: unto which promise our twelve tribes, instantly serving God day and night, hope to come. For which hope's sake, king Agrippa, I am accused of the Jews.
language2_text: Iya o yata pananalahen a sivosivovoong da no rarwa so ikakarwan a ineynapo ta, do ta kararalay ni Ama ta do to. Mo panirsirngen, ori o peypeypangayan no da rakpan jyaken no keylyan ta.

language1_text: Why should it be thought a thing incredible with you, that God should raise the dead?
language2_text: Am inyo rana a tao do Yotay am ikongo nyo ji nganoyngi ji Ama ta do to a mapeyvangon so nimawakwak rana tao.

language1_text: I verily thought with myself, that I ought to do many things contrary to the name of Jesus of Nazareth.
language2_text: "No kakwa pa am abo ji ko peyvazaya a izakat ko so tao a omamizing so nanao ni Yeso a tao do Nasale.

language1_text: Which thing I also did in Jerusalem: and many of the saints did I shut up in prison, having received authority from the chief priests; and when they were put to death, I gave my voice against them.
language2_text: Ori o mina vazay ko no keyyan ko pa do Yelosaleng. Nipya da yaken no panipanirsirngen no mapatanatanang so nakem da si Ama ta do to a omrakep so omanoyong ji Yeso a tao. No kapanzakat da jira am to ko myapya.

language1_text: And I punished them oft in every synagogue, and compelled them to blaspheme; and being exceedingly mad against them, I persecuted them even unto strange cities.
language2_text: Masangib ko sira a pakakasin do peyneynozyan da a kapanci ko nira omalalas ji Yeso a iraralay da. So nikakdeng ko a macioya jira. Tomakatakaw kangay ko do teyhesa ka ili a mapakakasi sira.

language1_text: Whereupon as I went to Damascus with authority and commission from the chief priests,
language2_text: "Ipisa nipya da yaken no panipanirsirngen no mapatanatanang so nakem da si Ama ta do to a mangay do Tamaseke.

language1_text: at midday, O king, I saw in the way a light from heaven, above the brightness of the sun, shining round about me and them which journeyed with me.
language2_text: Amyan ko do rarahan do peyignan no araw am to ko makacita so maniray apo do teyngato a mazngazngang pa kano araw a komowap jyaken a kano kararay ko.

language1_text: And when we were all fallen to the earth, I heard a voice speaking unto me, and saying in the Hebrew tongue, Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me? it is hard for thee to kick against the pricks.
language2_text: So nikamimin namen a nimavazakwang do teyrahem a nimakowap. Meyratateng am makamizing ko so ciring no Sipolay a tao. Maniring jyaken am, 'Sawlo, Sawlo, ikongo yamo pakakasyan jyaken. Jyabo o kapakaharag mo jyaken a. Ta rakorako o oyowyat ko a ka nimo.'

language1_text: And I said, Who art thou, Lord? And he said, I am Jesus whom thou persecutest.
language2_text: Maniring ko jya am, 'Mo Panirsirngen, sino ka.' Maniring am, 'Yaken rana am si Yeso ko a mo pakakasin.

language1_text: But rise, and stand upon thy feet: for I have appeared unto thee for this purpose, to make thee a minister and a witness both of these things which thou hast seen, and of those things in the which I will appear unto thee;
language2_text: Peyvangon rana a kapeylimwang mo nyaken a nimapacita jimo. Ta yaken rana am yako nipamnekan imo a mahap so vazay ko. So peylimwangan mo no meypanam pa vazay a itoro ko jimo.

language1_text: delivering thee from the people, and from the Gentiles, unto whom now I send thee,
language2_text: Ko tovoin imo a meylimwang nyaken do tao do Yotay a kano beken a tao do Yotay. No si myan so omraherahet jimo am cyaha, ta apzatan ko imo.

language1_text: to open their eyes, and to turn them from darkness to light, and from the power of Satan unto God, that they may receive forgiveness of sins, and inheritance among them which are sanctified by faith that is in me.
language2_text: Ko tovoin imo a omiwang do mata da kapakacita da rana so kazngangan a komaro do vazay ni Satan a omanoyong rana ji Ama ta do to. So ikanoyong da rana mavonas so raraten a macikaop do amraralay nyaken a tao,' kwan na yaken ni Yeso.

language1_text: Whereupon, O king Agrippa, I was not disobedient unto the heavenly vision:
language2_text: "Am ori mo Aglipa a panirsirngen, o ko to mangozai do yana nipanci jyaken ni Yeso no kapakacita ko sya.

language1_text: but shewed first unto them of Damascus, and at Jerusalem, and throughout all the coasts of Judæ a, and then to the Gentiles, that they should repent and turn to God, and do works meet for repentance.
language2_text: Nimanma na do Tamaseke a kado Yelosaleng o nyangayan ko a kangay ko na do peycyeylilyan na do Yotay a kado peyilyan da no beken a tao do Yotay amvavaga jira a komaro do peyraratenan da a somazap si Ama ta do to a mapacita rana no apiya icicirawat da, do kanoyong da rana nimamlis.

language1_text: For these causes the Jews caught me in the temple, and went about to kill me.
language2_text: Ikongo do nimangnanao ko do beken a tao do Yotay, am ori o nirakpan da jyaken no tao do Yotay do rako a panaralayan a vovwan a zakaten.

language1_text: Having therefore obtained help of God, I continue unto this day, witnessing both to small and great, saying none other things than those which the prophets and Moses did say should come:
language2_text: Yato ngai sicyaraw eya o na nisidongan jyaken ni Ama ta do to a meylimwang no ciriciring na do meynakem a tao a kano ipangoyongoyod da tao. O nipeylimwang ko am meyyangay a kano nipeylimwang ni Moyse a kano panoyonoywan na so ciring ni Ama ta do to no kakwa.

language1_text: that Christ should suffer, and that he should be the first that should rise from the dead, and should shew light unto the people, and to the Gentiles.
language2_text: Ta o nipeylimwang da da Moyse am manoyong keyyan no alalaw ni Kizisto a wakwaken da. So ika iya na no ney manma na a nimirwa a mavyay. Ta iya o mapatazadang jyaten a tao do Yotay a kano beken a tao do Yotay."

language1_text: And as he thus spake for himself, Festus said with a loud voice, Paul, thou art beside thyself; much learning doth make thee mad.
language2_text: Ji na pa teyka ni Pawlo o ciring na am to na amizing si Veyseto a amlololos. Maniring am, "Ka zomyak eya an? Ta yateywara rana o mo naknakmen a vazay."

language1_text: But he said, I am not mad, most noble Festus; but speak forth the words of truth and soberness.
language2_text: Maniring si Pawlo am, "Ko ikamo imo mo Veyseto panirsirngen am jyabo ko kazyak a. Yamanoyong saon o ciring ko ang."

language1_text: For the king knoweth of these things, before whom also I speak freely: for I am persuaded that none of these things are hidden from him; for this thing was not done in a corner.
language2_text: Maniring si Pawlo ji Aglipa am, "Mo katenngan o akman sang a vazay. Am ori o ko jyamogawi a yamapatwaw sya jimo. Ta o akman rana sya a vazay am abo makatayo sya.

language1_text: King Agrippa, believest thou the prophets? I know that thou believest.
language2_text: Mo Aglipa a panirsirngen, mo anoyngan o ciring da no panoyonoywan na so ciring ni Ama ta do to no kakwa pa? Ko katenngan mo kanoyong jya."

language1_text: Then Agrippa said unto Paul, Almost thou persuadest me to be a Christian.
language2_text: Maniring si Aglipa ji Pawlo am, "Mo panopen yaken a yaomanoyong ji Kizisto?"

language1_text: And Paul said, I would to God, that not only thou, but also all that hear me this day, were both almost, and altogether such as I am, except these bonds.
language2_text: Maniring si Pawlo ji Aglipa am, "Tana mahay rana am to ko meynozyan nimo a kano aro a mangamizing a tao do jya a kamimin nyo rana akman jyaken a omanoyong jya. Am ji nyo nginara yaken a da aptengen!"

language1_text: And when he had thus spoken, the king rose up, and the governor, and Bernice, and they that sat with them:
language2_text: Mamizing na ni Aglipa kani Veyseto a kano meyngaran so Peynici a mavakes a kano aro a tao a mangamizing am mina to sira meytatanek a makowbot do pantaw.

language1_text: and when they were gone aside, they talked between themselves, saying, This man doeth nothing worthy of death or of bonds.
language2_text: Amyan rana sira do pantaw am maniring sira do kadwan jira am, "Ikongo peypeypangayan no kato tamtengan sya, kato ta wakwakan sya."

language1_text: Then said Agrippa unto Festus, This man might have been set at liberty, if he had not appealed unto Cæ sar.
language2_text: Maniring si Aglipa ji Veyseto am, "No ji na nipanci no tao eya o kangay na ji Kaysa a panirsirngen no Loma am jyabo o kaji ta mapasawayan sya."

language1_text: And when it was determined that we should sail into Italy, they delivered Paul and certain other prisoners unto one named Julius, a centurion of Augustus' band.
language2_text: Ikongo do nipamnekan da no panipanirsirngen o kangay da ni Pawlo do Itadi, am ori o nitorwan da ni Pawlo a kano aro a nipteng da do mimong no itaysang no Loma a meyngaran si Sodian.

language1_text: And entering into a ship of Adramyttium, we launched, meaning to sail by the coasts of Asia; one Aristarchus, a Macedonian of Thessalonica, being with us.
language2_text: So nisakay namen do avang a nimapo do Atamityan a mangay do Yasiya a pongso. Nimacihza jyamen si Aditako a tao do Tesalonicya. O ili rana am macinapnap do Maciton.

language1_text: And the next day we touched at Sidon. And Julius courteously entreated Paul, and gave him liberty to go unto his friends to refresh himself.
language2_text: Ikadwa na araw am makaranes namen do Siton. Ikongo do ikaglaw na si Pawlo ni Sodian, am ori o nipya na sya makarala a komala so kagagan na.

language1_text: And when we had launched from thence, we sailed under Cyprus, because the winds were contrary.
language2_text: Karwan namen do Siton am izasen na yamen no rako a pagpag. Am ori o ninanad namen a mangay a macimazeveng so avang namen do Saypolose a pongso.

language1_text: And when we had sailed over the sea of Cilicia and Pamphylia, we came to Myra, a city of Lycia.
language2_text: Peyhavasan namen o ili do Cidicya kado Pangveydiya am makaranes namen do Mila a ili a macinapnap do Dicya.

language1_text: And there the centurion found a ship of Alexandria sailing into Italy; and he put us therein.
language2_text: Makaranes namen dang am macita ni Sodian o asa ka avang apo do Adisanta a meypangay do Itadi. Karahan am ipanci na yamen a somakay do avang ang.

language1_text: And when we had sailed slowly many days, and scarce were come over against Cnidus, the wind not suffering us, we sailed under Crete, over against Salmone;
language2_text: O avang rana ori am tey mapakeh a somongay. Am ori o nikahay namen a makaranes do Kenito, ta ji namen a sangoz o pagpag. Am ori o mina to namen meyhavasi do Kedite a pongso a to namen paninida o avang do kehtengan na. Mownay am makaranes namen rana do kananayan do Samoni.

language1_text: and, hardly passing it, came unto a place which is called The fair havens; nigh whereunto was the city of Lasea.
language2_text: Pandan namen rana nimapaninid so avang namen, do kaji namen makasangozan sya. Mownay am makaranes namen do ngaranan da Tey yapya a minato. O minato rana am macinapnap do Lasiya ili.

language1_text: Now when much time was spent, and when sailing was now dangerous, because the fast was now already past, Paul admonished them,
language2_text: Makaranes namen rana dang am ilawden na. Am ori o nikainin namen. Maniring rana si Pawlo do aro a tao no avang am,

language1_text: and said unto them, Sirs, I perceive that this voyage will be with hurt and much damage, not only of the lading and ship, but also of our lives.
language2_text: "Manga keypong, ko citahen o palanginan am manginanawa ta no si meypangay ta. Jyabo kaji na kavan no avang ta. Ji na zyodan o aro a warawara do avang eya."

language1_text: Nevertheless the centurion believed the master and the owner of the ship, more than those things which were spoken by Paul.
language2_text: Am o mimong no itaysang a tao am apyapyahen na pa o kamizing na so mapasongay so avang a kano mapeyyavang sya. Ji na ngamiznga o ciring ni Pawlo.

language1_text: And because the haven was not commodious to winter in, the more part advised to depart thence also, if by any means they might attain to Phenice, and there to winter; which is an haven of Crete, and lieth toward the south west and north west.
language2_text: No ahemyan am masakboz na o minato ang. Am ori o to da lovoci no tao no avang a manci no kapasongay so avang, ta tey kakza da o kapakaranes da do Venici do Kedite a pongso. Ta tey meymatek o minato do dang a nanalan da so kapiya rana no kakawan.

language1_text: And when the south wind blew softly, supposing that they had obtained their purpose, loosing thence, they sailed close by Crete.
language2_text: No kano nang am nimehteng pa. Am ori o ningingitan namen so ipanenbong namen a mangay rana. Am to namen paninida o avang namen do Kedite a pongso.

language1_text: But not long after there arose against it a tempestuous wind, called Euroclydon.
language2_text: So nikakeykai na nisangsang na.

language1_text: And when the ship was caught, and could not bear up into the wind, we let her drive.
language2_text: Karahan am sibsiblakan na o avang namen. Ori o ji namen makasangozi sya. So to namen panowji rana sya.

language1_text: And running under a certain island which is called Clauda, we had much work to come by the boat:
language2_text: Ikongo do nimacimazeveng namen do asa ka mahataw a ngaranan da so Kawtaw, ori o nikapya namen rana a mapasakay so tataloran. Karahan am pakedkeden namen rana do avang.

language1_text: which when they had taken up, they used helps, undergirding the ship; and, fearing lest they should fall into the quicksands, strake sail, and so were driven.
language2_text: Mateyka namen rana pakedkeden o tataloran am imatkan namen no ovid o avang namen. Ta ihawa namen a makava. Ikongo do ikanyahey namen o avang a mangay somahag do kananayan do Siarti, am ori o nipakarwan namen so rako a vilad namen, kato namen rana macyocyozayan do angayan na nyamen no pagpag.

language1_text: And we being exceedingly tossed with a tempest, the next day they lightened the ship;
language2_text: Ikongo do ji na heman no kakawan, am ori o to namen rana meywalici no karwan no warawara do avang do ikadwa na araw.

language1_text: and the third day we cast out with our own hands the tackling of the ship.
language2_text: Ikatlo na araw am ji na pa ngehtengan. Am meywasik namen pa dang so maoran no avang ikarehmet na.

language1_text: And when neither sun nor stars in many days appeared, and no small tempest lay on us, all hope that we should be saved was then taken away.
language2_text: Nimownay namen a jya nimakacita so araw a kano mata no hanit, do kaji na ablisan no hangin. Am ori o to namen rana macirierisi.

language1_text: But after long abstinence Paul stood forth in the midst of them, and said, Sirs, ye should have hearkened unto me, and not have loosed from Crete, and to have gained this harm and loss.
language2_text: Ikongo do tey mownay namen a jya nimangakaday, am ori o nipeytatanek ni Pawlo. Maniring am, "Kokay kamo. No nyamizing nyo o ciring ko asyo do kaji ta pasongayan sya do Kedite a pongso am jyabo ta mina kakman sya yamakavakava so avang a.

language1_text: And now I exhort you to be of good cheer: for there shall be no loss of any man's life among you, but of the ship.
language2_text: Am ko ipanci pa jinyo am ji kamo anyahey. Ta apya tamo. Am o avang ta ya am todabo rana makavakava.

language1_text: For there stood by me this night the angel of God, whose I am, and whom I serve,
language2_text: Ta si Ama ta do to rana a yako iraralay am nimanovoy so tinsi na no kamahep a yamanci nya jyaken. Yamaniring jyaken am,

language1_text: saying, Fear not, Paul; thou must be brought before Cæ sar: and, lo, God hath given thee all them that sail with thee.
language2_text: 'Mo Pawlo, ji ka onib. Ta manoyong o kangay mo do tangain na ni Kaysa. Ta na rana nimamizing ni Ama ta do to o inozi mo. So ikamimin nyo a apzatan na so kataotao do avang eya.' Ori o ciring na jyaken no tinsi.

language1_text: Wherefore, sirs, be of good cheer: for I believe God, that it shall be even as it was told me.
language2_text: Am ori o ji nyo anyahei, manga keypong an. Ta ko anoyngan si Ama ta do to a mangononong do ciring na jyaken.

language1_text: Howbeit we must be cast upon a certain island.
language2_text: Cyaha, ta amyan so asa ka likta pongso a kazadawan ta."

language1_text: But when the fourteenth night was come, as we were driven up and down in Adria, about midnight the shipmen deemed that they drew near to some country;
language2_text: Ikapat na so icyarwa (14) no araraw no niyan namen do karakwan no awa am to na rana pavyota yamen do meyngaran so Yatediya awa. Avak no ahep am ipanci da no tao no avang o kasngen namen rana do pamsan na.

language1_text: and sounded, and found it twenty fathoms: and when they had gone a little further, they sounded again, and found it fifteen fathoms.
language2_text: Paliwaten da o ovid a iktokto da do kararahem no awa am to ngyan so ikasi kapat na (40) anet no kararahem na. Ipirwa da aktoktwan am to ngyan so ikasi katlo na (30) anet.

language1_text: Then fearing lest we should have fallen upon rocks, they cast four anchors out of the stern, and wished for the day.
language2_text: Ikongo do ikanyahey da kasahag no avang, am ori o nipakasan da so apat a ka ipanenbong namen do maoji a omapanala so karaw na.

language1_text: And as the shipmen were about to flee out of the ship, when they had let down the boat into the sea, under colour as though they would have cast anchors out of the foreship,
language2_text: Ikongo do meykagcigcin sira o tao no avang, am ori o nipagcinan da so tataloran da. Am o karwan da am mangay sira do morong na akmey mapagcin so ipanenbong.

language1_text: Paul said to the centurion and to the soldiers, Except these abide in the ship, ye cannot be saved.
language2_text: Am maniring si Pawlo do mimong no itaysang a kano macilolo jya itaysang am, "No si somaway sira ito am jyabo kavyay ta."

language1_text: Then the soldiers cut off the ropes of the boat, and let her fall off.
language2_text: Am ori o nikteban da sya no itaysang so ovid no tataloran a kahatahataw na meyparai do avang ang.

language1_text: And while the day was coming on, Paul besought them all to take meat, saying, This day is the fourteenth day that ye have tarried and continued fasting, having taken nothing.
language2_text: Meyzengazengang rana am ipanci na sira ni Pawlo a koman. Maniring jira am, "Kamo kapat rana so icyarwa so araraw a yajya nimangakaday do nyo kalaw.

language1_text: Wherefore I pray you to take some meat: for this is for your health: for there shall not an hair fall from the head of any of you.
language2_text: Sijya kamo rana, ta koman ta na. Ta ori o iyan no oyowyat nyo. Cyaha, ta apya ta."

language1_text: And when he had thus spoken, he took bread, and gave thanks to God in presence of them all: and when he had broken it, he began to eat.
language2_text: Teyka na o ciring na am mangap si Pawlo so myanpaw a kasaray na nya ji Ama ta do to do tangain da kakcikcil na sya kanen.

language1_text: Then were they all of good cheer, and they also took some meat.
language2_text: So ji da na mogawi a koman rana.

language1_text: And we were in all in the ship two hundred threescore and sixteen souls.
language2_text: Yamen rana nimaoran do avang a tao am namen nanem so ikakawaowan so ikakatlwan na poo (276).

language1_text: And when they had eaten enough, they lightened the ship, and cast out the wheat into the sea.
language2_text: Teyka namen rana koman am pipowa da rana o nimavezed a mogi, ta ihepaw da do avang.

language1_text: And when it was day, they knew not the land: but they discovered a certain creek with a shore, into the which they were minded, if it were possible, to thrust in the ship.
language2_text: Penzak rana am ji da singkaji no tao no avang o pongso am macita da o kananayan. Ikakza da o kangay da mapanbong so avang da do dang.

language1_text: And when they had taken up the anchors, they committed themselves unto the sea, and loosed the rudder bands, and hoised up the mainsail to the wind, and made toward shore.
language2_text: Karahan am akteben da o ovid no panenbong da kowvay da so ovid a iktan no savilak a kangingit da so vilad do morong na kapavyot na so avang do pasalan.

language1_text: And falling into a place where two seas met, they ran the ship aground; and the forepart stuck fast, and remained unmoveable, but the hinder part was broken with the violence of the waves.
language2_text: Karahan am mangay somahag o avang namen a kaji na rana makapeygonagonayan a kakavakava no maoji na sibsiblakan na no rako azda.

language1_text: And the soldiers' counsel was to kill the prisoners, lest any of them should swim out, and escape.
language2_text: Naknakmen da no itaysang o kazakat da so nipteng da tao, ta ihawa da sira meyyawawat a somaway.

language1_text: But the centurion, willing to save Paul, kept them from their purpose; and commanded that they which could swim should cast themselves first into the sea, and get to land:
language2_text: Am o mimong no itaysang am ikarilaw na si Pawlo. So ji na nimyai sira amwakwak sira. Maniring rana do aro a aptengen da tao am, "Inyo rana yamakeykeyyawat am peyyawat kamo na mangay do pamsan na."

language1_text: and the rest, some on boards, and some on broken pieces of the ship. And so it came to pass, that they escaped all safe to land.
language2_text: O macikavang jira tao am amyan jira so mangap so tapi. Amyan jira so mangap so oraoran no avang a peyyawatan da. Am ori o nikamimin namen rana nimeyyawawat a mangay do pamsan na.

language1_text: And when they were escaped, then they knew that the island was called Melita.
language2_text: Makarala namen rana do pamsan na am katenngan namen rana o kapongpongso na a ngaranan da so Maarta.

language1_text: And the barbarous people shewed us no little kindness: for they kindled a fire, and received us every one, because of the present rain, and because of the cold.
language2_text: No kanang rana am macimoy a karekmeh na. Am apya sira dang o meyili a tao. Ta nitaotao da yamen a kapeydokdok da nyamen so apoy a panangdangan namen.

language1_text: And when Paul had gathered a bundle of sticks, and laid them on the fire, there came a viper out of the heat, and fastened on his hand.
language2_text: Pangain na ni Pawlo o nikpeh na kayo do panangdangan namen am makowbot o mavowaw, ta nikakwatan a kalavicin na do lima na a somongit sya.

language1_text: And when the barbarians saw the venomous beast hang on his hand, they said among themselves, No doubt this man is a murderer, whom, though he hath escaped the sea, yet vengeance suffereth not to live.
language2_text: Macita da no meyili dang a tao am maniring sira am, "Yajya nimangap so tao ya. Tana yaji nimawakwak ya do karakwan no awa am oya rana na masapa a alalaw na, do na kapeyraraten."

language1_text: And he shook off the beast into the fire, and felt no harm.
language2_text: Karahan am toktoken na rana ni Pawlo o mavowaw do apoy am abo o nipeyzazan na.

language1_text: Howbeit they looked when he should have swollen, or fallen down dead suddenly: but after they had looked a great while, and saw no harm come to him, they changed their minds, and said that he was a god.
language2_text: To da pananala no aro a tao o kalipad no lima na, kawakwak na am abo imeymonan da sya. Am ori o nipeyzokaban da nya. Maniring rana sira am, "Ala tao do to ya?"

language1_text: In the same quarters were possessions of the chief man of the island, whose name was Publius; who received us, and lodged us three days courteously.
language2_text: Amyan dang so tao a macisngen so nihakawan a meyngaran si Popaydi a panirsirngen da. Macita na yamen am yangay na yamen do vahay da a taotawwen so katlo araw.

language1_text: And it came to pass, that the father of Publius lay sick of a fever and of a bloody flux: to whom Paul entered in, and prayed, and laid his hands on him, and healed him.
language2_text: No kanang am nimeyngen o velek na ni ama na ni Popaydi a kapeyingwat na pa sya. Mangay jya si Pawlo am paoptahen na o lima na do kataotao na a meynozi nya. Ori o nikapya na rana.

language1_text: So when this was done, others also, which had diseases in the island, came, and were healed:
language2_text: Mamizing da o vazay ni Pawlo no tao do dang am meykayyai o meykeyngeyngen a tao. So ikamimin da apya rana a nipeynozi ni Pawlo.

language1_text: who also honoured us with many honours; and when we departed, they laded us with such things as were necessary.
language2_text: Nimacipinda no kanang o kanig da nyamen no tao. Karwan namen rana sira am aro o apzapzatan a nitoro da jyamen a paciralayan namen a mangay do asa ka avang.

language1_text: And after three months we departed in a ship of Alexandria, which had wintered in the isle, whose sign was Castor and Pollux.
language2_text: Mavitos rana o katlo a vehan am mavang namen do asa ka avang apo do Yadisanta a nimanbong dang do karahet no kakawan do ahemyan. O avang rana ori am ngaranan da so Adwa ka tao do to.

language1_text: And landing at Syracuse, we tarried there three days.
language2_text: Makaranes rana o avang do Silako a ili am nimeywalam namen dang so katlo araw.

language1_text: And from thence we fetched a compass, and came to Rhegium: and after one day the south wind blew, and we came the next day to Puteoli:
language2_text: Karwan namen dang am mangay namen rana do Leciang. Ikadwa na araw am somazawsaw. Am ori o nipavyotan na jyamen so kasaraw a kapakaranes namen rana do Potidi a ili.

language1_text: where we found brethren, and were desired to tarry with them seven days: and so we went toward Rome.
language2_text: Makarahan am makasazi namen do dang so akma nameney kakteh do cinai. Nipeyseysan da yamen so kapito araw a kalam namen mangay rana do Loma.

language1_text: And from thence, when the brethren heard of us, they came to meet us as far as Appii forum, and The three taverns: whom when Paul saw, he thanked God, and took courage.
language2_text: Mamizing da yamen no amyan do Loma akma nameney kakteh do cinai am mangay da tazapyahen yamen do rako a panazangan a ngaranan da a Yapio. O karwan da am nimangay sira do ngaranan da so Meykatlo a iseysanan a ili a tomazapya jyamen. Macita na sira ni Pawlo am isaray na ji Ama ta do to. Ta nikaitan o onowned na.

language1_text: And when we came to Rome, the centurion delivered the prisoners to the captain of the guard: but Paul was suffered to dwell by himself with a soldier that kept him.
language2_text: Makaranes namen do Loma am apyahen da si Pawlo a kano amzat jya itaysang a meyvahay do asa ka vahay.

language1_text: And it came to pass, that after three days Paul called the chief of the Jews together: and when they were come together, he said unto them, Men and brethren, though I have committed nothing against the people, or customs of our fathers, yet was I delivered prisoner from Jerusalem into the hands of the Romans.
language2_text: Ikatlo na araw am lovoten na sira ni Pawlo o panipanirsirngen da no tao do Yotay. Maniring jira si Pawlo am, "Manga kahakay, yaken rana am tana ko jya niraherahet o keylyan ta a yajya nimapasobna do iwawalam no ineynapo ta am da todey amtenga yaken do Yelosaleng a da kangay nyaken do panirsirngen no Loma a pacicin.

language1_text: Who, when they had examined me, would have let me go, because there was no cause of death in me.
language2_text: No kapacici da jyaken am ji da kala o karatan ko a izakat da jyaken. Ori o naknakman da so kapasaway da jyaken.

language1_text: But when the Jews spake against it, I was constrained to appeal unto Cæ sar; not that I had ought to accuse my nation of.
language2_text: Am raten da no keylyan ta tao do Yotay. Am ori o to ko na manci nya so kangay ko do tangain ni Kaysa. Am yabwata o yasa ka ciring a ko iraherahet so keylyan ta tao do Yotay.

language1_text: For this cause therefore have I called for you, to see you, and to speak with you: because that for the hope of Israel I am bound with this chain.
language2_text: Am ori o ko kakzeban jinyo a yapacisirsirngan. Ta o da nivaodan jyaken am yaomagaz do ko kanoyong ji Yeso Kizisto a yarana mownay a da pananalahen no Isedi a tao."

language1_text: And they said unto him, We neither received letters out of Judæ a concerning thee, neither any of the brethren that came shewed or spake any harm of thee.
language2_text: Maniring sira ji Pawlo am, "O akman rana sang a vazay mo am yabo namen nimahap a teygami apo do ili nyo a omagaz jimo. Yabwata do keylyan nyo o asa ka tao a nimapo do dang a yamraherahet jimo.

language1_text: But we desire to hear of thee what thou thinkest: for as concerning this sect, we know that every where it is spoken against.
language2_text: Am pancyan pala jyamen, ta namen katenngan inyo a yamraralay ni Yeso a da pacioyyan no aro a tao do peycyeylilyan na."

language1_text: And when they had appointed him a day, there came many to him into his lodging; to whom he expounded and testified the kingdom of God, persuading them concerning Jesus, both out of the law of Moses, and out of the prophets, from morning till evening.
language2_text: Meyratateng am mamnek sira so kasaraw a ipeylovolovot da so tao a omamizing so ciring ni Pawlo. Marateng rana o araraw na am aro sira o tao a nimai a omamizing so ciring ni Pawlo. Meyratateng am papwen na ni Pawlo do penzak a kangay na nya do mahep a omononong do italamozong na ni Ama ta do to a mapanod sira. Meyratateng am vilangan na o iwawalam na ni Moyse a kano vakong da no panoyonoywan na ciring ni Ama ta do to no kakwa a mapanop sira a omanoyong ji Yeso.

language1_text: And some believed the things which were spoken, and some believed not.
language2_text: O nipanci na ciriciring am amyan so tao a niomanoyong jya. Amyan so ji nganoyong jya.

language1_text: And when they agreed not among themselves, they departed, after that Paul had spoken one word, Well spake the Holy Ghost by Esaias the prophet unto our fathers,
language2_text: So ipeytaretarek no nakenakem da. Am ori o to da na meysyasyai. No kaji da pa meysyasyayan am maniring si Pawlo jira am, "Manoyong o nipanci no Seyzi do ineynapo ta a nivatvatkan ni Isayya a panoyonoywan na so ciring ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: saying, Go unto this people, and say, Hearing ye shall hear, and shall not understand; And seeing ye shall see, and not perceive:
language2_text: Maniring si Isayya am, 'Mey mo ipanci do aro a tao an. Manoyong o kamizing nyo sya am ji nyo a tenngi. Macita nyo am ji nyo a pengkad.

language1_text: For the heart of this people is waxed gross, And their ears are dull of hearing, And their eyes have they closed; Lest they should see with their eyes, And hear with their ears, And understand with their heart, And should be converted, And I should heal them.
language2_text: Ta tey masalit o onowned da no tao eya. O cicilwan da am yakacilcilan. O mata da am yameyreket. Ta no sira macipayok so onowned am makacita o mata da. Makamizing o cicilwan da. Makazazap da no onowned a kapeysinaoli da rana jyaken. Ta ori o ipatazadang ko sira do teyngato.'"

language1_text: Be it known therefore unto you, that the salvation of God is sent unto the Gentiles, and that they will hear it.
language2_text: Maniring pa si Pawlo am, "Inyo rana am anoyngan nyo si Ama ta do to a yarana mapatazadang so beken a tao do Yotay no ciriciring na, do da kapeyhanhan nya."

language1_text: And when he had said these words, the Jews departed, and had great reasoning among themselves.
language2_text: [Teyka na o ciring ni Pawlo am to sira na meycyangangay o tao do Yotay. So nikapanes da a somkad do kadwan jira.]

language1_text: And Paul dwelt two whole years in his own hired house, and received all that came in unto him,
language2_text: Mina kadwa kawan si Pawlo a nimeyvahay do nivood na vahay a kasaray na a tomaotao so mey manangangay nya tao,

language1_text: preaching the kingdom of God, and teaching those things which concern the Lord Jesus Christ, with all confidence, no man forbidding him.
language2_text: a kapangnanao na no italamozong na ni Ama ta do to a kano omagaz ji Yeso Kizisto a Panirsirngen ta. So ikabo no ikamogaw na. So ikabo rana no itaysang a omza sya a meylimwang no ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: Paul, a servant of Jesus Christ, called to be an apostle, separated unto the gospel of God,
language2_text: Yaken rana am si Pawlo ko a lamlamsoy ni Yeso Kizisto. Na nipamnekan yaken ni Yeso Kizisto a amlivolivon no Mapasaray a Ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: (which he had promised afore by his prophets in the holy scriptures, ) concerning his Son Jesus Christ our Lord, which was made of the seed of David according to the flesh;
language2_text: O Mapasaray a Ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to am nipatwaw da no panoyonoywan na so ciring na do nivatvatkan da Seysyo no kakwa pa a omagaz do Anak na si Yeso Kizisto a Panirsirngen ta. No hapen do itetngehan ta do tao am iya o sivovoong na ni Tawey. O Mapasaray a Ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to am nipatwaw da no panoyonoywan na so ciring na do nivatvatkan da Seysyo no kakwa pa a omagaz do Anak na si Yeso Kizisto a Panirsirngen ta. No hapen do itetngehan ta do tao am iya o sivovoong na ni Tawey.

language1_text: and declared to be the Son of God with power, according to the spirit of holiness, by the resurrection from the dead:
language2_text: No hapen do ka Tao do to na am iya o nipeyvangon na ni Ama ta do to a nimapo do heseb na. So ikanoyong na Anak na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: by whom we have received grace and apostleship, for obedience to the faith among all nations, for his name:
language2_text: Am ori o ko pangozayan do ngaran na a yamahap so vazay na yamapanop so tao a yaomanoyong ji Yeso Kizisto do peycyamahamahatawan na,

language1_text: among whom are ye also the called of Jesus Christ:
language2_text: a pacizanodan nyo a tao do Loma a yana nipamnekan ni Ama ta do to a italamozong na ni Yeso Kizisto.

language1_text: to all that be in Rome, beloved of God, called to be saints: Grace to you and peace from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ.
language2_text: Am ori o yako peyteygamyan ninyo a na tey karilaw ni Ama ta do to a tao do Loma a yamanoyong a na italamozong ni Ama ta do to. Inaoy si itoro na o pangangarilawan na kano ikapiya no onowned nyo ni Ama ta do to a kani Yeso Kizisto a Panirsirngen ta.

language1_text: First, I thank my God through Jesus Christ for you all, that your faith is spoken of throughout the whole world.
language2_text: Ney manma na am ko isaray ji Ama ta do to si Yeso Kizisto, ta o nyo peyhanhanan nya am yada rana peyrengarengayan no tao do peycyamahamahatawan na.

language1_text: For God is my witness, whom I serve with my spirit in the gospel of his Son, that without ceasing I make mention of you always in my prayers;
language2_text: Na katenngan ni Ama ta do to o ko kasangib a yameynozi ninyo, do yako ikowyat a yamahap so vazay na yameylimwang no Mapasaray a Ciriciring no Anak na.

language1_text: making request, if by any means now at length I might have a prosperous journey by the will of God to come unto you.
language2_text: Ko jimtad a yameynozi ji Ama ta do to do kapeypalanginan na nyaken. So yangay ko jinyo do dang.

language1_text: For I long to see you, that I may impart unto you some spiritual gift, to the end ye may be established;
language2_text: Inaoy si macita ko inyo a kananao ko jinyo a kowyat nyo na meyhanhan ni Ama ta do to, do kasidong na jinyo no Seyzi.

language1_text: that is, that I may be comforted together with you by the mutual faith both of you and me.
language2_text: Ala apyapya o kapanci ko no kapasipayyait ta so onowned ji Ama ta do to.

language1_text: Now I would not have you ignorant, brethren, that oftentimes I purposed to come unto you, (but was let hitherto, ) that I might have some fruit among you also, even as among other Gentiles.
language2_text: Yako masangib a yamnakenakem so yako kangay jinyo manga kakteh. Am na katey aro no yamzazat jyaken. Am ori o ko jyangai jinyo do dang. Ta ko ikakza inyo a nanawen a kapeyparo da no tao a omanoyong ji Yeso Kizisto do dang, akman so niomanod a beken a tao do Yotay no keyyan ko pa do ili da no beken a tao do Yotay.

language1_text: I am debtor both to the Greeks, and to the Barbarians; both to the wise, and to the unwise.
language2_text: Tana ko macizavoz do meykataretarek a tao am meyyangangay sira ori a yako sidongen no Ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: So, as much as in me is, I am ready to preach the gospel to you that are at Rome also.
language2_text: Am ori o ko ikakman sang a yamakza no kapeylimwang no Mapasaray a Ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to jinyo a yameyili do Loma a tao.

language1_text: For I am not ashamed of the gospel of Christ: for it is the power of God unto salvation to every one that believeth; to the Jew first, and also to the Greek.
language2_text: Ko ipeyhanhan o Mapasaray a Ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to. Ta ori rana am oyowyat na ni Ama ta do to a omahap so omanoyong jya tao do kapyapyan. Oya rana am manmanma a nipeylimwang do tao do Yotay a kapacitonton da no beken a tao do Yotay.

language1_text: For therein is the righteousness of God revealed from faith to faith: as it is written, The just shall live by faith.
language2_text: Ta o Mapasaray a Ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to o ipakateneng ta do kabnek na jyaten ni Ama ta do to a abo so raraten do tangain na. O yapwan na no nya am amyapo do kapeyhanhan ta nya. Ta maniring do Seysyo am, "O tao rana a abneken na ni Ama ta do to a abo so raraten do tangain na am mahap da o to meyyonong a ikavyay no pahad da."

language1_text: For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men, who hold the truth in unrighteousness;
language2_text: Nipaziman na rana ni Ama ta do to o rako a oyaoyyan na no meyraraten a tao a kano ji raralay nya tao. O raraten no tao am ori o yambonbon do yamanoyong a nanao na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: because that which may be known of God is manifest in them; for God hath shewed it unto them.
language2_text: Pasingsingtan na sira ni Ama ta do to, ta nipaziman na rana ni Ama ta do to o vazay na do tangain da. So da ipakateneng rana jya.

language1_text: For the invisible things of him from the creation of the world are clearly seen, being understood by the things that are made, even his eternal power and Godhead; so that they are without excuse:
