language2_text: Yajyacita si Ama ta do to. Am nimakalapo no kamamaog na so karawan o kaji na ablisan no ka Tao do to na. Ta apo do nyamamaog na o ipakateneng jya Tao do to arako so oyowyat. So ikabo no tao a omalalas jya.

language1_text: because that, when they knew God, they glorified him not as God, neither were thankful; but became vain in their imaginations, and their foolish heart was darkened.
language2_text: Am tana da katenngan si Ama ta do to am da ji raralayan, da ji narayan o aryarilaw na sira. So da icyakmey yamavota so onowned a yaji makateneng ji Ama ta do to.

language1_text: Professing themselves to be wise, they became fools,
language2_text: Sira mapakateneteneng. Am jyakman sang, ta yabwata da katatenngan.

language1_text: And changed the glory of the uncorruptible God into an image made like to corruptible man, and to birds, and fourfooted beasts, and creeping things.
language2_text: Da ji raralayan o yato meyyonong a Tao do to. Da iraralay o da nipariparing a yakmey taotao a kano meyyasasalap a kano omalalam a kano makakaday a nipariparing da.

language1_text: Wherefore God also gave them up to uncleanness through the lusts of their own hearts, to dishonour their own bodies between themselves:
language2_text: Am ori o to na rana macyozai ni Ama ta do to do onowned da a mapeyvazay so macimasesnek a raraten da.

language1_text: who changed the truth of God into a lie, and worshipped and served the creature more than the Creator, who is blessed for ever. Amen.
language2_text: Da peymakarwan o manoyong a nanao na ni Ama ta do to a da kahap so malas a nanao amraralay no masaod no karawan a nyamamaog na ni Ama ta do to, a ji raralay no manoyong a Tao do to a nimangamamaog so makakaday. So ika si Ama ta do to na no to meyyonong a iraralay ta. Amin.

language1_text: For this cause God gave them up unto vile affections: for even their women did change the natural use into that which is against nature:
language2_text: O akman sang a vazay da am to na macipanadngi ni Ama ta do to o onowned da a somagpyan. Ta o mavakes rana am mangzakza sira so kehngehngay da no kolit.

language1_text: and likewise also the men, leaving the natural use of the woman, burned in their lust one toward another; men with men working that which is unseemly, and receiving in themselves that recompence of their error which was meet.
language2_text: Sira akman sang o mahakay, ta da jyakzan o kapacitovong da do mavakes, ta ikeykakza da pa o kapacitovong da do icyamahakay da. Am ori o ipeydedna na jira no peyoyaoyyan na ni Ama ta do to a ingingnen no kataotao da.

language1_text: And even as they did not like to retain God in their knowledge, God gave them over to a reprobate mind, to do those things which are not convenient;
language2_text: Ji da ranakzan no tao o manoyong a nanao na ni Ama ta do to. Am ori o to na rana macipanadngi do onowned da a meyparahet a mapeyvazay so makararahet a vazay.

language1_text: being filled with all unrighteousness, fornication, wickedness, covetousness, maliciousness; full of envy, murder, debate, deceit, malignity; whisperers,
language2_text: Yamakakaday o raraten do onowned da akman so mangagom, manginanahet, manwakwak so tao, mapatongtonggal, mangalalas a kano mangamaog no tao so ciring.

language1_text: backbiters, haters of God, despiteful, proud, boasters, inventors of evil things, disobedient to parents,
language2_text: Sira macitamtamwad. Da pacioyyan si Ama ta do to. Da pasnesneken o kadwan jira. Da pazwain o kataotao da. Sira manrahet so aktokto a yameyraraten. Da jyaglawan o inyapwan da.

language1_text: without understanding, covenantbreakers, without natural affection, implacable, unmerciful:
language2_text: Sya akmey yabo so nakenakem. Da alalasan o mina ciring da. Yabo pangangarilawan da.

language1_text: who knowing the judgment of God, that they which commit such things are worthy of death, not only do the same, but have pleasure in them that do them.
language2_text: Tana katenngan da si Ama ta do to a amwoya no akman so sang a vazay am da jyamamman, ta da ikeykavevek a yamanara so tao a akman sira so vazay.

language1_text: Therefore thou art inexcusable, O man, whosoever thou art that judgest: for wherein thou judgest another, thou condemnest thyself; for thou that judgest doest the same things. But we are sure that the judgment of God is according to truth against them which commit such things.
language2_text: Yata katenngan o kanoyong na no oyaoyyan na ni Ama ta do to no akman so sang a tao. Am no si manamwad ka so tao am raraten mo ori. Ta o peyraratenan mo so sang am mo ipanci o kataotao mo a abo so karatan. Yata katenngan o kanoyong na no oyaoyyan na ni Ama ta do to no akman so sang a tao. Am no si manamwad ka so tao am raraten mo ori. Ta o peyraratenan mo so sang am mo ipanci o kataotao mo a abo so karatan.

language1_text: And thinkest thou this, O man, that judgest them which do such things, and doest the same, that thou shalt escape the judgment of God?
language2_text: O nyo raten a vazay da no tao am ori o nyo peyvazain. Am makatayo ka do peykapyapinpinan na rana so tao ni Ama ta do to?

language1_text: Or despisest thou the riches of his goodness and forbearance and longsuffering; not knowing that the goodness of God leadeth thee to repentance?
language2_text: Manngwa, mo jyatenngi o pangangarilawan na ni Ama ta do to a yameypalanginan nimo a yamamlis? Am yamo kato nazibwan no rako a pangangasyan na yamvonas so raraten mo, do yana kakzeb jimo a yamamlis so onowned.

language1_text: But after thy hardness and impenitent heart treasurest up unto thyself wrath against the day of wrath and revelation of the righteous judgment of God;
language2_text: Am yamo kakmey mavota so onowned a yaji mamlis. Am no si marateng rana o araraw na no peyoyaoyyan na ni Ama ta do to am jyabo kaji nakdekdengan pa no ipasingsingkad na jimo no ji mapeycyakaban so tao a Tao do to a.

language1_text: Who will render to every man according to his deeds:
language2_text: Ta si Ama ta do to rana am to na palololwa do vazay no tao o itoro na jira.

language1_text: to them who by patient continuance in well doing seek for glory and honour and immortality, eternal life:
language2_text: Yamyan so tao a yajimtad no da kapanidong so tao a yakomala so azwazway na ni Ama ta do to a kano to meyyonong a ikavyay no pahad da. O akman rana sang a tao am itoro na jira ni Ama ta do to o to meyyonong a ikavyay no pahad da do teyngato.

language1_text: but unto them that are contentious, and do not obey the truth, but obey unrighteousness, indignation and wrath,
language2_text: Am o yatomaosya so manoyong a nanao na ni Ama ta do to a yaomonot do malas a vazay da am meydedna jira o peyoyaoyyan na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: tribulation and anguish, upon every soul of man that doeth evil, of the Jew first, and also of the Gentile;
language2_text: O yameyraraten rana tao am tana tao do Yotay a tana beken a tao do Yotay am abo jira o makaliklik so alalaw da.

language1_text: but glory, honour, and peace, to every man that worketh good, to the Jew first, and also to the Gentile:
language2_text: Am o manidong a tao am tana tao do Yotay a tana beken a tao do Yotay am ipanta na sira so azwazway da kano ikeynakem da kano ikapiya no onowned da.

language1_text: for there is no respect of persons with God.
language2_text: Ta si Ama ta do to rana am ji mapeykakaban so tao.

language1_text: For as many as have sinned without law shall also perish without law: and as many as have sinned in the law shall be judged by the law;
language2_text: O iwawalam na ni Ama ta do to a nitaid na ji Moyse am abo ori do beken a tao do Yotay a pangozayan da. O raraten da am ori oyyan na nira ni Ama ta do to, ta amyan so ipakateneng da do apya kano marahet. Am o tao do Yotay am ori o yanan no nitaid na a ciriciring na. So pangozayan na ni Ama ta do to do iwawalam na amwoya nira no meyraraten sira.

language1_text: (for not the hearers of the law are just before God, but the doers of the law shall be justified.
language2_text: Beken a omamizing sya o abneken na ni Ama ta do to abo so raraten do tangain na. Ta o mangozay do iwawalam na a peyvazain o abneken na abo so raraten do tangain na.

language1_text: For when the Gentiles, which have not the law, do by nature the things contained in the law, these, having not the law, are a law unto themselves:
language2_text: O beken a tao do Yotay am ji da tenngi o iwawalam na ni Ama ta do to a nivatvatkan ni Moyse. Am amyan so pangozayan da do onowned da. So ipakateneng da do apya kano marahet. So icyakma ney to ngyan no iwawalam na ni Ama ta do to do onowned da no beken a tao do Yotay.

language1_text: which shew the work of the law written in their hearts, their conscience also bearing witness, and their thoughts the mean while accusing or else excusing one another;)
language2_text: O apya icicirawat da am yongkad na ori no keyyan na do onowned da no iwawalam na ni Ama ta do to. Ta katenngan da o apya kano marahet a nakenakem da.

language1_text: in the day when God shall judge the secrets of men by Jesus Christ according to my gospel.
language2_text: O yako ipeylimwang a Mapasaray a Ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to am no si marateng rana o yai ni Yeso Kizisto a mapeykapyapinpinan so tao am patwawen na rana o makakaday a taywen no tao do onowned da.

language1_text: Behold, thou art called a Jew, and restest in the law, and makest thy boast of God,
language2_text: Inyo rana a tao do Yotay am nyo ipakazwazway o iwawalam na ni Moyse a kano mina kapamnekan na jinyo ni Ama ta do to amraralay nya.

language1_text: and knowest his will, and approvest the things that are more excellent, being instructed out of the law;
language2_text: Nyo katenngan o apya kano marahet, ta yamyan jinyo o iwawalam na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: and art confident that thou thyself art a guide of the blind, a light of them which are in darkness,
language2_text: Yanyo ipanci o yanyo kapangonong no mavota tao a yamangay do kazngangan.

language1_text: an instructor of the foolish, a teacher of babes, which hast the form of knowledge and of the truth in the law.
language2_text: Nyo ipanci o kataotao nyo a makananao so jyateneng a tao. Nyo kapanci no kataotao nyo a mapamizing so avayo pa amraralay ni Ama ta do to a tao do yanyo kapakateneng do manoyong a nanao, a yamangozay do iwawalam na ni Moyse.

language1_text: Thou therefore which teachest another, teachest thou not thyself? thou that preachest a man should not steal, dost thou steal?
language2_text: Nyo nanawen o aro a tao. Am ikongo yanyo ji makananaoi so kataotao nyo. No kamo maniring am, "Ji kamo manakaw," am kamo manakaw.

language1_text: Thou that sayest a man should not commit adultery, dost thou commit adultery? thou that abhorrest idols, dost thou commit sacrilege?
language2_text: No kamo maniring am, "Ji mangzakza so icyatatao," am nyo ikakman sang. Nyo ikaoya o yamanaralay so malas a da iraralay. Am ikongo yanyo ipanakaw do panaralayan da.

language1_text: Thou that makest thy boast of the law, through breaking the law dishonourest thou God?
language2_text: Nyo ipakazwazway o na keyyan jinyo no iwawalam na ni Ama ta do to. Am nyo ji peyvazaya. Am ori o na pacikatamwadan jinyo ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: For the name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles through you, as it is written.
language2_text: Ta maniring do Seysyo am, "Inyo a tao do Yotay o na yapwan no da kakolala so ngaran na ni Ama ta do to no beken a tao do Yotay."

language1_text: For circumcision verily profiteth, if thou keep the law: but if thou be a breaker of the law, thy circumcision is made uncircumcision.
language2_text: No kamo manoyong a yamahap so iwawalam na ni Ama ta do to am manoyong o keyyan no peypeypangayan no kayongkad do kataotao nyo. Am si ji nyo ngapa o iwawalam na am abwata peypeypangayan no kayongkad nyo do kataotao nyo.

language1_text: Therefore if the uncircumcision keep the righteousness of the law, shall not his uncircumcision be counted for circumcision?
language2_text: Tana ji da yongkaji no beken a tao do Yotay o kataotao da am no ahapen da o iwawalam na ni Ama ta do to am jyabo kaji na pazanodan sira do nimyongkad do kataotao da a tao ni Ama ta do to a avyain na.

language1_text: And shall not uncircumcision which is by nature, if it fulfil the law, judge thee, who by the letter and circumcision dost transgress the law?
language2_text: So ikanoyong na a meydedna jinyo a tao do Yotay no peyoyaoyyan na ni Ama ta do to. Ta tana myan jinyo so nivatvatkan ni Moyse a iwawalam na ni Ama ta do to a amyongkad do kataotao nyo am nyo ji mangononongi o iwawalam na a peyvazain. Tana da ji yongkaji o kataotao da no beken a tao do Yotay am da pangononongan o iwawalam na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: For he is not a Jew, which is one outwardly; neither is that circumcision, which is outward in the flesh:
language2_text: Am sino manoyong a tao do Yotay a italamozong na ni Ama ta do to. Manngwa, nimyongkad do kataotao da? Beken a ori, ta o omanoyong jya tao am ori o italamozong na.

language1_text: but he is a Jew, which is one inwardly; and circumcision is that of the heart, in the spirit, and not in the letter; whose praise is not of men, but of God.
language2_text: O manoyong a tao do Yotay am mamlis so onowned a omanoyong ji Ama ta do to. Ta ori rana am vazay na ori no Seyzi na ni Ama ta do to. So ikabeken a kahap so iwawalam na ni Ama ta do to a nitaid na ji Moyse. O mahap na azwazway no nimamlis so onowned a tao am beken a apo do tao, ta apo ji Ama ta do to.

language1_text: What advantage then hath the Jew? or what profit is there of circumcision?
language2_text: No manoyong kakman na sang am ikongo peypeypangayan no ka tao do Yotay da kano kayongkad da do kataotao da.

language1_text: Much every way: chiefly, because that unto them were committed the oracles of God.
language2_text: Yaro peypeypangayan no nang. O ney manma na am na nitoro jira ni Ama ta do to o ciriciring na.

language1_text: For what if some did not believe? shall their unbelief make the faith of God without effect?
language2_text: Tana yamyan jira so yatatasa yaji nganoyong do ciriciring na am cinakongo na. Manngwa, ablisen na pa o nakenakem na ni Ama ta do to?

language1_text: God forbid: yea, let God be true, but every man a liar; as it is written, That thou mightest be justified in thy sayings, And mightest overcome when thou art judged.
language2_text: Jyabo kakman na sang a. Tana todamimin o tao a mangalalas am jyabo kapangalalas na ni Ama ta do to a. Akman so ciring na do Seysyo. Ta maniring am, "No mehtaw o ciring mo am yamo pangononongan an. No kapacici da jimo am ji ka nikapatawan."

language1_text: But if our unrighteousness commend the righteousness of God, what shall we say? Is God unrighteous who taketh vengeance? (I speak as a man)
language2_text: Ala yamyan so tao a manci no, "Apya o keyyan no raraten ta. Ta o raraten ta am ipakateneng da no tao ji Ama ta do to a ji meyraraten a kazwazway da sya. So ikalas na ni Ama ta do to a mapasingsingkad jyaten."

language1_text: God forbid: for then how shall God judge the world?
language2_text: Beken a akman sang an. Ta no si malas o kapasingsingkad na jyaten ni Ama ta do to am makongo so wanjin a mapeykapyapinpin so tao do karawan.

language1_text: For if the truth of God hath more abounded through my lie unto his glory; why yet am I also judged as a sinner?
language2_text: Ala yamyan pa so tao a yamanci no, "Si malas o ciring ko am jyabo kaji da makatenngan jya no tao si Ama ta do to a yajyalas so ciring a. No akman sang am ikongo pasingsingkadan na jyaken ni Ama ta do to."

language1_text: And not rather, (as we be slanderously reported, and as some affirm that we say, ) Let us do evil, that good may come? whose damnation is just.
language2_text: "Ikongo ta jyangai a meyraraten a kapeypapya ta nya." So da iyan no tao a yamanci no kapeyciring ko so sang, do da karaherahet jyaken. So ikanoyong da no akman sang a tao a peydednan na no oyaoyyan na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: What then? are we better than they? No, in no wise: for we have before proved both Jews and Gentiles, that they are all under sin;
language2_text: Manngwa, namen apyapya pa tao do Yotay a kano karwan no tao do tangain na ni Ama ta do to? Jyabo kakman na sang a. Nipanci ko na o tao do Yotay a kano beken a tao do Yotay a yameyyangay a yameysaod pa so raraten.

language1_text: as it is written, There is none righteous, no, not one:
language2_text: Akman so ipanci na do Seysyo. Ta maniring am, "Abwata o yasa ka tao abo so raraten.

language1_text: There is none that understandeth, There is none that seeketh after God.
language2_text: Abwata o yasa ka tao a yamakateneng ji Ama ta do to. Yabo o yasa ka tao a yamakza no na kararalay ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: They are all gone out of the way, they are together become unprofitable; There is none that doeth good, no, not one.
language2_text: Yamamimin o tao a yamlikod ji Ama ta do to a yamangay do da peyraratenan. Yabo o yasa ka tao a apya so nakenakem.

language1_text: Their throat is an open sepulchre; With their tongues they have used deceit; The poison of asps is under their lips:
language2_text: O ciriciring da am ikarahet no tao. Sya mangononong so yamalas. So na icyakmey mavowaw no ciriciring da a tey manginanawa.

language1_text: Whose mouth is full of cursing and bitterness:
language2_text: Ta mamimin a ipangangavay o ciriciring da.

language1_text: Their feet are swift to shed blood:
language2_text: No meyoyaoya sira am panwakwakan da rana so tao.

language1_text: Destruction and misery are in their ways:
language2_text: O angayan da nira ori am abo o ji da peyrarehta tao.

language1_text: And the way of peace have they not known:
language2_text: Ji da tenngi o kapya no onowned da do icyatatao da.

language1_text: There is no fear of God before their eyes.
language2_text: Ji da anyaheyan o peyoyaoyyan na ni Ama ta do to."

language1_text: Now we know that what things soever the law saith, it saith to them who are under the law: that every mouth may be stopped, and all the world may become guilty before God.
language2_text: O iwawalam na ni Moyse am itoro na ni Ama ta do to do tao do Yotay a pangozayan da. So ikabo no tao do karawan a omalalas do raraten da do tangain na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: Therefore by the deeds of the law there shall no flesh be justified in his sight: for by the law is the knowledge of sin.
language2_text: Abo asa ka tao a mangozay do iwawalam na ni Moyse a manoyong a manci no kabo no raraten na do tangain na ni Ama ta do to. Ta o iwawalam na ni Moyse am kapanidong na so tao a makateneng do raraten da.

language1_text: But now the righteousness of God without the law is manifested, being witnessed by the law and the prophets;
language2_text: Sicyaikwaya am na rana nipananao jyaten o na kabnek jyaten ni Ama ta do to a abo so raraten do tangain na. Ori rana am beken a iwawalam na ni Moyse, ta monganay do kapeyhanhan ni Yeso Kizisto akman so mina ciring da no panoyonoywan na so ciring ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: even the righteousness of God which is by faith of Jesus Christ unto all and upon all them that believe: for there is no difference:
language2_text: Si ipeyhanhan ta si Yeso Kizisto am abneken na rana yaten ni Ama ta do to a abo so raraten do tangain na. So ipeyyangangay na no nang a itoro na do meyhanhan nya tao.

language1_text: for all have sinned, and come short of the glory of God;
language2_text: Ta tanyo mamimin a yameyraraten a yaji makanet so nakenakem do tangain na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: being justified freely by his grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus:
language2_text: So na nitovoyan si Yeso Kizisto a yasomidong jyaten a komaro do raraten ta do na karilaw nyaten. So ikanoyong ta na abo so raraten do tangain na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: whom God hath set forth to be a propitiation through faith in his blood, to declare his righteousness for the remission of sins that are past, through the forbearance of God;
language2_text: Nitovoy na si Yeso Kizisto a mangay mawakwak no raraten ta. So ikanoyong no meyhanhan nya tao a mavonas rana so raraten. O ikakman na sang ni Ama ta do to am ipacita na o kaji na alasan a mapeykapyapinpin so tao. Ta o pangangasyan na am ori o ji na rana mapasingsingkaji do meyhanhan nya tao no kakwa.

language1_text: to declare, I say, at this time his righteousness: that he might be just, and the justifier of him which believeth in Jesus.
language2_text: Am sicyaikwa rana ya am na nyahap ni Yeso Kizisto o raraten no tao. So ikanoyong da no meyhanhan nya tao a mavonas rana so raraten ji Ama ta do to a kabnek na sira a abo so raraten do tangain na. Ori na ikatey yapya no na ahahapan sya ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: Where is boasting then? It is excluded. By what law? of works? Nay: but by the law of faith.
language2_text: Am ikongo ipakazwazway ta. Jyabo a. O ko pancyan no nang am beken a ta kahap so iwawalam na ni Moyse o yata ikapya do tangain na ni Ama ta do to. Ta yaomagaz do yata kapeyhanhan ni Yeso Kizisto.

language1_text: Therefore we conclude that a man is justified by faith without the deeds of the law.
language2_text: O ikabo no raraten no tao do tangain ni Ama ta do to am meykasaha. Ori rana am ipeyhanhan si Yeso Kizisto. So ikabeken a kahap ta so iwawalam na ni Moyse.

language1_text: Is he the God of the Jews only? is he not also of the Gentiles? Yes, of the Gentiles also:
language2_text: Jyabo ka tao do Yotay no mapeytao do to si Ama ta do to a. Ta Tao do to da no beken a tao do Yotay. So na ikanoyong no nang.

language1_text: seeing it is one God, which shall justify the circumcision by faith, and uncircumcision through faith.
language2_text: Yasa si Ama ta do to. O ikapya namen a tao do Yotay do tangain na am akman sang, ta inyo rana beken a tao do Yotay am no si anoyngan nyo si Ama ta do to am akman kamo sang a vonasen na so raraten.

language1_text: Do we then make void the law through faith? God forbid: yea, we establish the law.
language2_text: No akman sang am manngwa, todabo rana o oyowyat na no iwawalam na ni Moyse? Jyabo kakman na sang a. Ta o manoyong a meyhanhan ni Yeso Kizisto a tao am ori o ipanci a manoyong a mangononong do iwawalam na ni Moyse.

language1_text: What shall we say then that Abraham our father, as pertaining to the flesh, hath found?
language2_text: Naknakmen ta pala si Apolahan a manoyong a ineynapo namen a tao do Yotay.

language1_text: For if Abraham were justified by works, he hath whereof to glory; but not before God.
language2_text: No si monganay do apya icicirawat na o abnekan na sya abo so raraten do tangain na ni Ama ta do to am manoyong kapakazwazway na nya. Am ji na mapazwayan do tangain na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: For what saith the scripture? Abraham believed God, and it was counted unto him for righteousness.
language2_text: Ta maniring do Seysyo am, "Na anoyngan si Ama ta do to ni Apolahan. Ori nibnekan na sya ni Ama ta do to do a abo so raraten do tangain na."

language1_text: Now to him that worketh is the reward not reckoned of grace, but of debt.
language2_text: O meyvazay a tao am manoyong o kapeynizpi sira. Am o nizpi da am beken a karilawan na nira no mapeyvazay sira, ta nizpi da do kapeyvazay da.

language1_text: But to him that worketh not, but believeth on him that justifieth the ungodly, his faith is counted for righteousness.
language2_text: Am o nakenakem na jyaten ni Ama ta do to am beken a akman sang. Ta o meyhanhan nya tao am beken a monganay do kapya no icicirawat na. Ta o abnekan na sya abo so raraten ni Ama ta do to am monganay do kapeyhanhan na nya.

language1_text: Even as David also describeth the blessedness of the man, unto whom God imputeth righteousness without works,
language2_text: O akman rana sang a tao am tey yapya an, ta ji monganay do apya icicirawat na o yana vonasan so raraten na. Ori o akman so nipanci ni Tawey. Maniring am,

language1_text: saying, Blessed are they whose iniquities are forgiven, And whose sins are covered.
language2_text: "O nivonas na rana so raraten ni Ama ta do to a tao am manoyong sira tey yapya o akman sang a tao.

language1_text: Blessed is the man to whom the Lord will not impute sin.
language2_text: O ji na rana naknakma ni Ama ta do to so raraten a tao am tey yapya o akman sang a tao."

language1_text: Cometh this blessedness then upon the circumcision only, or upon the uncircumcision also? for we say that faith was reckoned to Abraham for righteousness.
language2_text: O ipanci na ni Tawey a tey yapya a tao am manngwa, o nimyongkad do kataotao na o peycirngan na sya? Beken a ori an. Ta macyangay sira o jya nimyongkad do kataotao da. Ta maniring do Seysyo am, "Na anoyngan si Ama ta do to ni Apolahan. Ori o nibnekan na sya ni Ama ta do to a abo so raraten."

language1_text: How was it then reckoned? when he was in circumcision, or in uncircumcision? Not in circumcision, but in uncircumcision.
language2_text: Ikongo nikapwan no akman sang. No kaji da pa nimyongkadan ji Apolahan an? No kateyka na rana niyongkadan da. Jyabo kaji na nimyapwan no kaji da niyongkadan do kataotao na.

language1_text: And he received the sign of circumcision, a seal of the righteousness of the faith which he had yet being uncircumcised: that he might be the father of all them that believe, though they be not circumcised; that righteousness might be imputed unto them also:
language2_text: O peypeypangayan na no kayongkad da do kataotao na am nivonas na rana ni Ama ta do to o raraten na, ta nipeyhanhan na si Ama ta do to. Am ori nipancyan na nya abo rana so raraten. Ori o da abnekan si Apolahan a ama da no yameyhanhan ni Ama ta do to a tao. Tana ji da yongkaji o kataotao da am to na rana abneken sira abo so raraten do kapeyhanhan da ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: and the father of circumcision to them who are not of the circumcision only, but who also walk in the steps of that faith of our father Abraham, which he had being yet uncircumcised.
language2_text: Akman sang, ta yada akmey ama no yarana niyongkadan do kataotao da tao. Am beken a yada kanimyongkad rana do kataotao da, ta yada inarahen pa si Apolahan a yameyhanhan ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: For the promise, that he should be the heir of the world, was not to Abraham, or to his seed, through the law, but through the righteousness of faith.
language2_text: O mina ciring na ni Ama ta do to ji Apolahan am itoro na o karawan ji Apolahan a kano sivosivovoong na. Am beken a kahap na ni Apolahan so iwawalam na ni Ama ta do to o peycirngan na sya, ta yamonganay do na kapeyhanhan ni Ama ta do to ni Apolahan. Ori nyabnekan na sya ni Ama ta do to abo so raraten do tangain na.

language1_text: For if they which are of the law be heirs, faith is made void, and the promise made of none effect:
language2_text: Ta no si azawen na yaten ni Ama ta do to do kahap ta so iwawalam na ni Moyse am manngwa, abo saon o peypeypangayan no kapeyhanhan ta ni Ama ta do to. So ikabo na saon no peypeypangayan no mina ciring na jyaten am.

language1_text: because the law worketh wrath: for where no law is, there is no transgression.
language2_text: O iwawalam na ni Moyse o yapwan no peyoyaoya na ni Ama ta do to. Ta abo yasa ka tao a manoyong a makahap sya. No abo pangozayan a iwawalam am do wanjin o kapwan no raraten no tao.

language1_text: Therefore it is of faith, that it might be by grace; to the end the promise might be sure to all the seed; not to that only which is of the law, but to that also which is of the faith of Abraham; who is the father of us all,
language2_text: O mina ciring na ni Ama ta do to so meyhanhan nya tao am to na palololwa do kapeyhanhan da nya. So ji na monganai do kapya no icicirawat ta. Ta o aryarilaw na ni Ama ta do to jyaten a sivosivovoong na ni Apolahan am ori o nipanci na a itoro na jyaten ni Ama ta do to. So ji ta mangozai do iwawalam na ni Moyse. Ta macyangay ta ji Apolahan a omanoyong ji Ama ta do to. Ta iya rana am akma tey ama a yameyhanhan ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: (as it is written, I have made thee a father of many nations, ) before him whom he believed, even God, who quickeneth the dead, and calleth those things which be not as though they were.
language2_text: Ta maniring do Seysyo am, "Ko abneken imo a ama da no tao do peycyamahamahatawan na." So ipangononong na no ciring ni Ama ta do to. Ta o na anoyngan ni Apolahan a Tao do to am yamapeyvangon so nimawakwak a tao a nimangamamaog so karawan.

language1_text: Who against hope believed in hope, that he might become the father of many nations, according to that which was spoken, So shall thy seed be.
language2_text: Tana katenngan na o katey masalit na no keyyan no minapodpod jya do kararakeh na rana am na anoyngan o kapangononong na no mina ciring na jya ni Ama ta do to. Ta maniring si Ama ta do to jya am, "Somaod ka so sivosivovoong."

language1_text: And being not weak in faith, he considered not his own body now dead, when he was about an hundred years old, neither yet the deadness of Sarah's womb:
language2_text: Toda ji makapoo (100) o kakawakawan na am naknakmen na rana o kararakeh na ni Apolahan. O mavakes na meyngaran si Salay am ji rana makapeytaodtod ori. Am ji na haywan ni Apolahan o kapeyhanhan na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: he staggered not at the promise of God through unbelief; but was strong in faith, giving glory to God;
language2_text: Tana akman sang am ji na haywan o kararalay na ni Ama ta do to. Ta ikowyowyat na meyhanhan ni Ama ta do to a omazwazway sya.

language1_text: and being fully persuaded that, what he had promised, he was able also to perform.
language2_text: Anoyngan na si Ama ta do to a mangononong do mina ciring na jya.

language1_text: And therefore it was imputed to him for righteousness.
language2_text: Am ori o nibnekan na sya ni Ama ta do to si Apolahan a abo so raraten do tangain na do kapeyhanhan na nya.

language1_text: Now it was not written for his sake alone, that it was imputed to him;
language2_text: Am beken a iyaha o peycirngan na so kabo no raraten na.

language1_text: but for us also, to whom it shall be imputed, if we believe on him that raised up Jesus our Lord from the dead;
language2_text: Ta akman sang o ciring na jyaten, do yata kanoyong ji Ama ta do to a nimirwa a omvyay si Yeso Kizisto a Panirsirngen ta. So icyakman ta sang a abneken na ni Ama ta do to a abo so raraten do tangain na.

language1_text: who was delivered for our offences, and was raised again for our justification.
language2_text: Nimawakwak si Yeso no raraten ta a kapirwa na rana mavyay. So ikanoyong ta na ipanci ni Ama ta do to abo so raraten do tangain na.

language1_text: Therefore being justified by faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ:
language2_text: O na abnekan jyaten ni Ama ta do to a abo so raraten do tangain na am ta ipeyhanhan si Yeso Kizisto a Panirsirngen ta. So ikanoyong ta rana macikaop ji Ama ta do to.

language1_text: by whom also we have access by faith into this grace wherein we stand, and rejoice in hope of the glory of God.
language2_text: O ta ikakman sang sicyaikwaya am pangangarilawan na ni Ama ta do to, do ta kapeyhanhan ni Kizisto. Am ori o ikasaray ta, ta katenngan ta o kahap na jyaten ni Ama ta do to do teyngato a macikasaray do azwazway na.

language1_text: And not only so, but we glory in tribulations also: knowing that tribulation worketh patience;
language2_text: Tana amyan so alalaw ta am masaray ta. Ta ori ipakateneng ta rana do ahapan ta sya no myan so alalaw ta.

language1_text: and patience, experience; and experience, hope:
language2_text: Ta si myan rana so peyneynaran ta sya do alalaw ta am mowyat ta na so onowned a omnanala so itoro na jyaten ni Ama ta do to sarasaray ta,

language1_text: and hope maketh not ashamed; because the love of God is shed abroad in our hearts by the Holy Ghost which is given unto us.
language2_text: do kapeyhanhan ta ni Ama ta do to a mangononong do mina ciring na jyaten. Ta o Seyzi a nitoro na jyaten ni Ama ta do to am ori o yaomoyat do onowned ta a makateneng ta do pangangarilawan na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: For when we were yet without strength, in due time Christ died for the ungodly.
language2_text: No kakwa pa am abo oyowyat ta a komaro do peyraratenan ta. Am kanimangozay na jya ni Kizisto do nipamnekan ni Ama ta do to a araraw a mangay mawakwak nyaten.

language1_text: For scarcely for a righteous man will one die: yet peradventure for a good man some would even dare to die.
language2_text: Yabo o tao a mawakwak no icyatatao na. Am ala yamyan so mawakwak no apiya so ahahapan sya tao.

language1_text: But God commendeth his love toward us, in that, while we were yet sinners, Christ died for us.
language2_text: Am no kapeyraraten ta pa am nikawakwak na yaten ni Kizisto. Ori rana am yongkad na ori ni Ama ta do to, do na karilaw nyaten.

language1_text: Much more then, being now justified by his blood, we shall be saved from wrath through him.
language2_text: No ta manoyong rana a yanimavonas so raraten no rala ni Yeso Kizisto am abneken na rana yaten ni Ama ta do to a abo so raraten do tangain na. No si akman sang am maliklik ta o peyoyaoyyan na ni Ama ta do to no makwa.

language1_text: For if, when we were enemies, we were reconciled to God by the death of his Son, much more, being reconciled, we shall be saved by his life.
language2_text: No kakwa am abo o kasngesngenan ta ji Ama ta do to. Am mina kawakwak na nyaten no Anak na. Am ori o ta na ipacikaop ji Ama ta do to. No manoyong o akman sang am jyabo kaji na ngahapan jyaten a. Ta si Yeso Kizisto rana am yamyan do teyngato a yasomidong jyaten.

language1_text: And not only so, but we also joy in God through our Lord Jesus Christ, by whom we have now received the atonement.
language2_text: Tamo isaray ji Ama ta do to o na kanimapanop jyaten ni Yeso Kizisto ji Ama ta do to. Am ori o yata ipacikaop ji Ama ta do to. So ta na ikasaray do yana kanimahap ni Kizisto so vazay na ni Ama ta do to a yasomidong jyaten.

language1_text: Wherefore, as by one man sin entered into the world, and death by sin; and so death passed upon all men, for that all have sinned:
language2_text: Si Adam o yapwan no raraten do karawan. Am ori o nyangay na no inawan na do kapeyraraten na. Ori o nikapwan no kawakwak rana no tao do karawan. Ta yamamimin o tao a yameyraraten.

language1_text: (for until the law sin was in the world: but sin is not imputed when there is no law.
language2_text: No kabo na pa no nitoro na ni Ama ta do to a iwawalam na ji Moyse am amyan rana so raraten no tao do karawan. Am o raraten no tao am ji pa mancyan a raraten da, ta abo pa o iwawalam a pangozayan da.

language1_text: Nevertheless death reigned from Adam to Moses, even over them that had not sinned after the similitude of Adam's transgression, who is the figure of him that was to come.
language2_text: Am no kabo pa no iwawalam na ni Moyse am amyan rana so tao a mawakwak. Tana ji sira akman si Adam a ji niomamizing si Ama ta do to am akman sira si Adam a mawakwak, ta amyan so raraten da. Si Adam am pehngehngain ji Yeso Kizisto. Am meytarek o pamoonen da do tao.

language1_text: But not as the offence, so also is the free gift. For if through the offence of one many be dead, much more the grace of God, and the gift by grace, which is by one man, Jesus Christ, hath abounded unto many.
language2_text: Ta si Adam rana am nimeyraraten. Am ori o nikapwan no ikawakwak no tao. Am si Yeso Kizisto am tey mangarilaw, ta nikawakwak na o raraten no tao. O akman sang a pangangarilawan na ni Ama ta do to a yana nitoro do aro a tao am yabo tonggal na.

language1_text: And not as it was by one that sinned, so is the gift: for the judgment was by one to condemnation, but the free gift is of many offences unto justification.
language2_text: Meyraraten si Adam. Am ori o iyan no raraten no tao a mangay do kararatan. Am o meyhanhan ni Yeso Kizisto a tao am mavonas o raraten da, ta mahap da o pangangarilawan na ni Ama ta do to. Am ori o abnekan na rana sira abo so raraten do tangain na.

language1_text: For if by one man's offence death reigned by one; much more they which receive abundance of grace and of the gift of righteousness shall reign in life by one, Jesus Christ.)
language2_text: So ikanoyong na no raraten na ni Adam a yapwan no ikawakwak rana no tao. Am arakorako pa o pangangarilawan na ni Ama ta do to a kani Yeso Kizisto a yamapeyvaliw jyaten a abo so raraten do tangain na ni Ama ta do to a manta nyaten so to meyyonong a ikavyay no pahad ta.

language1_text: Therefore as by the offence of one judgment came upon all men to condemnation; even so by the righteousness of one the free gift came upon all men unto justification of life.
language2_text: So ikanoyong na no raraten na ni Adam a yapwan no kapeydedna no oyaoyyan na ni Ama ta do to do tao do karawan. Akman sang, ta o kapyapya na ni Kizisto am ikamimin no meyhanhan nya tao a mavonas rana so raraten a ipakahap da rana so to meyyonong a ikavyay no pahad da.

language1_text: For as by one man's disobedience many were made sinners, so by the obedience of one shall many be made righteous.
language2_text: Yakman sang o aro a tao a omamoon so raraten ni Adam. Am kanyahap na rana ni Yeso Kizisto so vazay ni Ama ta do to a mawakwak no raraten ta. Am ori o ikamimin no tao a meyhanhan nya abneken na ni Ama ta do to a abo so raraten do tangain na.

language1_text: Moreover the law entered, that the offence might abound. But where sin abounded, grace did much more abound:
language2_text: O nitoro ni Ama ta do to a iwawalam na ni Moyse am ipakateneng no tao do raraten da. Am tana akman sang am arakorako pa o aryarilaw na jyaten ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: that as sin hath reigned unto death, even so might grace reign through righteousness unto eternal life by Jesus Christ our Lord.
language2_text: No kakwa pa am niharag no raraten o tao do karawan. Am ori o ikamimin da mawakwak no tao. Am o pangangarilawan na ni Ama ta do to am na nitoro do meyhanhan nya tao. So ikamimin da rana vonasen na so raraten. So ipakahap da rana so to meyyonong a ikavyay no pahad da, do da kanoyong ji Yeso Kizisto a Panirsirngen ta.

language1_text: What shall we say then? Shall we continue in sin, that grace may abound?
language2_text: Manngwa, ji ta ngaroi o raraten ta a kato na ngarilawan nyaten ni Ama ta do to?

language1_text: God forbid. How shall we, that are dead to sin, live any longer therein?
language2_text: Jyabo kakman ta sang a. Ta yatamo rana nikarwan o peyraratenan ta. Am manngwa, olin ta pa o peyraratenan taha?

language1_text: Know ye not, that so many of us as were baptized into Jesus Christ were baptized into his death? Therefore we are buried with him by baptism into death: that like as Christ was raised up from the dead by the glory of the Father, even so we also should walk in newness of life.
language2_text: Kamo jyamimin a makateneng do peypeypangayan no kataktak da jyaten. Ta ori rana am yongkad no kapacizanod no raraten ta a yakmey nimaciwakwak ji Yeso Kizisto. So icyakman ta sang a macizanod ji Kizisto a mirwa a mavyay. So ikanoyong ta na makahap so vayo rana icicirawat ta, akman si Yeso a nipirwa na avyain ni Ama ta do to no oyowyat na.Kamo jyamimin a makateneng do peypeypangayan no kataktak da jyaten. Ta ori rana am yongkad no kapacizanod no raraten ta a yakmey nimaciwakwak ji Yeso Kizisto. So icyakman ta sang a macizanod ji Kizisto a mirwa a mavyay. So ikanoyong ta na makahap so vayo rana icicirawat ta, akman si Yeso a nipirwa na avyain ni Ama ta do to no oyowyat na.

language1_text: For if we have been planted together in the likeness of his death, we shall be also in the likeness of his resurrection:
language2_text: No ta na macikaop ji Kizisto am yamyan pa so kapirwa na jyaten a avyain ni Ama ta do to no makwa.

language1_text: knowing this, that our old man is crucified with him, that the body of sin might be destroyed, that henceforth we should not serve sin.
language2_text: Tamo na katenngan o adan ta onowned a yarana akmey nimacizanod ji Kizisto a nipadket do jyojika. So ikanoyong ta na a nikomaro rana do raraten ta. So ikabo na rana no oyowyat no raraten a tomalamozong nyaten.

language1_text: For he that is dead is freed from sin.
language2_text: Ta no mawakwak rana o tao am ji na rana nalamozongan no raraten.

language1_text: Now if we be dead with Christ, we believe that we shall also live with him:
language2_text: No si nimacizanod ji Kizisto o adan ta onowned a nidomket do jyojika am anoyngan ta o kapacizanod ta ji Kizisto a mavyay.

language1_text: knowing that Christ being raised from the dead dieth no more; death hath no more dominion over him.
language2_text: Ta tanyo na katenngan si Kizisto a nimirwa a mavyay. So ji na rana wakwaki. Ta abo o oyowyat a makawakwak sya.

language1_text: For in that he died, he died unto sin once: but in that he liveth, he liveth unto God.
language2_text: Ipisa si Yeso a mawakwak no raraten ta tao. So na rana ipacikaop ji Ama ta do to a mavyay sicyaikwaya.

language1_text: Likewise reckon ye also yourselves to be dead indeed unto sin, but alive unto God through Jesus Christ our Lord.
language2_text: Akman sang, ta naknakmen nyo o kapacizanod no adan a onowned nyo ji Kizisto a nimawakwak no raraten nyo. So ikanoyong nyo na a meypahagnat so onowned ji Ama ta do to, ta kamo rana macikaop ji Yeso Kizisto.

language1_text: Let not sin therefore reign in your mortal body, that ye should obey it in the lusts thereof.
language2_text: Am ori o ji nyo to amyapyai so kataotao nyo a italamozong no raraten. Ji nyo to ngonongonoci o marahet a onowned nyo.

language1_text: Neither yield ye your members as instruments of unrighteousness unto sin: but yield yourselves unto God, as those that are alive from the dead, and your members as instruments of righteousness unto God.
language2_text: Ji nyo mamyapyan o peyvongvongwan nyo a peylamlamsoin no raraten. Ta itoro nyo o kataotao nyo ji Ama ta do to a mahap so vazay na. O torwan nyo no kataotao nyo ji Ama ta do to am ahapen nyo o apya vazay na. Ta iya o na yapwan no vayo a inawan ta.

language1_text: For sin shall not have dominion over you: for ye are not under the law, but under grace.
language2_text: So ji na rana nalamozongi ninyo no raraten. Ta nyo na ipeyhanhan o pangangarilawan na ni Ama ta do to a makavonas so raraten nyo. So ji na monganai do apya icicirawat nyo.

language1_text: What then? shall we sin, because we are not under the law, but under grace? God forbid.
language2_text: No akman sang am manngwa, apya saon o kato ta na meyraratenan a meyhanhan no pangangarilawan na ni Ama ta do to a makavonas so raraten ta? Jyabo kakman ta sang a.

language1_text: Know ye not, that to whom ye yield yourselves servants to obey, his servants ye are to whom ye obey; whether of sin unto death, or of obedience unto righteousness?
language2_text: No onotan nyo o ciring no tao am manoyong kamo a lamlamsoy da. Akman sang, ta no si onotan nyo o raraten am manoyong kamo a lamlamsoy no raraten a mangay do kararatan. Am no si onotan nyo si Ama ta do to am abneken na inyo a abo so raraten do tangain na.

language1_text: But God be thanked, that ye were the servants of sin, but ye have obeyed from the heart that form of doctrine which was delivered you.
language2_text: Am ta isaray ji Ama ta do to. Ta no kakwa am akma ney lamlamsoy inyo no raraten. Am sicyaikwa rana ya am yasa rana o onowned nyo a yaomonot do manoyong a nanao.

language1_text: Being then made free from sin, ye became the servants of righteousness.
language2_text: Am ori o ji na rana mapeylamlamsoi jinyo no raraten. So ikanoyong nyo na yamahap so apya vazay na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: I speak after the manner of men because of the infirmity of your flesh: for as ye have yielded your members servants to uncleanness and to iniquity unto iniquity; even so now yield your members servants to righteousness unto holiness.
language2_text: Abo o makdeng a ciring ko jinyo, ta ko ihawa inyo a ji makateneng jya. No kakwa pa am ji nyo amzaci o onowned nyo. Am ori o ikarahet no vazay nyo. So ikanoyong nyo akma ney lamlamsoy no raraten. Am sicyaikwa rana ya am itoro nyo o kataotao nyo ji Ama ta do to a mahap so vazay na. Ta ori o ji nyo rana meylimotengi so onowned a lamlamsoy na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: For when ye were the servants of sin, ye were free from righteousness.
language2_text: No kapeylamlamsoy na pa jinyo no raraten am ji nyo akzan o kapeyvazay nyo so apiya vazay.

language1_text: What fruit had ye then in those things whereof ye are now ashamed? for the end of those things is death.
language2_text: O yanyo ipacimanig rana sicyaikwaya a vazay am nipeyvazay nyo na. Am ikongo o na kapyapyan no akman sang. Kangay nyo saon do kararatan no akman sang am.

language1_text: But now being made free from sin, and become servants to God, ye have your fruit unto holiness, and the end everlasting life.
language2_text: Am inyo rana sicyaikwaya am ji na rana peylamlamsoya inyo no raraten. Ta yanyo rana kakzeben si Ama ta do to a mapeylamlamsoy jinyo. So yanyo rana ipeyngongyod a yaomonot rana ji Ama ta do to. So ikanoyong nyo a makahap so to meyyonong a ikavyay no pahad nyo.

language1_text: For the wages of sin is death; but the gift of God is eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord.
language2_text: Ta o kapalit no raraten am mangay do makotokotod a lila no apoy a mangay no makwa. Am o yazaw na ni Ama ta do to so yamacibedbed ji Yeso Kizisto a Panirsirngen ta am ipanta na so to meyyonong a ikavyay no pahad da.

language1_text: Know ye not, brethren, (for I speak to them that know the law, ) how that the law hath dominion over a man as long as he liveth?
language2_text: Nyo jyatenngi, manga kakteh, o yokoyokod rana no tao do karawan eya am o mavyay a tao o kapyan na. Am no mawakwak rana tao am abo rana peypeypangayan na no yokoyokod do karawan.

language1_text: For the woman which hath an husband is bound by the law to her husband so long as he liveth; but if the husband be dead, she is loosed from the law of her husband.
language2_text: Akman so nimacivahavahay rana a mavakes. Ta no mavyay pa o kahanghangan na am ji na to ngaroi. Ta ori o adan a iwawalam no tao do karawan. No si mawakwak saon o kahanghangan na o ji na rana mangozai do iwawalam ori am.

language1_text: So then if, while her husband liveth, she be married to another man, she shall be called an adulteress: but if her husband be dead, she is free from that law; so that she is no adulteress, though she be married to another man.
language2_text: Am ori an, no meyigegen pa o kahanghangan na am ji to macitovong do karwan no tao. Ta o akman rana sang am somagpyan. Am no nimawakwak rana o kahanghangan na am ipanci rana ori no tao a to rana naliway. So ikapya na rana macivahavahay.

language1_text: Wherefore, my brethren, ye also are become dead to the law by the body of Christ; that ye should be married to another, even to him who is raised from the dead, that we should bring forth fruit unto God.
language2_text: Manga kakteh, yakamo akman sang a na rana ji nalamozongan no iwawalam na ni Moyse. Ta kanyo na macikaop ji Yeso Kizisto a nimawakwak no raraten nyo. Inyo rana sicyaikwaya am na rana ipeymatmatngeh inyo ni Yeso a yanimirwa a mavyay a Panirsirngen ta. Ta iya o manoyong a ahapen ta so vazay.

language1_text: For when we were in the flesh, the motions of sins, which were by the law, did work in our members to bring forth fruit unto death.
language2_text: No kato ta pa mangozayan do adan a onowned ta a meyraraten am nipatwaw no iwawalam na ni Moyse o raraten ta do onowned ta. Am o kapalit no raraten am mangay do makotokotod a lila no apoy a mangay no makwa.

language1_text: But now we are delivered from the law, that being dead wherein we were held; that we should serve in newness of spirit, and not in the oldness of the letter.
language2_text: Am sicyaikwa rana ya am na rana jyagogadan yaten no nivatvatkan a iwawalam na ni Moyse. Ta ori rana am adan rana ori. So ta na pangozayan do na ipananao jyaten no Seyzi a vayo a nakenakem ta ji Ama ta do to.

language1_text: What shall we say then? Is the law sin? God forbid. Nay, I had not known sin, but by the law: for I had not known lust, except the law had said, Thou shalt not covet.
language2_text: No akman sang am manngwa, ipanci ta o iwawalam na ni Moyse a yapwan no raraten? Jyabo kakman na sang a. Ta o iwawalam na ni Moyse am ipakateneng ta do raraten. No abo iwawalam a yamanci no kaji mangagoman am jyabo ko kapakateneng do karahet no mangagom a.

language1_text: But sin, taking occasion by the commandment, wrought in me all manner of concupiscence. For without the law sin was dead.
language2_text: Nimeycicinda jyaken o raraten a amyan. No ipanci no iwawalam na ni Moyse o kaji mangagoman am ikaraherahet ko a mangagom. No abo iwawalam na ni Moyse am jyabo kapakateneng ta do kapeyraraten ta.

language1_text: For I was alive without the law once: but when the commandment came, sin revived, and I died.
language2_text: No kaji ko pa makatenngan do iwawalam na ni Moyse am akmey abo raraten ko. Am katenngan ko na o iwawalam na ni Moyse am katenngan ko na o karahet no icicirawat ko, do kapakateneng ko rana do peyoyaoyyan na ni Ama ta do to do meyraraten a tao.

language1_text: And the commandment, which was ordained to life, I found to be unto death.
language2_text: Am o peypeypangayan no iwawalam na ni Moyse am ipakateneng no tao do to meyyonong a ikavyay no pahad. Am o akman rana sang jyaken am yangay ko do kararatan. Ta yako jya nimataptap a yanipeyvazay no iwawalam na ni Moyse.

language1_text: For sin, taking occasion by the commandment, deceived me, and by it slew me.
language2_text: Manoyong ko kakmey mavota no raraten. Am ori o ko nipasobnan do iwawalam na ni Moyse. So ikanoyong ko mangay do kararatan.

language1_text: Wherefore the law is holy, and the commandment holy, and just, and good.
language2_text: Am o iwawalam na rana ni Moyse am apyaha, ta abo marahet do dang.

language1_text: Was then that which is good made death unto me? God forbid. But sin, that it might appear sin, working death in me by that which is good; that sin by the commandment might become exceeding sinful.
language2_text: Manngwa, iwawalam na ni Moyse o yangay ko do kararatan? Jyabo kakman na sang a. O yangay ko do kararatan am raraten ko. Abo o karatan no iwawalam na ni Moyse. Ta ipakateneng no tao do raraten na. So na ikanoyong no raraten a mapeyparai jyaten ji Ama ta do to.

language1_text: For we know that the law is spiritual: but I am carnal, sold under sin.
language2_text: Manoyong o na kapo ji Ama ta do to no iwawalam na ni Moyse. Am yaten rana am tao ta. Jyabo kapakataptap ta so yadomket a ciring do iwawalam na ni Moyse a.

language1_text: For that which I do I allow not: for what I would, that do I not; but what I hate, that do I.
language2_text: Ko jyatenngi o ko vazay. Ta o ko ikakza a vazay am ko ji peyvazaya. O ko pacioyyan a vazay am ko mangay peyvazain.

language1_text: If then I do that which I would not, I consent unto the law that it is good.
language2_text: Ko anoyngan o iwawalam na ni Moyse a manci nyaken a ji meyraraten. Am ko jyapakongo kataotao ko, ta ko meyraraten.

language1_text: Now then it is no more I that do it, but sin that dwelleth in me.
language2_text: No yamanoyong ori am beken a yaken o yameyngongyod a yamapeyvazay sya. Ta o raraten do onowned ko am ori o yamapeyvazay sya.

language1_text: For I know that in me (that is, in my flesh, ) dwelleth no good thing: for to will is present with me; but how to perform that which is good I find not.
language2_text: Ko katenngan o na kabo no apya do onowned ko. Tana ko tey kakza ahapen o apya vazay am ko jyapakongo a yapeyvazain.

language1_text: For the good that I would I do not: but the evil which I would not, that I do.
language2_text: O ko ikakza apya vazay am ko ji ngapa. O ko jyakzan a marahet a vazay am ko ahapen.

language1_text: Now if I do that I would not, it is no more I that do it, but sin that dwelleth in me.
language2_text: No si peyvazain ko o yako jyakzan a vazay am manoyong ka beken a yaken no nang. Ta vazay na ori no yamyan do onowned ko a raraten.

language1_text: I find then a law, that, when I would do good, evil is present with me.
language2_text: Cinatao ko o kapeyraraten ko. No ko ikakza o yako kapanidong am ko ji peyvazaya, ko kahap so yamarahet a vazay.

language1_text: For I delight in the law of God after the inward man:
language2_text: Am o na ikakza no onowned ko am vazay na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: but I see another law in my members, warring against the law of my mind, and bringing me into captivity to the law of sin which is in my members.
language2_text: Am kapeylamlamsoy na so kataotao ko no raraten. Ori o yamaciliman do ikakza no onowned ko. Am ori o yako icyakmey mavaod no raraten.

language1_text: O wretched man that I am! who shall deliver me from the body of this death?
language2_text: Yako tey mazikna so onowned. Sino makasidong jyaken a komaro do raraten kaji ko angayan do kararatan.

language1_text: I thank God through Jesus Christ our Lord. So then with the mind I myself serve the law of God; but with the flesh the law of sin.
language2_text: Ko isaray ji Ama ta do to. Ta yana sidongen yaken ni Yeso Kizisto a Panirsirngen ta. Yako ikakza o yako kownot ji Ama ta do to am o raraten do onowned ko am ori o yasomengseng jyaken.

language1_text: There is therefore now no condemnation to them which are in Christ Jesus, who walk not after the flesh, but after the Spirit.
language2_text: O pacikaopan ni Kizisto a tao sicyaikwaya am ji na rana meydednai no peyoyaoyyan na ni Ama ta do to a mangay no makwa.

language1_text: For the law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus hath made me free from the law of sin and death.
language2_text: Ta o Seyzi am ori o yamapanop jyaten ji Yeso Kizisto. So ta ikanoyong rana yakmey nikowvayan so raraten a kano ji na rana meydednai no peyoyaoyyan na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: For what the law could not do, in that it was weak through the flesh, God sending his own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh, and for sin, condemned sin in the flesh:
language2_text: O iwawalam na ni Moyse am ji na sidong yaten a komaro do peyraratenan ta. Ta cinatao ta o kapeyraraten ta. Am si Ama ta do to am ori o yanisomidong jyaten. Na nitovoy o Anak na a yamacingay so keyteytawan do tao do karawan a yanimawakwak no raraten ta. So ji na rana nalamozongi nyaten no raraten.

language1_text: that the righteousness of the law might be fulfilled in us, who walk not after the flesh, but after the Spirit.
language2_text: O nikakman na sang ni Ama ta do to am na ikarilaw yaten a ji makataptap so iwawalam ni Moyse. Am ori o na nitovoyan so Seyzi a omoyat jyaten a omonot do isaray na ni Ama ta do to a vazay, a ji rana meyraratenan.

language1_text: For they that are after the flesh do mind the things of the flesh; but they that are after the Spirit the things of the Spirit.
language2_text: Ta o to mangozay do malas a onowned a tao am italamozong no onowned na. Omonot do Seyzi a tao am italamozong na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: For to be carnally minded is death; but to be spiritually minded is life and peace.
language2_text: O italamozong no adan na onowned a tao am mangay do kararatan. O italamozong no Seyzi am mahap da o ikapiya no onowned da kano to meyyonong a ikavyay no pahad da.

language1_text: Because the carnal mind is enmity against God: for it is not subject to the law of God, neither indeed can be.
language2_text: O to mangozay do malas a onowned na tao am akma ney kavosoyan si Ama ta do to. Ta ji na ngonoci o iwawalam na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: So then they that are in the flesh cannot please God.
language2_text: O to mangozay do malas a onowned na tao am ji nakzan o akman sang ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: But ye are not in the flesh, but in the Spirit, if so be that the Spirit of God dwell in you. Now if any man have not the Spirit of Christ, he is none of his.
language2_text: No si italamozong na inyo no Seyzi am manoyong o kaji nyo na mangozayan do adan a onowned nyo. Ta o vazay no Seyzi o pangozayan nyo. O kabwan no Seyzi na ni Yeso Kizisto am ji macikaop ji Kizisto.

language1_text: And if Christ be in you, the body is dead because of sin; but the Spirit is life because of righteousness.
language2_text: Am no si myan jinyo si Kizisto am tana mawakwak o kataotao nyo am mavyay o pahad nyo, ta yana rana nivonas o raraten nyo ni Ama ta do to. Am ori o na abnekan jinyo abo rana so raraten do tangain na.

language1_text: But if the Spirit of him that raised up Jesus from the dead dwell in you, he that raised up Christ from the dead shall also quicken your mortal bodies by his Spirit that dwelleth in you.
language2_text: No si myan jinyo o Seyzi na ni Ama ta do to a niomvyay si Yeso Kizisto am akman kamo sang a ipirwa na avyain ni Ama ta do to, do kowyat na jinyo no Seyzi na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: Therefore, brethren, we are debtors, not to the flesh, to live after the flesh.
language2_text: Am ori an, manga kakteh o ji ta to mangozai do adan ta onowned an.

language1_text: For if ye live after the flesh, ye shall die: but if ye through the Spirit do mortify the deeds of the body, ye shall live.
language2_text: Ta no si to nyo mangozai o adan a onowned nyo am jyabo kaji nyo angayan do kararatan a. Am no si onotan nyo o Seyzi a komaro do raraten nyo am jyabo kaji nyo avyayan do teyngato a.

language1_text: For as many as are led by the Spirit of God, they are the sons of God.
language2_text: O ipeypalanginan na no Seyzi a tao am mamimin sira akma ney anak ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: For ye have not received the spirit of bondage again to fear; but ye have received the Spirit of adoption, whereby we cry, Abba, Father.
language2_text: Ta o itoro na ni Ama ta do to a Seyzi am beken a mapeylamlamsoy jinyo a omanyanyahey jinyo, ta peyvaliwen na inyo a akma ney anak ni Ama ta do to. So oyatan na jyaten no Seyzi a tomawag ji Ama ta do to a manci no, "Mo Ama."

language1_text: The Spirit itself beareth witness with our spirit, that we are the children of God:
language2_text: O Seyzi do onowned ta am ori o ipakateneng ta do mina kapeyvaliw na jyaten a akma ney anak ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: and if children, then heirs; heirs of God, and joint-heirs with Christ; if so be that we suffer with him, that we may be also glorified together.
language2_text: No manoyong o kakma tey anak ni Ama ta do to am manoyong keyyan no itoro na jyaten no makwa. So ikakman ta sang a macikasaray do Anak na si Yeso Kizisto. Ta yaten rana am no macyanod ta do alalaw na ni Kizisto am macikazway ta do azwazway na.

language1_text: For I reckon that the sufferings of this present time are not worthy to be compared with the glory which shall be revealed in us.
language2_text: Ko naknakmen o alalaw ta sicyaikwaya am jyabo kapakataha na so yaomanam a azwazway ta no makwa.

language1_text: For the earnest expectation of the creature waiteth for the manifestation of the sons of God.
language2_text: O yamakakaday a na nyamamaog ni Ama ta do to am yada toda ji nalla o araraw no ipeytotwaw no azwazway na do omanoyong jya tao.

language1_text: For the creature was made subject to vanity, not willingly, but by reason of him who hath subjected the same in hope, because the creature itself also shall be delivered from the bondage of corruption into the glorious liberty of the children of God.
language2_text: Ta o yameykamadadayan a nyamamaog na ni Ama ta do to am nimablis o nyamaogan na sira do kanimacizanod da ji Adam a nioyyan na ni Ama ta do to. Am beken a monganay do nyamamaog na o akman sang, ta monganay ji Ama ta do to. Am tana akman sang am amyan so kasa araw a isaliway da no nyamamaog na. So ikanoyong da rana macikasaray do omanoyong ji Ama ta do to a tao a ji rana babalinas. Ta o yameykamadadayan a nyamamaog na ni Ama ta do to am nimablis o nyamaogan na sira do kanimacizanod da ji Adam a nioyyan na ni Ama ta do to. Am beken a monganay do nyamamaog na o akman sang, ta monganay ji Ama ta do to. Am tana akman sang am amyan so kasa araw a isaliway da no nyamamaog na. So ikanoyong da rana macikasaray do omanoyong ji Ama ta do to a tao a ji rana babalinas.

language1_text: For we know that the whole creation groaneth and travaileth in pain together until now.
language2_text: Yata katenngan sicyaikwaya o yamakakaday a yana nyamamaog ni Ama ta do to a yamyan so alalaw, akman so amyan do vahay a mavakes so zikzikna.

language1_text: And not only they, but ourselves also, which have the firstfruits of the Spirit, even we ourselves groan within ourselves, waiting for the adoption, to wit, the redemption of our body.
language2_text: Beken a o nyamamaog na o akman sang. Ta yaten rana ya na yanan no Seyzi a tao a yongkad na no kapanta na nyaten ni Ama ta do to so to meyyonong a ikavyay no pahad ta am akman ta sang do onowned ta a macizizikna jya, a omapanala si Ama ta do to a mapanop jyaten a anak na a manta nyaten so ji rana wakwak a kataotao ta do teyngato.

language1_text: For we are saved by hope: but hope that is seen is not hope: for what a man seeth, why doth he yet hope for?
language2_text: O na patazadangan jyaten ni Ama ta do to am ta toda ji ngamoga a yamahap o yana itoro ni Ama ta do to. Am no to na cita o akman sang am ji mancyan ori a yatoda ji ngamoga a mahap a itoro na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: But if we hope for that we see not, then do we with patience wait for it.
language2_text: Am no ipeyhanhan ta o yaji macimatai am manoyong kaji ta maciziziknan a omnanala sya.

language1_text: Likewise the Spirit also helpeth our infirmities: for we know not what we should pray for as we ought: but the Spirit itself maketh intercession for us with groanings which cannot be uttered.
language2_text: Akman sang, ta no myan so alalaw ta am na sidongen yaten no Seyzi. No ji ta teneng a mapasyasi ji Ama ta do to am na rana to mapasyasyan nyaten no Seyzi no ji ta tenngi a patwawen a ciring.

language1_text: And he that searcheth the hearts knoweth what is the mind of the Spirit, because he maketh intercession for the saints according to the will of God.
language2_text: Si Ama ta do to o yamakateneng do onowned ta. Katenngan na o nakenakem no Seyzi. Ta o Seyzi am na to mangozai o nakenakem na ni Ama ta do to a yameynozi nyaten a yamanoyong a italamozong na tao.

language1_text: And we know that all things work together for good to them that love God, to them who are the called according to his purpose.
language2_text: Tamo katenngan na kasidong ni Ama ta do to so yamraralay nya a tao a nipamnekan na mangozay do nakenakem na a tao. So na ikamimin no vazay da na ipeypalanginan ni Ama ta do to. So ikanoyong da meypapya nya.

language1_text: For whom he did foreknow, he also did predestinate to be conformed to the image of his Son, that he might be the firstborn among many brethren.
language2_text: Ta o nipamnekan na ni Ama ta do to a amraralay nya tao am to na ji ngamoga sira akman so Anak na si Yeso Kizisto apiya so ahahapan sya. So ikanoyong na ni Yeso a akmey rakeh na jyaten akmey meyketeketeh do cinai.

language1_text: Moreover whom he did predestinate, them he also called: and whom he called, them he also justified: and whom he justified, them he also glorified.
language2_text: Ta o tao a nipamnekan na ni Ama ta do to a amraralay nya am nipanop na sira a omanoyong jya, kabnek na sira abo so raraten do tangain na. So ikanoyong da macikazway jya do teyngato no makwa.

language1_text: What shall we then say to these things? If God be for us, who can be against us?
language2_text: No yakman sang am ikongo ipanci ta. No si sidongen na yaten ni Ama ta do to am abo makaharag jyaten.

language1_text: He that spared not his own Son, but delivered him up for us all, how shall he not with him also freely give us all things?
language2_text: Kakwakwan no Anak na yana ji ingbeywani a yana nitoro a mawakwak nyaten. Ney manngo rana o yamakakaday a kakzeben ta no nakem. Ta jyabo o na ingbeywan jyaten a.

language1_text: Who shall lay any thing to the charge of God's elect? It is God that justifieth.
language2_text: Sino o amraherahet jyaten a nipamnekan na ni Ama ta do to. Ta yaten rana am na rana nibnek yaten a abo so raraten do tangain na.

language1_text: Who is he that condemneth? It is Christ that died, yea rather, that is risen again, who is even at the right hand of God, who also maketh intercession for us.
language2_text: Am sino paro o yamanci no kaoya na nyaten ni Ama ta do to no makwa. Jyabo asa ka tao a. Ta si Yeso Kizisto rana nimawakwak a kapirwa na mavyay am yamyan rana do wanan na ni Ama ta do to a yameyneynozi nyaten.

language1_text: Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? shall tribulation, or distress, or persecution, or famine, or nakedness, or peril, or sword?
language2_text: Ikongo o makapasyay jyaten do pangangarilawan ni Yeso Kizisto. Manngwa, alalaw ta? Manngwa, peyrarehtan da jyaten? Manngwa, kakcinan ta? Manngwa, kabo no peymeymasaodan ta? Manngwa, kangineynanawan ta? Manngwa, wakwakan da jyaten? Jyabo a. Ta yabo o makapasyay jyaten do pangangarilawan ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: As it is written, For thy sake we are killed all the day long; We are accounted as sheep for the slaughter.
language2_text: O aro a alalaw ta am akman so yadomket do Seysyo. Ta maniring am, "Anoyngan namen imo. Am ori o yanamen ipangday so araraw a yatoda jyangay so inawan. Yada yamen patpehen no tao do kagling a yaomanam a yada wakwaken."

language1_text: Nay, in all these things we are more than conquerors through him that loved us.
language2_text: Am cyaha, ta no si ipeyhanhan ta si Yeso Kizisto a yamarilaw nyaten am jyabo kaji ta makaharagan so yamakakaday a alalaw ta a.

language1_text: For I am persuaded, that neither death, nor life, nor angels, nor principalities, nor powers, nor things present, nor things to come, nor height, nor depth, nor any other creature, shall be able to separate us from the love of God, which is in Christ Jesus our Lord.
language2_text: Ta yako anoyngan o kabo no makapasyay jyaten do pangangarilawan ni Ama ta do to. Tana mavyay ta, tana mawakwak ta am to meyyonong o karilawan na nyaten ni Ama ta do to. Tana tinsi a tana kalamsoyan ni Satan am abo o makapasyay jyaten ji Ama ta do to a marilaw nyaten. So ikabo no oyowyat do sinokob no hanit a makapasyay jyaten do aryarilaw na jyaten ni Ama ta do to. Tana sicyaikwaya, tana no makwa am abo do karawan o amyan so oyowyat a mapasyay jyaten do pangangarilawan na ni Ama ta do to a yarana macikaop ji Yeso Kizisto a Panirsirngen ta.Ta yako anoyngan o kabo no makapasyay jyaten do pangangarilawan ni Ama ta do to. Tana mavyay ta, tana mawakwak ta am to meyyonong o karilawan na nyaten ni Ama ta do to. Tana tinsi a tana kalamsoyan ni Satan am abo o makapasyay jyaten ji Ama ta do to a marilaw nyaten. So ikabo no oyowyat do sinokob no hanit a makapasyay jyaten do aryarilaw na jyaten ni Ama ta do to. Tana sicyaikwaya, tana no makwa am abo do karawan o amyan so oyowyat a mapasyay jyaten do pangangarilawan na ni Ama ta do to a yarana macikaop ji Yeso Kizisto a Panirsirngen ta.

language1_text: Brethren, my heart's desire and prayer to God for Israel is, that they might be saved.
language2_text: Manga kakteh, ko tey kakza sira o Isedi a tao a kasina ko no inawan a ahapen na ni Ama ta do to. Am ori o ko jimtaji nira a ipeynozi ji Ama ta do to.

language1_text: For I bear them record that they have a zeal of God, but not according to knowledge.
language2_text: To ko na macitangain jinyo am yamanoyong da kakdeng no nakem ji Ama ta do to. Am yaji macimangno o da katenngan.

language1_text: For they being ignorant of God's righteousness, and going about to establish their own righteousness, have not submitted themselves unto the righteousness of God.
language2_text: Da to mangozangozai o nakenakem da a mahap so iwawalam na ni Moyse a yaji meyhanhan ni Ama ta do to a yamvonas so raraten a manci nira abo rana so raraten do tangain na.

language1_text: For Christ is the end of the law for righteousness to every one that believeth.
language2_text: O na nyai ni Kizisto do karawan am ipanci na o kabo no oyowyat no iwawalam na ni Moyse a amvonas so raraten no tao. Ta si Ama ta do to o makavonas so raraten ta tao. So ikanoyong no meyhanhan rana nya tao a abneken na ni Ama ta do to a abo rana so raraten do tangain na.

language1_text: For Moses describeth the righteousness which is of the law, That the man which doeth those things shall live by them.
language2_text: O nipanci ni Moyse am o tao a makataptap sya ahapen so nivatvatkan na a iwawalam am ori o abneken na ni Ama ta do to a abo so raraten do tangain na.

language1_text: But the righteousness which is of faith speaketh on this wise, Say not in thine heart, Who shall ascend into heaven? (that is, to bring Christ down from above:)
language2_text: Am o meyhanhan ni Yeso a tao o vonasen na ni Ama ta do to so raraten a abneken na abo so raraten do tangain na. Ta maniring do Seysyo am, "Ji mo mancyan o, 'Sino mangay do teyngato a mapeyhekas si Kizisto.'"

language1_text: or, Who shall descend into the deep? (that is, to bring up Christ again from the dead.)
language2_text: "Ji mo mancyan o, 'Sino mangay a mapeyvangon si Kizisto do heseb na.'"

language1_text: But what saith it? The word is nigh thee, even in thy mouth, and in thy heart: that is, the word of faith, which we preach;
language2_text: Ta maniring do Seysyo am, "Jyabo kasalit no ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to a katenngan nyo a. Ta o ciriciring na am nyo masangib a yamalavat. O ciriciring na am yamyan do onowned nyo."

language1_text: that if thou shalt confess with thy mouth the Lord Jesus, and shalt believe in thine heart that God hath raised him from the dead, thou shalt be saved.
language2_text: No si to mo na mancyan kanoyong mo ji Yeso Kizisto a Panirsirngen mo a kanoyong mo jya a nipirwa na avyain ni Ama ta do to am ahapen na imo ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: For with the heart man believeth unto righteousness; and with the mouth confession is made unto salvation.
language2_text: Ta no anoyngan ta si Yeso am abneken na yaten ni Ama ta do to a abo so raraten do tangain na. Akman sang, ta no to ta na patwawa do tao o kanoyong ta ji Kizisto am manoyong o kahap na rana jyaten ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: For the scripture saith, Whosoever believeth on him shall not be ashamed.
language2_text: Maniring do Seysyo am, "Omanoyong jya tao am amyan so nakem na jira ni Ama ta do to."

language1_text: For there is no difference between the Jew and the Greek: for the same Lord over all is rich unto all that call upon him.
language2_text: O peycirngan na so sang am kazagoman ta tao a meyhanhan nya. So ikabo rana no tao do Yotay a kano beken a tao do Yotay, ta si Ama ta do to rana am Panirsirngen ta tao do karawan. So ikanoyong na manta no mapasyasi jya tao so kakzeben da no nakem.

language1_text: For whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved.
language2_text: Akman so ciring do Seysyo. Maniring am, "O tomawag jya tao am patazadangen na sira."

language1_text: How then shall they call on him in whom they have not believed? and how shall they believe in him of whom they have not heard? and how shall they hear without a preacher?
language2_text: Am no ji da nganoyngi am makongo sira tomawag jya. No ji da pa nimamizing o ciriciring na am makongo sira omanoyong jya. No jya nimeylimwang o ciriciring na am makongo so wanjin o tao a makamizing sya.

language1_text: And how shall they preach, except they be sent? as it is written, How beautiful are the feet of them that preach the gospel of peace, and bring glad tidings of good things!
language2_text: No abo nitovoy na a tao am makongo so wanjin a meylimwang o ciriciring na. Ta maniring do Seysyo am, "Yatey yapya o da kapakaranes a yameylimwang no Mapasaray a Ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to."

language1_text: But they have not all obeyed the gospel. For Esaias saith, Lord, who hath believed our report?
language2_text: Am beken a todamimin o tao a omanoyong do Mapasaray a Ciriciring na. Maniring si Isayya am, "Mo Panirsirngen, sino omanoyong do yanamen ipeylimwang a ciriciring mo."

language1_text: So then faith cometh by hearing, and hearing by the word of God.
language2_text: So ikanoyong no kayapo na do kapakamizing so ciriciring na ni Kizisto o peyhanhanan ta nya.

language1_text: But I say, Have they not heard? Yes verily, Their sound went into all the earth, And their words unto the ends of the world.
language2_text: Am o ko ipanci am manoyong o kaji da nimakamizngan sya no tao do Yotay so ciriciring na ni Kizisto? Jyabo da kajya nimakamizngan sya. Ta maniring do Seysyo am, "O ciriciring na am yada rana nipeylimwang do aro a tao do karawan. Yakman sang, ta yarana nimeylimwang do peycyamahamahatawan na."

language1_text: But I say, Did not Israel know? First Moses saith, I will provoke you to jealousy by them that are no people, And by a foolish nation I will anger you.
language2_text: To ko na macitangain jinyo am manngwa, yada jyatenngi no Isedi a tao o kamimin na so tao ahapen ni Ama ta do to? Akman rana sang am nipanci na rana ni Moyse a ciring na ni Ama ta do to. Maniring am, "Ikarilaw ko sira o beken a tao do Yotay a keynanahet nyo nira a tao do Yotay."

language1_text: But Esaias is very bold, and saith, I was found of them that sought me not; I was made manifest unto them that asked not after me.
language2_text: Nipakoyokoy na pa ni Isayya a ciring am, "Makala da rana yaken no ji ngala jyaken a tao. Mapacita ko do yaji ngala jyaken a tao."

language1_text: But to Israel he saith, All day long I have stretched forth my hands unto a disobedient and gainsaying people.
language2_text: Am maniring pa si Ama ta do to do Isedi a tao a nipanci na ni Isayya am, "Ko jimtadan sira tawagan am yada ji ngamiznga o ciring ko."

language1_text: I say then, Hath God cast away his people? God forbid. For I also am an Israelite, of the seed of Abraham, of the tribe of Benjamin.
language2_text: To ko na macitangain jinyo am manngwa, nitaosya na sira ni Ama ta do to o nipamnekan na tao? Jyabo a. Ta yaken rana am Isedi a tao ko a sivovoong na ni Apolahan a macitetngehan ji Penyaming.

language1_text: God hath not cast away his people which he foreknew. Wot ye not what the scripture saith of Elias? how he maketh intercession to God against Israel, saying,
language2_text: Na jya nitaosya ni Ama ta do to o nipamnekan na pa tao no kakwa. Nyo jyatenngi o ciring do Seysyo? No karaherahet na so Isedi a tao ni Idiya do tangain na ni Ama ta do to am,

language1_text: Lord, they have killed thy prophets, and digged down thine altars; and I am left alone, and they seek my life.
language2_text: maniring am, "Mo Panirsirngen, niwakwak da o panoyonoywan mo so ciring a tao a da kasokasokab so patatanangan so nakem da jimo. So yako ikasa ka tao rana. Am da pa naknakmen yaken a yawakwaken."

language1_text: But what saith the answer of God unto him? I have reserved to myself seven thousand men, who have not bowed the knee to the image of Baal.
language2_text: Tovisan na ni Ama ta do to am, "Yapito a ranaw (7000) pa sira o yako nivezed a omanoyong jyaken. Sira rana am ji sira pa nimanaralay so malas a iraralay da a ngaranan da Paar."

language1_text: Even so then at this present time also there is a remnant according to the election of grace. And if by grace, then is it no more of works: otherwise grace is no more grace. But if it be of works, then is it no more grace: otherwise work is no more work.
language2_text: Yakman sang sicyaikwaya do Isedi a tao. Ta yana nipamnekan ni Ama ta do to sira o yapereh a tao. Na pangozayan o pangangasyan na a yamamnek do tao. So ikabeken a apya icicirawat da no yana pangozayan. No si manoyong o kapangozay na do apya icicirawat no tao am malas o pangangasyan na.Yakman sang sicyaikwaya do Isedi a tao. Ta yana nipamnekan ni Ama ta do to sira o yapereh a tao. Na pangozayan o pangangasyan na a yamamnek do tao. So ikabeken a apya icicirawat da no yana pangozayan. No si manoyong o kapangozay na do apya icicirawat no tao am malas o pangangasyan na.

language1_text: What then? Israel hath not obtained that which he seeketh for; but the election hath obtained it, and the rest were blinded
language2_text: Am ori o ji da makahapi sya no Isedi a tao so kakzeben da no nakem. Ta o nipamnekan na ni Ama ta do to am ori o nivonas na so raraten a kabnek na sira abo so raraten do tangain na, ta nipeyhanhan da si Yeso Kizisto. Am o karwan no tao am to da nazibwan o pangangasyan na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: (according as it is written, God hath given them the spirit of slumber, eyes that they should not see, and ears that they should not hear;) unto this day.
language2_text: Akman so ciring na do Seysyo. Maniring am, "To na macyocyozai rana sira ni Ama ta do to a ji mamlis so onowned a mangay sicyaikwaya. So yada icyakmey mavota, yakmey mateleh."

language1_text: And David saith, Let their table be made a snare, and a trap, And a stumblingblock, and a recompence unto them:
language2_text: O mina ciring na pa ni Tawey am, "Inaoy no si ipeyparahet da o yada pamarmarngan so kanen. Inaoy no si meydedna jira o oyaoya na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: Let their eyes be darkened, that they may not see, And bow down their back alway.
language2_text: Inaoy no si masari o citahen da kaji da rana makacittan, kaji da rana makatankan a alpiden no alalaw da a mangay no makwa."

language1_text: I say then, Have they stumbled that they should fall? God forbid: but rather through their fall salvation is come unto the Gentiles, for to provoke them to jealousy.
language2_text: Am o yako ipacici jinyo am manngwa, to sira na nakeb o tao do Yotay a ji na ngapa rana ni Ama ta do to? Jyabo kakman na sang a. Ta sicyaikwaya am na avyain o beken a tao do Yotay. So kaoyyan da nira ikeynanahet no tao do Yotay a kablis da rana so onowned da a omanoyong rana ji Ama ta do to.

language1_text: Now if the fall of them be the riches of the world, and the diminishing of them the riches of the Gentiles; how much more their fulness?
language2_text: Yada nipeypapya no tao do karawan o da kajya niomanoyngan ji Ama ta do to no tao do Yotay. Am no si mamlis rana sira o tao do Yotay a kavyay na sira ni Ama ta do to am jyabo kaji na rakorakwan pa no peypapyan na so tao do karawan a.

language1_text: For I speak to you Gentiles, inasmuch as I am the apostle of the Gentiles, I magnify mine office:
language2_text: Yako pacisirsirngan inyo a beken a tao do Yotay. Yako tey masaray a nipamnekan ni Yeso Kizisto a omlivolivon no Mapasaray a Ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to jinyo a beken a tao do Yotay.

language1_text: if by any means I may provoke to emulation them which are my flesh, and might save some of them.
language2_text: Ala ikeynanahet da yaken no tao do Yotay a kasina ko no inawan. Am cyaha, ta ipakasidong na so karwan da a kaji na meydednan jira no peyoyaoyyan na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: For if the casting away of them be the reconciling of the world, what shall the receiving of them be, but life from the dead?
language2_text: Ta peymakarwan na sira o tao do Yotay a kahap na so beken a tao do Yotay. Am si ahapen na sira o tao do Yotay am jyabo kaji da narayan a makahap rana so to meyyonong a ikavyay no pahad da.

language1_text: For if the firstfruit be holy, the lump is also holy: and if the root be holy, so are the branches.
language2_text: Ta nipamnekan na si Apolahan ni Ama ta do to. So ikakman da sang no sivosivovoong na nipamnekan na ni Ama ta do to. Akman so kayo. Ta no mavyay o yamot na am mavyay o kayo na kano yangayangaw na.
