language2_text: Am yajyakman sang an. Ta yamanoyong si Kizisto a yanimirwa a mavyay. Ori rana am yongkad no kanoyong da mirwa a mavyay no yarana nimawakwak a yamraralay nya a tao.

language1_text: For since by man came death, by man came also the resurrection of the dead.
language2_text: Si Adam o yapwan no kawakwak no tao. Akman sang, ta si Yeso Kizisto o yapwan no keypirwa a mavyay no tao.

language1_text: For as in Adam all die, even so in Christ shall all be made alive.
language2_text: Akman sang an. Ta o da ikawakwak no tao am sira pa macirapa so inawan ji Adam. O ipeyvangon da no amraralay ni Yeso a tao am macikownongan rana sira ji Kizisto.

language1_text: But every man in his own order: Christ the firstfruits; afterward they that are Christ's at his coming.
language2_text: Am matwatonton o tao a mirwa a mavyay. Ney manma am si Kizisto. O tomonton am amraralay nya tao, no si marateng o araraw no yai na ni Kizisto,

language1_text: Then cometh the end, when he shall have delivered up the kingdom to God, even the Father; when he shall have put down all rule and all authority and power.
language2_text: a kapakaranes na rana no pangavosan no karawan. No si marateng o araraw no nang am balinasen na ni Kizisto o oyowyat no jyacita a kalamsoyan na ni Satan a kavosoyan na ni Ama ta do to a katoro na rana ni Yeso no karawan ji Ama ta do to a italamozong na.

language1_text: For he must reign, till he hath put all enemies under his feet.
language2_text: Tana abo pa o akman sang a vazay am jyablis si Yeso Kizisto a Panirsirngen do yanam na pa ni Ama ta do to ambalinas so kavosoyan na.

language1_text: The last enemy that shall be destroyed is death.
language2_text: O ney manowji na balinasen ni Ama ta do to am kawakwakan no tao. So ikabo rana no mawakwak a tao.

language1_text: For he hath put all things under his feet. But when he saith all things are put under him, it is manifest that he is excepted, which did put all things under him.
language2_text: Ta maniring do Seysyo am, "Nipamnekan na ni Ama ta do to a meymatmatngeh no karawan." O karawan a na malavat do jya am ji macyangay dang si Ama ta do to. Ta iya o nitomoro nya ji Kizisto so oyowyat na a tomalamozong no karawan.

language1_text: And when all things shall be subdued unto him, then shall the Son also himself be subject unto him that put all things under him, that God may be all in all.
language2_text: Am no si marateng rana o araraw no ikakata na ni Kizisto am miminen na o karawan a italamozong. Am ji na meysopoi o oyowyat na ni Ama ta do to. So ikanoyong na rana mazway a meymatmatngeh no karawan ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: Else what shall they do which are baptized for the dead, if the dead rise not at all? why are they then baptized for the dead?
language2_text: No ji mirwa a mavyay o tao am ikongo peypeypangayan no icicirawat nyo a tomaktak do mavyay a tao a izagom nyo so nimawakwak a tao.

language1_text: And why stand we in jeopardy every hour?
language2_text: Ikongo namen to nomoki sya no kalalavitan no inawan namen.

language1_text: I protest by your rejoicing which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord, I die daily.
language2_text: Manga kakteh, ko mangday so araraw a yatoda jyangangay so inawan. Yamanoyong ori o ciring ko jinyo an. Ta yako tey saray nyo kapacikaop rana ji Yeso Kizisto a Panirsirngen ta.

language1_text: If after the manner of men I have fought with beasts at Ephesus, what advantageth it me, if the dead rise not? let us eat and drink; for to morrow we die.
language2_text: Akman so mina alalaw ko do Ivoso. Ta mina akma koy to maciliman do masozi a kokoman so tao do peyrehrehtan da jyaken no tao. No ji mirwa a mavyay o nimawakwak a tao am tana to tamo rana mamaring so kanen do araraw am ibnek so kaji ta limanan do kadadayan na so araraw.

language1_text: Be not deceived: evil communications corrupt good manners.
language2_text: Ji kamo todakakey a kalittan. No macikagagan ka do somagpyan a tao am mangay kapasagpyan na jimo so icicirawat.

language1_text: Awake to righteousness, and sin not; for some have not the knowledge of God: I speak this to your shame.
language2_text: Paolin nyo o nakenakem nyo do kapyapyan. Paseykeden nyo na o kapeyraraten nyo. Yatatasa jinyo a yana ji makateneng ji Ama ta do to. O ko peycirngan sya am kapakateneng nyo do kanigan nyo.

language1_text: But some man will say, How are the dead raised up? and with what body do they come?
language2_text: No maniring o tao am, "Sino ipanci o kato mirwan a mavyay no tao. Akman so wanjin o kamamagenan da nira ang."

language1_text: Thou fool, that which thou sowest is not quickened, except it die:
language2_text: Oyod nyo a kasagpyan a tao. No jyawakwak o nipamowa mo a vettow no kayo am jyabo kalida na.

language1_text: and that which thou sowest, thou sowest not that body that shall be, but bare grain, it may chance of wheat, or of some other grain:
language2_text: Abo mapamowa so meyvoovoong rana mowamowa, ta o vettow na o pamowahen, akman so avyas no kadai.

language1_text: but God giveth it a body as it hath pleased him, and to every seed his own body.
language2_text: Na to mangozai ni Ama ta do to o nakenakem na do na mamaogan so vettow. Akman sang an. Ta to macilolo o mahap mo do nipamowa mo a vettow.

language1_text: All flesh is not the same flesh: but there is one kind of flesh of men, another flesh of beasts, another of fishes, and another of birds.
language2_text: Yakman sang o kataotao no nyamamaog na ni Ama ta do to, ta yameykataretarek. O tao am tao so kamamagenan. Omalalam am omalalam so kamamagenan. Meyyasasalap am meyyasasalap so kamamagenan. Among am among so kamamagenan.

language1_text: There are also celestial bodies, and bodies terrestrial: but the glory of the celestial is one, and the glory of the terrestrial is another.
language2_text: Yakman sang o masaod no hanit. Ta o kapyapya no masaod no hanit am yaji meyyangay a kano masaod no teyrahem so kapyapya.

language1_text: There is one glory of the sun, and another glory of the moon, and another glory of the stars: for one star differeth from another star in glory.
language2_text: Araw am yamyan so na ipaniniray. O vehan am yamyan so na ipaniniray. Akman sang o mata no hanit a matarek so ipaniniray. So da ipeykataretarek no kazngazngang no mata no hanit.

language1_text: So also is the resurrection of the dead. It is sown in corruption; it is raised in incorruption:
language2_text: Akman so sang, ta meytarek o kataotao ta do teyngato a kado teyrahem. Ta no si mirwa ta mavyay am vayo rana o kataotao ta a ji rana wakwak.

language1_text: it is sown in dishonour; it is raised in glory: it is sown in weakness; it is raised in power:
language2_text: O nibobo rana tao am abo o oyowyat na. Am no mirwa ta mavyay am tey mazway ta na.

language1_text: it is sown a natural body; it is raised a spiritual body. There is a natural body, and there is a spiritual body.
language2_text: O kataotao ta am ori o ibobo. Am o mirwa a mavyay a kataotao am vayo rana ori a mavyay do teyngato. No manoyong keyyan no kataotao ta do karawan am manoyong keyyan no kataotao ta do teyngato.

language1_text: And so it is written, The first man Adam was made a living soul; the last Adam was made a quickening spirit.
language2_text: Ta maniring do Seysyo am, "Si Adam am tao kamamaogan na." Am o ipanci a manowji a Adam am si Kizisto a manta nyaten so to meyyonong a ikavyay no pahad ta.

language1_text: Howbeit that was not first which is spiritual, but that which is natural; and afterward that which is spiritual.
language2_text: Manmanma o kataotao ta do karawan a keyyan na rana no monganay do teyngato a kataotao ta.

language1_text: The first man is of the earth, earthy: the second man is the Lord from heaven.
language2_text: O ney manma na tao a si Adam am nyamaog na ni Ama ta do to no tana. O manowji a Adam am si Kizisto. Iya rana am nimapo do teyngato.

language1_text: As is the earthy, such are they also that are earthy: and as is the heavenly, such are they also that are heavenly.
language2_text: O tao do teyrahem am akman sira si Adam so kataotao a nimapo do tana. O tao do teyngato am akman sira si Yeso so kataotao.

language1_text: And as we have borne the image of the earthy, we shall also bear the image of the heavenly.
language2_text: So na iyan rana jyaten no kataotao ta do karawan. Am no makwa am amyan rana so kamamagen ta a kataotao ta do teyngato akman so kataotao na ni Yeso.

language1_text: Now this I say, brethren, that flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God; neither doth corruption inherit incorruption.
language2_text: Manga kakteh, o ko ipanci am o kataotao ta sicyaikwaya am ji macikaop do italamozong na ni Ama ta do to no makwa, ta mawakwak o kataotao ta do teyrahem eya.

language1_text: Behold, I shew you a mystery; We shall not all sleep, but we shall all be changed,
language2_text: Amizngen nyo o mapeyzokab a nanao a jya nipatwaw pa no kakwa a nipanci na jyaken ni Ama ta do to. Beken a to ta mimin a mawakwak. Am mamimin ta mablis so kataotao.

language1_text: in a moment, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trump: for the trumpet shall sound, and the dead shall be raised incorruptible, and we shall be changed.
language2_text: Am makeykai ori, akmey peyrektan no mata. No si mamizing no tao o ney manowji rana ipatao jyaten a zapa am makaranes rana o akman sang a vazay a kapeyoli da mavyay no mawakwak a tao a kaji da rana wakwakan. So icyakman ta sang a mablis so kataotao.

language1_text: For this corruptible must put on incorruption, and this mortal must put on immortality.
language2_text: Ta o kataotao ta na do karawan am mablis rana a kaji na rana wakwakan.

language1_text: So when this corruptible shall have put on incorruption, and this mortal shall have put on immortality, then shall be brought to pass the saying that is written, Death is swallowed up in victory.
language2_text: No mateyka rana ori am ori o ipangononong na rana no ciring do Seysyo. Ta maniring am, "Na rana nibalinas o kawakwak no tao. So ikabo na rana no tao a mawakwak."

language1_text: O death, where is thy sting? O grave, where is thy victory?
language2_text: "So ikabo rana no kanyaheyan ta no kawakwak ta. So ikabo rana no mazabab so onowned a tao."

language1_text: The sting of death is sin; and the strength of sin is the law.
language2_text: O kanyaheyan da no kawakwak da no tao am ikanyahey da o kaoya na nira ni Ama ta do to do kapeyraraten da. O ipeyraraten da am ji da ngapa o iwawalam na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: But thanks be to God, which giveth us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.
language2_text: Am ta isaray ji Ama ta do to. Ta si Yeso Kizisto a Panirsirngen ta o yarana nimapakavos so vazay na. So ta na jyanyahei a mawakwak, ta yana rana niovayan yaten do raraten ta.

language1_text: Therefore, my beloved brethren, be ye stedfast, unmoveable, always abounding in the work of the Lord, forasmuch as ye know that your labour is not in vain in the Lord.
language2_text: Am ori an, manga keypong an, makakdeng kamo so nakenakem ji Yeso Kizisto a Panirsirngen ta. Makowyat kamo a mapeyvazay so vazay na. Cyaha, ta nyo katenngan o kaji na liklikan so mapeyvazay so vazay na tao.

language1_text: Now concerning the collection for the saints, as I have given order to the churches of Galatia, even so do ye.
language2_text: O peysinsinmowen rana isidong so sinjya do Yelosaleng am to nyo manginarai o mina ciring ko so peycyakyokyokayan na do Cyalatay.

language1_text: Upon the first day of the week let every one of you lay by him in store, as God hath prospered him, that there be no gatherings when I come.
language2_text: Mangday ka niciyo na o kamimin nyo a mapasina do nizpi nyo a nimahap nyo a kakpeh nyo sya. Am to nyo palolwa do karwaro no nimahap nyo a nizpi o pasinahen nyo. Ji nyo nanala yaken, ta to nyo ngonongonongi o kapeysinsinmo nyo sya.

language1_text: And when I come, whomsoever ye shall approve by your letters, them will I send to bring your liberality unto Jerusalem.
language2_text: No si makaranes ko na am manovoy ko so ipeyhanhan nyo a tao a maciralay do teygami a kano nipeysinsinmo nyo a nizpi a yangay da do Yelosaleng.

language1_text: And if it be meet that I go also, they shall go with me.
language2_text: Am no si paciralayan ko nizpi am to sira na macihza jyaken a mangay.

language1_text: Now I will come unto you, when I shall pass through Macedonia: for I do pass through Macedonia.
language2_text: Yaken rana am ko meyliktaw do Maciton. Si mateyka ko a itazogaw o aro a kyokay do Maciton am mangay ko jinyo.

language1_text: And it may be that I will abide, yea, and winter with you, that ye may bring me on my journey whithersoever I go.
language2_text: Ala miseysan ko jinyo do dang so makanateng a araw. Ala si mavitos rana o amyan am ori o yangay ko rana mangilili a sidongen nyo pa yaken a meypangay do angayan ko.

language1_text: For I will not see you now by the way; but I trust to tarry a while with you, if the Lord permit.
language2_text: Ta no si apyahen na ni Ama ta do to am ko ikakza o kownay ko pa a macikaop jinyo do dang.

language1_text: But I will tarry at Ephesus until Pentecost.
language2_text: Am to ko pa vezed do Ivoso eya mangay do araraw no ipamarimaring ta so kanen a somaray no nihakawan ta.

language1_text: For a great door and effectual is opened unto me, and there are many adversaries.
language2_text: Tana yaro yamrahet jyaken a yameylimwang no ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to am ko ji macimazai. Ta yatey yaro o makza no ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: Now if Timotheus come, see that he may be with you without fear: for he worketh the work of the Lord, as I also do.
language2_text: No si mangay si Timotay jinyo dang am taotawwen nyo an, a kapiya na no onowned na an. Ta yanamen meyyangay a yamahap so vazay na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: Let no man therefore despise him: but conduct him forth in peace, that he may come unto me: for I look for him with the brethren.
language2_text: Ji nyo ngolala. Ta sidongen nyo a meypangay jyaken do jya. Ta yako nanalahen si Timotay a kano kakehza na a mai jyaken do jya.

language1_text: As touching our brother Apollos, I greatly desired him to come unto you with the brethren: but his will was not at all to come at this time; but he will come when he shall have convenient time.
language2_text: O kakteh ta si Apolo am ko masangib a ipanci jya o kakekehza da sira kakteh ta mangay tomazogaw ninyo. Am na sapasapan pa. Cyaha, ta amyan so kasaraw a yangay na jinyo.

language1_text: Watch ye, stand fast in the faith, quit you like men, be strong.
language2_text: Meytataziman kamo an. Makahadpet kamo so nakenakem a omraralay ni Ama ta do to. Ji kamo a nyahey.

language1_text: Let all your things be done with charity.
language2_text: Pangozayan nyo o pangangarilawan na do makakaday a vazay nyo.

language1_text: I beseech you, brethren, (ye know the house of Stephanas, that it is the firstfruits of Achaia, and that they have addicted themselves to the ministry of the saints, )
language2_text: Nyo katenngan sira Setiva yasa ka vahay, ta sira rana yasa ka vahay do Sila am ney manma sira niomanoyong ji Yeso a tao a tey mowyat a somidong so sinjya.

language1_text: that ye submit yourselves unto such, and to every one that helpeth with us, and laboureth.
language2_text: Am ori o amizngen nyo so akman sang a tao a kano kararay da mahap so vazay na ni Ama ta do to. Amizngen nyo o yokodan da ninyo.

language1_text: I am glad of the coming of Stephanas and Fortunatus and Achaicus: for that which was lacking on your part they have supplied.
language2_text: Ko masaray do da kanimai da Setiva kani Votonato a kani Akayko. Yakmey kataotao nyo sira do nyo ikabo do jya.

language1_text: For they have refreshed my spirit and your's: therefore acknowledge ye them that are such.
language2_text: Tana yaken a tana inyo am tamo meyyangay a yasomaray nira. O akman rana sira ya am ikanig nyo sira ya an.

language1_text: The churches of Asia salute you. Aquila and Priscilla salute you much in the Lord, with the church that is in their house.
language2_text: Da ipeyminaminasi inyo no peycyakyokyokayan na do Yasiya. Tana si Akwila kani Paycila kano aro a sinjya a meyneynozi do vahay da am yakman sang sira yameyminaminasi ninyo do tamo kakmey yasa yamraralay ni Yeso.

language1_text: All the brethren greet you. Greet ye one another with an holy kiss.
language2_text: Sira mamimin o kakteh ta do jya yameyminaminasi ninyo. Inyo rana am masicyakarilaw kamo a meyminaminasi no kadwan jinyo.

language1_text: The salutation of me Paul with mine own hand.
language2_text: Yaken rana am si Pawlo ko a yamapadket so aryarilaw ko jinyo do vakong eya. Makapya kamo an.

language1_text: If any man love not the Lord Jesus Christ, let him be Anathema Maran-atha.
language2_text: No myan so ji raralay ni Yeso Kizisto a tao am manoyong kapeygegcin na jya no oyaoya na ni Ama ta do to. Mo Yeso Kizisto, inaoy si mai ka na.

language1_text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
language2_text: Inaoy si itoro na ni Yeso a Panirsirngen ta o pangangarilawan na jinyo.

language1_text: My love be with you all in Christ Jesus. Amen. The first epistle to the Corinthians was written from Philippi by Stephanas, and Fortunatus, and Achaicus, and Timotheus.
language2_text: Ko ikarilaw inyo, ta kamo macikaop ji Yeso Kizisto.

language1_text: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Timothy our brother, unto the church of God which is at Corinth, with all the saints which are in all Achaia:
language2_text: Yaken rana am si Pawlo ko a lamlamsoy na ni Ama ta do to a yana nipamnekan ni Yeso Kizisto a amlivolivon no ciriciring na. Yaken rana kano akma tey kakteh do cinai si Timotay am namen ipeyteygami inyo a Kedinto kyokay a kazagoman nyo a sinjya do Sila.

language1_text: grace be to you and peace from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
language2_text: Inaoy si itoro na ni Ama ta do to a kani Yeso Kizisto a Panirsirngen ta o pangangarilawan na kano ikapiya no onowned nyo.

language1_text: Blessed be God, even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies, and the God of all comfort;
language2_text: Isaray tamo ji Ama na ni Yeso Kizisto a Panirsirngen ta. Ta iya rana am yamanoyong a yamarilaw nyaten a yana yapwan no makakaday a mapasaray so tao.

language1_text: who comforteth us in all our tribulation, that we may be able to comfort them which are in any trouble, by the comfort wherewith we ourselves are comforted of God.
language2_text: Na sidongen yamen do aro a alalaw namen. So ikanoyong namen a mangozay do pangangarilawan na a marilaw no makasazi so makakaday a alalaw da tao.

language1_text: For as the sufferings of Christ abound in us, so our consolation also aboundeth by Christ.
language2_text: Tana arako alalaw a mai jyamen do kahap namen so vazay ni Kizisto am cyaha, ta ikarakorako no sidongan na jyamen ni Kizisto.

language1_text: And whether we be afflicted, it is for your consolation and salvation, which is effectual in the enduring of the same sufferings which we also suffer: or whether we be comforted, it is for your consolation and salvation.
language2_text: No makasazi namen so alalaw am cyaha, ta ipeypapya nyo. Ta no sidongen na yamen ni Ama ta do to am akman namen sang a somidong jinyo a mapait jinyo, kapeypakdeng nyo rana so nakenakem a akman jyamen a to nazibo no alalaw.

language1_text: And our hope of you is stedfast, knowing, that as ye are partakers of the sufferings, so shall ye be also of the consolation.
language2_text: Am ori o namen peyhanhanan ninyo a jyagogad so onowned. Ta namen katenngan inyo a yamacizanod jyamen so alalaw. So icyakman nyo sang a macizanod do sarasaray a itoro na jyaten ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: For we would not, brethren, have you ignorant of our trouble which came to us in Asia, that we were pressed out of measure, above strength, insomuch that we despaired even of life:
language2_text: Manga kakteh, ko kakzeben inyo a makateneng do alalaw namen no keyyan namen pa do Yasiya pongso. Ta teywara o mina alalaw namen. Ori o ji namen ngatatai do kavyay namen.

language1_text: but we had the sentence of death in ourselves, that we should not trust in ourselves, but in God which raiseth the dead:
language2_text: O nakenakem namen rana do onowned namen am to namen anoyngi o kawakwak namen. O peypeypangayan no nang am ipakateneng namen do kaji namen meyhanhanan no kataotao namen. Ta si Ama ta do to o ipeyhanhan namen a mamyay so nimawakwak a tao.

language1_text: who delivered us from so great a death, and doth deliver: in whom we trust that he will yet deliver us;
language2_text: Na nipahawa yamen do yamakakaday a kanginanawan namen. So namen peyhanhanan ni Ama ta do to a somidong jyamen a mangay no makwa.

language1_text: ye also helping together by prayer for us, that for the gift bestowed upon us by the means of many persons thanks may be given by many on our behalf.
language2_text: No si ipeynozi nyo yamen am jyabo kaji na nidongan jyamen ni Ama ta do to, do kamizing na so inozi nyo jyamen. So sarayan da no akman sang ji Ama ta do to no aro a tao.

language1_text: For our rejoicing is this, the testimony of our conscience, that in simplicity and godly sincerity, not with fleshly wisdom, but by the grace of God, we have had our conversation in the world, and more abundantly to you-ward.
language2_text: Namen isaray o na kapeypalanginan no nakenakem namen ni Ama ta do to do karawan. Am beken a teneteneng namen ori, ta namen pangozayan o teneteneng na kano pangangasyan ni Ama ta do to. Akman sang o na katey yapya no nakenakem ta so kadwan jyaten.

language1_text: For we write none other things unto you, than what ye read or acknowledge; and I trust ye shall acknowledge even to the end;
language2_text: Ta o namen nivatvatkan a ciring jinyo am o yanyo katenngan a vilangan. So namen kakzan ninyo a makateneng do vazay namen,

language1_text: as also ye have acknowledged us in part, that we are your rejoicing, even as ye also are our's in the day of the Lord Jesus.
language2_text: a kapiya na rana no nakenakem nyo jyamen. No si akman sang do araraw no yai na ni Yeso a Panirsirngen ta am jyabo kaji nyo azwayan jyamen a. So ikakman namen sang a zomwazway jinyo.

language1_text: And in this confidence I was minded to come unto you before, that ye might have a second benefit;
language2_text: Am ori o ko naknakman so keypirwa ko a mangay jinyo do dang. So ikanoyong nyo a ipidwa somaray.

language1_text: and to pass by you into Macedonia, and to come again out of Macedonia unto you, and of you to be brought on my way toward Judæ a.
language2_text: No si meypangay ko do Maciton am ko pinanakman o kapanmanma ko a mangay jinyo do dang. No si meysinaoli ko am mangay ko pa jinyo. Ta sidongen nyo yaken a mangay do Yotay.

language1_text: When I therefore was thus minded, did I use lightness? or the things that I purpose, do I purpose according to the flesh, that with me there should be yea yea, and nay nay?
language2_text: Manoyong o kanimamnek ko jya am ji ko nimangay. Manngwa, ipanci rana o akman sang a mabliblis so nakem? No katatay ko do akman sang a vazay ko am manngwa, ko to ngonongonongi o onowned ko a manci no ka noon ko sya, ka beken ko sya?

language1_text: But as God is true, our word toward you was not yea and nay.
language2_text: Am beken a akman so nyo ipanci. Ta o ipanci ko jinyo a ciring am beken a yameyveyvalyat. Ta si Ama ta do to a ko anopen am yabo na kalasan.

language1_text: For the Son of God, Jesus Christ, who was preached among you by us, even by me and Silvanus and Timotheus, was not yea and nay, but in him was yea.
language2_text: Akman sang o Anak na ni Ama ta do to a si Yeso Kizisto a yanamen nipeylimwang jinyo si Sila kani Timotay. Ta jyabliblis o ciring na. Ta o nipatwaw na rana ni Yeso a ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to am pangononongan na a peyvazain.

language1_text: For all the promises of God in him are yea, and in him Amen, unto the glory of God by us.
language2_text: Ta na rana nipangononongan o aryarilaw na jyaten ni Ama ta do to ni Yeso Kizisto. Am ori o icyakma tey asa so onowned a manci no Amin a zomwazway si Ama ta do to.

language1_text: Now he which stablisheth us with you in Christ, and hath anointed us, is God;
language2_text: O yamapait jyamen a ka ninyo a yakomdeng so nakem ji Yeso am si Ama ta do to. Nipamnekan na yaten a lamlamsoy na.

language1_text: who hath also sealed us, and given the earnest of the Spirit in our hearts.
language2_text: So na nitorwan nya jyaten so Seyzi a omoyat do onowned ta. O Seyzi rana am tovil no kanoyong ta a monganay jya tao. Ta o Seyzi rana am akma ney yongkad no makakaday a omanam a itoro na jyaten ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: Moreover I call God for a record upon my soul, that to spare you I came not as yet unto Corinth.
language2_text: Ko tawagan si Ama ta do to a macingosongoso nyaken. No si mangalalas ko am cyaha, ta pasingsingkadan na yaken. Ori o to ko na manci no kaji ko nangayan do Kedinto a omwoya ninyo. Ta manakem ko o kapamlis nyo pa.

language1_text: Not for that we have dominion over your faith, but are helpers of your joy: for by faith ye stand.
language2_text: Beken a namen gacigatan inyo a manganoyong, ta yakamo na makdeng so nakem ji Ama ta do to. So namen kagagan ninyo a pacivazayan do namen kapasaray jinyo.

language1_text: But I determined this with myself, that I would not come again to you in heaviness.
language2_text: Am ori o to ko na mamneki do kaji ko na ratan so kangangay nyo no si mangay ko pa jinyo no ipisa.

language1_text: For if I make you sorry, who is he then that maketh me glad, but the same which is made sorry by me?
language2_text: No si yaken yaomrahet so aktokto nyo am sino pa o ipeyhanhan ko a mapasaray jyaken. Inyo saon o mapasaray jyaken.

language1_text: And I wrote this same unto you, lest, when I came, I should have sorrow from them of whom I ought to rejoice; having confidence in you all, that my joy is the joy of you all.
language2_text: Am ori an o ko nipeyteygamyan ninyo, ta maraherahet o karahet nyo so aktokto no si makaranes ko jinyo. Ta yako ipeyhanhan inyo a yamapasaray jyaken no si mangay ko jinyo do dang. Ta ko anoyngan o sarasaray ko a sarasaray nyoo.

language1_text: For out of much affliction and anguish of heart I wrote unto you with many tears; not that ye should be grieved, but that ye might know the love which I have more abundantly unto you.
language2_text: To ko meykaoo a meyngen so onowned no kapeyteygami ko ninyo. Am beken a irahet ko so onowned nyo, ta ipakateneng nyo jyaken a tey marilaw ninyo.

language1_text: But if any have caused grief, he hath not grieved me, but in part: that I may not overcharge you all.
language2_text: No myan so tao a amrahet so aktokto no karwan no tao am beken a yakehen o raheten na so aktokto. Ta mamimin kamo a ko peycirngan sya. Am beken a ipasnesnek ta so nimapeyvazay so akman sang a tao.

language1_text: Sufficient to such a man is this punishment, which was inflicted of many.
language2_text: Ta ikananao na rana o oyaoyyan da nya no aro a tao.

language1_text: So that contrariwise ye ought rather to forgive him, and comfort him, lest perhaps such a one should be swallowed up with overmuch sorrow.
language2_text: Inyo rana am to nyo peykabobwa, apwapwen nyo o akman sang a tao an. Ta marahet o katey meyngen na so onowned.

language1_text: Wherefore I beseech you that ye would confirm your love toward him.
language2_text: Am ori an o ko kakzeban jinyo amnanao sya a kapakateneng na rana jinyo a marilaw nya.

language1_text: For to this end also did I write, that I might know the proof of you, whether ye be obedient in all things.
language2_text: O peypeypangayan no mina teygami ko jinyo asyo am iskad ko do nakenakem nyo. Ta manngo paro sira, panoden da o nakem da jyaken an?

language1_text: To whom ye forgive any thing, I forgive also: for if I forgave any thing, to whom I forgave it, for your sakes forgave I it in the person of Christ;
language2_text: O peykabobwen nyo so marahet a vazay a tao am to ko macyanod so nakem jinyo. Ta o ikakman ko sang am peyyanowanopen ko inyo so nakem do tangain ni Yeso Kizisto.

language1_text: lest Satan should get an advantage of us: for we are not ignorant of his devices.
language2_text: Ta maraherahet o kakata na ni Satan. Ta yabo jyaten o yaji makateneng do ipanlilita ni Satan.

language1_text: Furthermore, when I came to Troas to preach Christ's gospel, and a door was opened unto me of the Lord,
language2_text: No kangay ko do Teloya ili a meylimwang no Mapasaray a Ciriciring na ni Yeso Kizisto am niwangan na rana ni Yeso o angayan ko peyvazayan.

language1_text: I had no rest in my spirit, because I found not Titus my brother: but taking my leave of them, I went from thence into Macedonia.
language2_text: Am ko marahet so aktokto, ta ji ko nimasinmo si Tito a akma tey kakteh do cinai. Am ori o to ko naitaiji so tao do dang a kangay ko na do Maciton.

language1_text: Now thanks be unto God, which always causeth us to triumph in Christ, and maketh manifest the savour of his knowledge by us in every place.
language2_text: Am yako isaray ji Ama ta do to, ta yata na macikaop ji Yeso Kizisto. Ta na niharag rana ni Yeso Kizisto o raraten. So ta ikanoyong rana a macizanod ji Kizisto a nimakata. So da ipakateneng rana ji Yeso no tao, do ta kalivolivon no Mapasaray a Ciriciring na ni Kizisto.

language1_text: For we are unto God a sweet savour of Christ, in them that are saved, and in them that perish:
language2_text: Tamo akman rana si Yeso Kizisto a na isaray ni Ama ta do to, do ta kapeylimwang no Mapasaray a Ciriciring na do omanoyong jya tao a kano ji nganoyong jya tao.

language1_text: to the one we are the savour of death unto death; and to the other the savour of life unto life. And who is sufficient for these things?
language2_text: Am o ji nganoyong jya tao am ikaoya da o akman sang a ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to, do kangay na jira no peyoyaoyyan ni Ama ta do to no makwa. Am omanoyong jya tao am ikavyay no pahad da. Sino makapeyvazay so akman sang a rako a vazay.

language1_text: For we are not as many, which corrupt the word of God: but as of sincerity, but as of God, in the sight of God speak we in Christ.
language2_text: Namen jyakman so aro a tao a yamacininizpi no nanao ni Ama ta do to. Ta namen meyngongyod a nipamnekan ni Ama ta do to a yameylimwang no ciriciring na. So namen ikanoyong a yaji mangalalas so ciring a lamlamsoy na ni Kizisto.

language1_text: Do we begin again to commend ourselves? or need we, as some others, epistles of commendation to you, or letters of commendation from you?
language2_text: Manngwa, namen pahamahen o aktokto namen? Manngwa, namen akman so yatatasa tao a manta ninyo so teygami a yongkad namen a lamlamsoy ni Ama ta do to? Namen ji ngakzeba inyo a meylimwang nya do tao so kazwayan namen.

language1_text: Ye are our epistle written in our hearts, known and read of all men:
language2_text: Ta inyo rana am akma kamoy teygami a yongkad namen a yanivatvatkan do onowned namen a vilangan da no tao.

language1_text: forasmuch as ye are manifestly declared to be the epistle of Christ ministered by us, written not with ink, but with the Spirit of the living God; not in tables of stone, but in fleshy tables of the heart.
language2_text: Kamo mapayok a akma ney teygami ni Kizisto a yana nivatvatkan a yana niparara jyamen. O teygami rana ya am beken a yana nivatvatkan ni Ama ta do to no ipeyveyvatvatek do mataripis a vato a nitaid na ji Moyse. Ta nivatvatkan no Seyzi no to meyyonong a Tao do to do onowned no tao.

language1_text: And such trust have we through Christ to God-ward:
language2_text: O namen icyakman sang am si Ama ta do to o nimamnek jyamen a lamlamsoy na. So namen peyhanhanan ni Kizisto a omoyat jyamen.

language1_text: not that we are sufficient of ourselves to think any thing as of ourselves; but our sufficiency is of God;
language2_text: Am beken a namen pangozayan o oyowyat namen a yamapeyvazay so sya. Ta o yakapwan no oyowyat a kano teneteneng namen a yamapeyvazay so sya am yapo ji Ama ta do to.

language1_text: who also hath made us able ministers of the new testament; not of the letter, but of the spirit: for the letter killeth, but the spirit giveth life.
language2_text: Iya o yanamen ipakahap so vayo a pangozayan a ciring na ni Ama ta do to a yanamen ipeylimwang. Oya rana am beken a nivatvatkan. Ta pangozayan a ciring no Seyzi. O nivatvatkan a iwawalam am ikawakwak no tao. Am o Seyzi am itoro na jyaten o to meyyonong a ikavyay no pahad ta.

language1_text: But if the ministration of death, written and engraven in stones, was glorious, so that the children of Israel could not stedfastly behold the face of Moses for the glory of his countenance; which glory was to be done away:
language2_text: O iwawalam ni Moyse am nivatvatkan do mataripis a vato. No keyyan no nang am tomwaw rana o azwazway na ni Ama ta do to. No kanang am nimaniray o moing ni Moyse. Am ori o nikakowap da no Isedi a tao no oyowyat na ni Ama ta do to. No si manoyong a mazway o na kapwan no peyoyaoyyan ni Ama ta do to a iwawalam ni Moyse am

language1_text: how shall not the ministration of the spirit be rather glorious?
language2_text: ney manngo o oyowyat no Seyzi a mapanop jyaten ji Ama ta do to. Ta jyabo kaji na azwazwayan pa kano iwawalam ni Moyse a.

language1_text: For if the ministration of condemnation be glory, much more doth the ministration of righteousness exceed in glory.
language2_text: No manoyong o kazway no iwawalam ni Moyse a manci no raraten am arakorako pa o kazwayan na no vayo a pangozayan a ciring na ni Ama ta do to a makavonas so raraten ta, a kabo na rana no raraten ta do tangain na.

language1_text: For even that which was made glorious had no glory in this respect, by reason of the glory that excelleth.
language2_text: O vayo a pangozayan a ciring na ni Ama ta do to am na rana to meyhavasi o adan a pangozayan a ciring ni Moyse.

language1_text: For if that which is done away was glorious, much more that which remaineth is glorious.
language2_text: No yamanoyong keyyan no oyowyat na no yaji meyyonownay a iwawalam am jyabo kaji na rakorakwan pa no oyowyat na no yato meyyonong ori a.

language1_text: Seeing then that we have such hope, we use great plainness of speech:
language2_text: Yanamen manoyong a meyhanhan no akman sang. Am ori o yanamen jyaonibi rana a meylimwang no ciring na ni Yeso Kizisto.

language1_text: and not as Moses, which put a vail over his face, that the children of Israel could not stedfastly look to the end of that which is abolished:
language2_text: Yanamen jyakman si Moyse a mangap so milakayob a ibengbeng so moing na, kaji da makacittan no Isedi a tao so maniray a moing na, do kanimeypalikey na rana no iciray na sira.

language1_text: but their minds were blinded: for until this day remaineth the same vail untaken away in the reading of the old testament; which vail is done away in Christ.
language2_text: Am o onowned da am yakmey kaneban yatodangay sicyaikwaya. Ta no yada vilangan o yamakakaday a vakong do adan a Seysyo am yakman sang a yamabengbeng o onowned da. Ta o macitovong a tao ji Kizisto o ikapakaro no ombengbeng do onowned da.

language1_text: But even unto this day, when Moses is read, the vail is upon their heart.
language2_text: Yamangay sicyaikwaya o na ji iwangi no onowned da no yameyvilang do nivatvatkan ni Moyse a vakong.

language1_text: Nevertheless when it shall turn to the Lord, the vail shall be taken away.
language2_text: Am no sazapen da o Panirsirngen ta am keywangan o onowned da.

language1_text: Now the Lord is that Spirit: and where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is liberty.
language2_text: O yana malavat do jya Panirsirngen ta am Seyzi. O yanan no Seyzi a tao am kowvayan rana o onowned na, ta italamozong na rana no Seyzi.

language1_text: But we all, with open face beholding as in a glass the glory of the Lord, are changed into the same image from glory to glory, even as by the Spirit of the Lord.
language2_text: Yatamo todamimin a yajyabengbengi so moing. Ta o tao rana a omonot do Panirsirngen ta Seyzi am amyan rana jira o azwazway na ni Ama ta do to a omyavayo sira. Am ori o icyakman da sya so icicirawat a tey mazway.

language1_text: Therefore seeing we have this ministry, as we have received mercy, we faint not;
language2_text: Yamanoyong si Ama ta do to a yamarilaw nyamen do na kapahanhan jyamen do vazay na. Ori o namen rana jyaraci nya so onowned.

language1_text: but have renounced the hidden things of dishonesty, not walking in craftiness, nor handling the word of God deceitfully; but by manifestation of the truth commending ourselves to every man's conscience in the sight of God.
language2_text: Namen ji ngapa o macimanig a vazay. Namen ji mangalalas. Namen ji palasa o ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to, ji powziba o nanao ni Ama ta do to. Ta ipacita namen do tao o icicirawat namen, do kanoyong namen a lamlamsoy na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: But if our gospel be hid, it is hid to them that are lost:
language2_text: No myan so ji makateneng do Mapasaray a Ciriciring a ipeylimwang namen am o ji manaralay a tao saon o ji makateneng jya.

language1_text: in whom the god of this world hath blinded the minds of them which believe not, lest the light of the glorious gospel of Christ, who is the image of God, should shine unto them.
language2_text: Da ji nganoyngi no tao, ta yana bengbengen ni Satan o onowned da no yaji manganoyong a tao. Am ori o da ji makatenngi do peypeypangayan no Mapasaray a Ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to a yaomagaz do azwazway na ni Yeso Kizisto. Ta si Yeso Kizisto rana am ta nipakacita rana si Ama ta do to.

language1_text: For we preach not ourselves, but Christ Jesus the Lord; and ourselves your servants for Jesus' sake.
language2_text: Beken a kataotao namen o namen ipeylimwang, ta namen ipeylimwang si Yeso Kizisto a manoyong a Panirsirngen ta. O namen sidongan jinyo am lamlamsoy na yamen ni Yeso Kizisto.

language1_text: For God, who commanded the light to shine out of darkness, hath shined in our hearts, to give the light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ.
language2_text: O nimangamaog no ciring na so zezak a Tao do to am ori o amzezak so masyonowned ta. Ori o ta ipakateneng do azwazway na ni Ama ta do to amyan ji Yeso Kizisto.

language1_text: But we have this treasure in earthen vessels, that the excellency of the power may be of God, and not of us.
language2_text: Am yamen rana am katonodan namen o nyamaog no tana vanga a maspispi. Am o maoran do onowned namen a ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to am tey makdeng. So ikabeken a yamonganay jyamen no oyowyat a meylimwang nya, ta monganay ji Ama ta do to.

language1_text: We are troubled on every side, yet not distressed; we are perplexed, but not in despair;
language2_text: Namen masangib a makasazi so alalaw am namen ji pehmai. Tomakatakaw am namen kaji makatenngan do namen ahahapan sya am ji namen a mahayo.

language1_text: persecuted, but not forsaken; cast down, but not destroyed;
language2_text: Yaro tao a macioya jyamen am yamyan so tao a marilaw nyamen. No to namen jyangangay so inawan a pakakasyan da am ji namen a wakwak.

language1_text: always bearing about in the body the dying of the Lord Jesus, that the life also of Jesus might be made manifest in our body.
language2_text: Namen masangib a yatoda jyangangay so inawan akman si Yeso Kizisto a nipamnekan da a limanen, do yanamen kapeylimwang ni Yeso Kizisto a yapa mavyay a Tao do to.

language1_text: For we which live are alway delivered unto death for Jesus' sake, that the life also of Jesus might be made manifest in our mortal flesh.
language2_text: O ikakman na sang am yamonganay ji Yeso Kizisto o yapwan no inawan namen.

language1_text: So then death worketh in us, but life in you.
language2_text: Tana masangib namen a toda jyangangay so inawan am cyaha, ta ipakasidong namen jinyo a makahap so to meyyonong a ikavyay no pahad nyo.

language1_text: We having the same spirit of faith, according as it is written, I believed, and therefore have I spoken; we also believe, and therefore speak;
language2_text: Ta maniring do Seysyo am, "Ko anoyngan si Ama ta do to an. Am ori o ko peylimwangan nya." Namen akman so sang a meyhanhan nya. Am ori o namen peylimwangan nya.

language1_text: knowing that he which raised up the Lord Jesus shall raise up us also by Jesus, and shall present us with you.
language2_text: Namen katenngan o yanimapeyvangon si Yeso a Tao do to a mapeyvangon jyamen akman si Yeso a kamimin ta na macikaop jya do teyngato.

language1_text: For all things are for your sakes, that the abundant grace might through the thanksgiving of many redound to the glory of God.
language2_text: Monganay jinyo o alalaw namen a ipakasidong namen jinyo a peypahagnaten so nakenakem ji Ama ta do to. So na ikanoyong no pangangarilawan na ni Ama ta do to a itoro na do aro a tao. Am ori o ikarwaro rana no tao a zomwazway si Ama ta do to a isaray da.

language1_text: For which cause we faint not; but though our outward man perish, yet the inward man is renewed day by day.
language2_text: Am ori an, namen jyaraci nya so onowned. Tana ji namen a ngahay a yameypararakeh am yamangday do araraw o onowned namen a yameypahagnat.

language1_text: For our light affliction, which is but for a moment, worketh for us a far more exceeding and eternal weight of glory;
language2_text: O yaji meyyonownay a alalaw namen eya am ipakahap namen so maharahara pa, a to meyyonong a azwazway namen ji Ama ta do to.

language1_text: while we look not at the things which are seen, but at the things which are not seen: for the things which are seen are temporal; but the things which are not seen are eternal.
language2_text: Namen jyakzan o macimalag do mata namen a monganay do karawan. Ta namen ikeykakza o yajyacita no mata. Ta ori rana am ji meyyonownay ori. Am o yajyacita no mata am to meyyonong ori.

language1_text: For we know that if our earthly house of this tabernacle were dissolved, we have a building of God, an house not made with hands, eternal in the heavens.
language2_text: Tamo katenngan o na kakmey vahay no kataotao ta do karawan eya a mababalinas. Am no makwa am ipanta na yaten so asa ka vayo a kataotao ta do teyngato ni Ama ta do to. Am beken a nyamaog no tao, ta nyamaog ni Ama ta do to. Am ori o to na meyyonongi.

language1_text: For in this we groan, earnestly desiring to be clothed upon with our house which is from heaven:
language2_text: Tana tamo macizizikna sicyaikwaya yatoda ji nalap a yamangay a meyvahay do teyngato am

language1_text: if so be that being clothed we shall not be found naked.
language2_text: no marateng o araraw no kapanta na nyaten so vayo a kataotao ta am beken a todaveyvow a pahad ta, ta macyangay dang o vayo a kataotao ta.

language1_text: For we that are in this tabernacle do groan, being burdened: not for that we would be unclothed, but clothed upon, that mortality might be swallowed up of life.
language2_text: O kataotao ta ya akma tey vahay do karawan eya am yamakahap so alalaw ta do karawan. So to ta ji ngamogi so kangay ta do teyngato, do na katey yaro no alalaw ta do teyrahem. So ikanoyong na rana no maliman a kataotao ta ya alitan na rana no vayo a itoro na ni Ama ta do to a to meyyonong a kataotao ta.

language1_text: Now he that hath wrought us for the selfsame thing is God, who also hath given unto us the earnest of the Spirit.
language2_text: Ta isonong na yaten ni Ama ta do to a somazap so akman sang a yeyyak ta no mata. O yongkad no nang am Seyzi a na nitoro jyaten.

language1_text: Therefore we are always confident, knowing that, whilst we are at home in the body, we are absent from the Lord:
language2_text: Am ori an, yaten rana a meyhanhan ni Yeso Kizisto a tao am ji tamo a ratan no onowned no amyan so alalaw ta an. Ta tamo katenngan no mavyay pa o kataotao ta am marai pa o kapacikaop ta ji Yeso do teyngato.

language1_text: (for we walk by faith, not by sight:)
language2_text: Tana ta jyacita no mata ta si Ama ta do to am ta ipeyhanhan sicyaikwaya a mangononong do ciriciring na.

language1_text: we are confident, I say, and willing rather to be absent from the body, and to be present with the Lord.
language2_text: So ikanoyong ta rana jyavokahaw a toda ji ngamaog so kataotao ta do karawan a mangay a macitovong ji Yeso a Panirsirngen ta.

language1_text: Wherefore we labour, that, whether present or absent, we may be accepted of him.
language2_text: Tana kataotao ta do teyrahem am tana monganay rana o kataotao ta do teyngato am ney makdeng na am ji ta hamangi o kapasaray ta si Yeso a Panirsirngen ta.

language1_text: For we must all appear before the judgment seat of Christ; that every one may receive the things done in his body, according to that he hath done, whether it be good or bad.
language2_text: Ta mamimin tamo eya a mangay do tangain ni Yeso Kizisto a pacicin na. To na palololwa do mina vazay ta do karawan o itoro na jyaten.

language1_text: Knowing therefore the terror of the Lord, we persuade men; but we are made manifest unto God; and I trust also are made manifest in your consciences.
language2_text: Namen katenngan o kapeypanam no kapacici na jyaten ni Ama ta do to. Am ori o namen vavagan do tao a amraralay ni Ama ta do to. Ta yana katenngan o onowned namen ni Ama ta do to. Inaoy si akman kamo sang a makateneng do onowned namen.

language1_text: For we commend not ourselves again unto you, but give you occasion to glory on our behalf, that ye may have somewhat to answer them which glory in appearance, and not in heart.
language2_text: Beken a namen pazwain o kataotao namen jinyo. Ta namen kakzeben inyo a zomwazway so mina vazay namen do tao. Ta ori o itovis nyo do mapakazwazway no kapya da a ji macipayok so onowned ji Ama ta do to.

language1_text: For whether we be beside ourselves, it is to God: or whether we be sober, it is for your cause.
language2_text: Tana ipanci da yamen no tao a meylamraw am cyaha, ji namen rata ori an, do namen kahap so vazay ni Ama ta do to. Am no si katenngan namen o apya kano marahet am cyaha, ta ipeypapya nyo.

language1_text: For the love of Christ constraineth us; because we thus judge, that if one died for all, then were all dead:
language2_text: O pangangarilawan ni Kizisto amyan do onowned namen. Ta namen katenngan sicyaikwaya o kanimawakwak ni Yeso no tao do karawan. Am ori o ta icyakmey asa rana a macizanod do inawan ni Yeso a nimawakwak.

language1_text: and that he died for all, that they which live should not henceforth live unto themselves, but unto him which died for them, and rose again.
language2_text: Na nikawakwak ni Yeso o tao do karawan. Ori o ji ta to mangozai do aktokto ta. Ta pangozayan ta si Yeso Kizisto a nimawakwak no raraten ta a kapirwa na rana mavyay.

language1_text: Wherefore henceforth know we no man after the flesh: yea, though we have known Christ after the flesh, yet now henceforth know we him no more.
language2_text: Am ori o ji ta to mangozai do ahahapan ta sya a tomita so icyatatao ta. Tana akman so sang o nyahahapan ta si Kizisto no kakwa am cyaha, ta tamo na niblisan sicyaikwaya.

language1_text: Therefore if any man be in Christ, he is a new creature: old things are passed away; behold, all things are become new.
language2_text: Ta o macikaop ji Yeso Kizisto a tao am vayo rana o onowned na. Ta nipeymakarwan na rana o adan a icicirawat na. So ikamimin na rana vayo.

language1_text: And all things are of God, who hath reconciled us to himself by Jesus Christ, and hath given to us the ministry of reconciliation;
language2_text: O akman rana sang am mamimin ori a vazay na ni Ama ta do to. Si Yeso Kizisto am ori o tanyo ipacikaop rana ji Ama ta do to a mina kavosoyan na. So ta icyakman sang a ipeyhanhan ni Ama ta do to a mangay a mapanop so ji manaralay a tao ji Ama ta do to.

language1_text: to wit, that God was in Christ, reconciling the world unto himself, not imputing their trespasses unto them; and hath committed unto us the word of reconciliation.
language2_text: O yanamen ipeylimwang a ciriciring eya am na nipangozayan si Yeso ni Ama ta do to a yamapanop jyaten a tao do karawan. Na ji nita o raraten no tao. So na torwan nya jyamen so nanao na a meylimwang nya do tao a kanop da rana si Ama ta do to.

language1_text: Now then we are ambassadors for Christ, as though God did beseech you by us: we pray you in Christ's stead, be ye reconciled to God.
language2_text: Lamlamsoy na yamen ni Kizisto. Na nitovoy yamen a amvavaga jinyo. Namen akmey kataotao ni Ama ta do to a manci nya jinyo so: Mamlis kamo rana a omanop si Ama ta do to. Ta ori o ipacikaop na jinyo.

language1_text: For he hath made him to be sin for us, who knew no sin; that we might be made the righteousness of God in him.
language2_text: Na nikarilaw yaten ni Ama ta do to. So na nitovoyan si Kizisto abo so raraten a nimalit so raraten ta. Am ori o tanyo ipacikaop ji Kizisto a abwata rana so raraten do tangain na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: We then, as workers together with him, beseech you also that ye receive not the grace of God in vain.
language2_text: Yamen rana na pacipeyvazayan ni Ama ta do to am namen vavagan inyo o kaji nyo tongbowan so aryarilaw na jinyo ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: (For he saith, I have heard thee in a time accepted, And in the day of salvation have I succoured thee: behold, now is the accepted time; behold, now is the day of salvation.)
language2_text: Ta maniring si Ama ta do to am, "No katawag nyo jyaken am nimamizing ko na inyo an. No keyyan no alalaw nyo am nisidong ko inyo an." Amizngen nyo an. Ta sicyaikwa rana ya am na pantan yaten so pangangasyan na ni Ama ta do to. Sicyaraw eya am manoyong a araraw no na isidong jyaten ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: Giving no offence in any thing, that the ministry be not blamed:
language2_text: Namen ji mapeyvazay so marahet a vazay a tamwadan da jyamen no tao. Inaoy no si ji namen meyvazay so marahet a vazay a ikazazat do tao a omonot ji Ama ta do to.

language1_text: But in all things approving ourselves as the ministers of God, in much patience, in afflictions, in necessities, in distresses,
language2_text: Yamen rana do yamakakaday a vazay am yanamen akmey tongbowa o yameykamadadayan a alalaw, do namen kanoyong a lamlamsoy ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: in stripes, in imprisonments, in tumults, in labours, in watchings, in fastings;
language2_text: Nibakbakan da yamen. Nyaneban da yamen. Nigolo da o cicilwan namen no tao. Nimazikna namen. Nimapowaw namen ji makaitkeh. Nimakcin namen.

language1_text: by pureness, by knowledge, by longsuffering, by kindness, by the Holy Ghost, by love unfeigned,
language2_text: Am keyyan no teneteneng namen a kano pangarilawan namen a omzat do nakenakem namen. Am ori o to namen nangboi sya. So kapya namen a nisidong no Seyzi a meyngongyod a marilaw no tao.

language1_text: by the word of truth, by the power of God, by the armour of righteousness on the right hand and on the left,
language2_text: Nioyatan na yamen ni Ama ta do to a meylimwang no manoyong a nanao na a mapacitacita no kanoyong namen a lamlamsoy na ni Ama ta do to. So icyakma nameney mapeyvoovoo so apya nakenakem namen a iharag namen so amrahet jyamen a tao.

language1_text: by honour and dishonour, by evil report and good report: as deceivers, and yet true;
language2_text: Amyan so zomwazway jyamen am amyan so mapeyleylak jyamen. So ikanoyong namen a ipanci da no tao a mapeycyakawad so tao. Am abo akman sang a nakenakem namen.

language1_text: as unknown, and yet well known; as dying, and, behold, we live; as chastened, and not killed;
language2_text: Da ipanci o kabo no tao a yamakateneng jyamen. Am yajyakman sang, ta yabo o yaji makateneng jyamen a tao. Da ipanci yamen a yana nimazakat. Am yajyakman sang, ta namen pa mavyay. Tana da nibakbakan yamen am namen jya nimawakwak.

language1_text: as sorrowful, yet alway rejoicing; as poor, yet making many rich; as having nothing, and yet possessing all things.
language2_text: Tana yamyan so namen ilavi so onowned am yamyan so namen isaray so onowned. Tana namen makcin am cyaha, ta namen avyain o pahad no aro a tao. Tana yabo o peymeymasaodan namen do karawan am cyaha, ta abo kalahen namen a yamacikaop ji Ama ta do to.

language1_text: O ye Corinthians, our mouth is open unto you, our heart is enlarged.
language2_text: Inyo rana kagagan namen do Kedinto am namen ji manayo so ciring jinyo an, ta namen tey kaglaw inyo.

language1_text: Ye are not straitened in us, but ye are straitened in your own bowels.
language2_text: Beken a namen taywen o aryarilaw namen jinyo. Ta monganay rana jinyo a yaji ngiwang do onowned nyo.

language1_text: Now for a recompence in the same, (I speak as unto my children, ) be ye also enlarged.
language2_text: Ko na inyo abneken a minapodpod jyamen. Am ori o namen peycirngan sang. So inaran nyo jyamen so nakenakem jinyo.

language1_text: Be ye not unequally yoked together with unbelievers: for what fellowship hath righteousness with unrighteousness? and what communion hath light with darkness?
language2_text: Ji kamo macizanod so onowned do ji manaralay a tao an. Ta ji meyyangay o pangtoktwan nyo a ka nira. Ta jyabo kapeyzavoz no apya kano marahet a. Akman sang o mazngang a kano kasarisaryan, ta ji meyzavoz.

language1_text: And what concord hath Christ with Belial? or what part hath he that believeth with an infidel?
language2_text: Jyabo kapacizanod ni Kizisto ji Satan a. Jyabo kapeyyangay no amraralay ni Ama ta do to a kano ji manaralay a tao a.

language1_text: And what agreement hath the temple of God with idols? for ye are the temple of the living God; as God hath said, I will dwell in them, and walk in them; and I will be their God, and they shall be my people.
language2_text: Ji nyo peyzavoza o raralayan nyo ni Ama ta do to a kano malas a iraralay da no tao. Ta yaten o na yanan no to meyyonong a Tao do to. Akman so ipanci na do Seysyo. Ta maniring am, "Macikaop ko do omanoyong jyaken a tao a keyyan ko do onowned da. So abnekan da jyaken a Tao do to da. So ikanoyong da italamozong ko a tao.

language1_text: WhereforeCome out from among them, and be ye separate, saith the Lord, And touch not the unclean thing; And I will receive you,
language2_text: Am ori o ji nyo pehngai so onowned nyo do ji manaralay a tao. Ji kamo macizanod jira. Ji nyo nginara o malas a vazay da. Ta ori o sarayan ko ninyo."

language1_text: And will be a Father unto you, And ye shall be my sons and daughters, saith the Lord Almighty.
language2_text: "Ama nyo yaken. Inyo rana am anak ko inyo. O ciring rana ya am si Ama ta do to a Panirsirngen ta o mapeyciring sya."

language1_text: Having therefore these promises, dearly beloved, let us cleanse ourselves from all filthiness of the flesh and spirit, perfecting holiness in the fear of God.
language2_text: Am ori an manga kakteh an, no yamanoyong o akman sang a nakem na jyaten ni Ama ta do to am apzatan ta o onowned ta an. Ji ta mamyapyan o kataotao ta kano nakenakem ta a macizavoz do raraten. Ta naknakmen ta o kaji tamo meylimotngan so onowned a omraralay ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: Receive us; we have wronged no man, we have corrupted no man, we have defrauded no man.
language2_text: Inarahen nyo yamen so nakenakem jinyo an. Ta abo namen nirahet no kangangay do kadwan jyaten. Yabwata asa ka tao namen nilittan no ciring namen.

language1_text: I speak not this to condemn you: for I have said before, that ye are in our hearts to die and live with you.
language2_text: O ko peycirngan so sang am beken a ko patwawen o nyo karatan. Ta nipanci ko na jinyo namen karilaw ninyo. Tana mavyay namen a tana mawakwak namen am abo makapeysyay jyaten so nakenakem.

language1_text: Great is my boldness of speech toward you, great is my glorying of you: I am filled with comfort, I am exceeding joyful in all our tribulation.
language2_text: Yako ipeyhanhan inyo. Yako azwain inyo. Tana amyan so aro a alalaw ko am ko jyanyaheyan. Ta yako ipeyhanhan inyo a mapadnadna so nakem ko.

language1_text: For, when we were come into Macedonia, our flesh had no rest, but we were troubled on every side; without were fightings, within were fears.
language2_text: Ta makaranes namen do Maciton am ji namen nimeywalam. Ta ji namen angned so ninyakan, do katey yaro no alalaw namen do peycyeylilyan na do kazyakan da nyamen a kapaciyoman na pa no kasinalaw namen ninyo a mablis so nakenakem ji Ama ta do to.

language1_text: Nevertheless God, that comforteth those that are cast down, comforted us by the coming of Titus;
language2_text: Am si Ama ta do to a marilaw no makasi a tao am ori nisomidong jyamen a yanitomovoy si Tito a yamapait jyamen.

language1_text: and not by his coming only, but by the consolation wherewith he was comforted in you, when he told us your earnest desire, your mourning, your fervent mind toward me; so that I rejoiced the more.
language2_text: Beken a na kai do jya an. Ta aro o ciring na a nipanci na jyamen do kanimapait nyo sya a kapanci nyo no kakzan nyo nyaken a macita, keyngen nyo so onowned a makanakem so marahet a vazay nyo no kakwa. So nyo ikanoyong a mahap so vazay ko. Ori o ko sarayan no akman sang jinyo.

language1_text: For though I made you sorry with a letter, I do not repent, though I did repent: for I perceive that the same epistle hath made you sorry, though it were but for a season.
language2_text: O mina teygami ko jinyo no kakwa am tana nikazabab nyo so onowned am ko ji nimaneseh. Am manakenakem ko am jyabo kaji nyo mazababan so onowned no mina ciring ko jinyo do teygami ko a. Am ori o icyakma koy maneneseh.

language1_text: Now I rejoice, not that ye were made sorry, but that ye sorrowed to repentance: for ye were made sorry after a godly manner, that ye might receive damage by us in nothing.
language2_text: Am ko na masaray sicyaikwaya. Am beken a ko isaray o kanimazabab nyo nyaken so onowned. Ta o lavyan nyo am nyo nikablis so onowned. Ta nakenakem na ori ni Ama ta do to. So nikapya no vazay namen jinyo.

language1_text: For godly sorrow worketh repentance to salvation not to be repented of: but the sorrow of the world worketh death.
language2_text: Ta o omlavi a mamlis do peyraratenan da am niblis na ni Ama ta do to so onowned da a ipeypapya da. Am o monganay do karawan a ilavi no onowned da no ji makanakem si Ama ta do to am ipeykaraherahet da.

language1_text: For behold this selfsame thing, that ye sorrowed after a godly sort, what carefulness it wrought in you, yea, what clearing of yourselves, yea, what indignation, yea, what fear, yea, what vehement desire, yea, what zeal, yea, what revenge! In all things ye have approved yourselves to be clear in this matter.
language2_text: Cittey kamo pala. Ta si Ama ta do to rana am na nipeypapya jinyo o lavyan nyo a meypakdeng so nakenakem jya. Ta nyo nikaoya rana o mina raraten nyo. Nyo nikaoya o peyraratenan na no asa ka tao ang. Ta nyo ji mya o kapacizagom nyo jya a peydednan no oyaoyyan na nya ni Ama ta do to. O akman rana sang a onowned nyo sicyaikwaya am yongkad na rana no kanoyong nyo nimamlis rana so onowned.

language1_text: Wherefore, though I wrote unto you, I did it not for his cause that had done the wrong, nor for his cause that suffered wrong, but that our care for you in the sight of God might appear unto you.
language2_text: O ko nivatvatkan do teygami ori am ko ivavaga do meyraraten a tao a kano ji na panadnada tao. Am o ney makdeng a peypeypangayan na pa no mina teygami ko jinyo am ko patwawen o apya nakenakem nyo jyamen do tangain ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: Therefore we were comforted in your comfort: yea, and exceedingly the more joyed we for the joy of Titus, because his spirit was refreshed by you all.
language2_text: Ori rana o nikait jyamen an. Am beken a orii an, ta o sarasaray ni Tito am ori o yanamen isaray. Ta nimamimin kamo a nisomidong sya. So na ikasaray.

language1_text: For if I have boasted any thing to him of you, I am not ashamed; but as we spake all things to you in truth, even so our boasting, which I made before Titus, is found a truth.
language2_text: Tana nyazwazway ko ninyo do tangain ni Tito am abo kalasan na no nang. Ta o mina ciring namen a pagazen namen jinyo am yamamimin a manoyong ori. So namen pacyanoyngan do namen pazwain do tangain ni Tito a yamanoyong.

language1_text: And his inward affection is more abundant toward you, whilst he remembereth the obedience of you all, how with fear and trembling ye received him.
language2_text: Am no na manakem inyo a aro a tao a yaomanoyong ji Ama ta do to am yakmey to ngyan jinyo o onowned na, do nyo kapeyveyveken sya.

language1_text: I rejoice therefore that I have confidence in you in all things.
language2_text: Ko tey masaray sicyaikwaya do ko kapeyhanhan rana ninyo.

language1_text: Moreover, brethren, we do you to wit of the grace of God bestowed on the churches of Macedonia;
language2_text: Manga kakteh ko do cinai, inaoy no si katenngan nyo o aryarilaw na ni Ama ta do to do peycyakyokyokayan na do Maciton.

language1_text: how that in a great trial of affliction the abundance of their joy and their deep poverty abounded unto the riches of their liberality.
language2_text: Tana tey makdeng o nilamdaman na sira ni Ama ta do to am sira na to naray. Tana mavak o velek da am da makto o da kapeykingking so da ipanidong.

language1_text: For to their power, I bear record, yea, and beyond their power they were willing of themselves;
language2_text: Ko na ji naywa o ciring ko am o kingking da am yarwaro rana kano yada makazamo do kataotao da a da nakem si Ama ta do to.

language1_text: praying us with much intreaty that we would receive the gift, and take upon us the fellowship of the ministering to the saints.
language2_text: Ta da to meynakman o da kai jyamen a manci no kasidong da so akma dey kakteh do cinai a sinjya do Yotay.

language1_text: And this they did, not as we hoped, but first gave their own selves to the Lord, and unto us by the will of God.
language2_text: Namen jyaktoktwan o vazay da a yatey yaro. Ta sira rana am da nipeykingking ji Ama ta do to o kataotao da a mahap so vazay na a yaomamizing so ciring namen.

language1_text: Insomuch that we desired Titus, that as he had begun, so he would also finish in you the same grace also.
language2_text: Am ori o namen kakzeban si Tito a to ngyan jinyo do dang a somidong jinyo a mapakavos so nipamnekan nyo a vazay a marilaw no akma nyoy kakteh do cinai.

language1_text: Therefore, as ye abound in every thing, in faith, and utterance, and knowledge, and in all diligence, and in your love to us, see that ye abound in this grace also.
language2_text: O yamakakaday a yamyan jinyo a nakenakem nyo si Ama ta do to a kano teneteneng nyo a mangononong a kano kowyowyat nyo a manidong so tao a kano aryarilaw nyo jyamen am yateywara rana an. Am ori o namen kakzan inyo a yajingbeywan do akman sya panidongan so tao.

language1_text: I speak not by commandment, but by occasion of the forwardness of others, and to prove the sincerity of your love.
language2_text: Am beken a ko gacigatan inyo a mapeyvazay sya. Ta ko ipaziman jinyo o kakdekdeng da no sinjya do Maciton a somkad do kanoyong na kalas na no pangangarilawan nyo so icyatatao nyo.

language1_text: For ye know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, that, though he was rich, yet for your sakes he became poor, that ye through his poverty might be rich.
language2_text: Nyo na katenngan o pangangasyan ni Yeso Kizisto a Panirsirngen ta. Iya rana am abwata o kakzeben na an. Ta iya rana am tey meynakem do teyngato. Am na kapanadnad jyaten. So na ikakmey makasi a tao. Na apyapyahen pa o na katoda katawwan a yamapazanod jyaten do azwazway na do teyngato.

language1_text: And herein I give my advice: for this is expedient for you, who have begun before, not only to do, but also to be forward a year ago.
language2_text: Ko naknakmen o akman sang a vazay am apyapya rana o kapakavos nyo sicyaikwaya so nipeysinsinmo nyo no kaminasawan a ipanidong nyo so tao. Ta nimanma kamo a nimapeyvazay so akman sya. So ika inyo no mapeynakem so akman sya.

language1_text: Now therefore perform the doing of it; that as there was a readiness to will, so there may be a performance also out of that which ye have.
language2_text: Am ori o ji nyo pahephepi jya a pakavosen. Ta inarahen nyo o kakdekdeng nyo no kavayo nyo pa mapeysinsinmo sya. Am to nyo mangozai o myan jinyo.

language1_text: For if there be first a willing mind, it is accepted according to that a man hath, and not according to that he hath not.
language2_text: No si manoyong kamo so onowned no meykingking kamo am jyabo kaji na narayan ninyo ni Ama ta do to a. Ta o kakzeben na jinyo ni Ama ta do to am beken a karo na, ta o myamyan jinyo.

language1_text: For I mean not that other men be eased, and ye burdened: but by an equality, that now at this time your abundance may be a supply for their want, that their abundance also may be a supply for your want: that there may be equality:
language2_text: Beken a ko ziknahen inyo a somidong so makasi a tao. No kamo manoyong a yamabsoy sicyaikwaya am sidongen nyo sira yamakcin a tao. Cyaha, ta no mabsoy sira am sidongen da inyo no makcin kamo. So ikanoyong nyo a macisidosidong do alalaw nyo. Beken a ko ziknahen inyo a somidong so makasi a tao. No kamo manoyong a yamabsoy sicyaikwaya am sidongen nyo sira yamakcin a tao. Cyaha, ta no mabsoy sira am sidongen da inyo no makcin kamo. So ikanoyong nyo a macisidosidong do alalaw nyo.

language1_text: as it is written, He that had gathered much had nothing over; and he that had gathered little had no lack.
language2_text: Ta maniring do Seysyo am, "O aro so nimahap am abo dang o mapanpan. O apereh so nimahap am todey macinet."

language1_text: But thanks be to God, which put the same earnest care into the heart of Titus for you.
language2_text: Namen isaray ji Ama ta do to, ta na nipait si Tito. So na icyakman jyamen a yamakdeng a yasomidong jinyo.

language1_text: For indeed he accepted the exhortation; but being more forward, of his own accord he went unto you.
language2_text: Beken a na kamizing so ciring namen, ta yamonganay jya yamakza no na kangay jinyo do dang.

language1_text: And we have sent with him the brother, whose praise is in the gospel throughout all the churches;
language2_text: Namen manovoy so yasa ka tao a macihza jya. Iya rana am da ikanig no tao do peycyakyokyokayan na a yameylimwang no Mapasaray a Ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: and not that only, but who was also chosen of the churches to travel with us with this grace, which is administered by us to the glory of the same Lord, and declaration of your ready mind:
language2_text: Beken a ori an, ta iya rana am da nitenngan no peycyakyokyokayan na yamacilivon jyamen a mapeyvazay so pangangarilawan na ni Ama ta do to. O namen ahapan so akman sya vazay am yatomngeh do azwazway ni Ama ta do to a ipakateneng da jyamen a meyngongyod so nakenakem a mangarilaw so tao.

language1_text: avoiding this, that no man should blame us in this abundance which is administered by us:
language2_text: Namen apzatan o onowned namen a yatomalamozong no aro a nizpi. Ta maraherahet o kazyak da nyamen no aro a tao.

language1_text: providing for honest things, not only in the sight of the Lord, but also in the sight of men.
language2_text: Beken a do tangain ni Ama ta do to o kapya namen so icicirawat. Ta akman sang do tangain no tao.

language1_text: And we have sent with them our brother, whom we have oftentimes proved diligent in many things, but now much more diligent, upon the great confidence which I have in you.
language2_text: Am ori o namen ipanovoy so yasa ka mahakay a macihza jira. Iya rana am namen masangib rana yaileylamdamen so onowned. Am ori o namen pakatenngan jya a tey makdeng a yamanidong so tao. Am ori o na ikasaray so onowned a yasomidong jinyo.

language1_text: Whether any do enquire of Titus, he is my partner and fellowhelper concerning you: or our brethren be enquired of, they are the messengers of the churches, and the glory of Christ.
language2_text: Si Tito rana am kararay ko ya a yasomidong jinyo. O yamacihza jya rarwa ka mahakay am nitenngan da no peycyakyokyokayan na. So ikanoyong da pacikazwayan ni Kizisto.

language1_text: Wherefore shew ye to them, and before the churches, the proof of your love, and of our boasting on your behalf.
language2_text: Taotawwen nyo sira a kamimin da no aro a kyokay a makateneng do akman sang a pangarilawan nyo a kaji da palasan so nyazwazwayan namen jinyo.

language1_text: For as touching the ministering to the saints, it is superfluous for me to write to you:
language2_text: O vazay rana do sidongan ta so sinjya do Yotay am tana ji ko na meyteygami jinyo.

language1_text: for I know the forwardness of your mind, for which I boast of you to them of Macedonia, that Achaia was ready a year ago; and your zeal hath provoked very many.
language2_text: Am cyaha, ta ko katenngan o na kajya salitan jinyo. Ta nyazwazway ko inyo do tao do Maciton, do kanimapapo nyo sya no kaminasawan so kasidong nyo sira. So da peyzokaban inyo a tao do Sila a yatey makdeng a yamanidong so tao.

language1_text: Yet have I sent the brethren, lest our boasting of you should be in vain in this behalf; that, as I said, ye may be ready:
language2_text: So ko tovoyan si Tito a kano rarwa a akma tey kakteh do cinai a mangay jinyo do dang. Inaoy si mangononong o ciring ko do kanoyong na rana no kingking nyo amyan rana. So ipacimangno na no namen azwazwayan jinyo.

language1_text: lest haply if they of Macedonia come with me, and find you unprepared, we (that we say not, ye) should be ashamed in this same confident boasting.
language2_text: No si myan so tao do Maciton a macihza jyamen a mangay a kapakateneng da do kingking nyo abo am jyabo kaji namen anigan a. So ikakman nyo sang a manig an.

language1_text: Therefore I thought it necessary to exhort the brethren, that they would go before unto you, and make up beforehand your bounty, whereof ye had notice before, that the same might be ready, as a matter of bounty, and not as of covetousness.
language2_text: Am ori an o ikapyapya pa no kapanovoy ko pala sira a manmanma a mangay jinyo do dang a amlovot so nipanci nyo a kingking nyo no kakwa pa. Inaoy no si manoyong rana myan no si makaranes ko na jinyo dang. Ta ori o pakatovilan da jinyo a masaray a manidong so tao.

language1_text: But this I say, He which soweth sparingly shall reap also sparingly; and he which soweth bountifully shall reap also bountifully.
language2_text: Manakem nyo an. Ta o apereh so nipamowa am apereh o mahap da. O aro so nipamowa am aro mahap da.

language1_text: Every man according as he purposeth in his heart, so let him give; not grudgingly, or of necessity: for God loveth a cheerful giver.
language2_text: Am to nyo palololwa o kingking nyo do onowned nyo. Ji nyo manenesehan, ta makto nyo an. Ta isaray na ni Ama ta do to o masaray so onowned a meykingking jya tao.

language1_text: And God is able to make all grace abound toward you; that ye, always having all sufficiency in all things, may abound to every good work:
language2_text: Ta arakorako pa o itoro na jinyo ni Ama ta do to. So ikanoyong nyo to meypanpan do kanekanen nyo a manidong so ikeykasi nyo a tao.

language1_text: (As it is written, He hath dispersed abroad; he hath given to the poor: His righteousness remaineth for ever.
language2_text: Akman so ciring do Seysyo. Maniring am, "O manidong so makasi a tao am peyyanen na ni Ama ta do to do onowned na a mangay no makwa."

language1_text: Now he that ministereth seed to the sower both minister bread for your food, and multiply your seed sown, and increase the fruits of your righteousness;)
language2_text: Si Ama ta do to am yapwan no mowahen da kano kanen da. Akman sang an, ta anoyngan nyo si Ama ta do to a manta ninyo so makakaday a ipanidong nyo so tao. So ikakman nyo so kayo so pangangarilawan a mapka no asi na.

language1_text: being enriched in every thing to all bountifulness, which causeth through us thanksgiving to God.
language2_text: Absoin na inyo an. So ikasangib nyo a manidong so tao an. So sarayan da nya ji Ama ta do to so apo jinyo a nisidong nyo sira.

language1_text: For the administration of this service not only supplieth the want of the saints, but is abundant also by many thanksgivings unto God;
language2_text: Ta o kingking nyo am yamanoyong yamakasidong so sinjya. So ikanoyong da no aro a tao a somaray nya ji Ama ta do to.

language1_text: whiles by the experiment of this ministration they glorify God for your professed subjection unto the gospel of Christ, and for your liberal distribution unto them, and unto all men;
language2_text: O akman rana sang a ipanidong nyo so tao am ipakateneng da jinyo no aro a tao a yaomonot ji Kizisto a yaji mapasala do nanao ni Kizisto a yamanidong so tao. Am ori o da miminan so azwazway a itoro ji Ama ta do to no aro a tao.

language1_text: and by their prayer for you, which long after you for the exceeding grace of God in you.
language2_text: So da ikakdeng no tao a yameyneynozi ninyo, do da kapakacita so aryarilaw na jinyo ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: Thanks be unto God for his unspeakable gift.
language2_text: Isaray ta ji Ama ta do to, do na kateywara no pangangarilawan na a yana nitoro jyaten!

language1_text: Now I Paul myself beseech you by the meekness and gentleness of Christ, who in presence am base among you, but being absent am bold toward you:
language2_text: Yaken rana am si Pawlo ko a yamvavaga jinyo. No kamo maniring am, "Ka apiya so ciring no ka macikaop jyamen. No ka ji macikaop jyamen am mo ji ngeypeypepzaci yamen do teygami mo," kwan nyo yaken. Am sicyaikwa rana ya am ko na hapen o kapyapya na ni Kizisto a yamapasyasi jinyo.

language1_text: but I beseech you, that I may not be bold when I am present with that confidence, wherewith I think to be bold against some, which think of us as if we walked according to the flesh.
language2_text: Ji nyo ngakzeba o kanig ko ninyo no si mai ko an. Ta jyabo kanig ko no yatomamwad jyamen a, a yamanci no namen kapazway so aktokto namen.

language1_text: For though we walk in the flesh, we do not war after the flesh:
language2_text: Tana namen macizavoz do tao do karawan am o namen ipacirawarawa am beken a yamonganay do karawan.

language1_text: (for the weapons of our warfare are not carnal, but mighty through God to the pulling down of strong holds;)
language2_text: Ta o voovoo namen am beken a yamonganay do oyowyat a kano teneteneng do karawan. Ta o oyowyat na ni Ama ta do to o voovoo namen a yato manbalinas so vazay ni Satan a yamangalalas so tao.

language1_text: casting down imaginations, and every high thing that exalteth itself against the knowledge of God, and bringing into captivity every thought to the obedience of Christ;
language2_text: Namen pahawahen so makakaday a mapazway a ciriciring a kano malas a nakenakem a yada izazat do tao a makateneng ji Ama ta do to. So namen pangozayan do oyowyat ni Ama ta do to a yamapanod so ji manaralay a tao ji Kizisto.

language1_text: and having in a readiness to revenge all disobedience, when your obedience is fulfilled.
language2_text: No si manoyong o kanod nyo rana ji Ama ta do to am ioya namen sira o ji ngonot a tao.

language1_text: Do ye look on things after the outward appearance? If any man trust to himself that he is Christ's, let him of himself think this again, that, as he is Christ's, even so are we Christ's.
language2_text: O vazay no tao o macita nyo. Am nyo jyacita o onowned no tao. No si amyan so tao a manci no katalamozong na ni Ama ta do to am manakenakem pa an. Ta beken a iyaha o yamonganay ji Kizisto. Ta namen akman sang a yamonganay ji Kizisto.

language1_text: For though I should boast somewhat more of our authority, which the Lord hath given us for edification, and not for your destruction, I should not be ashamed:
language2_text: O na nitoro jyamen ni Yeso Kizisto a vazay namen am namen sidongen inyo. Beken a namen ipeyparaherahet inyo. Am ori an, tana teywara o pazwayan namen so vazay namen am jyabo kanig namen a.

language1_text: that I may not seem as if I would terrify you by letters.
language2_text: Ji nyo mancyan o kangangamo ko jinyo no ciring ko do teygami an.

language1_text: For his letters, say they, are weighty and powerful; but his bodily presence is weak, and his speech contemptible.
language2_text: Yamyan so tao a yamapeyciring so, "No yameyvatvatek si Pawlo am tana yamangdet pa, yajyowyat am. Am no yana to macimata eya am malma, yabo so oyowyat a yamarahet so ipanirisiring."

language1_text: Let such an one think this, that, such as we are in word by letters when we are absent, such will we be also in deed when we are present.
language2_text: O mapeyciring sya a tao am naknakmen da an, no kabo namen an. Ikongo ciring namen do teygami. Jyabo namen kapacitarek so yanamen ahahapan sya do namen yai rana.

language1_text: For we dare not make ourselves of the number, or compare ourselves with some that commend themselves: but they measuring themselves by themselves, and comparing themselves among themselves, are not wise.
language2_text: Namen jyadkeci namen kapazanod so kataotao namen do yamapakarakarang so kataotao da. Ta yamanoyong da kakmey ji makownong jya an, a yamapehngay so kataotao da do kadwan jira.

language1_text: But we will not boast of things without our measure, but according to the measure of the rule which God hath distributed to us, a measure to reach even unto you.
language2_text: Jyabo na kateywara no namen pazwayan so kataotao namen. Ta o vazay namen ji Ama ta do to na pamindan. So na nipaminda jinyo no vazay namen a namen pazwain.

language1_text: For we stretch not ourselves beyond our measure, as though we reached not unto you: for we are come as far as to you also in preaching the gospel of Christ:
language2_text: No manoyong na kapaminda jinyo am yajyalas o na kaji meyhavasan no ciring ni Kizisto a yanamen ipamizing jinyo, do kaney manma namen a yameylimwang no Mapasaray a Ciriciring na ni Kizisto jinyo.

language1_text: not boasting of things without our measure, that is, of other men's labours; but having hope, when your faith is increased, that we shall be enlarged by you according to our rule abundantly,
language2_text: O yanamen jya nimatokod rana a ili am namen jyadkeci a yapazwain a manci no kanimapeyvazay namen sya. Am namen isaray o kapeypahagnat no onowned nyo. Ta ori o karakorako na pa no vazay namen jinyo,

language1_text: to preach the gospel in the regions beyond you, and not to boast in another man's line of things made ready to our hand.
language2_text: a yangay namen pa do peycyeylilyan na a peylimwangan no Mapasaray a Ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to. So ji namen mapazwai so nipakavos da vazay no tao a kazwayan namen.

language1_text: But he that glorieth, let him glory in the Lord.
language2_text: Akman so ciring do Seysyo. Maniring am, "O mapazway a tao am apyapya o kapazway na so vazay na ni Ama ta do to a Panirsirngen ta."

language1_text: For not he that commendeth himself is approved, but whom the Lord commendeth.
language2_text: Ta o ipanci na ni Ama ta do to apya so vazay am ori o manoyong a azwazwain. Ta o mapazway so kataotao na am ji na narayan ni Ama ta do to o akman sang.

language1_text: Would to God ye could bear with me a little in my folly: and indeed bear with me.
language2_text: Tana ji ko a teneteneng am amizngen nyo pa yaken an.

language1_text: For I am jealous over you with godly jealousy: for I have espoused you to one husband, that I may present you as a chaste virgin to Christ.
language2_text: Yaken rana am yako pangozayan o pangangarilawan na ni Ama ta do to a yamarilaw ninyo. Kamo akman so jya nimacivahavahay a mavakes a yako tovoin a someksek ji Kizisto.
