language1_text: There remaineth therefore a rest to the people of God.
language2_text: So na ikanoyong ni Ama ta do to a yanimangata so kasaraw a yana itaziman do yamonganay jya tao.

language1_text: For he that is entered into his rest, he also hath ceased from his own works, as God did from his.
language2_text: Ta o tao rana a macikaop ji Ama ta do to am mahap da rana o keylamnayan da kano ikapiya no onowned da, do kapeyhanhan da ni Ama ta do to a macikaop rana jira.

language1_text: Let us labour therefore to enter into that rest, lest any man fall after the same example of unbelief.
language2_text: Am ori o ikowyowyat ta pa a omonot do ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to. Ta ori o ipacikaop ta ji Ama ta do to. Sino ka paro a ominara so ji nganoyong do ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to a tao a yatey marahet so vazay.

language1_text: For the word of God is quick, and powerful, and sharper than any twoedged sword, piercing even to the dividing asunder of soul and spirit, and of the joints and marrow, and is a discerner of the thoughts and intents of the heart.
language2_text: O Ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to am tey rako o oyowyat na. So ikowyowyat na pa kano matarem a takzes a to makatjip so asisi a kano totowang. So ikakman na sang so kowyowyat no Ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to a makateneng do onowned a nakenakem no tao.

language1_text: Neither is there any creature that is not manifest in his sight: but all things are naked and opened unto the eyes of him with whom we have to do.
language2_text: Abo o makatayo do tangain ni Ama ta do to. O yamakakaday do karawan a nyamaog na am yabo na jyacita so vazay. So ikamimin ta katenngan na so onowned do tangain ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: Seeing then that we have a great high priest, that is passed into the heavens, Jesus the Son of God, let us hold fast our profession.
language2_text: Am ori o pangozayan ta do nakem ta yamraralay ni Ama ta do to. Ta yata ipeyhanhan si Yeso a ney manhama na mapatanatanang nyaten so nakem ta ji Ama ta do to. Iya rana am Anak ni Ama ta do to a yarana myan do tangain ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: For we have not an high priest which cannot be touched with the feeling of our infirmities; but was in all points tempted like as we are, yet without sin.
language2_text: Si Yeso Kizisto am panoyngen na yaten a tao do karawan a ji makanet so nakenakem. Ta iya rana am nimasapa na o makakaday a ilita na jya ni Satan. Am jya nikalittan. Iya am abo o raraten na.

language1_text: Let us therefore come boldly unto the throne of grace, that we may obtain mercy, and find grace to help in time of need.
language2_text: Am ori an, ji tamo a mogawi a omasngen do tangain ni Ama ta do to a omahap so itoro na jyaten a pangangasyan na kano pangangarilawan na a isidong ta so kataotao ta no makasazi ta so alalaw ta.

language1_text: For every high priest taken from among men is ordained for men in things pertaining to God, that he may offer both gifts and sacrifices for sins:
language2_text: O nipamnekan da no tao do Yotay a panirsirngen no mapatanatanang so nakem da si Ama ta do to am mapasyasi nira ji Ama ta do to, a mapatanang nira so makakaday a sarayan da ni Ama ta do to, kapatanang na so rala no kagling a kano baka a ivonas na so raraten da.

language1_text: who can have compassion on the ignorant, and on them that are out of the way; for that he himself also is compassed with infirmity.
language2_text: Amyan so karatan na no mapatanatanang so nakem da tao, ta meyyangay sira tao. Am ori o kanigan na no amyan so kalasan a tao a mapasyasi nira ji Ama ta do to.

language1_text: And by reason hereof he ought, as for the people, so also for himself, to offer for sins.
language2_text: Ori o pazanodan na so kataotao na ipasyasi ji Ama ta do to a ivonas na so raraten da.

language1_text: And no man taketh this honour unto himself, but he that is called of God, as was Aaron.
language2_text: Abo o tao a mapasolib so kataotao na do panirsirngen no mapatanatanang so nakem da si Ama ta do to. Ta o nitenngan ni Ama ta do to o mangay do dang, akman so tao a meyngaran so Yalon.

language1_text: So also Christ glorified not himself to be made an high priest; but he that said unto him, Thou art my Son, To day have I begotten thee.
language2_text: Yakman sang si Kizisto a yaji nimamnek do kataotao na a panirsirngen no mapatanatanang so nakem ta si Ama ta do to, ta nakenakem na ni Ama ta do to a nimamnek jya. Ta maniring si Ama ta do to jya am, "Imo am Anak ko imo an. So peylimwangan ko nimo a mapeyyama jyaken sicyaraw eya."

language1_text: As he saith also in another place, Thou art a priest for everAfter the order of Melchisedec.
language2_text: Maniring pa am, "Imo rana am akman ka si Mocisete a mapatanatanang so nakem no tao a mapasyasi nira jyaken a mangay do kaidan no karawan."

language1_text: Who in the days of his flesh, when he had offered up prayers and supplications with strong crying and tears unto him that was able to save him from death, and was heard in that he feared;
language2_text: No keyyan na pa ni Yeso do karawan am nimlolos a mapasyasi ji Ama ta do to a mapatastas sya do kawakwakan na. So niiteng no kaoo na mapasyasi ji Ama ta do to. Ikongo do nipehbo na o kataotao na, am ori o nyamizngan na sya ni Ama ta do to so ciring na.

language1_text: though he were a Son, yet learned he obedience by the things which he suffered;
language2_text: Tana Anak na ni Ama ta do to am nimasazi na o alalaw a ipeypahagnat na so nakem na a omonot ji Ama ta do to.

language1_text: and being made perfect, he became the author of eternal salvation unto all them that obey him;
language2_text: Komavos o vazay na ni Yeso am tombod rana jya o to meyyonong a ikavyay no pahad da no yaomonot jya tao,

language1_text: called of God an high priest after the order of Melchisedec.
language2_text: a kapamnek na ji Yeso ni Ama ta do to a ney manhama na a mapatanatanang nyaten so nakem ta ji Ama ta do to a mangay do kaidan no karawan, akman si Mocisete.

language1_text: Of whom we have many things to say, and hard to be uttered, seeing ye are dull of hearing.
language2_text: O akman rana sang a vazay am yaro pa dang o ciring ko a yamakekdeng am nyo kaji makazazaban a tao.

language1_text: For when for the time ye ought to be teachers, ye have need that one teach you again which be the first principles of the oracles of God; and are become such as have need of milk, and not of strong meat.
language2_text: No kamo mowyat a yamacinanao am kamo na mangnanao. Am asyosyo kamo eya a yada pananawen no tao no yatodalapit a ciring na ni Ama ta do to. So nyo icyakmey metdeh a yapa somoso.

language1_text: For every one that useth milk is unskilful in the word of righteousness: for he is a babe.
language2_text: O somoso a tao am ji pa makaveyvow. So ji na makatenngi do apya kano marahet.

language1_text: But strong meat belongeth to them that are of full age, even those who by reason of use have their senses exercised to discern both good and evil.
language2_text: O asa ka ciring dang am o makaveyvow o koman so cinvevekeh, ta mapeyneynara da rana. Akman so sang o makaveyvow a tao a makateneng do apya kano marahet.

language1_text: Therefore leaving the principles of the doctrine of Christ, let us go on unto perfection; not laying again the foundation of repentance from dead works, and of faith toward God,
language2_text: Yaten rana am meypahagnat tamo rana so nakem ji Ama ta do to. Taosya o kato ta oliolyan sya amizngen so ta na katenngan a nanao ni Ama ta do to do kapamlis a manganoyong,

language1_text: of the doctrine of baptisms, and of laying on of hands, and of resurrection of the dead, and of eternal judgment.
language2_text: a kano nanao na jyaten do manaktak a kano panlanlagan da nyaten no tao a mapaopta so lima da jyaten a kano nanao a omaing do mirwa mavyay a kano nanao na omaing do peykapyapinpinan na so tao ni Ama ta do to. Ta o akman rana sang am yatey masangib rana ori a yata mamizing.

language1_text: And this will we do, if God permit.
language2_text: Am ori an, ipeypahagnat tamo a macinanao do makdeng a nanao ni Ama ta do to. Ta ori o isaray na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: For it is impossible for those who were once enlightened, and have tasted of the heavenly gift, and were made partakers of the Holy Ghost,
language2_text: Ta o yamlikod do nanao ni Ama ta do to a tao am makongo sira ori a mamlis, do katenngan da rana si Ama ta do to, a nimakahap rana so karilawan na nira ni Ama ta do to, a yanan rana no Seyzi.

language1_text: and have tasted the good word of God, and the powers of the world to come,
language2_text: Sira rana am mapeyneynara da rana o katey yapya na no ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to. So da ipakateneng do mapeyzokab a oyowyat ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: if they shall fall away, to renew them again unto repentance; seeing they crucify to themselves the Son of God afresh, and put him to an open shame.
language2_text: Sira rana ya a to ngaro do manoyong a nanao ni Ama ta do to am abo rana o tao a makapeysinaoli so nakenakem da. Ta sira rana am akmey to da oliya o Anak ni Ama ta do to a padketen do jyojika a peyleylaken do tangain no tao.

language1_text: For the earth which drinketh in the rain that cometh oft upon it, and bringeth forth herbs meet for them by whom it is dressed, receiveth blessing from God:
language2_text: No masangib a kacimoyan o nihakawan am isaod na. O akman rana sang am tey yapya do mata no mapeynihakawan sya. Am ori rana am si Ama ta do to o mapasaod sya.

language1_text: but that which beareth thorns and briers is rejected, and is nigh unto cursing; whose end is to be burned.
language2_text: Am no maday a tamek omlida do nihakawan am to rana wagwaga o akman sang. O akman sang a tao am balinasen na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: But, beloved, we are persuaded better things of you, and things that accompany salvation, though we thus speak.
language2_text: Am inyo rana manga keypong am tana akman sang o ciring ko am yako anoyngan o kapyapya na pa no mahap nyo a patazadangen na ni Ama ta do to do teyngato.

language1_text: For God is not unrighteous to forget your work and labour of love, which ye have shewed toward his name, in that ye have ministered to the saints, and do minister.
language2_text: Ji mapeycyakaban si Ama ta do to. So na ji makahamangi do pangangarilawan nyo a kano vazay nyo. Ori rana am vazay nyo do karwan no sinjya a yajimtad a yasomidong sira.

language1_text: And we desire that every one of you do shew the same diligence to the full assurance of hope unto the end:
language2_text: O ney makdeng na yako kakzeben jinyo am mamimin kamo a jyablis so kakdekdeng so nakem a mangay no makwa. Ta ori o ipangononong no makakaday a kakdain nyo no nakem a itoro na jinyo ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: that ye be not slothful, but followers of them who through faith and patience inherit the promises.
language2_text: Namen ji mamyapyan inyo a malma so onowned. Inarahen nyo sira o yaji macizizikna a yaomanoyong ji Ama ta do to a tao. Ta ori o ipakahap nyo so makakaday a nakem na jinyo ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: For when God made promise to Abraham, because he could swear by no greater, he sware by himself,
language2_text: Nipanci na ni Ama ta do to ji Apolahan o keyyan no nakem na jya. Am to na mangozai o ngaran na a manci no keyyan no nakem na ji Apolahan, do kabo no makahad si Ama ta do to do karawan.

language1_text: saying, Surely blessing I will bless thee, and multiplying I will multiply thee.
language2_text: Maniring am, "Pangononongan ko o aryarilaw ko jimo a mapasaod so sivosivovoong mo."

language1_text: And so, after he had patiently endured, he obtained the promise.
language2_text: Ji na macimangsahi ni Apolahan a pananalahen. Makarahan am mahap na rana o nakem na sya ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: For men verily swear by the greater: and an oath for confirmation is to them an end of all strife.
language2_text: O tao rana do karawan am no amyan so makdeng a ciring da am manara sira so meynakem a tao a omamizing so ciring da a omagaz do ikazyak da a izavat da so masalit a vazay.

language1_text: Wherein God, willing more abundantly to shew unto the heirs of promise the immutability of his counsel, confirmed it by an oath:
language2_text: Mina to na rana mancyan ni Ama ta do to o kaji na ablisan no nakenakem na sira so tao a omamoon so mina ciring na jira. Am ori o nyaitan na do ciring na ni Ama ta do to akma ney yongkad. O nipasongsong na ciring am ngaran na ni Ama ta do to,

language1_text: that by two immutable things, in which it was impossible for God to lie, we might have a strong consolation, who have fled for refuge to lay hold upon the hope set before us:
language2_text: a ipadnadna na so nakem ta a yameyhanhan nya. Ta iya rana am jyabliblis o ahahapan na sya.

language1_text: which hope we have as an anchor of the soul, both sure and stedfast, and which entereth into that within the veil;
language2_text: Yamyan rana jyaten so yata ipeyhanhan. So icyakma ney nitkehnan a lalitan no pahad ta, yarana jyagonagonay a meypangay nyaten do tangain na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: whither the forerunner is for us entered, even Jesus, made an high priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec.
language2_text: Si Yeso am yarana nimanmanma a nimangay do tangain ni Ama ta do to a mapasyasi nyaten. So ikanoyong na ney manhama na mapatanatanang nyaten so nakem ta ji Ama ta do to a mangay do kaidan no karawan, akman si Mocisete.

language1_text: For this Melchisedec, king of Salem, priest of the most high God, who met Abraham returning from the slaughter of the kings, and blessed him;
language2_text: O meyngaran so Mocisete am panirsirngen da no Saleng. Iya ori am panirsirngen da no mapatanatanang nira so nakem da ji Ama ta do to. Teyka na sira balinasen ni Apolahan o apat a ka panirsirngen am meysinaoli rana. Meyratateng am rapongen na no meyngaran so Mocisete a kapanlanlag na nya.

language1_text: to whom also Abraham gave a tenth part of all; first being by interpretation King of righteousness, and after that also King of Salem, which is, King of peace;
language2_text: O ineynahap ni Apolahan a apzapzatan no kapeyyarap da am pasinahen na o asa vovonongan a itoro ji Mocisete. O peypeypangayan no ngaran ni Mocisete am "Ji mapeycyakaban so tao a panirsirngen". Ikongo do panirsirngen da no Saleng, am ori o pancyan da no ngaran na a "Ikapiya no onowned no tao a panirsirngen".

language1_text: without father, without mother, without descent, having neither beginning of days, nor end of life; but made like unto the Son of God; abideth a priest continually.
language2_text: Si Mocisete rana am abo do vakong o domket a ngaran no ama na kano ina na. So icyakman da sang no iteytetngehan da. So ji da nimapadkeci so araraw no cinatazak na kano cinawakwak na. So icyakma dey meyyangay a kano Anak ni Ama ta do to a mapatanatanang so nakem a mangay do kaidan no karawan.

language1_text: Now consider how great this man was, unto whom even the patriarch Abraham gave the tenth of the spoils.
language2_text: Naknakmen nyo pala. Jyabo na kajyahamahaman pa ni Mocisete do kanimapasina na no ineynapo ta si Apolahan so ineynahap na so asa vovonongan ji Mocisete.

language1_text: And verily they that are of the sons of Levi, who receive the office of the priesthood, have a commandment to take tithes of the people according to the law, that is, of their brethren, though they come out of the loins of Abraham:
language2_text: O apwapo da ni Diwey a mapatanatanang so nakem da si Ama ta do to am tana meyyangangay sira kano Isedi a tao a sivosivovoong ni Apolahan am to da mangozai o iwawalam a komakaday so Isedi a tao pangapan so asa vovonongan a kanen da a illam da sira.

language1_text: but he whose descent is not counted from them received tithes of Abraham, and blessed him that had the promises.
language2_text: Am tana ji macitetngehan si Mocisete ji Diwey am macivonong do ineynahap ni Apolahan so asa vovonongan a kapanlanlag na ni Mocisete si Apolahan a omamoon so mina ciring na jya ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: And without all contradiction the less is blessed of the better.
language2_text: O manlanlag no tao am makarakarang pa sira ori a kano ipanlanlag da tao. So ji na alasi no akman sang a ciring.

language1_text: And here men that die receive tithes; but there he receiveth them, of whom it is witnessed that he liveth.
language2_text: O mapatanatanang so nakem da si Ama ta do to am mangap sira do tao so asa vovonongan a illam da sira. Am mawakwak pa sira ang. Am si Mocisete am tana nimangap so asa vovonongan am akmey todavyay, do kaji da nimvatvatkan do Seysyo so araraw no cinatazak na kano cinawakwak na.

language1_text: And as I may so say, Levi also, who receiveth tithes, payed tithes in Abraham.
language2_text: Am ori an, mapasina si Apolahan so asa vovonongan am akmey to macizanod si Diwey a manta ni Mocisete so asa vovonongan.

language1_text: For he was yet in the loins of his father, when Melchisedec met him.
language2_text: Am no kangay na amrapong si Apolahan ni Mocisete am ji pa nimalikey si Diwey. Am macitetngehan ji Apolahan.

language1_text: If therefore perfection were by the Levitical priesthood, (for under it the people received the law, ) what further need was there that another priest should rise after the order of Melchisedec, and not be called after the order of Aaron?
language2_text: O iwawalam no Isedi a tao am nimakalapo no kakwa o kapangozay da do iwawalam ni Diwey a mapatanang so nakem da ji Ama ta do to. No makanet rana ori a ipakasalap ta do teyngato am ikongo tovoyan na pa ni Ama ta do to si Yeso Kizisto a mapatanatanang nyaten so nakem ta ji Ama ta do to akman si Mocisete, a iblis na so adan a iwawalam ni Yalon.

language1_text: For the priesthood being changed, there is made of necessity a change also of the law.
language2_text: Tovoin na ni Ama ta do to si Kizisto am mablis rana o iwawalam no mapatanatanang so nakem no kakwa.

language1_text: For he of whom these things are spoken pertaineth to another tribe, of which no man gave attendance at the altar. For it is evident that our Lord sprang out of Juda; of which tribe Moses spake nothing concerning priesthood.
language2_text: Ta si Yeso a Panirsirngen ta am yaji monganay do iteytetngehan ni Diwey. Ta macitetngehan da Yoda. Sira rana am abo pa jira o nimangay do mapatanang so nakem no tao ji Ama ta do to. Ta no kapakalavat ni Moyse so mapatanatanang so nakem si Ama ta do to am ji na nimalavat o itetngehan da Yoda.Ta si Yeso a Panirsirngen ta am yaji monganay do iteytetngehan ni Diwey. Ta macitetngehan da Yoda. Sira rana am abo pa jira o nimangay do mapatanang so nakem no tao ji Ama ta do to. Ta no kapakalavat ni Moyse so mapatanatanang so nakem si Ama ta do to am ji na nimalavat o itetngehan da Yoda.

language1_text: And it is yet far more evident: for that after the similitude of Melchisedec there ariseth another priest, who is made, not after the law of a carnal commandment, but after the power of an endless life.
language2_text: Yarana mapengkad sicyaikwaya o na kaniomablis rana ni Ama ta do to so iwawalam ni Moyse. Ta si Yeso rana o yavayo a mapatanatanang nyaten so nakem ta ji Ama ta do to yakman si Mocisete. Ta beken a na pangozayan o iwawalam no tao. Ta na pangozayan o na kato meyyonongan a mavyay a Tao do to. Yarana mapengkad sicyaikwaya o na kaniomablis rana ni Ama ta do to so iwawalam ni Moyse. Ta si Yeso rana o yavayo a mapatanatanang nyaten so nakem ta ji Ama ta do to yakman si Mocisete. Ta beken a na pangozayan o iwawalam no tao. Ta na pangozayan o na kato meyyonongan a mavyay a Tao do to.

language1_text: For he testifieth, Thou art a priest for everAfter the order of Melchisedec.
language2_text: Ta maniring do Seysyo am, "Imo rana am mapatanatanang ka so nakem no tao a mapasyasi nira jyaken a mangay do kaidan no karawan, akman si Mocisete."

language1_text: For there is verily a disannulling of the commandment going before for the weakness and unprofitableness thereof.
language2_text: So na rana ikablis no adan a iwawalam ni Moyse, ta yabo oyowyat na mapatazadang jyaten do teyngato.

language1_text: For the law made nothing perfect, but the bringing in of a better hope did; by the which we draw nigh unto God.
language2_text: Am cyaha, ta yarana myan so yapyapya pa hanhan ta a mapanop jyaten ji Ama ta do do. Iya rana am si Yeso Kizisto.

language1_text: And inasmuch as not without an oath he was made priest:
language2_text: Amyan so apyapya pa nyahahapan na sya ni Ama ta do to. Ta no kapamnek na ji Yeso a mapatanatanang so nakem am amyan so makdeng a ciring na. Ta no kapamnek da no tao do sivosivovoong ni Diwey a mapatanatanang so nakem am abo o makdeng a ciring na jira ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: (for those priests were made without an oath; but this with an oath by him that said unto him, The Lord sware and will not repent, Thou art a priest for everAfter the order of Melchisedec:)
language2_text: Am si Yeso am amyan so ciring na sya ni Ama ta do to. Maniring am, "Ji ko na ablisi o nakenakem ko a mamnek jimo a mapatanatanang so nakem no tao a mapasyasi nira jyaken a mangay do kaidan no karawan."

language1_text: By so much was Jesus made a surety of a better testament.
language2_text: So ikanoyong na ni Yeso Kizisto a yongkad ni Ama ta do to a mangononong do vayo a pangozayan a ciring na jyaten. So ikapyapya na pa no vayo a pangozayan a ciring na ni Ama ta do to a kano adan a ciring na a nitaid na ji Moyse.

language1_text: And they truly were many priests, because they were not suffered to continue by reason of death:
language2_text: O asa pa ko ipanci am o nipanlanlag da mapatanatanang so nakem no tao no kakwa am aro sira mapalipalit. Ta no mawakwak sira am todakteb rana o vazay da.

language1_text: but this man, because he continueth ever, hath an unchangeable priesthood.
language2_text: Am si Yeso rana am yato meyyonong a yamavyay. So yana ikabo no tao a makamoon so vazay na.

language1_text: Wherefore he is able also to save them to the uttermost that come unto God by him, seeing he ever liveth to make intercession for them.
language2_text: Am ori o yana ikanoyong a yamakasidong so yaomanop ji Ama ta do to a tao, do yana kato meyyonongan a mavyay a yamapasyasi nyaten ji Ama ta do to.

language1_text: For such an high priest became us, who is holy, harmless, undefiled, separate from sinners, and made higher than the heavens;
language2_text: So yana ikanoyong ni Yeso a ney manokdwan na a ta ipeyhanhan a mapatanatanang nyaten so nakem ta ji Ama ta do to. Ta yabo na karatan a yabo so raraten. Iya rana am na nipapinpin ni Ama ta do to do yameyraraten a tao. So ikanoyong na rana ney mazway na do teyrahem a kado teyngato.

language1_text: who needeth not daily, as those high priests, to offer up sacrifice, first for his own sins, and then for the people's: for this he did once, when he offered up himself.
language2_text: Iya am yamacitarek a kano aro a panipanirsirngen no mapatanatanang so nakem, do yana kaji mangdayan so araraw a yamapatanang so nakem da a ivonas so raraten da no tao. Iya rana am ipisa mapatanang so nakem na kato na rana ngavosan. O na nipatanang am kataotao na.

language1_text: For the law maketh men high priests which have infirmity; but the word of the oath, which was since the law, maketh the Son, who is consecrated for evermore.
language2_text: O nipamnekan no iwawalam ni Moyse a mapatanatanang so nakem am tao sira. So iyan no karatan da. Am o nipamnekan ni Ama ta do to a mapatanatanang so nakem am Anak na. So ikabo no karatan na. So to na meyyonongi a makasidong so tao no vazay na mangay do kaidan no karawan.

language1_text: Now of the things which we have spoken this is the sum: We have such an high priest, who is set on the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens;
language2_text: O yamakdeng a yata malavat am yamyan so ney manhama na mapatanatanang nyaten so nakem ta si Ama ta do to. Iya rana am si Yeso a yamhezsad do wanan na ni Ama ta do to do teyngato.

language1_text: a minister of the sanctuary, and of the true tabernacle, which the Lord pitched, and not man.
language2_text: Iya rana am yamyan do yamanoyong a raralayan ni Ama ta do to do teyngato a mapasyasi nyaten ji Ama ta do to. Am o yana yanan am beken a nyamaog no tao, ta nyamaog ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: For every high priest is ordained to offer gifts and sacrifices: wherefore it is of necessity that this man have somewhat also to offer.
language2_text: O vazay da no panipanirsirngen no mapatanatanang so nakem ji Ama ta do to no kakwa am patanangen da o nakem da a sarayan da ni Ama ta do to, a kapatanang da so rala no kagling a kano baka a ivonas da so raraten da. So icyakman na sang ni Yeso a mapatanang ji Ama ta do to.

language1_text: For if he were on earth, he should not be a priest, seeing that there are priests that offer gifts according to the law:
language2_text: No yamyan pa si Yeso do teyrahem am ji na peyvazaya o kapatanatanang na so nakem no tao ji Ama ta do to, ta amyan rana so mapeyvazay sya a mangozay do iwawalam no tao do Yotay.

language1_text: who serve unto the example and shadow of heavenly things, as Moses was admonished of God when he was about to make the tabernacle: for, See, saith he, that thou make all things according to the pattern shewed to thee in the mount.
language2_text: O vazay na no mapatanatanang so nakem no tao ji Ama ta do to do teyrahem am akmey avwavong no meyngongyod a vazay do teyngato. Ta ninara da o vazay do panaralayan do teyngato. O ipakateneng ta do akman sang am yamyan do Seysyo o nipanci na ni Ama ta do to ji Moyse no kapangamaog na so raralayan da ni Ama ta do to. Maniring jya si Ama ta do to am, "Naknakmen mo an. Ta to mo peynara o panaralayan a nipacita ko jimo do tokon so kamamaogan a paringen."

language1_text: But now hath he obtained a more excellent ministry, by how much also he is the mediator of a better covenant, which was established upon better promises.
language2_text: Am o vazay na ni Yeso a mapatanatanang so nakem ta ji Ama ta do to am maharahara pa kano vazay da no mapatanatanang so nakem no tao do teyrahem. Ta si Yeso rana am nipanop na yaten no vayo a pangozayan a ciring na ni Ama ta do to. O vayo a pangozayan a ciring na ni Ama ta do to am omaing do mina ciring na ni Ama ta do to so omanoyong jya tao. So ikapyapya na pa no nang a kano adan a pangozayan a ciring.

language1_text: For if that first covenant had been faultless, then should no place have been sought for the second.
language2_text: No abo karatan no manmanma a pangozayan a ciring am tana abo o ikadwa no pangozayan a ciring am makanet rana.

language1_text: For finding fault with them, he saith, Behold, the days come, saith the Lord, When I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and with the house of Judah:
language2_text: Am ioya na ni Ama ta do to o Isedi a tao. Maniring am, "Yarana makeykai o araraw no patnekan ko no Isedi a tao a kano Yoda tao so vayo a pangozayan a ciring.

language1_text: Not according to the covenant that I made with their fathersIn the day when I took them by the hand to lead them out of the land of Egypt; Because they continued not in my covenant, And I regarded them not, saith the Lord.
language2_text: O vayo a pangozayan da ciring am ji meyyangay a kano adan a nipangozayan da a ciring no ineynapo da no kakwa. Ta no kanang am nikalay ko o lima da a nyagag do Ayci. Am da ji mangononongi o nitoro ko jira a pangozayan da a ciring. Am ori o nipancyan ko no, 'Ji ko na peyvazaya sira.'

language1_text: For this is the covenant that I will make with the house of IsraelAfter those days, saith the Lord; I will put my laws into their mind, And write them in their hearts: And I will be to them a God, And they shall be to me a people:
language2_text: Maniring pa jira si Ama ta do to am, 'Ipatnek ko sira o Isedi a tao so pangozayan da a ciring no makwa. Peydednahen ko o iwawalam ko do oo da kapangay ko sya do onowned da. Abneken da yaken a Tao do to da. Abneken ko sira akma koy anak.

language1_text: And they shall not teach every man his neighbour, And every man his brother, saying, Know the Lord: For all shall know me, From the least to the greatest.
language2_text: Abo jira o manci nya do icyatatao da kano akma dey kakteh do cinai so kapanaralay da makateneng jyaken. Ta sira rana am tana kanakan a tana rarakeh am yatodamimin sira yamakateneng jyaken.

language1_text: For I will be merciful to their unrighteousness, And their sins and their iniquities will I remember no more.
language2_text: Vonasen ko o raraten da. Ji ko na naknakma o karatan da.'"

language1_text: In that he saith, A new covenant, he hath made the first old. Now that which decayeth and waxeth old is ready to vanish away.
language2_text: Yarana nimangamaog si Ama ta do to so vayo a pangozayan a ciring a nyalit na do adan a pangozayan a ciring. So to na rana tastasi no adan a pangozayan a ciring, ta abo rana o oyowyat na.

language1_text: Then verily the first covenant had also ordinances of divine service, and a worldly sanctuary.
language2_text: O manmanma a pangozayan a ciring na ni Ama ta do to am domket dang o katwatontonan no raralayan da ni Ama ta do to a kano nipatnek da no tao a vahay a raralayan da nya.

language1_text: For there was a tabernacle made; the first, wherein was the candlestick, and the table, and the shewbread; which is called the sanctuary.
language2_text: So nitnek na rana no akmey sarwap a ananaten da vahay a panaralayan. O manma aspangan do sahad na am ipanci da Meynakem a vahay, yanan no peyzeyzampwan a kano akakanan a kano nipatanang da ji Ama ta do to a pang.

language1_text: And after the second veil, the tabernacle which is called the Holiest of all;
language2_text: O peyyawwan no manma aspangan a kano katangked na vahay am milakayob o nipeyhawa da sya. O peyyawwan da sya no milakayob am Ney manokdwan na vahay.

language1_text: which had the golden censer, and the ark of the covenant overlaid round about with gold, wherein was the golden pot that had manna, and Aaron's rod that budded, and the tables of the covenant;
language2_text: Amyan dang so asleban da so mahangno a haneng. O panlenleban am ovay o akma ney kolit. O amyan pa dang am meykavahayan so ovay a kavangan. O makonokon do dang am tagaw a ovay a yanan no mana kano nitomyok a sisikod ni Yalon a kano vato a adketan no nanao na ni Ama ta do to a nitaid na ji Moyse.

language1_text: and over it the cherubims of glory shadowing the mercyseat; of which we cannot now speak particularly.
language2_text: O teyngato no kavangan am amyan dang so akmey tinsi a nyamaog no ovay a ngaranan da keloping. O peypeypangayan no nang am peydednan ni Ama ta do to. O panid no keloping ori am mavezay a ombonbon do pangapangayan da so rala no kagling a kano baka a ivonas so raraten no tao. O makakaday rana vazay am ji to mimin a ipanci sicyaikwaya.

language1_text: Now when these things were thus ordained, the priests went always into the first tabernacle, accomplishing the service of God.
language2_text: O katwatontonan no makakaday a vazay am mangday sira so araw o mapatanatanang so nakem a mangay do sahad no manma aspangan na vahay a mapatanang so nakem da ji Ama ta do to.

language1_text: But into the second went the high priest alone once every year, not without blood, which he offered for himself, and for the errors of the people:
language2_text: Am o Panirsirngen no mapatanatanang so nakem am no somdep do katangked na vahay am abo ikararwa na. Ipisa do kasa kawan a somdep. No somdep am mangap so rala no kagling a kano baka a patanangen na a ivonas na so monganay jya raraten na kano ji da ningongyod a raraten da no macikeylyan a tao.

language1_text: the Holy Ghost this signifying, that the way into the holiest of all was not yet made manifest, while as the first tabernacle was yet standing:
language2_text: O katwatontonan no raralayan ni Ama ta do to am Seyzi o mapananao nya. Ta no jyabalinas o akman so sang a adan a raralayan ni Ama ta do to am masalit o kato ngonongonongan jya no tao so kangay do tangain ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: which was a figure for the time then present, in which were offered both gifts and sacrifices, that could not make him that did the service perfect, as pertaining to the conscience;
language2_text: O peypeypangayan no yanimalavat ta makakaday a vazay ori am ipakateneng ta do kaji na makanetan no patanangen da kagling a kano baka ji Ama ta do to a ivonas so raraten no tao.

language1_text: which stood only in meats and drinks, and divers washings, and carnal ordinances, imposed on them until the time of reformation.
language2_text: Ta do ji na pa nimapatwawi ni Ama ta do to so apyapya pa kano adan a pangozayan a ciring am mamimin pa ori a omagaz do icicirawat a kano isovo a kanen.

language1_text: But Christ being come an high priest of good things to come, by a greater and more perfect tabernacle, not made with hands, that is to say, not of this building;
language2_text: Am yarana nimakaranes si Kizisto a ney manhama na yamapanop jyaten ji Ama ta do to a yamai no vayo a pangozayan a ciring na ni Ama ta do to. So na ikapyapya pa kano adan a pangozayan a ciring. So yana rana iyan do teyngato ni Yeso. Ta apyapya ori a kano nyamaog no tao do teyrahem a panaralayan.

language1_text: neither by the blood of goats and calves, but by his own blood he entered in once into the holy place, having obtained eternal redemption for us.
language2_text: Si Yeso Kizisto am ji rana mapalolo so rala no kagling a kano baka. Ta mina to na rana patananga o rala na ipatazadang na jyaten do teyngato. Am o akman rana sang a vazay am ipisa mapatanang nyaten a kakavos na rana a mangay do kaidan no karawan.

language1_text: For if the blood of bulls and of goats, and the ashes of an heifer sprinkling the unclean, sanctifieth to the purifying of the flesh:
language2_text: No si saboin o tao no nikataheman no nitemtem a avo no baka ranom a kapasaboy da jira so rala no kagling a kano baka do ipanci da akmey makanyaw do iwawalam da am todavoga rana sira.

language1_text: how much more shall the blood of Christ, who through the eternal Spirit offered himself without spot to God, purge your conscience from dead works to serve the living God?
language2_text: Kakwakwan na rana no rala no kagling a kano baka a ipanci da makavoga so nikaratan da. Imanngo rana o oyowyat no rala ni Kizisto. Ta nioyatan no Seyzi a mapatanang so abo so karatan a kataotao na ji Ama ta do to. Jyabo kaji na haraharan pa makavonas so marahet do onowned ta a ombalinas so malas a icicirawat ta. No si manoyong o kakman ta sang am manoyong ta pahanhanen na ni Ama ta do to do vazay na.

language1_text: And for this cause he is the mediator of the new testament, that by means of death, for the redemption of the transgressions that were under the first testament, they which are called might receive the promise of eternal inheritance.
language2_text: So ikanoyong ni Kizisto a yatomalamozong no vayo a pangozayan a ciring na ni Ama ta do to a somidong so nipamnekan na tao a omahap so nakem na jira. So na ikanoyong ni Kizisto a niomagag sira do raraten da a ji ngonot do manmanma pangozayan a ciring a nitaid na ji Moyse ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: For where a testament is, there must also of necessity be the death of the testator.
language2_text: O nitaid no toda jyawakwak a tao a ciring na am pangozayan da ori a ciring na no mawakwak rana.

language1_text: For a testament is of force after men are dead: otherwise it is of no strength at all while the testator liveth.
language2_text: Ta no mavyay pa tao a kataid na so ciring na am abo peypeypangayan no ciring na. Ta no si mawakwak rana o tomaid so ciring na am pangozayan da na o ciring a nitaid na jira.

language1_text: Whereupon neither the first testament was dedicated without blood.
language2_text: Akman sang o ney manma na pangozayan a ciring na ni Ama ta do to no kakwa. Ta no abo o rala amvoyog a patanangen ji Ama ta do to am abo oyowyat no adan a pangozayan a ciring na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: For when Moses had spoken every precept to all the people according to the law, he took the blood of calves and of goats, with water, and scarlet wool, and hyssop, and sprinkled both the book, and all the people,
language2_text: O ney manma na am ipeylimwang ni Moyse o iwawalam ni Ama ta do to do aro a tao a kapangap na rana so rala no baka kano kagling pazavozen do ranom, kapangap na rana so akmey vangkoro a milakayob a pinabedbed do akmey kamanakaoy a kasaboy na so aro a tao a kano vakong a adketan no nanao ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: saying, This is the blood of the testament which God hath enjoined unto you.
language2_text: Maniring am, "O rala rana ya am yongkad na ni Ama ta do to a manci ninyo a omahap so pangozayan a ciring na."

language1_text: Moreover he sprinkled with blood both the tabernacle, and all the vessels of the ministry.
language2_text: Akman sang si Moyse a mapasaboy so rala do akmey sarwap a panaralayan da kano makakaday amyan do sahad na a ipanaralay da.

language1_text: And almost all things are by the law purged with blood; and without shedding of blood is no remission.
language2_text: To da mangozai o iwawalam da somaboy no rala so makakaday a ipanaralay da. No abo rala am jyavonas o raraten.

language1_text: It was therefore necessary that the patterns of things in the heavens should be purified with these; but the heavenly things themselves with better sacrifices than these.
language2_text: Kakwakwan no panaralayan do teyrahem a yaominara sya do teyngato a yamangap so rala no kagling a kano baka a ipanvoga so tao. Ney manngo rana o panaralayan do teyngato. Jyabo kaji nakdekdengan pa no rala ni Yeso Kizisto do teyngato a ipanvoga na so tao ni Ama ta do to a.

language1_text: For Christ is not entered into the holy places made with hands, which are the figures of the true; but into heaven itself, now to appear in the presence of God for us:
language2_text: Jya nisomdep si Yeso do nyamaog no tao a akmey sarwap a panaralayan. Ta o nyamaog no tao am ji meyngongyod ori. Si Kizisto rana am yarana myan do teyngato a mapasyasi nyaten do tangain ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: nor yet that he should offer himself often, as the high priest entereth into the holy place every year with blood of others;
language2_text: O panirsirngen no mapatanatanang so nakem no tao do Yotay am mangday so awawan o kapatanang da so rala no kagling a kano baka do Ney manokdwan na vahay. Am si Kizisto rana am ipisa mapatanang so kataotao na a ivonas na so raraten no tao.

language1_text: for then must he often have suffered since the foundation of the world: but now once in the end of the world hath he appeared to put away sin by the sacrifice of himself.
language2_text: O na icyakman sang ni Yeso a yarana ji vangovangon so iwawalam no tao do Yotay a mapatanang so rala am na rana nipatanang o kataotao na abo so raraten a ivoga na so raraten no tao. So na ikeypisa ni Yeso a mangay mawakwak nyaten a kato na rana meyyonongan a mavonas rana no raraten ta.

language1_text: And as it is appointed unto men once to die, but after this the judgment:
language2_text: Mamimin o tao a ipisa mawakwak. Am no mawakwak o tao am pacicin na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: so Christ was once offered to bear the sins of many; and unto them that look for him shall he appear the second time without sin unto salvation.
language2_text: Yakman sang si Kizisto a ipisa mapatanang so kataotao na a ivonas na so raraten no aro a tao. So ikeypisa na pa mai do teyrahem. Am beken a raraten o vazay na. Ta mangay na hapen sira o mapanala sya tao.

language1_text: For the law having a shadow of good things to come, and not the very image of the things, can never with those sacrifices which they offered year by year continually make the comers thereunto perfect.
language2_text: O iwawalam na ni Moyse am ji makanet pa ori. Ta ori rana am akma ney avwavong pa ori no pangangasyan na ni Yeso a itoro na jyaten. Akman sang o da patanangen a yajyates do awawan a kagling a kano baka. Ta makongo ori a mapeypapya so tao a mangay do tangain ni Ama ta do to. Jyabo o kapakasidong na so tao a.

language1_text: For then would they not have ceased to be offered? because that the worshippers once purged should have had no more conscience of sins.
language2_text: No manoyong o kato na rana vonasan no raraten da no rala no kagling a kano baka am manoyong o kaji da rana makanakman so raraten da. So to na rana zavaci no kapatanatanang so kagling a kano baka.

language1_text: But in those sacrifices there is a remembrance again made of sins every year.
language2_text: Am o yapatanangan so kagling a kano baka ji Ama ta do to am ipakanakem da no tao so raraten da do awawan.

language1_text: For it is not possible that the blood of bulls and of goats should take away sins.
language2_text: Ta o rala no baka kano kagling am ji na vonas o raraten no tao.

language1_text: Wherefore when he cometh into the world, he saith, Sacrifice and offering thou wouldest not, But a body hast thou prepared me:
language2_text: Am ori an, pancyan na nya ni Kizisto ji Ama ta do to no kai na do teyrahem, "Mo jyakzan o yapatanangen a kagling a kano makakaday a nakem a patanangen jimo. Ta yamo rana nipanta yaken so kataotao a mahap so vazay mo.

language1_text: In burnt offerings and sacrifices for sin thou hast had no pleasure.
language2_text: Mo jyakzan o yatemtemen a kagling a kano baka. So mo ikakman so sang a yajyakza no rala no kagling a kano baka a ivonas so raraten no tao.

language1_text: Then said I, Lo, I come(In the volume of the book it is written of me, )To do thy will, O God.
language2_text: Am ori o ko pancyan no, 'Oya ko do jya a yamangozay do nakenakem mo, mo Ama do to, akman so yadomket do Seysyo a yaomagaz jyaken a vazay.'"

language1_text: Above when he said, Sacrifice and offering and burnt offerings and offering for sin thou wouldest not, neither hadst pleasure therein; which are offered by the law;
language2_text: O ney manma na nipanci ni Kizisto jya am, "Mo jyakzan o yapatanangen a kagling a kano makakaday, pacyangayan no rala a patanangen jimo a yamo ivonas so raraten." Tana yada pangozayan o iwawalam a yamapatanang so makakaday am yakman sang o ciring na ni Kizisto.

language1_text: then said he, Lo, I come to do thy will, O God. He taketh away the first, that he may establish the second.
language2_text: Maniring pa am, "Mo Ama do to, oya ko do jya a yamangozay do nakenakem mo." Am ori o mina to na rana nastasi ni Ama ta do to so adan a iwawalam ni Moyse. Ta na rana nyalitan ni Yeso Kizisto no kataotao na o adan a iwawalam ni Moyse.

language1_text: By the which will we are sanctified through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once for all.
language2_text: Na nipangononongan ni Yeso o nakenakem ni Ama ta do to a yamahap so vazay na a yamapasansan so kataotao na do jyojika. Am yaipisaha na kato miminan so raraten ta yanivonas.

language1_text: And every priest standeth daily ministering and offering oftentimes the same sacrifices, which can never take away sins:
language2_text: O yamapatanatanang nira so nakem da no tao do Yotay am mangday so araw sira a yameytatanek a yamahap so vazay ni Ama ta do to a mapatanang so kagling a kano baka. Am yameyyangangay do araw o da patanangen. Tana todangay no makwa am ji na vonas o raraten no tao no rala no kagling a kano baka.

language1_text: but this man, after he had offered one sacrifice for sins for ever, sat down on the right hand of God;
language2_text: Am o nipatanang na ni Kizisto a kataotao na am ipisaha. Am tey rako oyowyat na amvonas so raraten ta mangay do kaidan no karawan. So yana ilisna do wanan ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: from henceforth expecting till his enemies be made his footstool.
language2_text: Sicyaikwa rana ya am na rana panalahen si Ama ta do to a yamharag so yamacioya jya tao.

language1_text: For by one offering he hath perfected for ever them that are sanctified.
language2_text: Ipisa si Yeso a nimvoyog so rala a kavonas na rana no raraten da no omanoyong jya tao a mangay do kaidan no karawan.

language1_text: Whereof the Holy Ghost also is a witness to us: for after that he had said before,
language2_text: O ciring na jyaten no Seyzi do Seysyo am,

language1_text: This is the covenant that I will make with themAfter those days, saith the Lord, I will put my laws into their hearts, And in their minds will I write them;
language2_text: "Maniring si Ama ta do to am, Ipatnek ko sira so vayo a pangozayan a ciring no makwa. Peydednahen ko o iwawalam ko do oo da a kapangay ko sya do onowned da."

language1_text: And their sins and iniquities will I remember no more.
language2_text: Maniring pa am, "Ji ko na peyyana do onowned ko o raraten da kano karatan da."

language1_text: Now where remission of these is, there is no more offering for sin.
language2_text: Am no mavonas rana o raraten am todabo rana o patanangen da makakaday a ivonas da so raraten da.

language1_text: Having therefore, brethren, boldness to enter into the holiest by the blood of Jesus,
language2_text: Manga kakteh, o peypeypangayan no cinawakwak na ni Yeso am ipakateneng ta do kaji ta rana vokahawan a mangay do tangain ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: by a new and living way, which he hath consecrated for us, through the veil, that is to say, his flesh;
language2_text: Na nipeywadwad yaten ni Yeso so vayo a rarahan ta. Ori rana am rarahan ori a mangay do tangain ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: and having an high priest over the house of God;
language2_text: Yamyan so yata ipeyhanhan a ney manhama na mapatanatanang so nakem a mapasyasi nyaten ji Ama ta do to. Iya rana am si Yeso a yatomalamozong nyaten a macikaop jya.

language1_text: let us draw near with a true heart in full assurance of faith, having our hearts sprinkled from an evil conscience, and our bodies washed with pure water.
language2_text: Am ori o ikanoyong ta jyablis so onowned a akmey nioyasan so onowned a kano kataotao a omanop ji Ama ta do to.

language1_text: Let us hold fast the profession of our faith without wavering; (for he is faithful that promised;)
language2_text: Am ori o ji ta na ablisi so nakem a to ngotokot no kararalay ta ni Ama ta do to. Ta o mina ciring na jyaten ni Ama ta do to am abo kalasan na.

language1_text: and let us consider one another to provoke unto love and to good works:
language2_text: Manakem ta o kapait ta so nakenakem do kadwan jyaten. Manakem ta o kasidong ta so kadwan jyaten a mapatwaw so pangangarilawan na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: not forsaking the assembling of ourselves together, as the manner of some is; but exhorting one another: and so much the more, as ye see the day approaching.
language2_text: Ji ta nginara sira o yatatasa ka tao a yato nazibo no da kararalay ni Ama ta do to do kalwalovotan no tao. So ipasipapait ta, ta tamo na katenngan o na kasngen rana no araraw na no na yai ni Yeso. So ikakdekdeng tamo pa a mapait so kadwan jyaten.

language1_text: For if we sin wilfully after that we have received the knowledge of the truth, there remaineth no more sacrifice for sins,
language2_text: No katenngan ta na o nanao ni Ama ta do to a kapeyngongyod ta meyparai ji Ama ta do to a ji rana meysinaoli so onowned am abo rana o patanangen ta makavonas so akman sang a raraten.

language1_text: but a certain fearful looking for of judgment and fiery indignation, which shall devour the adversaries.
language2_text: Sira rana to nazibo ni Ama ta do to a tao am kapananala da rana so peyoyaoyyan na ni Ama ta do to do makotokotod a lila no apoy a ombalinas sira.

language1_text: He that despised Moses' law died without mercy under two or three witnesses:
language2_text: O mapasobna do iwawalam ni Moyse a tao am no si myan so rarwa a tatlo o nimakacita sira meyraraten am ji rana asyan sira, ta to rana wakwaka sira.

language1_text: of how much sorer punishment, suppose ye, shall he be thought worthy, who hath trodden under foot the Son of God, and hath counted the blood of the covenant, wherewith he was sanctified, an unholy thing, and hath done despite unto the Spirit of grace?
language2_text: O to ngolala so Anak na ni Ama ta do to a kano rala na a makavonas so raraten na, kato na nazibo no yamanta no tao so pangangasyan a Seyzi am o akman rana sang a tao am makongo so wanjin. Naknakmen nyo pala. Jyabo kaji nakdengan no ipasingsingkad na sya ni Ama ta do to a.

language1_text: For we know him that hath said, Vengeance belongeth unto me, I will recompense, saith the Lord. And again, The Lord shall judge his people.
language2_text: Ta tamo katenngan o ciring na ni Ama ta do to a manci no, "Amyan so ipasingkad ko so meyraraten a tao." Maniring pa am, "Ioya ko sira o marahet so iwawalam a omanod jyaken a tao."

language1_text: It is a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the living God.
language2_text: Si Ama ta rana do to am to meyyonong a mavyay. Am ori o to da makasii no pasingsingtan na tao!

language1_text: But call to remembrance the former days, in which, after ye were illuminated, ye endured a great fight of afflictions;
language2_text: Manakem nyo no kakwa. Tana aro o alalaw nyo no kavayo nyo pa a omanoyong ji Yeso am jyabo kanimaharag nyo no alalaw nyo a.

language1_text: partly, whilst ye were made a gazingstock both by reproaches and afflictions; and partly, whilst ye became companions of them that were so used.
language2_text: Tomakatakaw o kapasnesnek da jinyo a peyrarehten do tangain no aro a tao. Tomakatakaw o kapazasing da jinyo do peyrarehten da tao.

language1_text: For ye had compassion of me in my bonds, and took joyfully the spoiling of your goods, knowing in yourselves that ye have in heaven a better and an enduring substance.
language2_text: Akma kamoy to macizanod so alalaw do paneban da tao. No katakaw da so kangangay nyo a nyahap no tao am mina to nyo peykabobwa do onowned nyo. Ta katenngan nyo o kapakahap nyo so apyapya pa a peymeymasaodan nyo do teyngato.

language1_text: Cast not away therefore your confidence, which hath great recompence of reward.
language2_text: Am ori o ji nyo ablisi no onowned. Ta no si akman kamo sang so onowned am mahap nyo o rako a nakem na jinyo ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: For ye have need of patience, that, after ye have done the will of God, ye might receive the promise.
language2_text: Ji kamo macimazikna do vazay na ni Ama ta do to. Ta ori o ipakahap nyo so mina ciring na jinyo ni Ama ta do to no makwa.

language1_text: For yet a little while, And he that shall come will come, and will not tarry.
language2_text: Ta o ciring do Seysyo am, "Maniring si Ama ta do to am, 'Makeykai rana a kapakaranes na rana no pananalahen nyo a mai. So ji na mapainini jya.

language1_text: Now the just shall live by faith: But if any man draw back, my soul shall have no pleasure in him.
language2_text: O tao rana a omonot do nakenakem ko am mahap da o to meyyonong a ikavyay no pahad da do kanoyong da jyaken. Am o omlikod jyaken a tao am ji ko nakzan o akman sang.'"

language1_text: But we are not of them who draw back unto perdition; but of them that believe to the saving of the soul.
language2_text: Jyabo kapya ta so kapeydedna na jyaten no peyoyaoyyan na ni Ama ta do to, do kalikod ta jya. Ta yaten rana am ta anoyngan o kapatazadang na jyaten ni Ama ta do to do teyngato.

language1_text: Now faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen.
language2_text: O ipanganoyong rana ya am ipeyhanhan o vazay a ipeynanakem. O peypeypangayan no nang am anoyngan o kanoyong na myan no ji pa nimacita.

language1_text: For by it the elders obtained a good report.
language2_text: O sarayan na no tao no kakwa ni Ama ta do to am nipeyhanhan da si Ama ta do to.

language1_text: Through faith we understand that the worlds were framed by the word of God, so that things which are seen were not made of things which do appear.
language2_text: O ta ipakateneng do kaniomamamaog na ni Ama ta do to so karawan no ciring na am tana tamo jya nimacita am tamo na to nganoyngi o akman sang. So ikanoyong no yamacita eya nyamaog na ni Ama ta do to no ciring na.

language1_text: By faith Abel offered unto God a more excellent sacrifice than Cain, by which he obtained witness that he was righteous, God testifying of his gifts: and by it he being dead yet speaketh.
language2_text: O nikapyapya na no nipatanang ni Yapo a kani Kayin ji Ama ta do to am nipeyhanhan na ni Yapo si Ama ta do to. Ori o nisarayan na nya ni Ama ta do to. Ori o nyabnekan na sya abo so raraten do tangain na, do kanoyong na meyhanhan ni Ama ta do to. Tana yana rana mownay si Yapo a nimawakwak am nitaid na jyaten o kakdeng ta a meyhanhan ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: By faith Enoch was translated that he should not see death; and was not found, because God had translated him: for before his translation he had this testimony, that he pleased God.
language2_text: Si Inok rana am jya nimawakwak, ta mina to meytopos a nyahap na ni Ama ta do to, do kapeyhanhan na nya. So ji da rana nimakakalai sya no tao. Maniring do Seysyo am, "No kaji na pa ngapan sya ni Ama ta do to am nimanmanma o kasaray na nya ni Ama ta do to."

language1_text: But without faith it is impossible to please him: for he that cometh to God must believe that he is, and that he is a rewarder of them that diligently seek him.
language2_text: No abo panganoyngan no tao am ji na narayan ni Ama ta do to. O mai do tangain ni Ama ta do to a tao am anoyngan da o keyyan ni Ama ta do to a macikaop jira a marilaw no komakzeb sya tao.

language1_text: By faith Noah, being warned of God of things not seen as yet, moved with fear, prepared an ark to the saving of his house; by the which he condemned the world, and became heir of the righteousness which is by faith.
language2_text: Si Noya rana am tana ji na pa nimacita o vazay am nyamizing na o nipaziman na sya ni Ama ta do to, do kapeyhanhan na ni Ama ta do to. Ori o nipamaring na so rako a avang. Ori o nikapya da asa ka vahay do henep, do katey rako no raraten no tao do karawan. So nikanoyong ni Noya a nibnek na ni Ama ta do to abo so raraten do tangain na, ta nipeyhanhan na si Ama ta do to.

language1_text: By faith Abraham, when he was called to go out into a place which he should after receive for an inheritance, obeyed; and he went out, not knowing whither he went.
language2_text: Si Apolahan rana am nionotan na si Ama ta do to do kapeyhanhan na nya. Am ori o nikarwan na do keymiminili da a mangay do tovoyan na sya ni Ama ta do to a pongso a itoro na jya ni Ama ta do to. Am no kakaro na do keymiminili da am ji na tenngi o angayan na.

language1_text: By faith he sojourned in the land of promise, as in a strange country, dwelling in tabernacles with Isaac and Jacob, the heirs with him of the same promise:
language2_text: Tana meyvahay do matarek a ili si Apolahan am nipeyhanhan na si Ama ta do to. So nipangilili na a meyvahay do akmey sarwap. Akman sang si Isa kani Yakebo. Ta meyyangangay sira a omapanala so mina ciring na sira ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: for he looked for a city which hath foundations, whose builder and maker is God.
language2_text: Ta anoyngan na ni Apolahan o meypanam pa amaogen ni Ama ta do to a tey meymatek a ili do teyngato.

language1_text: Through faith also Sara herself received strength to conceive seed, and was delivered of a child when she was past age, because she judged him faithful who had promised.
language2_text: Tana rarakeh si Salay rana abo so kanen sospa am nimeytaodtod, do kapeyhanhan na ni Ama ta do to a mangononong do mina ciring na sya.

language1_text: Therefore sprang there even of one, and him as good as dead, so many as the stars of the sky in multitude, and as the sand which is by the sea shore innumerable.
language2_text: Tana rarakeh rana si Apolahan am akma raney mata no hanit a kano anay do pasalan o karwaro da no sivosivovoong na no makwa.

language1_text: These all died in faith, not having received the promises, but having seen them afar off, and were persuaded of them, and embraced them, and confessed that they were strangers and pilgrims on the earth.
language2_text: Sira rana ori am to da noiban do karawan o kapeyhanhan da ni Ama ta do to. Tana abo nimahap da do nipanci na ni Ama ta do to am da ji macimangsahi o da kapananala so akman sang a nakem na sira ni Ama ta do to. Da anoyngan o da kakmey mangilili a tao a yato ngiseysan do karawan.

language1_text: For they that say such things declare plainly that they seek a country.
language2_text: O mapeyciring so sang a tao am manoyong sira meykala no kataotao da so vahay da do teyngato.

language1_text: And truly, if they had been mindful of that country from whence they came out, they might have had opportunity to have returned.
language2_text: So ji da rana naknakmi so nikarwan da ili. Ta no ikapaw da am apya pa o kapeysinaoli da.

language1_text: But now they desire a better country, that is, an heavenly: wherefore God is not ashamed to be called their God: for he hath prepared for them a city.
language2_text: O ikakza da am apyapya pa vahay do teyngato. Am ori o ji na macimanigi nira ni Ama ta do to no kapanci da nya Ama da do to. Ta amyan rana so hapan na sira ili.

language1_text: By faith Abraham, when he was tried, offered up Isaac: and he that had received the promises offered up his only begotten son,
language2_text: No keyleylamdam na si Apolahan ni Ama ta do to a tomoro no anak na a meyngaran so Isa a wakwaken a patanangen ji Ama ta do to am ji na nikamama, do kapeyhanhan na nya. Ta ipeyhanhan na si Ama ta do to a manta nya so aro a sivosivovoong na.

language1_text: of whom it was said, That in Isaac shall thy seed be called:
language2_text: O mina ciring na jya ni Ama ta do to am, "O apwapo mo am mapo ji Isa."

language1_text: accounting that God was able to raise him up, even from the dead; from whence also he received him in a figure.
language2_text: Nipeyhanhan na ni Apolahan si Ama ta do to a mapaoli sya avyain si Isa. Am ori o ta pancyan ni Apolahan a nimahap si Isa do apwa kawakwakan na.

language1_text: By faith Isaac blessed Jacob and Esau concerning things to come.
language2_text: Si Isa rana am nipanlanlag na si Yakebo a kani Isaw, do kapeyhanhan na ni Ama ta do to a manta nira so ileylamnay da no nakem no makwa.

language1_text: By faith Jacob, when he was a dying, blessed both the sons of Joseph; and worshipped, leaning upon the top of his staff.
language2_text: No katod na rana jyawakwakan ni Yakebo am nipanlanlag na o rarwa ka anak ni Yoseyvo. So to na meysikoji a omraralay ni Ama ta do to, do kapeyhanhan na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: By faith Joseph, when he died, made mention of the departing of the children of Israel; and gave commandment concerning his bones.
language2_text: Ikongo do ipeyhanhan na ni Yoseyvo si Ama ta do to, am toda jyawakwak am malavat na sira o kakaro da do Ayci no Isedi a tao a kapanci na rana nya jira so ahahapan da so totowang na a ibobo do peyyalislisan da ili.

language1_text: By faith Moses, when he was born, was hid three months of his parents, because they saw he was a proper child; and they were not afraid of the king's commandment.
language2_text: Matazak si Moyse am macita da no inyapwan na o kapiya no kamahamahakay na. Karahan am mina katlo a vehan a nipowzib da. So ji da nimanyahei no ciring no panirsirngen, do kapeyhanhan da ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: By faith Moses, when he was come to years, refused to be called the son of Pharaoh's daughter;
language2_text: Makaveyvow si Moyse am nitaosya na o kapanci da nya taodtod no anak ni Valaw a panirsirngen, do kapeyhanhan na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: choosing rather to suffer affliction with the people of God, than to enjoy the pleasures of sin for a season;
language2_text: Apyapyahen na pa o kapacitetngehan na no inawan na do italamozong na ni Ama ta do to a Isedi a tao a peyrarehten da, do kaji nakzan no kahap na so ji meyyonownay a sarasaray do vahay ni Valaw.

language1_text: esteeming the reproach of Christ greater riches than the treasures in Egypt: for he had respect unto the recompence of the reward.
language2_text: Apyapyahen na pa o kapeyrarahet na mahap so vazay no Misayya. So nilikodan na do aro a peymeymasaodan da no tao do Ayci a pamoonen da jya. Ta anoyngan na o kapyapya na pa no peymeymasaodan ni Ama ta do to a itoro na jya.

language1_text: By faith he forsook Egypt, not fearing the wrath of the king: for he endured, as seeing him who is invisible.
language2_text: Ji na nyaheyan o kapeyoyaoya na ni Valaw. So nikaro na do Ayci. Ta akma ney todacita no mata si Ama ta do to a yamacitovong jya. Am ori o ji na rana kei a meysinaoli, do kapeyhanhan na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: Through faith he kept the passover, and the sprinkling of blood, lest he that destroyed the firstborn should touch them.
language2_text: Ikongo do ipeyhanhan na si Ama ta do to ni Moyse, am ori o nipapwan na so Iyeci a kano omrarala so pazezevngen da a katodaliklikan so vahay da no Isedi a tao no tinsi a omwakwak so kabnekan da no tao do Ayci.

language1_text: By faith they passed through the Red sea as by dry land: which the Egyptians assaying to do were drowned.
language2_text: Akmey to mangonong sira do kacyan o Isedi a tao do rako a awa a ngaranan da so Mabazangbang awa, do kapeyhanhan da ni Ama ta do to. Am mangonong sira o tao do Ayci am nimamimin sira nipeytalama na no awa.

language1_text: By faith the walls of Jericho fell down, after they were compassed about seven days.
language2_text: Nilivolivon da no Isedi a tao o ili a meyngaran so Yedike so kapito araw a kazdazday na rana no ahad no ili da, do kapeyhanhan da ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: By faith the harlot Rahab perished not with them that believed not, when she had received the spies with peace.
language2_text: Ikongo do ipeyhanhan na si Ama ta do to no manakaw a mavakes a meyngaran si Laha, am ori o ji na nimacikazosoji jira kano aro a ji ngonot ji Ama ta do to a tao a mawakwak. Ta nitaotao na o nitovoy no Isedi a tao a omileylamdam so tao do Yedike.

language1_text: And what shall I more say? for the time would fail me to tell of Gedeon, and of Barak, and of Samson, and of Jephthae; of David also, and Samuel, and of the prophets:
language2_text: Yaro pa dang o ciring ko am ko na ji mancyan si Cityan a kani Pala kani Sansong a kani Yevota kani Tawey a kani Samoar a kano aro a panoyonoywan na so ciring ni Ama ta do to a tao.

language1_text: who through faith subdued kingdoms, wrought righteousness, obtained promises, stopped the mouths of lions,
language2_text: Ikongo do nipeyhanhan da si Ama ta do to, am ori o nipakahap da so mina ciring na jira a somidong sira. So nibalinasan da so tao do livolivon no ili da. So nikapiya na rana no nyahahapan da sya. So icyakma dey nisomengseng do ngongoy no kokoman so tao, do kapeyhanhan da ni Ama ta do to a somidong sira.

language1_text: quenched the violence of fire, escaped the edge of the sword, out of weakness were made strong, waxed valiant in fight, turned to flight the armies of the aliens.
language2_text: So nihespan da do rako a lila no apoy. Nipakasaoy da do ipangan no tao a amwakwak sira. Kakwakwan da abo so oyowyat am nioyatan na sira ni Ama ta do to. So nikowyat da amharag so omarap sira tao do livolivon no ili da.

language1_text: Women received their dead raised to life again: and others were tortured, not accepting deliverance; that they might obtain a better resurrection:
language2_text: O tatasa a mavavakes am mina to mirwa a mavyay o nimawakwak a makaop do asa ka vahay da, do kapeyhanhan da ni Ama ta do to. O tatasa ka tao am apyapyahen da pa o kaneb da jira kapakakasi da sira wakwaken, do kahap da so kapanganoyong da a meyhanhan ni Ama ta do to. Ta katenngan da o kapirwa da mavyay no makwa.

language1_text: and others had trial of cruel mockings and scourgings, yea, moreover of bonds and imprisonment:
language2_text: Tatasa jira to myapya so kapeyzeyzozomyak da jira a bakbakan. So iyan no nivaod da kano nyaneban da.

language1_text: they were stoned, they were sawn asunder, were tempted, were slain with the sword: they wandered about in sheepskins and goatskins; being destitute, afflicted, tormented;
language2_text: Amyan so tao a nibhebhesan da nimawakwak. Amyan so nigetget da nipeyketeb so kataotao. Amyan so nizakat da no ipangan. Amyan so meyyayob so kolit no kagling a vovwan da limanen a paksozen. So to da liliwi so kakcinan da kano peyrarehtan da sira pakakasin.

language1_text: (of whom the world was not worthy:) they wandered in deserts, and in mountains, and in dens and caves of the earth.
language2_text: So ikapyapya na rana no kaji da macivahayan jira no apya so nakenakem a tao, do kateywara no pacioyyan da do manaralay a tao. So ikanoyong da akmey minaminasbang a to meyyowyaw do peycyeylilyan na kado kahasan. So to da rana pavyavingi so kataotao da do azcizcip.

language1_text: And these all, having obtained a good report through faith, received not the promise:
language2_text: Sira rana ori am admain na sira ni Ama ta do to o makdeng so nakem a tao. Am abo nimahap da mina ciring na sira ni Ama ta do to no kavyay da pa.

language1_text: God having provided some better thing for us, that they without us should not be made perfect.
language2_text: Ta amyan so nipamnekan na ni Ama ta do to a apyapya pa a itoro na jyaten. Ori rana am pehzahen na sira jyaten a makahap so to meyyonong a ikavyay no pahad da do teyngato a yazaw na sira.

language1_text: Wherefore seeing we also are compassed about with so great a cloud of witnesses, let us lay aside every weight, and the sin which doth so easily beset us, and let us run with patience the race that is set before us,
language2_text: So yada ikatey yaro no tao a ta rana nimacita so kakdekdeng a meyhanhan ni Ama ta do to no kakwa. Am ori an o akasan ta na so makakaday a ikasengseng jyaten a kano raraten ta yakmey omvaod jyaten a kowyat ta so onowned a akman so malayo a ji macimaza do palaywan na angayan.

language1_text: looking unto Jesus the author and finisher of our faith; who for the joy that was set before him endured the cross, despising the shame, and is set down at the right hand of the throne of God.
language2_text: To ta peyyononga a peyyanen do onowned ta si Yeso Kizisto. Ta iya rana am nimapapo so kapeyhanhan ta ni Ama ta do to. So ika iya na no mapeynyangavosan syaha. Ji na nikamama o jyojika do tangain na. To na nazibwan o peyleylakan da sya a wakwaken do jyojika. Ta katenngan na o kapeyvoga no sarasaray na no makwa. So na rana ilisna do wanan na ni Ama ta do to sicyaikwaya.

language1_text: For consider him that endured such contradiction of sinners against himself, lest ye be wearied and faint in your minds.
language2_text: Naknakmen nyo o mina vazay na to nomok so avavay da sya no meyraraten a tao. Ta ori o ji nyo a vokahawi no ingalaw da jinyo.

language1_text: Ye have not yet resisted unto blood, striving against sin.
language2_text: Ta kamo pa ji nimangay so inawan a yamacilimaliman ji Satan a yamapeyraraten jinyo.

language1_text: And ye have forgotten the exhortation which speaketh unto you as unto children, My son, despise not thou the chastening of the Lord, Nor faint when thou art rebuked of him:
language2_text: Manngwa, nyo na todahamangi o na ivavaga jinyo akman so inyapwan a amvavaga do anak na? Ta no maniring am, "Imo rana anak ko am azimanen mo o nanao ni Ama ta do to. Ji ka todarahet rana so onowned a nanawen na.

language1_text: For whom the Lord loveth he chasteneth, And scourgeth every son whom he receiveth.
language2_text: Ta si Ama ta do to am vavagan na sira o ikarilaw na tao. Nanawen na sira o abneken na anak."

language1_text: If ye endure chastening, God dealeth with you as with sons; for what son is he whom the father chasteneth not?
language2_text: Ahapen nyo o inanao na jinyo ni Ama ta do to. Ta o nanawan na jinyo am anak na inyo an. Ta abo inyapwan a ji nanao so anak.

language1_text: But if ye be without chastisement, whereof all are partakers, then are ye bastards, and not sons.
language2_text: No si ji kamo nanao am ji kamo meyngongyod a anak na.

language1_text: Furthermore we have had fathers of our flesh which corrected us, and we gave them reverence: shall we not much rather be in subjection unto the Father of spirits, and live?
language2_text: O meysinogat a ama ta do karawan am ta hapen o nanao da. So tamo kanigan nira. Am imanngo rana si Ama ta do teyngato. Jya mahamahama pa o onotan ta jya, do kahap ta so ikavyay no pahad ta.

language1_text: For they verily for a few days chastened us after their own pleasure; but he for our profit, that we might be partakers of his holiness.
language2_text: O meysinogat a ama ta do karawan am to da mangozai o ahahapan da sya amnanao jyaten. Am alinged ori an. Am o nanawan na jyaten ni Ama ta do to am ipeypapya na jyaten. Ta ori o ipacizanod ta jya abo so karatan.

language1_text: Now no chastening for the present seemeth to be joyous, but grievous: nevertheless afterward it yieldeth the peaceable fruit of righteousness unto them which are exercised thereby.
language2_text: No nanawen na yaten am akma tey marahet so aktokto. Am o makapeyneynara rana so nanao ni Ama ta do to a tao am masasaray rana o onowned da a ji rana meylimoteng so onowned.

language1_text: Wherefore lift up the hands which hang down, and the feeble knees;
language2_text: Am ori o yokayan nyo rana so onowned nyo a meyhanhan ni Ama ta do to. Ta ori o ikowyat nyo na so onowned.

language1_text: and make straight paths for your feet, lest that which is lame be turned out of the way; but let it rather be healed.
language2_text: Ji nyo pasala o pangonongan nyo. Ta ori o ji da tahaciji no makasapa so ai a tao. So ikanoyong nyo na karapan so onowned.

language1_text: Follow peace with all men, and holiness, without which no man shall see the Lord:
language2_text: Makowyowyat kamo pa mapeypyapya so nakenakem nyo a kano tao. Ahapen nyo o ji meylimoteng a onowned nyo a macikaop jira. No abo o akman sang jinyo am abo jinyo o makacita si Ama ta do to do teyngato.

language1_text: looking diligently lest any man fail of the grace of God; lest any root of bitterness springing up trouble you, and thereby many be defiled;
language2_text: Makapzat kamo, ta mapehes jinyo o pangangarilawan ni Ama ta do to. Makapzat kamo, ta amlida do onowned nyo o raraten nyo. Ta no meyparako ori am makangingit so tao a meyraraten.

language1_text: lest there be any fornicator, or profane person, as Esau, who for one morsel of meat sold his birthright.
language2_text: Taosya o kapasagpyan nyo so aktokto nyo. Ji nyo nginara si Isaw a meyparai ji Ama ta do to a mangazaw no ngaran na kabnekan ni ama na, do kaooo na no pinaring na kanen ni wari na.

language1_text: For ye know how that afterward, when he would have inherited the blessing, he was rejected: for he found no place of repentance, though he sought it carefully with tears.
language2_text: Meyratateng am kakzeben na si ama na manlanlag nya am ji na pakongo ni ama na. Ta masalit ji ama na a mapaoli so nimaskad rana vazay. Tana to lavi a maneseh si Isaw am ji na nimapaoli o nakem na ni ama na a manlanlag nya.

language1_text: For ye are not come unto the mount that might be touched, and that burned with fire, nor unto blackness, and darkness, and tempest,
language2_text: Inyo am kamo ji nimakaranes do tokon a meyngaran so Sinay. So nyo jyakmani so Isedi a tao a nimakaranes do dang a yanan no lila no apoy a kano cinalab a kano rako a sari a kano akmey hangin a pagpag.

language1_text: and the sound of a trumpet, and the voice of words; which voice they that heard intreated that the word should not be spoken to them any more:
language2_text: Amyan dang so meyzapa kano izezyak ni Ama ta do to. Mamizing da ori no aro a tao am to da na pakeka si Ama ta do to. Ta manyahey sira.

language1_text: (for they could not endure that which was commanded, And if so much as a beast touch the mountain, it shall be stoned, or thrust through with a dart:
language2_text: Ta ji da na pakongo a amizngen o ciring na ni Ama ta do to a manci no, "Tana asa ka omalalam o to macidnet do tokon am wakwaken no vato."

language1_text: and so terrible was the sight, that Moses said, I exceedingly fear and quake:)
language2_text: So ikanoyong na tey manganyahey no nimacita da. Am ori o nipancyan na nya ni Moyse so, "Ko na to zikzik a yamanyahey."

language1_text: but ye are come unto mount Sion, and unto the city of the living God, the heavenly Jerusalem, and to an innumerable company of angels,
language2_text: Am inyo am kamo nimai do Sian a tokon. Ori rana am to meyyonong ori a yanan na ni Ama ta do to, akmey Yelosaleng do teyngato. Do dang rana am yajyavilangi o tinsi ni Ama ta do to amraralay nya.

language1_text: to the general assembly and church of the firstborn, which are written in heaven, and to God the Judge of all, and to the spirits of just men made perfect,
language2_text: Inyo rana am kamo na nimakaranes do da kalwalovotan no yamraralay ni Ama ta do to a tao a yadomket so ngaran do teyngato. Inyo rana am kamo nimakaranes do yanan ni Ama ta do to a mapeykapyapinpinan so aro a tao. So yanyo ikanoyong rana yarana nimakaranes do na kabwan no yameyraraten a tao.

language1_text: and to Jesus the mediator of the new covenant, and to the blood of sprinkling, that speaketh better things than that of Abel.
language2_text: Inyo rana am kamo rana nimakaranes do tangain ni Yeso a yanimanta ninyo so vayo a pangozayan a ciring na ni Ama ta do to a na rana nitaktakan no rala na. Ta o rala na ni Yeso o mapanop jyaten ji Ama ta do to a omagaz do kapyapyan. Ta o rala na ni Yapo am omagaz do kararatan.

language1_text: See that ye refuse not him that speaketh. For if they escaped not who refused him that spake on earth, much more shall not we escape, if we turn away from him that speaketh from heaven:
language2_text: Am makapzat kamo. Ji nyo to nazibwan o ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to amnanao jinyo. Sira rana ya a to nazibo no yanipeylimwang ni Moyse a ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to am abo taywan da do peyoyaoyyan na ni Ama ta do to. No si to ta nazibwan o ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to a yapo do teyngato am teywara rana o raraten ta.

language1_text: whose voice then shook the earth: but now he hath promised, saying, Yet once more I shake not the earth only, but also heaven.
language2_text: Taiden na ni Ama ta do to no iwawalam na ji Moyse am mina todagnoz o teyrahem no ciring na ni Ama ta do to. Am o na nipanci pa sicyaikwaya am, "Ipisa ko pa gomnoz so teyrahem a kapazanod ko so hanit."

language1_text: And this word, Yet once more, signifieth the removing of those things that are shaken, as of things that are made, that those things which cannot be shaken may remain.
language2_text: O ciring na, "Ipisa ori," am mamimin o nyamaog na magnoz a mabalinas. O teyngato rana jyabalinas.

language1_text: Wherefore we receiving a kingdom which cannot be moved, let us have grace, whereby we may serve God acceptably with reverence and godly fear:
language2_text: Am ori o sarayan ta no to meyyonong a ji rana gonagonay a italamozong na ni Ama ta do to a yanan ta do teyngato. To ta mangozai o isaray na ni Ama ta do to a peyvazain, kowyat ta amraralay nya.

language1_text: for our God is a consuming fire.
language2_text: So ikakdekdeng ta pa so onowned a mahap so vazay na. Ta o peyoyaoyyan na ni Ama ta do to am akmey lila no apoy a manemtem so meyraraten a tao.

language1_text: Let brotherly love continue.
language2_text: Mangday kamo do araraw a masicyakarilaw a akman so meyketeketeh do cinai.

language1_text: Be not forgetful to entertain strangers: for thereby some have entertained angels unawares.
language2_text: Taotawwen nyo sira o tao do teyhesa ka ili do vahay nyo. Ta nimyan so tao a nimanaotao so tao do teyhesa ka ili am ji na tentenngi ka tinsi na no nitaotao na.

language1_text: Remember them that are in bonds, as bound with them; and them which suffer adversity, as being yourselves also in the body.
language2_text: Manakem nyo sira o yamyan do pamemtengan a tao. Ta akma kamoy to macizanod jira aptengen da. Manakem nyo sira o peyrarehten da a tao. Ta akma kamoy to macizanod jira a peyrarehten da.

language1_text: Marriage is honourable in all, and the bed undefiled: but whoremongers and adulterers God will judge.
language2_text: Naknakmen nyo o kakdeng no meysinmo a tao. Masipanadnadnad kamo so nakem a marwarog do vahay. Ta o mapasagpyan so aktokto a tao am pasingsingtan na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: Let your conversation be without covetousness; and be content with such things as ye have: for he hath said, I will never leave thee, nor forsake thee.
language2_text: Ji nyo pahama o kakzan nyo no nizpi. Isaray nyo no onowned o amyan rana jinyo. Ta maniring si Ama ta do to am, "To meyyonong o kaji ko ngarwan jimo. So ji ko mapaveyvowi jimo a manta nimo so kalahen mo no nakem."

language1_text: So that we may boldly say, The Lord is my helper, and I will not fearWhat man shall do unto me.
language2_text: Am ori o ji ta rana nyahey a manci no, "Ko jyavokahaw. Ta na sidongen yaken ni Ama ta do to. Kongwen da yaken no tao."

language1_text: Remember them which have the rule over you, who have spoken unto you the word of God: whose faith follow, considering the end of their conversation.
language2_text: Inarahen nyo sira o nimapalololo jinyo no kakwa a nimeylimwang no ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to. Ta no kapeyigegen da pa kangay na do nikawakwak da rana am yamamimin o vazay da omagaz do da kapeyhanhan ni Yeso. So inaran nyo so kakdekdeng da meyhanhan ni Yeso.

language1_text: Jesus Christ the same yesterday, and to day, and for ever.
language2_text: Ta si Yeso Kizisto rana am tana no kakyab a tana sicyaraw eya a tana todangay no makwa am yajyablis.

language1_text: Be not carried about with divers and strange doctrines. For it is a good thing that the heart be established with grace; not with meats, which have not profited them that have been occupied therein.
language2_text: Taosya o kapeycyakawad na jinyo no makakaday a malas a nanao da no tao. Ta kapangozay nyo do pangangarilawan ni Ama ta do to a mapahadpet so onowned nyo. Ji nyo meyhanhanan o pamarmarngan da so kanen. Ta ji na sidong inyo a makahap so to meyyonong a ikavyay no pahad nyo.

language1_text: We have an altar, whereof they have no right to eat which serve the tabernacle.
language2_text: Sira rana yamyan do akmey sarwap a panaralayan a yamapatanatanang no tao do Yotay so nakem da am abo kasngesngenan da jyaten a macizanod do mina vazay na jyaten ni Yeso Kizisto.

language1_text: For the bodies of those beasts, whose blood is brought into the sanctuary by the high priest for sin, are burned without the camp.
language2_text: O panirsirngen rana no mapatanatanang so nakem da no tao do Yotay am isdep na o rala no kagling a kano baka do Ney manokdwan na vahay a kapatanang na rana sya a ivonas na so raraten no tao. Am o kataotao da no kagling a kano baka am yangay da do siri no ili a katemtem da sya.

language1_text: Wherefore Jesus also, that he might sanctify the people with his own blood, suffered without the gate.
language2_text: Akman sang si Yeso a niwakwak da do siri no ili. O peypeypangayan no kaniomvoyog no rala ni Yeso am ivonas na so raraten no tao.

language1_text: Let us go forth therefore unto him without the camp, bearing his reproach.
language2_text: Am ori o karwan ta na do adan a raralayan da ni Ama ta do to no tao do Yotay a kapacizanod ta ji Yeso Kizisto do alalaw na.

language1_text: For here have we no continuing city, but we seek one to come.
language2_text: Ta abo do karawan eya o to meyyonong a peyvahayan ta. Am ori o ta kalan so to meyyonong a angayan ta no makwa.
