language2_text: Am yamyan pa so yako oyyan ninyo. Yamyan jinyo so yana nicirara ni Palang a yaomonot do nanao ni Palake. Si Palang am yamanci no Isedi a tao a meyraraten a nikoman so mina pazos da so malas a iraralay da a da kapasagpyan so aktokto da.

language1_text: So hast thou also them that hold the doctrine of the Nicolaitanes, which thing I hate.
language2_text: Yakman sang ta yamyan jinyo so yaomonot do nanao ni Nikela.

language1_text: Repent; or else I will come unto thee quickly, and will fight against them with the sword of my mouth.
language2_text: Am ori o ipamlis nyo, ta no ji kamo mamlis am makeykai ko a mai a kabalinas ko sira no yako sangpahen a ipangan.

language1_text: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches; To him that overcometh will I give to eat of the hidden manna, and will give him a white stone, and in the stone a new name written, which no man knoweth saving he that receiveth it.
language2_text: "'O ciring no Seyzi so peycyakyokyokayan na am amizngen nyo a yameycicilwan a tao an. Sira rana a jya nimablis so onowned a tao am itoro ko jira o kanen apo do teyngato a meyngaran so mana a yajyasingkad no mata sicyaikwaya a kapanta ko nya so malavang a veysen a adketan no vayo a ngaran. O mahap so veysen a tao o makateneng do ngaran a domket do veysen ang.'

language1_text: And unto the angel of the church in Thyatira write; These things saith the Son of God, who hath his eyes like unto a flame of fire, and his feet are like fine brass;
language2_text: "Ipeyteygami mo o yamimong no kyokay do Tiyatila. Si maniring ka am, 'Yamaniring o Anak na ni Ama ta do to a yakmey apoy so mata yamanikap a yameyyai so yakmey aswaz a nilinasan am:

language1_text: I know thy works, and charity, and service, and faith, and thy patience, and thy works; and the last to be more than the first.
language2_text: Yako katenngan o mo kasasaodan. Ko katenngan o nyo kararalay nyaken. Ko katenngan o nakenakem nyo si Ama ta do to a kano vazay nyo si Ama ta do to a yaji macizizikna do alalaw nyo. Yako katenngan o na karwaro pa no vazay nyo sicyaikwaya kano kakwa.

language1_text: Notwithstanding I have a few things against thee, because thou sufferest that woman Jezebel, which calleth herself a prophetess, to teach and to seduce my servants to commit fornication, and to eat things sacrificed unto idols.
language2_text: Am yasa ka vazay pa o yako oyyan ninyo. Inyo rana am nyo to amyapya o malas so ciring a mavakes a meyngaran so Yesipi. Na cirarahen o lamlamsoy ko a mapasagpyan so kataotao da a yakoman so pazos da no yamalas a da iraralay.

language1_text: And I gave her space to repent of her fornication; and she repented not.
language2_text: Nipanci ko rana jya o kapamlis na am ji na ablisi o kapasagpyan na so kataotao na.

language1_text: Behold, I will cast her into a bed, and them that commit adultery with her into great tribulation, except they repent of their deeds.
language2_text: Citahen nyo an, o pasingsingtan ko jya, keyngen no kataotao na an. O kararay na mapasagpyan so kataotao da am no si mamlis sira ji rana mapasagpyan so kataotao da am ori ikapya da. Am no si ji sira mamlis am pazanoden ko sira a peydednan no alalaw.

language1_text: And I will kill her children with death; and all the churches shall know that I am he which searcheth the reins and hearts: and I will give unto every one of you according to your works.
language2_text: Wakwaken ko sira o macihza jya tao, ipakatenngan da jyaken no tao do peycyakyokyokayan na a makateneng do onowned no tao. To ko palololwa do mina vazay nyo o itoro ko jinyo.

language1_text: But unto you I say, and unto the rest in Thyatira, as many as have not this doctrine, and which have not known the depths of Satan, as they speak; I will put upon you none other burden.
language2_text: "'Am inyo rana tatasa ka tao do Tiyatila a jya niomonot do malas a nanao a jya nimacinanao do matayo a iwawalam ni Satan am ji ko na norwan jinyo o masalit a ji nyo a patakan a vazay.

language1_text: But that which ye have already hold fast till I come.
language2_text: Am ahapen nyo o yanyo na nimamizing a nanao ni Ama ta do to mangay do ikeypirwa ko a meyhekas do karawan.

language1_text: And he that overcometh, and keepeth my works unto the end, to him will I give power over the nations:
language2_text: Sira rana jya nimablis so onowned a tao a to noib nya do karawan a mahap so nanao ko am ipanta ko sira so oyowyat da a tomalamozong no karawan.

language1_text: and he shall rule them with a rod of iron; as the vessels of a potter shall they be broken to shivers: even as I received of my Father.
language2_text: O itoro ko jira oyowyat am akman so oyowyat a nitoro na jyaken ni Ama. So icyakma dey vahalang to makaspi so vahanga a tomalamozong no karawan.

language1_text: And I will give him the morning star.
language2_text: Azawen ko sira so karow a mata no hanit.

language1_text: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches.
language2_text: O ciring no Seyzi so peycyakyokyokayan na am amizngen nyo a yameycicilwan a tao an.'

language1_text: And unto the angel of the church in Sardis write; These things saith he that hath the seven Spirits of God, and the seven stars; I know thy works, that thou hast a name that thou livest, and art dead.
language2_text: "Ipeyteygami mo o yamimong no kyokay do Satise. Si maniring ka am, 'Yamaniring o na yanan no Seyzi na ni Ama ta do to a kano yapito a ka mata no hanit am: Ko katenngan o nyo kasasaodan. Ko katenngan o da kapanci ninyo no tao a yamahap so nanao ko. Am yaji meyngongyod o onowned nyo jyaken.

language1_text: Be watchful, and strengthen the things which remain, that are ready to die: for I have not found thy works perfect before God.
language2_text: Am ori o ipeytataziman nyo an. Ta komdeng kamo so nakem an, do yanyo ikavyay pa eya an. Ta ko katenngan o vazay nyo do tangain ni Ama ta do to a yapa ji makanet.

language1_text: Remember therefore how thou hast received and heard, and hold fast, and repent. If therefore thou shalt not watch, I will come on thee as a thief, and thou shalt not know what hour I will come upon thee.
language2_text: Am peyyanen nyo do onowned nyo o yanyo nimamizing a nanao ni Ama ta do to a kapangononong nyo jya a komaro do raraten nyo. No si ji kamo yokay am ji ko mapaziman a mai akman so manakaw a tao. Jyabo kapakateneng nyo do araraw no yai ko a.

language1_text: Thou hast a few names even in Sardis which have not defiled their garments; and they shall walk with me in white: for they are worthy.
language2_text: Am yapa myan do Satise so yatatasa ka tao a yaji meylimoteng so onowned a yakman so ayob a manownaw. So ikanoyong da pehzahen ko jyaken do da katey yapya so nakenakem do tangain ko.

language1_text: He that overcometh, the same shall be clothed in white raiment; and I will not blot out his name out of the book of life, but I will confess his name before my Father, and before his angels.
language2_text: So icyakman da sang no jya nimablis so onowned a tao a peyyayoban ko so malavang a ayob. Ji ko ngopasa o ngaran da do vakong ko a yana adketan no ngarangaran da no na yanan no to meyyonong a ikavyay no pahad. Abneken ko sira do tangain ni Ama kano tinsi a monganay jyaken.

language1_text: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches.
language2_text: O ciring no Seyzi do peycyakyokyokayan na am amizngen nyo a yameycicilwan a tao an.'

language1_text: And to the angel of the church in Philadelphia write; These things saith he that is holy, he that is true, he that hath the key of David, he that openeth, and no man shutteth; and shutteth, and no man openeth;
language2_text: "Ipeyteygami mo o yamimong no kyokay do Veylatevey. Si maniring ka am, 'Yamaniring o yaji meylimoteng so onowned a tey manoyong am: Yaken rana am akman ko so panirsirngen a meyngaran so Tawey a yatomalamozong no kagi. So ikabo no tao a makaneb do niwangan ko. O yako nyaneban am abo makeywang jya.

language1_text: I know thy works: behold, I have set before thee an open door, and no man can shut it: for thou hast a little strength, and hast kept my word, and hast not denied my name.
language2_text: Ko katenngan o kasasaodan nyo. Ko katenngan nyo kajyowyatan. Am nyo kapangononong do nanao ko a yaji mapasaklang jyaken. Ko na niwangan o yasa ka pazezevngen do tangain nyo. O ko niwangan a pazezevngen am abo rana tao a makaneb jya.

language1_text: Behold, I will make them of the synagogue of Satan, which say they are Jews, and are not, but do lie; behold, I will make them to come and worship before thy feet, and to know that I have loved thee.
language2_text: Citahen nyo sira o kalavongan ni Satan a yamanci no yada ka tao do Yotay a yamangalalas. Ipanci ko sira mai a meylilitod do tangain nyo a kapakateneng da na jyaken a marilaw ninyo.

language1_text: Because thou hast kept the word of my patience, I also will keep thee from the hour of temptation, which shall come upon all the world, to try them that dwell upon the earth.
language2_text: Ta inyo rana am nyo pangononongan o ciring ko a yaji macizizikna jya. Am ori o apzatan ko jinyo no meydedna do karawan o alalaw a ileylamdam ko so tao do karawan.

language1_text: Behold, I come quickly: hold that fast which thou hast, that no man take thy crown.
language2_text: Ko na makeykai a mai. Am ori o ji nyo amtaji no kapangononong nyo do ciring ko an, a ji mamyapya no tao a mehes so azaw nyo a jyablis so onowned.

language1_text: Him that overcometh will I make a pillar in the temple of my God, and he shall go no more out: and I will write upon him the name of my God, and the name of the city of my God, which is new Jerusalem, which cometh down out of heaven from my God: and I will write upon him my new name.
language2_text: O jya nimablis so onowned a tao am akman sira so sominogat a ai no vahay a ralaralayan da ni Ama ta do to a vahay a kaji da na ngarwan do dang. Ta padketen ko do kataotao da o ngaran na ni Ama ta do to a kano ngaran no ili na ni Ama ta do to. Ori rana am apo ji Ama ta do to do teyngato a nipakas na a Vayo a Yelosaleng a kapadket ko so vayo a ngaran ko do kataotao da.

language1_text: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches.
language2_text: O ciring no Seyzi do peycyakyokyokayan na am amizngen nyo a yameycicilwan a tao an.'

language1_text: And unto the angel of the church of the Laodiceans write; These things saith the Amen, the faithful and true witness, the beginning of the creation of God;
language2_text: "Ipeyteygami mo o yamimong no kyokay do Lawticya. Si maniring ka am, 'Yamaniring o meyngaran so Amin a yatey manoyong a ipeyhanhan so ciring a yapwan no makakaday a na nyamamaog ni Ama ta do to am:

language1_text: I know thy works, that thou art neither cold nor hot: I would thou wert cold or hot.
language2_text: Ko katenngan o kasasaodan nyo. Ko katenngan inyo a mapeyhatay so onowned nyo. Am inaoy no si to kamo nangdeng so nakem.

language1_text: So then because thou art lukewarm, and neither cold nor hot, I will spue thee out of my mouth.
language2_text: Ta inyo rana am akman kamo so nikwat a ranom a yaji ngazidangdang a yajyarekmeh. So awwan ko ninyo.

language1_text: Because thou sayest, I am rich, and increased with goods, and have need of nothing; and knowest not that thou art wretched, and miserable, and poor, and blind, and naked:
language2_text: Kamo maniring am, "Ko mabsoy a yabo so yakalakalahen." Am nyo jyatenngi nyo katey makasi a tao a mavak so velek a nyo kavota a yabo so ayob.

language1_text: I counsel thee to buy of me gold tried in the fire, that thou mayest be rich; and white raiment, that thou mayest be clothed, and that the shame of thy nakedness do not appear; and anoint thine eyes with eyesalve, that thou mayest see.
language2_text: Am ori o ko pancyan ninyo a manazang jyaken so ovay a keynakem nyo na, a kapanazang nyo so malavang a ayob nyo a payoben nyo do kataotao nyo kaji nyo a nasnekan, a kapanazang nyo so kosozi a ilinas nyo do mata nyo a kapakacita nyo na.

language1_text: As many as I love, I rebuke and chasten: be zealous therefore, and repent.
language2_text: O ikarilaw ko a tao am miminen ko sira vavagan. Am ori o ipeypakdeng nyo so nakem a komaro do raraten nyo.

language1_text: Behold, I stand at the door, and knock: if any man hear my voice, and open the door, I will come in to him, and will sup with him, and he with me.
language2_text: Amizngen nyo yaken a meytatanek do pazezevngen nyo a mapaktoktow. No amyan so makamizing jyaken a keywang na do pazezevngen am somdep ko a kapacihanghang ko jya koman.

language1_text: To him that overcometh will I grant to sit with me in my throne, even as I also overcame, and am set down with my Father in his throne.
language2_text: O jya nimablis so onowned a tao am ipanta ko so oyowyat na a kapacitangked na jyaken do lilisnan ko. So icyakman na jyaken sicyaikwaya a nimakata yamacitangked ji Ama do lilisnan na.

language1_text: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches.
language2_text: O ciring na no Seyzi do peycyakyokyokayan na am amizngen nyo a yameycicilwan a tao an.'"

language1_text: After this I looked, and, behold, a door was opened in heaven: and the first voice which I heard was as it were of a trumpet talking with me; which said, Come up hither, and I will shew thee things which must be hereafter.
language2_text: Karahan am macita ko o teyngato a kacyangan. Ipirwa ko mamizing o akmey meyzapa. Maniring am, "Tanang do jya, ta ipacita ko jimo o yaomanam a vazay."

language1_text: And immediately I was in the spirit: and, behold, a throne was set in heaven, and one sat on the throne.
language2_text: So ji ko nimeyyahahai a nitalamozong no Seyzi. So nipakacita ko na do teyngato so lilisnan no panirsirngen a keyyan no amlisna dang.

language1_text: And he that sat was to look upon like a jasper and a sardine stone: and there was a rainbow round about the throne, in sight like unto an emerald.
language2_text: O keyteytawan no moing na am akman rana so ovay a somilasilaw a kano olo a maniray. So ikatey mazway na citahen. O livolivon na no lilisnan am livonen no nangirang. O keyteytawan na am akmey tamek.

language1_text: And round about the throne were four and twenty seats: and upon the seats I saw four and twenty elders sitting, clothed in white raiment; and they had on their heads crowns of gold.
language2_text: Apat so ikasikatlo (24) o lilisnan a amlivon so lilisnan no panirsirngen ang a lisnan no papat so ikakatlwan (24) a kamanrarakehan a meyyayob so malavang a magorogod a kapeysakop da so vowawan.

language1_text: And out of the throne proceeded lightnings and thunderings and voices: and there were seven lamps of fire burning before the throne, which are the seven Spirits of God.
language2_text: Amyan so to meycicilat a kano gomanazegez a nimapo do lilisnan no panirsirngen a keyyan no apito a ka zampo a amlila do tangain no lilisnan. Ori rana am Seyzi na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: And before the throne there was a sea of glass like unto crystal: and in the midst of the throne, and round about the throne, were four beasts full of eyes before and behind.
language2_text: Amyan so malavang a panganinwan akman so awa so karakorako do tangain no lilisnan a keyyan no apat a omalalam do sirisiri no lilisnan. O sazapen da kano likod da am makakaday no aro a mata da.

language1_text: And the first beast was like a lion, and the second beast like a calf, and the third beast had a face as a man, and the fourth beast was like a flying eagle.
language2_text: O ney manma na omalalam am akma raney kokoman so tao. Ikadwa na am akmey baka. Ikatlo na am moing no tao. Ikapat na am akmey kangkang a to nalasalap.

language1_text: And the four beasts had each of them six wings about him; and they were full of eyes within: and they rest not day and night, saying, Holy, holy, holy, Lord God Almighty, which was, and is, and is to come.
language2_text: So ikamimin da meykanem so panid no apat a omalalam am tana sazapen na, tana likod na am makakaday no mata na. Sira rana am abo maraw a abo mahep a to da meyyanwanooji. O anwanood da am, "Mo ji meylimoteng so onowned a Panirsirngen a tey mowyat a Tao do to a to meyyonong a mavyay a nimapo no kakwa, kasicyaikwaya kano kangay na do kaidan no karawan."

language1_text: And when those beasts give glory and honour and thanks to him that sat on the throne, who liveth for ever and ever,
language2_text: O anwanood da no apat a ka omalalam am azwazway a kano keynakem a kano sarasaray a yanood da so to meyyonong a mavyay a omlisna do lilisnan ang. No meyyanwanood sira o omalalam am,

language1_text: the four and twenty elders fall down before him that sat on the throne, and worship him that liveth for ever and ever, and cast their crowns before the throne, saying,
language2_text: meylilitod sira o papat so ikakatlwan (24) a kamanrarakehan a omraralay no to meyyonong a mavyay a omlisna do lilisnan ang a kapangay da so sakop da vowawan do tangain no lilisnan ang. Maniring sira am,

language1_text: Thou art worthy, O Lord, to receive glory and honour and power: for thou hast created all things, and for thy pleasure they are and were created.
language2_text: "Panirsirngen namen, Tao do to namen, manoyong ka mahap so azwazway a kano keynakman a kano oyowyat. Imo nimangamamaog so makakaday. Mamimin a nakenakem mo o nikamaog no makakaday."

language1_text: And I saw in the right hand of him that sat on the throne a book written within and on the backside, sealed with seven seals.
language2_text: Ko macita o yaomlisna do lilisnan a yameypinan so makowkow a vakong no wanan na. O vakong rana am yameyyatovang a yana adketan no vatvatek a nipatodwan no apito a ipatotodo a kapadket da jya so vakong a jya nivezay pa no tao.

language1_text: And I saw a strong angel proclaiming with a loud voice, Who is worthy to open the book, and to loose the seals thereof?
language2_text: Yako kapakacita pa so yatey mowyat a tinsi a yamlolos a yamanci no, "Sino o makapakaro so nipadketan a vakong a kavezay na sya."

language1_text: And no man in heaven, nor in earth, neither under the earth, was able to open the book, neither to look thereon.
language2_text: Am tana do teyngato a tana do teyrahem a tana mavyay a tana nimawakwak rana am abo o asa ka tao a makavezay sya vilangan.

language1_text: And I wept much, because no man was found worthy to open and to read the book, neither to look thereon.
language2_text: Ori o nilavi ko, ta abo tao makawasak sya vezain a vilangan so vakong ang. Ta ji pa makanet o onowned da.

language1_text: And one of the elders saith unto me, Weep not: behold, the Lion of the tribe of Juda, the Root of David, hath prevailed to open the book, and to loose the seven seals thereof.
language2_text: Karahan am maniring jyaken o asa ka tao do kamanrarakehan am, "Ji ka lavi. Citahey o Kokoman so tao a yanimakowbot a yapo do iteytetngehan ni Yoda a sivovoong ni Tawey a yarana nimakata. Iya o mapakaro so yapito a ka vakong a nipadketan."

language1_text: And I beheld, and, lo, in the midst of the throne and of the four beasts, and in the midst of the elders, stood a Lamb as it had been slain, having seven horns and seven eyes, which are the seven Spirits of God sent forth into all the earth.
language2_text: Karahan am macita ko o Kagling a amyan do avak no lilisnan a kano apat a ka omalalam a kano kamanrarakehan. O Kagling rana am akma raney niwakwak da a apito so ozong a kapito no mata na. O mata na am Seyzi na ni Ama ta do to a nitovoy na mangay do teyrahem.

language1_text: And he came and took the book out of the right hand of him that sat upon the throne.
language2_text: Karahan am meypasngen o Kagling do sazapen no lilisnan a kahap na so vakong do wanan no amyan do lilisnan ang.

language1_text: And when he had taken the book, the four beasts and four and twenty elders fell down before the Lamb, having every one of them harps, and golden vials full of odours, which are the prayers of saints.
language2_text: Todahen na o vakong no Kagling am meylilitod sira o papat so ikakatlwan (24) a kamanrarakehan a kano apat a ka omalalam do tangain no Kagling a kamimin da no kamanrarakehan a meykaryag a somaray a kaponged da no vowawan a kapnowan no mahangno a haneng. O mahangno a haneng am inozi da ori no manaralay a tao,

language1_text: And they sung a new song, saying, Thou art worthy to take the book, and to open the seals thereof: for thou wast slain, and hast redeemed us to God by thy blood out of every kindred, and tongue, and people, and nation;
language2_text: a kapeyyanwanood da so vayo a anood. O kanwanoodan na am, "Imo o makahap so vakong a mapakaro so nipadketan a vakong. Ta imo rana am niwakwak da imo. O nimvoyog a rala mo am nimapatastas so tao do peycyeylilyan na kano meykataretarek so ciring a kano meytaretarek a tao do sinokob no hanit a yaitoro ji Ama ta do to a yaponged na.

language1_text: and hast made us unto our God kings and priests: and we shall reign on the earth.
language2_text: Imo yada nipamlis a yada to ngonongonongi do kangay da do tangain na ni Ama ta do to a amraralay nya. So talamozongan da no teyrahem no makwa."

language1_text: And I beheld, and I heard the voice of many angels round about the throne and the beasts and the elders: and the number of them was ten thousand times ten thousand, and thousands of thousands;
language2_text: Karahan am ko pa macita yako kapakamizing so yamakazivo a tinsi a omlivon so lilisnan no Panirsirngen a kano apat a ka omalalam a kano kamanrarakehan,

language1_text: saying with a loud voice, Worthy is the Lamb that was slain to receive power, and riches, and wisdom, and strength, and honour, and glory, and blessing.
language2_text: a omlololos a meyyanwanood. O aingan no anood da am, "O niwakwak da Kagling am manoyong a mahap so oyowyat a kano keynakman a kano teneteneng a kano azwazway a kano sarasaray a anwanooden."

language1_text: And every creature which is in heaven, and on the earth, and under the earth, and such as are in the sea, and all that are in them, heard I saying, Blessing, and honour, and glory, and power, be unto him that sitteth upon the throne, and unto the Lamb for ever and ever.
language2_text: Karahan am mamizing ko o makakaday a nyamaog na do teyngato a kado teyrahem a kado awa, pacyangayan da no nimawakwak rana tao meyyanwanood. O aingan no anood da am, "Inaoy no si mamimin o sarasaray a kano azwazway a kano oyowyat a mangay do yaomlisna do lilisnan na kano Kagling a mangay do kaidan no karawan."

language1_text: And the four beasts said, Amen. And the four and twenty elders fell down and worshipped him that liveth for ever and ever.
language2_text: Maniring sira o apat a ka omalalam am, "Yamanoyong," a kapeylilitod da rana o kamanrarakehan a omraralay nya.

language1_text: And I saw when the Lamb opened one of the seals, and I heard, as it were the noise of thunder, one of the four beasts saying, Come and see.
language2_text: Macita ko o Kagling a mapakaro so ney manma na nipadketan a vakong do makowkow a vakong ang a kapakamizing ko so asa ka omalalam do apat ang a zomaigezeg a akma raney adey. Maniring am, "Sijya."

language1_text: And I saw, and behold a white horse: and he that sat on him had a bow; and a crown was given unto him: and he went forth conquering, and to conquer.
language2_text: Citahen ko am macita ko o asa ka malavang a baka. O maoran do baka am meypinan so akmey paltog a mangay macyarap a kapanta da nya so sakop a kangay na rana. So ikanoyong na makata.

language1_text: And when he had opened the second seal, I heard the second beast say, Come and see.
language2_text: Pakarwen na no Kagling o ikadwa no vakong a nipadketan am mamizing ko o ikadwa no omalalam a meyzezyak. Maniring am, "Sijya."

language1_text: And there went out another horse that was red: and power was given to him that sat thereon to take peace from the earth, and that they should kill one another: and there was given unto him a great sword.
language2_text: Meyratateng am makowbot o asa ka akmey vangkoro a baka. O maoran do baka am amyan so oyowyat na mapeyparahet so karawan. So ipacizakazakat da na no tao. Karahan am todahen na o matarem a ipangan.

language1_text: And when he had opened the third seal, I heard the third beast say, Come and see. And I beheld, and lo a black horse; and he that sat on him had a pair of balances in his hand.
language2_text: Pakarwen na no Kagling o ikatlo no vakong a nipadketan am mamizing ko o ikatlo no omalalam a meyzezyak. Maniring am, "Sijya." Citahen ko am macita ko o asa ka mavaheng a baka. O maoran do baka tao am meypinan o lima na so pangananngan.

language1_text: And I heard a voice in the midst of the four beasts say, A measure of wheat for a penny, and three measures of barley for a penny; and see thou hurt not the oil and the wine.
language2_text: Akma koy todamizing o ciring da no apat a ka omalalam. Maniring am, "O nizpi no asa ka tao do kasaraw am ji dabsoyan pa do kapeykakcin no tao. Am to da meypanpani o kanen a haneng a kano saki."

language1_text: And when he had opened the fourth seal, I heard the voice of the fourth beast say, Come and see.
language2_text: Pakarwen no Kagling o ikapat no nipadketan a vakong am mamizing ko o ikapat no omalalam a meyzezyak. Maniring am, "Sijya."

language1_text: And I looked, and behold a pale horse: and his name that sat on him was Death, and Hell followed with him. And power was given unto them over the fourth part of the earth, to kill with sword, and with hunger, and with death, and with the beasts of the earth.
language2_text: Citahen ko am macita ko o baka akman rana so kakawan so keyteytawan. O maoran do baka am meyngaran ori so Kawakwakan a kapacitonton na no meyngaran so Heseb. So iyan no oyowyat da omwakwak so icyakapat no tao do karawan. Karwan da am mawakwak no arap. Karwan da am mawakwak no abcil. Karwan da am mawakwak no ingingnen a kano makakaday a kokoman so tao.

language1_text: And when he had opened the fifth seal, I saw under the altar the souls of them that were slain for the word of God, and for the testimony which they held:
language2_text: Pakarwen na no Kagling o ikalima no nipadketan a vakong am macita ko dobo no patanatanangan so nakem o pahad da no niwakwak da a ji macimaza no kapeylimwang da no ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: and they cried with a loud voice, saying, How long, O Lord, holy and true, dost thou not judge and avenge our blood on them that dwell on the earth?
language2_text: Maniring sira amlololos am, "Mo Panirsirngen a tey mowyat a tey meynakem a manoyong a ipeyhanhan, si mango am pacicin mo a peykapyapinpinen mo o tao do karawan a mangonong nyamen a yada niwakwak."

language1_text: And white robes were given unto every one of them; and it was said unto them, that they should rest yet for a little season, until their fellowservants also and their brethren, that should be killed as they were, should be fulfilled.
language2_text: Makarahan am maponged sira no malavang a magorogod a kapakamizing ko so ciring a manci nira meywalam pa, mangay no si mablit rana sira o kararay da a mahap so vazay ni Yeso Kizisto a akma dey kakteh do cinai a akman sira wakwaken da.

language1_text: And I beheld when he had opened the sixth seal, and, lo, there was a great earthquake; and the sun became black as sackcloth of hair, and the moon became as blood;
language2_text: Karahan am macita ko pa o Kagling a mapakaro so ikanem no vakong a nipadketan. No kanang am mina to meykanini. So icyakma ney mavaheng a milakayob no araw a nimahesep. O vehan rana am akma raney rala.

language1_text: and the stars of heaven fell unto the earth, even as a fig tree casteth her untimely figs, when she is shaken of a mighty wind.
language2_text: O mata no hanit rana am makas rana do teyrahem, akman rana so mata pa asi no kayo a nizigzig no pagpag a makas do teyrahem.

language1_text: And the heaven departed as a scroll when it is rolled together; and every mountain and island were moved out of their places.
language2_text: O hanit rana am akma raney vakong a nikowkow a todabo. O tokon a kano mahataw am mablis sira do yanan da.

language1_text: And the kings of the earth, and the great men, and the rich men, and the chief captains, and the mighty men, and every bondman, and every free man, hid themselves in the dens and in the rocks of the mountains;
language2_text: O panipanirsirngen rana do karawan a kano makayokod no teyhesa ka mahataw a kano kabtekan da no panirsirngen no itaysang a kano meynakem a tao a kano peylamsoin da kano to naliway a tao am mamimin sira mangay somazok do meykavavavahay a azcip a kano tokon,

language1_text: and said to the mountains and rocks, Fall on us, and hide us from the face of him that sitteth on the throne, and from the wrath of the Lamb:
language2_text: a kalololos da do tokotokon a kado pongopongow a manci no, "Zingboi kamo yamen a taywen a kaji da makacittan jyamen no yasomozi so moing a Kagling a kano yaomlisna do lilisnan a Tao do to.

language1_text: For the great day of his wrath is come; and who shall be able to stand?
language2_text: Ta oya rana o araraw no ipakaranes no da peyoyaoyyan. Sino todavangon do dang."

language1_text: And after these things I saw four angels standing on the four corners of the earth, holding the four winds of the earth, that the wind should not blow on the earth, nor on the sea, nor on any tree.
language2_text: Makarahan am macita ko o apat a ka tinsi a madaday do ngoso no palipalanginan a somengseng do yapwan no meykapat a pagpag a kaji na makaligligisi so yanan no karawan a kano awa kano kayokayo.

language1_text: And I saw another angel ascending from the east, having the seal of the living God: and he cried with a loud voice to the four angels, to whom it was given to hurt the earth and the sea,
language2_text: Macita ko o asa ka tinsi apo do daddan no araw a meypinan so akmey ipadedket a yongkad ni Ama ta do to a amlolos a tomawag do nipanta na ni Ama ta do to so oyowyat a papat a ka tinsi a tey mowyat a to rana mapeykaraherahet so karawan a kano awa.

language1_text: saying, Hurt not the earth, neither the sea, nor the trees, till we have sealed the servants of our God in their foreheads.
language2_text: Maniring am, "Ji nyo peykaraherahet o karawan a kano awa kano kayokayo. Pananalahen nyo pa yamen a mapadket do zozogwan no lamlamsoy ni Ama ta do to so itovil namen jira."

language1_text: And I heard the number of them which were sealed: and there were sealed an hundred and forty and four thousand of all the tribes of the children of Israel.
language2_text: O nimamizing ko pa am o nipadketan do iteytetngehan da no Isedi a tao am yamyan so ikakapatan da ranaw so ikalima da zivo no ikadwa da latos (144, 000) no tao.

language1_text: Of the tribe of Juda were sealed twelve thousand. Of the tribe of Reuben were sealed twelve thousand. Of the tribe of Gad were sealed twelve thousand.
language2_text: O nipadketan do iteytetngehan da ni Yoda am o kakarwan sira ranaw so ikakarwan na zivo (12, 000). O iteytetngehan ni Dipen am kakarwan sira ranaw so ikakarwan na zivo (12, 000). O iteytetngehan ni Cyate am kakarwan sira ranaw so ikakarwan na zivo (12, 000).

language1_text: Of the tribe of Aser were sealed twelve thousand. Of the tribe of Nepthalim were sealed twelve thousand. Of the tribe of Manasses were sealed twelve thousand.
language2_text: O iteytetngehan ni Asiar am kakarwan sira ranaw so ikakarwan na zivo (12, 000). O iteytetngehan ni Navotadi am kakarwan sira ranaw so ikakarwan na zivo (12, 000). O iteytetngehan ni Manase am kakarwan sira ranaw so ikakarwan na zivo (12, 000).

language1_text: Of the tribe of Simeon were sealed twelve thousand. Of the tribe of Levi were sealed twelve thousand. Of the tribe of Issachar were sealed twelve thousand.
language2_text: O iteytetngehan ni Simoyang am kakarwan sira ranaw so ikakarwan na zivo (12, 000). O iteytetngehan ni Diwey am kakarwan sira ranaw so ikakarwan na zivo (12, 000). O iteytetngehan ni Isacya am kakarwan sira ranaw so ikakarwan na zivo (12, 000).

language1_text: Of the tribe of Zabulon were sealed twelve thousand. Of the tribe of Joseph were sealed twelve thousand. Of the tribe of Benjamin were sealed twelve thousand.
language2_text: O iteytetngehan ni Sipolon am kakarwan sira ranaw so ikakarwan na zivo (12, 000). O iteytetngehan ni Yoseyvo am kakarwan sira ranaw so ikakarwan na zivo (12, 000). O iteytetngehan ni Penyaming am kakarwan sira ranaw so ikakarwan na zivo (12, 000).

language1_text: After this I beheld, and, lo, a great multitude, which no man could number, of all nations, and kindreds, and people, and tongues, stood before the throne, and before the Lamb, clothed with white robes, and palms in their hands;
language2_text: Karahan am makacita ko so aro a tao am jyavilangi sira rana apo do peycyamahamahatawan na kano meykataretarek so ciriciring a meytatanek do sazapen no lilisnan a kano Kagling. Meyyayob sira so malavang a magorogod a meypinan so voovoong.

language1_text: and cried with a loud voice, saying, Salvation to our God which sitteth upon the throne, and unto the Lamb.
language2_text: Maniring sira amlololos am, "Isaray ta si Ama ta do to a omlisna do lilisnan a kano Kagling, ta sira o mapatazadang jyaten."

language1_text: And all the angels stood round about the throne, and about the elders and the four beasts, and fell before the throne on their faces, and worshipped God,
language2_text: Mamimin o tinsi a meytatanek do livolivon no lilisnan a kano kamanrarakehan a kano apat a ka omalalam a kapeylilitod da do sazapen no lilisnan a omraralay ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: saying, Amen: Blessing, and glory, and wisdom, and thanksgiving, and honour, and power, and might, be unto our God for ever and ever. Amen.
language2_text: Maniring sira am, "Amin. Inaoy no si omaing jimo mo Ama do to o sarasaray a kano azwazway a kano teneteneng a kano keynakman a kano oyowyat a mangay do kaidan no karawan! Amin!"

language1_text: And one of the elders answered, saying unto me, What are these which are arrayed in white robes? and whence came they?
language2_text: Maniring o asa ka rarakeh do aro a kamanrarakehan jyaken am, "Sino sira o yameyyayob so yamalavang a magorogod ang. Do wanjin da kapwan nira ang."

language1_text: And I said unto him, Sir, thou knowest. And he said to me, These are they which came out of great tribulation, and have washed their robes, and made them white in the blood of the Lamb.
language2_text: Maniring ko am, "Imo o makateneng jya." Maniring jyaken am, "Sira rana am nimasapa da o rako a alalaw da no kakwa. Sira rana am nioyasan da no rala no Kagling o ayob da. So na ikalalavang rana no ayob da.

language1_text: Therefore are they before the throne of God, and serve him day and night in his temple: and he that sitteth on the throne shall dwell among them.
language2_text: Ori o da ipeytatanek do sazapen no lilisnan ni Ama ta do to a yamahap so vazay na no yamaraw a kano mahep do panaralayan a mangay na apzatan ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: They shall hunger no more, neither thirst any more; neither shall the sun light on them, nor any heat.
language2_text: So ji da ranakcini a ji da rana awawi a kaji da rana dangdangan no araw a kano yazidangdang na.

language1_text: For the Lamb which is in the midst of the throne shall feed them, and shall lead them unto living fountains of waters: and God shall wipe away all tears from their eyes.
language2_text: Ta peyveyveknen na sira no meytatanek do sazapen no lilisnan a Kagling a kapangonong na nira yangay do atbodan no ranom a yakapwan no to meyyonong a ikavyay no pahad da. So ikanoyong ni Ama ta do to a omlinas do kaoo da."

language1_text: And when he had opened the seventh seal, there was silence in heaven about the space of half an hour.
language2_text: Pakarwen no Kagling o ikapito no vakong a nipadketan am kakteb no vatvatek o ji na nimeyminiminiki no teyngato.

language1_text: And I saw the seven angels which stood before God; and to them were given seven trumpets.
language2_text: Makarahan am macita ko o papito a ka tinsi a meytatanek a maponged no teyhesa ka zapa.

language1_text: And another angel came and stood at the altar, having a golden censer; and there was given unto him much incense, that he should offer it with the prayers of all saints upon the golden altar which was before the throne.
language2_text: O asa ka tinsi am mai a meypinan so vowawan a yanan no mahangno a haneng a meytatanek do patanatanangan so nakem. So ikaro no mahangno a haneng a nitoro da jya a kapazanod na so inozi no sinjya patanangen do vowawan a patanatanangan so nakem do sazapen no lilisnan.

language1_text: And the smoke of the incense, which came with the prayers of the saints, ascended up before God out of the angel's hand.
language2_text: O aob no mahangno a haneng am macizanod do inozi da no sinjya a kapeypangato na apo do lima no tinsi a yameytatanek do tangain ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: And the angel took the censer, and filled it with fire of the altar, and cast it into the earth: and there were voices, and thunderings, and lightnings, and an earthquake.
language2_text: Makarahan am apnowen no tinsi o vowawan a yanan no mahangno a haneng no apoy do patanatanangan so nakem a kabokbok na nya do teyrahem. Am ori o niyan no zomaigezeg a kapeycicilat na a kapeykanini na.

language1_text: And the seven angels which had the seven trumpets prepared themselves to sound.
language2_text: Makarahan am o papito a tinsi a meypinan so teyhesa ka zapa a omanam a da avyotan.

language1_text: The first angel sounded, and there followed hail and fire mingled with blood, and they were cast upon the earth: and the third part of trees was burnt up, and all green grass was burnt up.
language2_text: Avyotan no ney manma na tinsi am amyan so makarerekmeh a kano apoy a pacizavozan no rala a mabokbok do teyrahem. Karahan am o icyakatlo no tana kano kayo am nimamimin a matemtem. So nikamimin no tamek a nimatemtem.

language1_text: And the second angel sounded, and as it were a great mountain burning with fire was cast into the sea: and the third part of the sea became blood;
language2_text: Avyotan no ikararwa no tinsi am amyan so akma raney masleb a rako a tokon a makas do awa. O icyakatlo no awa am to rana meyngongyod a rala.

language1_text: and the third part of the creatures which were in the sea, and had life, died; and the third part of the ships were destroyed.
language2_text: O masaod no awa am icyakatlo na o nimawakwak. O avang am icyakatlo na o nimakava.

language1_text: And the third angel sounded, and there fell a great star from heaven, burning as it were a lamp, and it fell upon the third part of the rivers, and upon the fountains of waters;
language2_text: Avyotan no ikatatlo no tinsi am amyan so rako a mata no hanit a masleb no apoy a makas a apo do hanit a makas do icyakatlo no ayo a kado icyakatlo no atbod.

language1_text: and the name of the star is called Wormwood: and the third part of the waters became wormwood; and many men died of the waters, because they were made bitter.
language2_text: O ngaran no mata no hanit am Makopad. Karahan am icyakatlo no ranom to rana kopad. Ayopen no aro a tao am meycyawawakwak sira do kakopad no ranom ang.

language1_text: And the fourth angel sounded, and the third part of the sun was smitten, and the third part of the moon, and the third part of the stars; so as the third part of them was darkened, and the day shone not for a third part of it, and the night likewise.
language2_text: Avyotan no ikapapat no tinsi am icyakatlo no araw a kano vehan a kano mata no hanit o ji rana makacimat. Am ori o icyakatlo no araw a todasari. Akman sang no macyey no mahep, ta icyakatlo no ahep o to na sari.

language1_text: And I beheld, and heard an angel flying through the midst of heaven, saying with a loud voice, Woe, woe, woe, to the inhabiters of the earth by reason of the other voices of the trumpet of the three angels, which are yet to sound!
language2_text: Citahen ko am mamizing ko o asa ka kangkang a somalap do hanit. Maniring am, "To sira makasi o tao do teyrahem. Ta da rana avatan no yatatlo a ka tinsi o zapa yavyotan."

language1_text: And the fifth angel sounded, and I saw a star fall from heaven unto the earth: and to him was given the key of the bottomless pit.
language2_text: Avyotan no ikalalima no tinsi o zapa am macita ko o asa ka mata no hanit a makas do teyrahem a kahap na so kagi no abo so takadan a gazawagaw a jyatenngi so karaherahem.

language1_text: And he opened the bottomless pit; and there arose a smoke out of the pit, as the smoke of a great furnace; and the sun and the air were darkened by reason of the smoke of the pit.
language2_text: Iwangan na no mata no hanit o gazawagaw am mamsot o rako a aob. So ikakedep na rana no araw a bonbonan no rako a aob,

language1_text: And there came out of the smoke locusts upon the earth: and unto them was given power, as the scorpions of the earth have power.
language2_text: a keyyan no zozon a makowbot do aob a makas do teyrahem. So icyakma dey alilipwan a manongit so tao,

language1_text: And it was commanded them that they should not hurt the grass of the earth, neither any green thing, neither any tree; but only those men which have not the seal of God in their foreheads.
language2_text: a keyyan no ciring a manci nya jira so kaji da mapeycyaraherahetan so tamek a kano kayo a kano makakaday a mowamowa. Am apya o kasongit da so jya nitovilan so zozogwan a tao, do kapakatovil da jira a omanop ji Ama ta do to.

language1_text: And to them it was given that they should not kill them, but that they should be tormented five months: and their torment was as the torment of a scorpion, when he striketh a man.
language2_text: Am marahet o kato da na patoposan sira, ta kapeyingen da sira so kataotao so kalima vehan. O pakaliliwan da sya am akman rana so nisongit no alilipwan a maninicin.

language1_text: And in those days shall men seek death, and shall not find it; and shall desire to die, and death shall flee from them.
language2_text: Apyapyahen da pa o kato da na wakwakan do makalima vehan am ji sira wakwak.

language1_text: And the shapes of the locusts were like unto horses prepared unto battle; and on their heads were as it were crowns like gold, and their faces were as the faces of men.
language2_text: O kamamagenan da no zozon am akma raney omarap a baka. O sakop da am akma raney vowawan. O moing da am akma raney tao.

language1_text: And they had hair as the hair of women, and their teeth were as the teeth of lions.
language2_text: O avok da am akmey avok no mavakes. O ngepen da am akmey ngepen no kokoman so tao.

language1_text: And they had breastplates, as it were breastplates of iron; and the sound of their wings was as the sound of chariots of many horses running to battle.
language2_text: O asot da am akma raney vahalang. No somalap sira am akma raney komsoz a baka a zomaigezeg.

language1_text: And they had tails like unto scorpions, and there were stings in their tails: and their power was to hurt men five months.
language2_text: Meyyanenbek o ipos da a icyakma dey alilipwan. O ipos da am ori tey rahet a mapeyrarahet so tao so makalima vehan.

language1_text: And they had a king over them, which is the angel of the bottomless pit, whose name in the Hebrew tongue is Abaddon, but in the Greek tongue hath his name Apollyon.
language2_text: Amyan so asa ka panirsirngen a tomalamozong nira. Iya rana am tinsi a tomalamozong no abo so takadan a gazawagaw a jyatenngi so karaherahem. O ingaran da jya no Sipolay am Apaton. O ingaran da jya no tao do Sila am Apolon. O peypeypangayan no nang am Manbalinas.

language1_text: One woe is past; and, behold, there come two woes more hereafter.
language2_text: Mavitos o ney manma na alalaw am amyan pa so meykadwa alalaw a mai.

language1_text: And the sixth angel sounded, and I heard a voice from the four horns of the golden altar which is before God,
language2_text: Avyotan no ikananem no tinsi am makamizing ko so meyzezyak do livolivon no vowawan a patanatanangan so nakem do tangain ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: saying to the sixth angel which had the trumpet, Loose the four angels which are bound in the great river Euphrates.
language2_text: Maniring do ikananem no tinsi a meyzapa am, "Pasaway rana o yapapat a ka tinsi a nipteng do ayo a yameyngaran so Yovalati."

language1_text: And the four angels were loosed, which were prepared for an hour, and a day, and a month, and a year, for to slay the third part of men.
language2_text: Karahan am pasawain na rana sira o papat a ka tinsi. Am amyan rana akman sang a nakenakem da a ambalinas so icyakatlo no tao do karawan do awan eya, do vehan eya, do araw eya a sicyacitwai.

language1_text: And the number of the army of the horsemen were two hundred thousand thousand: and I heard the number of them.
language2_text: O nimamizing ko pa macihza do apat a ka tinsi am yadwa ranaw so kalatolatos (200, 000, 000) sira o tao a maoran do baka itaysang.

language1_text: And thus I saw the horses in the vision, and them that sat on them, having breastplates of fire, and of jacinth, and brimstone: and the heads of the horses were as the heads of lions; and out of their mouths issued fire and smoke and brimstone.
language2_text: O nimacita ko pa do tateynep ko am aro a baka kano maoran do baka itaysang. O asot da no maoran do baka itaysang am akmey vangkoro a kano mazaponay so keyteytawan a kano akmey kawarey no manok so keyteytawan. O oo no baka am akmey oo no kokoman so tao a keyyan no apoy a kano aob a mamsot do ngoso da.

language1_text: By these three was the third part of men killed, by the fire, and by the smoke, and by the brimstone, which issued out of their mouths.
language2_text: Icyakatlo no tao do karawan o nimawakwak no mamsot do ngongoy no aro a baka apoy a kano aob.

language1_text: For their power is in their mouth, and in their tails: for their tails were like unto serpents, and had heads, and with them they do hurt.
language2_text: O oyowyat da no baka am amyan do ngongoy da kano ipos da. So icyakma ney volay no ipos da a pacitolangan no oo da a mapeyzaza so tao.

language1_text: And the rest of the men which were not killed by these plagues yet repented not of the works of their hands, that they should not worship devils, and idols of gold, and silver, and brass, and stone, and of wood: which neither can see, nor hear, nor walk:
language2_text: O karwan no tao do karawan a jya nimawakwak no apo do ngongoy no baka am ji da macimazai o kararalay da no kalamsoyan ni Satan a kano ovay a kano gizit a kano vato a kano kayokayo a nyamaog da a ji makacita, ji makamizing, ji makalam.

language1_text: neither repented they of their murders, nor of their sorceries, nor of their fornication, nor of their thefts.
language2_text: Ji da nazidan kapanwakwak da so tao a mangalalas no oyowyat ni Satan, mapeyzavozavoz so tao na a kapanakaw da. So ikabo no pamlimlisan da.

language1_text: And I saw another mighty angel come down from heaven, clothed with a cloud: and a rainbow was upon his head, and his face was as it were the sun, and his feet as pillars of fire:
language2_text: Nimakacita ko pa so asa ka tey mowyat a tinsi apo do teyngato a meyyayob so cinalab a meysakop so nangirang. O moing na am akma raney araw a maniray. O ai na am akma raney amlida apoy.

language1_text: and he had in his hand a little book open: and he set his right foot upon the sea, and his left foot on the earth,
language2_text: O lima na am meypinan so mavezay a likta vakong. O asa ka ai na am amzasag do awa. O asa ka ai na am amzasag do kacyan.

language1_text: and cried with a loud voice, as when a lion roareth: and when he had cried, seven thunders uttered their voices.
language2_text: No amlololos ori am akma raney kokoman so tao so ilololos. No ipisa amlolos am apito o adey a zomaigezeg.

language1_text: And when the seven thunders had uttered their voices, I was about to write: and I heard a voice from heaven saying unto me, Seal up those things which the seven thunders uttered, and write them not.
language2_text: Padketen ko o peypeypangayan no apito a ka adey am amyan so ciring a apo do teyngato. Maniring am, "O peypeypangayan no yapito a ka adey am ji mo meycicicyan. Ji mo padketa."

language1_text: And the angel which I saw stand upon the sea and upon the earth lifted up his hand to heaven,
language2_text: Komavos rana ori am o nimacita ko a tinsi a meytatanek do awa kado kacyan am macita ko rana mapatala so wanan na do teyngato,

language1_text: and sware by him that liveth for ever and ever, who created heaven, and the things that therein are, and the earth, and the things that therein are, and the sea, and the things which are therein, that there should be time no longer:
language2_text: kasirisiring na si Ama ta do to a nimangamamaog so hanit a kano teyrahem a kano awa kano meycyamadadayan a nyamamaog na. Maniring am, "Ji rana inini ori.

language1_text: but in the days of the voice of the seventh angel, when he shall begin to sound, the mystery of God should be finished, as he hath declared to his servants the prophets.
language2_text: Ta no si omanam pa avyotan no ikapito no tinsi am pangononongan na rana ni Ama ta do to o mina ciring na pa so aro a lamlamsoy na a panoyonoywan na so ciring na."

language1_text: And the voice which I heard from heaven spake unto me again, and said, Go and take the little book which is open in the hand of the angel which standeth upon the sea and upon the earth.
language2_text: Makarahan am mamizing ko pa o nimamizing ko pa no kakwa apo do teyngato. Maniring am, "Mangay mo hapen kai mo no yamavezay a vakong do lima no tinsi a yameytatanek do awa kado kacyan."

language1_text: And I went unto the angel, and said unto him, Give me the little book. And he said unto me, Take it, and eat it up; and it shall make thy belly bitter, but it shall be in thy mouth sweet as honey.
language2_text: Mangay ko am ipanci ko o tinsi a tomoro nya jyaken so likta vakong. Maniring jyaken am, "Hapey a katlen mo nya. Tana meyngen do velek mo am cyaha, ta maganinem do ngoso mo."

language1_text: And I took the little book out of the angel's hand, and ate it up; and it was in my mouth sweet as honey: and as soon as I had eaten it, my belly was bitter.
language2_text: Karahan am todahen ko o likta vakong a apo do lima na a kakan ko sya. So nikanoyong no ngoso ko a maganinem. Am itlen ko am todeyngen rana o velek ko.

language1_text: And he said unto me, Thou must prophesy again before many peoples, and nations, and tongues, and kings.
language2_text: Maniring pa jyaken o tinsi am, "Ipisa ka pa a mangay a mapaziman sya do peycyamahamahatawan na kano meykataretarek a tao a kano meykataretarek so ciriciring a kano aro a panipanirsirngen."

language1_text: And there was given me a reed like unto a rod: and the angel stood, saying, Rise, and measure the temple of God, and the altar, and them that worship therein.
language2_text: Amyan so nimanta nyaken so kayo a dedpang. Maniring jyaken am, "Tanek a kaktokto mo do yana tankan no yararalayan ni Ama ta do to a kano patanatanangan so nakem a kavilang mo do karwaro da no yamanaralay a tao.

language1_text: But the court which is without the temple leave out, and measure it not; for it is given unto the Gentiles: and the holy city shall they tread under foot forty and two months.
language2_text: Am ji mo aktoktoi o pantaw na, ta o pantaw na am yarana nitoro do beken a tao do Yotay. Sira rana am ipeykaraherahet da o akma ney ili ni Ama ta do to a yadwa so ikasikalima (42) a vehan.

language1_text: And I will give power unto my two witnesses, and they shall prophesy a thousand two hundred and threescore days, clothed in sackcloth.
language2_text: Manovoy ko so rarwa ka meyyayob so zaping a tao a yongkad na ni Ama ta do to. Sira rana am ipeylimwang da o ciring na so adwa so ikasikalima (42) vehan."

language1_text: These are the two olive trees, and the two candlesticks standing before the God of the earth.
language2_text: O rarwa ka lamlamsoy na ni Ama ta do to am katonodan da o adwa ka kayo a kano adwa ka zampo a meytatanek do tangain ni Ama ta do to a Panirsirngen no karawan.

language1_text: And if any man will hurt them, fire proceedeth out of their mouth, and devoureth their enemies: and if any man will hurt them, he must in this manner be killed.
language2_text: No amyan so tao a amnakenakem so kapeyzaza na sira am to makowbot do ngongoy da o apoy a itemtem da so kavosoyan da a kawakwak da rana.

language1_text: These have power to shut heaven, that it rain not in the days of their prophecy: and have power over waters to turn them to blood, and to smite the earth with all plagues, as often as they will.
language2_text: Amyan so oyowyat da amzazat do cimoy do peylimwangan da no ciring na ni Ama ta do to. So talamozongan da no tozongan no ranom a kapeyvaliw da so ranom a rala. So iyan no oyowyat da a mapeykaraherahet so tao do karawan no makakaday a alalaw. Am jyapingsan o araraw no ipeykaraherahet da so tao.

language1_text: And when they shall have finished their testimony, the beast that ascendeth out of the bottomless pit shall make war against them, and shall overcome them, and kill them.
language2_text: Mateyka da ipanci o ciring na ni Ama ta do to am arapen na sira no omalalam a apo do gazawagaw a kaharag na sira wakwaken.

language1_text: And their dead bodies shall lie in the street of the great city, which spiritually is called Sodom and Egypt, where also our Lord was crucified.
language2_text: O kataotao da am to rana nangyan do rarahan do rako a ili. Do dang rana am nipadketan da so Panirsirngen ta do jyojika. O pehngehngayan da so ngaran no ili am Sotoma kano Ayci.

language1_text: And they of the people and kindreds and tongues and nations shall see their dead bodies three days and an half, and shall not suffer their dead bodies to be put in graves.
language2_text: O nimapo do peycyeytetngehan a tao a kano peycyeylilyan a kano meykataretarek so ciriciring a kano peycyamahamahatawan na am mangay da citahen o kataotao da so kasisi so ikapat a araw. Ji da amya o tao a ambobo nira.

language1_text: And they that dwell upon the earth shall rejoice over them, and make merry, and shall send gifts one to another; because these two prophets tormented them that dwelt on the earth.
language2_text: Somaray o tao do teyrahem a makacita sira a nimawakwak rana. Macyazazaw sira somaray, ta nimapo do rarwa ka lamlamsoy na ni Ama ta do to o alalaw no tao do karawan.

language1_text: And after three days and an half the spirit of life from God entered into them, and they stood upon their feet; and great fear fell upon them which saw them.
language2_text: Mavitos rana o kasisi so ikapat a araw am avyain na rana sira ni Ama ta do to. Ori o nipeyvangon da rana. Am ori o nikanyahey da no tao a makacita sira tomanek.

language1_text: And they heard a great voice from heaven saying unto them, Come up hither. And they ascended up to heaven in a cloud; and their enemies beheld them.
language2_text: Makamizing sira o rarwa ka tao so amlololos a apo do teyngato. Maniring jira am, "Sijya kamo do jya." Karahan am citahen da sira no kavosoyan da omavang do cinalab a meycyakavat do teyngato.

language1_text: And the same hour was there a great earthquake, and the tenth part of the city fell, and in the earthquake were slain of men seven thousand: and the remnant were affrighted, and gave glory to the God of heaven.
language2_text: Karahan am meykanini. Am ori o nikazkem na no pozos na no rako a ili. O nimawakwak no kanini a tao am kakapitwan na ranaw (7000) sira. So nikanyahey da no nimavezed pa tao a kazway da rana si Ama ta do to do teyngato.

language1_text: The second woe is past; and, behold, the third woe cometh quickly.
language2_text: Komavos o ikadwa no alalaw am meypanam o ikatlo no alalaw a mai.

language1_text: And the seventh angel sounded; and there were great voices in heaven, saying, The kingdoms of this world are become the kingdoms of our Lord, and of his Christ; and he shall reign for ever and ever.
language2_text: Avyotan no ikapapito no tinsi am amyan so macyak a ciring do teyngato. Maniring am, "Oyowyat a yatomalamozong no karawan am yamonganay do Panirsirngen ta kani Kizisto a nipamnekan na a yatomalamozong nya a mangay do kaidan no karawan."

language1_text: And the four and twenty elders, which sat before God on their seats, fell upon their faces, and worshipped God,
language2_text: O yamyan do tangain ni Ama ta do to yaomlisna do lilisnan na yapapat so ikakatlwan (24) a kamanrarakehan am yamamimin a yameylilitod do teyrahem a yaomraralay ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: saying, We give thee thanks, O Lord God Almighty, which art, and wast, and art to come; because thou hast taken to thee thy great power, and hast reigned.
language2_text: Maniring sira am, "Nimakalapo no kakwa na kato ngayyan sicyaikwaya Panirsirngen a yatey mowyat a Tao do to. Namen isaray imo, ta yamo nyahap no rako a oyowyat mo o mo kapeypanirsirngen sicyaikwaya.

language1_text: And the nations were angry, and thy wrath is come, and the time of the dead, that they should be judged, and that thou shouldest give reward unto thy servants the prophets, and to the saints, and them that fear thy name, small and great; and shouldest destroy them which destroy the earth.
language2_text: Ta no kapeyoyaoya da no ji raralay nimo a tao am nipadna mo rana o peyoyaoyyan mo jira. Yarana marateng o araraw no yamo ipacici so nimawakwak a tao. O lamlamsoy mo a panoyonoywan mo so ciring mo a kano yaomanop jimo a yamraralay nimo a tao am tana meynakem sira, tana makasi a tao sira am mo miminen sira azawen. Sira rana yamapeykaraherahet so karawan a tao am yamo balinasen sira."

language1_text: And the temple of God was opened in heaven, and there was seen in his temple the ark of his testament: and there were lightnings, and voices, and thunderings, and an earthquake, and great hail.
language2_text: Karahan am meywang rana o raralayan ni Ama ta do to do teyngato a kapeytotwaw no kavangan a kakozongan no nivatvatkan a pangozayan a ciring na ni Ama ta do to do Isedi a tao no kakwa pa amyan do panaralayan, a kapeycicilat na zomaigezeg, a kapeykanini na rana, a kapeycyahekas no rarako a makarerekmeh do teyrahem.

language1_text: And there appeared a great wonder in heaven; a woman clothed with the sun, and the moon under her feet, and upon her head a crown of twelve stars:
language2_text: Kapeytotwaw no mapangyangyalak a vazay do hanit. O peypeypangayan no nang am amyan so makdeng a vazay do kadadayan na so araraw. So niyan no asa ka mavakes a meyyayob so araw a kazasag na do vehan a meysakop so adwa so ikarwa (12) a mata no hanit.

language1_text: and she being with child cried, travailing in birth, and pained to be delivered.
language2_text: O mavakes rana am makeykai rana amyan do vahay. So ilololos na makaliliw so velek na.

language1_text: And there appeared another wonder in heaven; and behold a great red dragon, having seven heads and ten horns, and seven crowns upon his heads.
language2_text: Karahan am amyan pa so mapangyangyalak a meytotwaw do hanit. Amyan so asa ka rako a akmey vangkoro a kamolay. Oo na am apito. Ozong na am asa ngarnan. Makakaday oo na no sakop no panirsirngen.

language1_text: And his tail drew the third part of the stars of heaven, and did cast them to the earth: and the dragon stood before the woman which was ready to be delivered, for to devour her child as soon as it was born.
language2_text: O ipos na am kowkowen na o icyakatlo no mata no hanit a papispisen do teyrahem a kapeytatanek na do tangain no mavakes a tod na ji ngyan do vahay a mapananala so katazak na tao no kanakan a kapacyop na sya a kanen.

language1_text: And she brought forth a man child, who was to rule all nations with a rod of iron: and her child was caught up unto God, and to his throne.
language2_text: Amyan do vahay o mavakes am mahakay o anak na. So icyakma ney vahalang so kowyowyat a tomalamozong so peycyamahamahatawan na no makwa. Am o kanakan rana am katkaten do lilisnan ni Ama ta do to,

language1_text: And the woman fled into the wilderness, where she hath a place prepared of God, that they should feed her there a thousand two hundred and threescore days.
language2_text: a kaksoz no mavakes do kahasan a kangay na do angayan na nya ni Ama ta do to. So nipeyveyveknan na sya ni Ama ta do to so adwa so ikasikalima (42) a vehan.

language1_text: And there was war in heaven: Michael and his angels fought against the dragon; and the dragon fought and his angels,
language2_text: Karahan am meyyarap sira do teyngato. O meyngaran so Micyale a tinsi a kano kararay na tinsi am macyarap do kamolay a kapalolo na no kamolay so kalamsoyan na macyarap jira.

language1_text: and prevailed not; neither was their place found any more in heaven.
language2_text: Am nimaharag o kamolay. So ji da rana vezeji do teyngato no kamolay a kano kalamsoyan na,

language1_text: And the great dragon was cast out, that old serpent, called the Devil, and Satan, which deceiveth the whole world: he was cast out into the earth, and his angels were cast out with him.
language2_text: kakas na sya ni Ama ta do to so rako a kamolay. Ori rana am nimeytetnga volay no kakwa. O ngaran na am si Satan a yatomirara so tao a yameyraraten. O kamolay rana am nimamispis do teyrahem. So icyakman da sang no kalamsoyan na iwalit na do teyrahem ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: And I heard a loud voice saying in heaven, Now is come salvation, and strength, and the kingdom of our God, and the power of his Christ: for the accuser of our brethren is cast down, which accused them before our God day and night.
language2_text: Karahan am makamizing ko pa do teyngato so macyak a ciring. Maniring am, "Oya rana o araraw no na patazadangan jyaten ni Ama ta do to. Na rana nipacita ni Ama ta do to o oyowyat na. Yana rana nipatwaw ji Kizisto o oyowyat na a meymatmatngeh no teyngato. Ta na rana nipapispis do teyrahem ni Ama ta do to o yamraherahet so akma tey kakteh do cinai do maraw a kado mahep do tangain na ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: And they overcame him by the blood of the Lamb, and by the word of their testimony; and they loved not their lives unto the death.
language2_text: O rala no Kagling a kano nipeylimwang da a nanao ni Ama ta do to am ori o da niharag so kamolay. So ikanoyong da yaji hawa no yada kaliman.

language1_text: Therefore rejoice, ye heavens, and ye that dwell in them. Woe to the inhabiters of the earth and of the sea! for the devil is come down unto you, having great wrath, because he knoweth that he hath but a short time.
language2_text: Am ori o isaray nyo a tao do teyngato. So to nyo makasi a tao amyan pa do karawan. Ta yasomozi si Satan a yamangay jinyo do dang. Ta katenngan na o kalikey rana no araraw na."

language1_text: And when the dragon saw that he was cast unto the earth, he persecuted the woman which brought forth the man child.
language2_text: Katenngan no kamolay o kanimapaptad na rana do teyrahem am mangay na cyocyowen o keyyan pa do vahay a mavakes.

language1_text: And to the woman were given two wings of a great eagle, that she might fly into the wilderness, into her place, where she is nourished for a time, and times, and half a time, from the face of the serpent.
language2_text: Karahan am makahap o mavakes ang so adwa ka panid no kangkang a ipakasalap na rana mangay do kabwan no nihakawan no tao a meyvahay. So iyan na do dang so kasisi so ikapat a kawan a mapeylamnay so kataotao na a ji na rana gogadan no kamolay.

language1_text: And the serpent cast out of his mouth water as a flood after the woman, that he might cause her to be carried away of the flood.
language2_text: Meyratateng am amyan so rako a ranom a mamsot do ngongoy no kamolay a ipazyod na so mavakes.

language1_text: And the earth helped the woman, and the earth opened her mouth, and swallowed up the flood which the dragon cast out of his mouth.
language2_text: Am mina kasidong na sya no tana so mavakes a nisomepsep do tana so ranom a apo do ngongoy no kamolay.

language1_text: And the dragon was wroth with the woman, and went to make war with the remnant of her seed, which keep the commandments of God, and have the testimony of Jesus Christ.
language2_text: Karahan am somozi o kamolay a omarap so komownongan do mavakes. Ta sira rana am omonot do ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to a tao a omanoyong do nanao ni Yeso a tao.

language1_text: And I stood upon the sand of the sea, and saw a beast rise up out of the sea, having seven heads and ten horns, and upon his horns ten crowns, and upon his heads the name of blasphemy.
language2_text: Karahan am makacita ko so asa ka omalalam a apo do awa. O ozong na am asa ngarnan. Oo na am apito. O ozong na am makakaday no sakop no panirsirngen. Oo na am adketan no ngaran a iraherahet na si Ama ta do to.

language1_text: And the beast which I saw was like unto a leopard, and his feet were as the feet of a bear, and his mouth as the mouth of a lion: and the dragon gave him his power, and his seat, and great authority.
language2_text: O nimacita ko a omalalam am akma raney kokoman so tao. O ai na am akmey ai no rako a kokoman so tao. Akman sang o ngongoy na. So nitorwan na no kamolay so oyowyat na kano lilisnan na kano keynakman na do omalalam.

language1_text: And I saw one of his heads as it were wounded to death; and his deadly wound was healed: and all the world wondered after the beast.
language2_text: O asa ka oo no omalalam am akman rana so makdeng a nimeyzaza. Am kanimapya na rana no nipeyzazan na. Ori o nisavasavak da no tao do karawan a macilolo do omalalam ang.

language1_text: And they worshipped the dragon which gave power unto the beast: and they worshipped the beast, saying, Who is like unto the beast? who is able to make war with him?
language2_text: To da na raralayan o kamolay. Ta nitoro na o oyowyat na do omalalam. So icyakman na sang no omalalam a iraralay da. Maniring sira am, "Sino makataha so omalalam eya. Sino makahad sya."

language1_text: And there was given unto him a mouth speaking great things and blasphemies; and power was given unto him to continue forty and two months.
language2_text: So nipyan na pa no kamolay so omalalam a mapazway a omraherahet si Ama ta do to a kapya na sya to ngonongonong do vazay na do adwa so ikasikalima (42) a vehan.

language1_text: And he opened his mouth in blasphemy against God, to blaspheme his name, and his tabernacle, and them that dwell in heaven.
language2_text: Ori o niraherahetan na so ngaran ni Ama ta do to a kano peyvahayan na kano macikaop jya tao do teyngato.

language1_text: And it was given unto him to make war with the saints, and to overcome them: and power was given him over all kindreds, and tongues, and nations.
language2_text: So to na rana myapyai sya amgogad no omanop ji Ama ta do to a tao a iharag na sira. So ikatey mowyat na tomalamozong no meykeytetngehan a tao do karawan a kano peycyamahamahatawan na kano meykataretarek so ciriciring a tao.

language1_text: And all that dwell upon the earth shall worship him, whose names are not written in the book of life of the Lamb slain from the foundation of the world.
language2_text: O tao rana do karawan a jidket so ngaran do vakong no niwakwak da Kagling a yanan na rana no to meyyonong a ikavyay no pahad da tao am ori o amraralay nya. O vakong rana ya am na adketan no ngarangaran da no kaji na pa mangamaogan so karawan.

language1_text: If any man have an ear, let him hear.
language2_text: O meycicilwan a tao am amizngen nyo an.

language1_text: He that leadeth into captivity shall go into captivity: he that killeth with the sword must be killed with the sword. Here is the patience and the faith of the saints.
language2_text: O ipanci a vaoden am mangay kavaod sira an. O ipanci a mahap so inawan no ipangan am mangay kangay no inawan da no ipangan. So ikamimin da no amraralay ni Ama ta do to a ji macizizikna do kapeyhanhan da nya.

language1_text: And I beheld another beast coming up out of the earth; and he had two horns like a lamb, and he spake as a dragon.
language2_text: Makacita ko pa so asa ka omalalam a apo do oned no tana. Ori rana am adwa ozong na akman rana so ozong no kagling. Am o izezyak na am akman rana so kamolay.

language1_text: And he exerciseth all the power of the first beast before him, and causeth the earth and them which dwell therein to worship the first beast, whose deadly wound was healed.
language2_text: Amyan ori do tangain no nimanmanma a omalalam a mapeyvazay so rako a oyowyat no nimanma a omalalam ang. Iya rana am gacigatan na o tao do karawan mangay omraralay no nimapya rana so nipeyzazan a omalalam ang.

language1_text: And he doeth great wonders, so that he maketh fire come down from heaven on the earth in the sight of men,
language2_text: Meyvazay o ikadwa na no omalalam so mapangyangyalak a vazay am pakasen na o apoy a apo do teyngato do tangain no aro a tao.

language1_text: and deceiveth them that dwell on the earth by the means of those miracles which he had power to do in the sight of the beast; saying to them that dwell on the earth, that they should make an image to the beast, which had the wound by a sword, and did live.
language2_text: So nipakahap na so rako a oyowyat a meyvazay so mapangyangyalak a vazay do tangain no nimanma na omalalam. Am ori o nilittan na do tao do karawan. Ipanci na o tao do karawan a mamaring so kamamagenan no nimatavaz no ipangan a omalalam.

language1_text: And he had power to give life unto the image of the beast, that the image of the beast should both speak, and cause that as many as would not worship the image of the beast should be killed.
language2_text: Makahap o ikadwa na no omalalam so rako a oyowyat am avyain na o akma ney keyteytawan no nimanma na omalalam. So nipeyzezyak na rana a kawakwak na so ji raralay nya a tao.

language1_text: And he causeth all, both small and great, rich and poor, free and bond, to receive a mark in their right hand, or in their foreheads:
language2_text: Karahan am gacigatan na o aro a tao, tana meynakem a tana jyeynakem, a tana makcin a tana mabsoy, a tana peylamsoin da kano ji da peylamsoyan, miminen na o wanan da kano zozogwan da tovilan.

language1_text: and that no man might buy or sell, save he that had the mark, or the name of the beast, or the number of his name.
language2_text: O ipadedket am vilang a ngaran na no omalalam. O jya nipadketan am ji makasazang so kanen na. Ji makapalit no apzapzatan na so ileylamnay na so nakem.

language1_text: Here is wisdom. Let him that hath understanding count the number of the beast: for it is the number of a man; and his number is Six hundred threescore and six.
language2_text: O mateneng a tao am to da na tenngi o peypeypangayan no vilang a ngaran no omalalam. Ta o peypeypangayan no vilang am asa ka tao. O vilang am yanem o neykasikapito a poo no neykapito a ranaw (666).

language1_text: And I looked, and, lo, a Lamb stood on the mount Sion, and with him an hundred forty and four thousand, having his Father's name written in their foreheads.
language2_text: Macita ko pa o Kagling a meytatanek do meyngaran so Sian a tokon. O macihza jya tao am yamyan so ikakapatan da ranaw so ikalima da zivo no ikadwa da latos (144, 000) no tao. So ikamimin no zozogwan da adketan no ngaran no Kagling a kano ngaran na ni Ama na.

language1_text: And I heard a voice from heaven, as the voice of many waters, and as the voice of a great thunder: and I heard the voice of harpers harping with their harps:
language2_text: O nimamizing ko a ciring a apo do teyngato am akma raney azda kano adey a zomaigezeg. O nimamizing ko pa am akma raney meykaryag.

language1_text: and they sung as it were a new song before the throne, and before the four beasts, and the elders: and no man could learn that song but the hundred and forty and four thousand, which were redeemed from the earth.
language2_text: Sira rana am meytatanek sira do sazapen no lilisnan a kano apat a ka omalalam a kano kamanrarakehan a meyyanwanood so vayo a anood. O meyyanwanood a tao am o nipasakay na do kapyapyan am yamyan so ikakapatan da ranaw so ikalima da zivo no ikadwa da latos (144, 000) no tao o makateneng do anood a peyyanwanooden.

language1_text: These are they which were not defiled with women; for they are virgins. These are they which follow the Lamb whithersoever he goeth. These were redeemed from among men, being the firstfruits unto God and to the Lamb.
language2_text: Sira rana am ji nagpyan so aktokto sira a macilocilolo do angayan no Kagling. Sira rana am nipasakay na sira do kapyapyan. So ipanoma da nira patanangen ji Ama ta do to a kano Kagling.

language1_text: And in their mouth was found no guile: for they are without fault before the throne of God.
language2_text: Ji pa nimangalalas sira. So ikanoyong da abo so kararatan.

language1_text: And I saw another angel fly in the midst of heaven, having the everlasting gospel to preach unto them that dwell on the earth, and to every nation, and kindred, and tongue, and people,
language2_text: Macita ko o tinsi am somalap do hanit. Iya rana am yanan no to meyyonong a Mapasaray a Ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to a ipeylimwang na do peycyamahamahatawan na kado peycyeylilyan na kado meykataretarek so ciriciring do karawan.

language1_text: saying with a loud voice, Fear God, and give glory to him; for the hour of his judgment is come: and worship him that made heaven, and earth, and the sea, and the fountains of waters.
language2_text: Maniring a amlololos am, "Anooden nyo si Ama ta do to a iraralay. Ta yana marateng o araraw na no ipacici na a mapeykapyapinpin so tao do karawan. So raralayan nyo no yanimangamaog so hanit a kano teyrahem a kano awa kano tozongan no makakaday a atbod a ranom."

language1_text: And there followed another angel, saying, Babylon is fallen, is fallen, that great city, because she made all nations drink of the wine of the wrath of her fornication.
language2_text: Maniring o ikararwa no tinsi am, "Yarana mabalinas o rako a ili a meyngaran so Papilon. Ta yana itoro do tao o yamapasagpyan a saki a da yopen."

language1_text: And the third angel followed them, saying with a loud voice, If any man worship the beast and his image, and receive his mark in his forehead, or in his hand,
language2_text: Maniring o ikatatlo no tinsi a amlololos am, "O amraralay no omalalam a kano kamamagenan na nipadketan rana so zozogwan a kano lima am,

language1_text: the same shall drink of the wine of the wrath of God, which is poured out without mixture into the cup of his indignation; and he shall be tormented with fire and brimstone in the presence of the holy angels, and in the presence of the Lamb:
language2_text: ayopen da o masozi a saki ni Ama ta do to. O saki rana am sozisozyan na ni Ama ta do to. So ikabo no kasyasyan na nira. O paglowan na so ayoyopen no peyoyaoyyan na am pasingsingkadan na sira do tangain no aro a tinsi a kano Kagling a matemtem no lila no apoy.

language1_text: and the smoke of their torment ascendeth up for ever and ever: and they have no rest day nor night, who worship the beast and his image, and whosoever receiveth the mark of his name.
language2_text: O amrahet so kangangay da aob am jimtad a meypangay do teyngato. Sira rana omraralay no omalalam a kano kamamagenan na kano adketan no ngaran na so zozogwan am ji sira makayaknen a makaliliw so kataotao da do apoy ang."

language1_text: Here is the patience of the saints: here are they that keep the commandments of God, and the faith of Jesus.
language2_text: Inyo rana a omonot do ciriciring na ni Ama ta do to a ji na lilis so nakem ji Yeso a tao am makowyowyat kamo pa omraralay nya.

language1_text: And I heard a voice from heaven saying unto me, Write, Blessed are the dead which die in the Lord from henceforth: Yea, saith the Spirit, that they may rest from their labours; and their works do follow them.
language2_text: Makamizing ko pa so ciring a apo do teyngato. Maniring am, "Amyapo sicyaraw eya o katey rako na rana no sarasaray da no mawakwak no vazay ni Yeso a tao. So vatvatkan mo do ciring eya." Maniring o Seyzi am, "Manoyong o kakavos na rana no zikzikna da. So ipeywalam da rana, ta amyan so kakownongan no mina zikna da."

language1_text: And I looked, and behold a white cloud, and upon the cloud one sat like unto the Son of man, having on his head a golden crown, and in his hand a sharp sickle.
language2_text: Meyratateng am makacita ko so asa ka malavang a cinalab a lisnan no akma raney tao a meysakop so vowawan a meypinan so matarem a kekezdas.

language1_text: And another angel came out of the temple, crying with a loud voice to him that sat on the cloud, Thrust in thy sickle, and reap: for the time is come for thee to reap; for the harvest of the earth is ripe.
language2_text: O asa ka tinsi am makowbot a apo do panaralayan a tomawag do omlisna do cinalab ang. Maniring a amlololos am, "Yarana marateng o araraw na. So na ikanoyong rana no mowamowa ko do karawan a yarana mazako. So mangay mo langyan rana sya no kekezdas."

language1_text: And he that sat on the cloud thrust in his sickle on the earth; and the earth was reaped.
language2_text: Karahan am langin na rana no kekezdas na no amlisna do cinalab ang a kalangi na rana so mowamowa na do teyrahem.

language1_text: And another angel came out of the temple which is in heaven, he also having a sharp sickle.
language2_text: Makacita ko pa so asa ka tinsi a apo do panaralayan a makowbot. Akman sang ori, ta meypinan so matarem a kekezdas.

language1_text: And another angel came out from the altar, which had power over fire; and cried with a loud cry to him that had the sharp sickle, saying, Thrust in thy sharp sickle, and gather the clusters of the vine of the earth; for her grapes are fully ripe.
language2_text: Karahan am amyan so asa ka tinsi a tomalamozong no apoy a meytotwaw a apo do patanatanangan so nakem a tomawag do meypinan so matarem a kekezdas a tinsi. Maniring a amlololos am, "Tavazen mo no kekezdas mo o potaw do teyrahem, ta yarana mazako o asi no potaw."

language1_text: And the angel thrust in his sickle into the earth, and gathered the vine of the earth, and cast it into the great winepress of the wrath of God.
language2_text: Meyratateng am langin na rana no tinsi no kekezdas do teyrahem a tomavaz so potaw a asi no kayo a kapangay na sya do pangangatesan so saki. Ori rana am peyoyaoyyan ni Ama ta do to.

language1_text: And the winepress was trodden without the city, and blood came out of the winepress, even unto the horse bridles, by the space of a thousand and six hundred furlongs.
language2_text: O potaw a asi no kayo am atdesen da na do siri no ili da a katesen a kapeytotwaw no rala apo do pangangatesan so potaw. So icyakma ney ayo a omhangop so karatayan. O karaherahem na am manda do kawakan.

language1_text: And I saw another sign in heaven, great and marvellous, seven angels having the seven last plagues; for in them is filled up the wrath of God.
language2_text: Citahen ko am amyan so macitarek a mapangyangyalak. O peypeypangayan na am meypanam a alalaw no makwa. So niyan no papito a ka tinsi a tomalamozong no ney manowji na apito a ka alalaw. Ta pangononongan na rana ni Ama ta do to o peyoyaoyyan na do alalaw ang.

language1_text: And I saw as it were a sea of glass mingled with fire: and them that had gotten the victory over the beast, and over his image, and over his mark, and over the number of his name, stand on the sea of glass, having the harps of God.
language2_text: Citahen ko pa am makacita ko so akma raney awa panganinwan a pacizavozan no apoy. So iyan no tatasa ka tao a nimacita ko. Sira rana am niharag da na o omalalam a kano kamamagenan na kano abo so tovil a tao.
